ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindMaterial.#ctor
DESC:Constructor. Creates an empty material binding.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindMaterial.setMaterialDescription(Unigine.UGUID,Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Sets the description parameters of the animated material. This method is used if the access mode is set to
PARAMS:guid:GUID of the animated material. | file_guid:GUID of the file describing the animated material.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindMaterial.setObjectDescription(int,char)
DESC:Sets the description parameters of the object to which a surface with the animated material belongs. This method is used if the access mode is set to .
PARAMS:id:ID of the object, to which a surface with the animated material belongs. | name:Name of the object, to which a surface with the animated material belongs.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindMaterial.setSurfaceDescription(char,int)
DESC:Sets the description parameters of the surface to which the animated material is assigned. This method is used if the access mode is set to
PARAMS:name:Name of the surface, to which the animated material is assigned. | index:Number of the surface, to which the animated material is assigned.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationBindMaterial.ACCESS_FROM_ASSET
DESC:The material to be animated is obtained from a material asset (.mat).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationBindMaterial.ACCESS_FROM_SURFACE
DESC:The material to be animated is obtained from a surface of an object. In this case we'll get a child material inherited from the one assigned to the surface.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindNode.#ctor
DESC:Constructor. Creates an empty node binding.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindNode.setNodeDescription(int,char)
DESC:Sets the description components of the animated node.
PARAMS:id:ID of the node, to be animated. | name:name of the node, to be animated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindPropertyParameter.#ctor
DESC:Constructor. Creates an empty property parameter binding.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindPropertyParameter.setPropertyDescription(Unigine.UGUID,Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Sets the description components of the animated property parameter. This method is used if the access mode is set to .
PARAMS:guid:GUID of the property to which the animated parameter belongs. | file_guid:GUID of the file describing the property to which the animated parameter belongs.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindPropertyParameter.setNodeDescription(int,char)
DESC:Sets the description components of the animated property parameter. This method is used if the access mode is set to .
PARAMS:id:ID of the node property, to which the animated parameter belongs. | name:name of the node, to which a property with the animated parameter belongs.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindPropertyParameter.setNodePropertyDescription(char,int)
DESC:Sets the description components of the animated property parameter. This method is used if the access mode is set to or .
PARAMS:name:Name of the property, to which the animated parameter belongs. | index:index of the property, to which the animated parameter belongs.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationBindPropertyParameter.setSurfaceDescription(char,int)
DESC:Sets the description components of the animated property parameter. This method is used if the access mode is set to .
PARAMS:name:number of the surface, to which a property with the animated parameter is assigned. | index:number of the surface, to which a property with the animated parameter is assigned.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationBindPropertyParameter.ACCESS_FROM_ASSET
DESC:The material to be animated is obtained from a material asset (.mat).

ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.ANIMATION_CURVE
DESC:The animation curve storing values.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.ANIMATION_CURVE_INT
DESC:The animation curve storing integer values (see the AnimationCurveInt class).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.ANIMATION_CURVE_FLOAT
DESC:The animation curve storing float values (see the AnimationCurveIntFloat class).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.ANIMATION_CURVE_DOUBLE
DESC:The animation curve storing double values (see the AnimationCurveDouble class).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.ANIMATION_CURVE_BOOL
DESC:The animation curve storing boolean values (see the AnimationCurveBool class).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.ANIMATION_CURVE_SCALAR
DESC:The animation curve storing scalar values (see the AnimationCurveScalar class).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.ANIMATION_CURVE_QUAT
DESC:The animation curve storing quaternion values (see the AnimationCurveQuat class).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.ANIMATION_CURVE_STRING
DESC:The animation curve storing string values (see the AnimationCurveString class).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.ANIMATION_CURVE_UGUID
DESC:The animation curve storing UGUID values (see the AnimationCurveUGUID class).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.KEY_TYPE_CONSTANT
DESC:The left key value is used within the whole segment between two keys.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.KEY_TYPE_LINEAR
DESC:Linear interpolation between two keys is used.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.KEY_TYPE_SMOOTH
DESC:A Bézier curve is used for interpolation, with the left and the right tangent of each key symmetric to the origin.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.KEY_TYPE_BREAK
DESC:A Bézier curve is used for interpolation, with a possibility to configure the left and the right tangent of each key independently.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AnimationCurve.NUM_KEY_TYPES
DESC:The total number of types of interpolation between the keys.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.#ctor
DESC:Constructor. Creates a new boolean animation curve instance.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.copy(Unigine.Ptr{AnimationCurveBool})
DESC:Copies all data (key points and tangents) from the specified source curve.
PARAMS:curve:Source curve.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.addKey(float,bool)
DESC:Adds a new key point with the specified value at the specified point of the timeline to the curve.
PARAMS:time:Time of the key on the timeline, in seconds. | value:The boolean value of the key.
RETURNS:Index of the added key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.addKey(float,bool,AnimationCurve::KEY_TYPE)
DESC:Adds a new key point with the specified value and type at the specified point of the timeline to the curve.
PARAMS:time:Time of the key on the timeline, in seconds. | value:The boolean value of the key. | type:Interpolation type set for the key, one of the KEY_TYPE_* values.
RETURNS:Index of the added key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.addKey(float,bool,AnimationCurve::KEY_TYPE,Unigine.Math.vec2,Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Adds a new key point with the specified value, type and tangents at the specified point of the timeline to the curve.
PARAMS:time:Time of the key on the timeline, in seconds. | value:The boolean value of the key. | type:Interpolation type set for the key, one of the KEY_TYPE_* values. | left_tangent:Coordinates of the left tangent at the key point. | right_tangent:Coordinates of the right tangent at the key point.
RETURNS:Index of the added key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.removeKey(int)
DESC:Removes the key point with the specified index from the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.moveKey(int,float)
DESC:Moves the key point with the specified number to a new time position (preserving the tangents). The index of key point will be updated automatically. This method can be used to implement dragging of keys on the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve. | new_time:Time of the key on the timeline, in seconds.
RETURNS:New index of the key.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.setKeyType(int,AnimationCurve::KEY_TYPE)
DESC:Sets the interpolation type for the specified key on the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve. | type:Interpolation type set for the key, one of the KEY_TYPE_* values.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.getKeyType(int) const
DESC:Returns the interpolation type of the specified key on the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve.
RETURNS:Interpolation type set for the key, one of the KEY_TYPE_* values.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.getKeyTime(int) const
DESC:Returns the current time of the key point with the specified index.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve.
RETURNS:The time of the specified key point on the timeline, in seconds.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.getDefaultKeyValue const
DESC:Returns the default value for all keys in the curve.
RETURNS:Default value for all keys in the curve.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.setKeyValue(int,bool)
DESC:Sets the value for the specified key on the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve. | value:The boolean value of the key.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.getKeyValue(int) const
DESC:Returns the current value for the specified key on the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve.
RETURNS:The boolean value of the key.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.setKeyLeftTangent(int,Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Sets new coordinates for the left tangent at the specified key point of the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve. | left_tangent:Coordinates of the left tangent at the specified key point to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.getKeyLeftTangent(int) const
DESC:Returns the current coordinates for the left tangent at the specified key point of the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve.
RETURNS:Coordinates of the left tangent at the specified key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.setKeyRightTangent(int,Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Sets new coordinates for the right tangent at the specified key point of the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve. | right_tangent:Coordinates of the right tangent at the specified key point to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.getKeyRightTangent(int) const
DESC:Returns the current coordinates for the right tangent at the specified key point of the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve.
RETURNS:Coordinates of the right tangent at the specified key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.setTypeOfAllKeys(AnimationCurve::KEY_TYPE)
DESC:Sets the interpolation type for all keys of the curve.
PARAMS:type:Interpolation type set for the key, one of the KEY_TYPE_* values.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.clear
DESC:Clears the curve removing all key points and tangents.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.getValueByTime(float)
DESC:Returns the key value at the specified key point of the curve.
PARAMS:time:Time of the key on the timeline, in seconds.
RETURNS:The curve value at the specified key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.getValueByNormalizedTime(float)
DESC:Returns the key value using the normalized time value of the key.
PARAMS:normalized_time:The normalized time value of the key.
RETURNS:The curve value at the specified key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.save(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Blob}) const
DESC:Saves the curve data to a blob.
PARAMS:blob:Blob to which the curve data will be saved.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationCurveBool.load(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Blob})
DESC:Loads the curve data from the blob.
PARAMS:blob:Blob storing the curve data.
-

PARAMS:infos:Output buffer for information on all modifiers that are active in this frame.
RETURNS:Number of modifiers.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationFrame.interpolate(Unigine.Ptr{AnimationFrame},float)
DESC:Interpolates values of all modifiers of the frame between the current frame and the specified one with the given interpolation coefficient and updates all frame modifiers with interpolated values: val = interpolate(val, frame_val, k).
PARAMS:frame:Target animation frame. | k:Interpolation coefficient.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationFrame.interpolate(Unigine.Ptr{AnimationFrame},float,Unigine.Ptr{AnimationMask})
DESC:Interpolates values of all modifiers of the frame between the current frame and the specified one with the given interpolation coefficient. Values of modifiers that belong to the specified exclusion mask are ignored and kept unchanged. All frame modifiers are updated with interpolated values: val = interpolate(val, frame_val, k).
PARAMS:frame:Target animation frame. | k:Interpolation coefficient. | exclude_mask:Animation mask to be excluded from interpolation.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.#ctor
DESC:Constructor. Creates an empty playback with default settings.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getObject(int) const
DESC:Returns an animation object by its index.
PARAMS:index:Animation object index.
RETURNS:Animation object with the specified index.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.containsObject(Unigine.Ptr{AnimationObject}) const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the animation playback contains the specified animation object.
PARAMS:anim_obj:Animation object to be checked.
RETURNS:true if the the animation playback contains the specified animation object; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.clear
DESC:Clears the animation playback removing all animation objects, layers and tracks from it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.apply(float)
DESC:Calculates actual values for all modifiers of all tracks played at the specified moment (taking weights into account) and applied to real animated objects (overrides of animation objects for this playback).
PARAMS:time:Time value for which the resulting changes are to be calculated and applied to animated objects.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.apply(Unigine.Ptr{AnimationFrame})
DESC:Applies the specified animation frame - actual values are calculated for all modifiers of all tracks played at this frame (taking weights into account) and applied to real animated objects (overrides of animation objects for this playback).
PARAMS:frame:Animation frame to be applied.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.play
DESC:Plays the animation playback either from the start or from the moment when the playback was paused (see ).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.pause
DESC:Pauses the animation playback, so the playback can be resumed from this moment upon calling .
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.stop
DESC:Stops the animation playback.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.setTrack(Unigine.Ptr{AnimationTrack})
DESC:Sets the first animation track of the first layer.
PARAMS:track:New animation track to be set as the first track of the first layer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getTrack const
DESC:Returns the first animation track of the first layer.
RETURNS:First animation track of the first layer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.addLayer
DESC:Adds a new animation layer to the playback.
RETURNS:Index of the new added layer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.addLayer(Unigine.Ptr{AnimationTrack})
DESC:Adds a new animation layer to the playback and adds the specified animation track to this new layer.
PARAMS:track:Animation track to be added to the new created layer.
RETURNS:Index of the new added layer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.removeLayer(int)
DESC:Removes the animation layer with the specified index from the playback.
PARAMS:index:Index of the layer to be removed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getNumLayers const
DESC:Returns the total number of animation layers in the playback.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.addLayerTrack(int)
DESC:Adds a new empty animation track to the layer with the specified index.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index.
RETURNS:Index of the new added animation track.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.addLayerTrack(int,Unigine.Ptr{AnimationTrack})
DESC:Adds the specified animation track to the layer with the specified index.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track:New track to be added to the layer.
RETURNS:Index of the new added animation track.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.removeLayerTrack(int,int)
DESC:Removes the animation track with the specified index from the specified layer.
PARAMS:layer_index:Index of the layer containing the track to be removed. | track_index:Index of the track to be removed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getNumLayerTracks(int) const
DESC:Returns the number of animation tracks for the layer with the specified index.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index.
RETURNS:Number of animation tracks for the layer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.setLayerTrack(int,int,Unigine.Ptr{AnimationTrack})
DESC:Sets the specified animation track by index for the specified layer.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index. | track:Animation track to be set for the given layer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getLayerTrack(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the animation track by index for the specified layer.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index.
RETURNS:Animation track set for the given layer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.setLayerTrackBeginTime(int,int,float)
DESC:Sets a new offset time (from the beginning of the playback) for the specified track of the specified layer.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index. | offest:Offset time to be set, in seconds.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getLayerTrackBeginTime(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the current offset time (from the beginning of the playback) for the specified track of the specified layer.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index.
RETURNS:Current offset time, in seconds.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.setLayerTrackSpeed(int,int,float)
DESC:Sets a new speed factor value for the specified track of the specified layer.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index. | speed:New speed factor value to be set (the value of 2 means that the track is played 2 times faster, while 0.5f will slow it down 2 times).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getLayerTrackSpeed(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the current speed factor value for the specified track of the specified layer.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index.
RETURNS:Current speed factor value (the value of 2 means that the track is played 2 times faster, while 0.5f will slow it down 2 times).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.setLayerTrackApplyBefore(int,int,bool)
DESC:Sets the flag specifying if the start frame of the track is applied to the playback before the track starts.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index. | is_apply:true to enable applying the start frame of the track before the track starts; false - to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.isLayerTrackApplyBefore(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the flag specifying if the the start frame of the track is applied to the playback before the track starts.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index.
RETURNS:true if the start frame of the track is applied to the playback before the track starts; otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.setLayerTrackApplyAfter(int,int,bool)
DESC:Sets the flag specifying if the end frame of the track is applied to the playback after the track ends.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index. | is_apply:true to enable applying the end frame of the track after the track ends; false - to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.isLayerTrackApplyAfter(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the flag specifying if the end frame of the track is applied to the playback after the track ends.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index.
RETURNS:true if the end frame of the track is applied to the playback after the track ends; false - to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.setLayerTrackWeightCurve(int,int,Unigine.Ptr{AnimationCurveFloat})
DESC:Sets a new weight curve for the specified track of the specified layer. Weights are used for mixing multiple simultaneously played tracks together. The weight curve defines the dynamics of track weight change over time.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index. | curve:Weight curve to be set for the specified track.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getLayerTrackWeightCurve(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the current weight curve for the specified track of the specified layer. Weights are used for mixing multiple simultaneously played tracks together. The weight curve defines the dynamics of track weight change over time.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index.
RETURNS:Weight curve for the specified track.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.setLayerTrackLinearFade(int,int,float,bool,bool)
DESC:Enables linear fading (in, out, or both) for the track across the specified effect time span. This method automatically updates the weight curve for the track.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index. | effect_time:Time interval (in seconds) across which the fading effect is applied. Both fade-in and fade-out intervals (if used together) are equal to this value. | use_fade_in:Set true to enable the fade-in effect for the track; false - to disable it. | use_fade_out:Set true to enable the fade-out effect for the track; false - to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getLayerTrackDuration(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the current duration for the specified track of the specified layer.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index.
RETURNS:Track duration, in seconds.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getLayerTrackEndTime(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the current end time for the specified track of the specified layer.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index. | track_index:Track index.
RETURNS:Track end time, in seconds.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getLayerDuration(int) const
DESC:Returns the duration of the animation layer with the specified index.
PARAMS:layer_index:Layer index.
RETURNS:Duration of the layer, in seconds.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.setTime(float,float,float)
DESC:Sets the current playback time, and optional from and to limits.
PARAMS:time:Current playback time to be set, in seconds. | from:Start time to be set, in seconds. | to:End time to be set, in seconds.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationPlayback.getTime const
DESC:Returns the current playback time, in seconds.
RETURNS:Current playback time, in seconds.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationTrack.removeObjectModifier(Unigine.Ptr{AnimationObject},Unigine.Ptr{AnimationModifier})
DESC:Removes the specified modifier from the specified animation object.
PARAMS:anim_obj:Target animation object from which a modifier should be removed. | modifier:Animation modifier to be removed.

DESC:Collects all modifiers for the specified animation object and puts them to the out_modifiers buffer.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationTrack.updateSingletonModifier(Unigine.Ptr{AnimationModifier})

PARAMS:modifier:Singleton animation modifier to be updated.
RETURNS:true if the specified singleton modifier was successfully updated; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationTrack.removeSingletonModifier(Unigine.Ptr{AnimationModifier})
DESC:Removes the specified singleton animation modifier from the track.
PARAMS:modifier:Singleton animation modifier to be removed.

DESC:Collects all singleton animation modifiers of the track and puts them to the out_modifiers buffer.

RETURNS:Number of singleton animation modifiers of the track.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationTrack.getFrame(float)
DESC:Returns the animation frame for the specified moment of time. A frame can be thought of as a vertical slice of values of all tracks and modifiers played at the specified moment.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AnimationTrack.getFrameByNormalizedTime(float)
DESC:Returns the animation frame for the specified moment of time (normalized). A frame can be thought of as a vertical slice of values of all tracks and modifiers played at the specified moment.
PARAMS:time:Normalized time value (in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range) for which a frame is to be obtained .
RETURNS:Animation frame for the specified time.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Animations.getObjectByIndex(int) const

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.getImage(int)
DESC:Returns the image loaded by the specified operation. This method does not remove the image from the list of loaded ones. If you want the image to be removed from this list right after retrieving it, use the method.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.getMesh(int)

PARAMS:id:Loading operation identifier (see the method).

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.getNode(int)
DESC:Returns the node loaded by the specified operation. If the node loaded by the specified operation consists of multiple objects, a new dummy object to combine them is created and its smart pointer is returned. This method does not remove the node from the list of loaded ones. If you want the node to be removed from this list right after retrieving it, use the method.
PARAMS:id:Loading operation identifier (see the method).

DESC:Puts the nodes loaded by the specified operation to the specified array. If the node loaded by the specified operation consists of multiple objects, they are put into the array. This method does not remove the nodes from the list of loaded ones. If you want the nodes to be removed from this list right after retrieving them, use the method.
PARAMS:id:Loading operation identifier. | nodes:Array of loaded nodes' smart pointers.
RETURNS:1 if the operation is successful; otherwise, 0.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.forceFile(int)

PARAMS:id:Loading operation identifier (see the method).
RETURNS:1 if the file is loaded successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.forceImage(int)
DESC:Forces loading of the image. The specified image will be loaded right after the currently loading image (if any) is processed. All other file system operations are suspended until the forced image is loaded. The image won't be loaded immediately after calling the method as it can be large.

RETURNS:1 if the image is loaded successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.forceMesh(int)
DESC:Forces loading of the mesh. The specified mesf will be loaded right after the currently loading mesh (if any) is processed. All other file system operations are suspended until the forced mesh is loaded. The mesh won't be loaded immediately after calling the method as it can be large.
PARAMS:id:Loading operation identifier (see the method).
RETURNS:1 if the mesh is loaded successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.forceNode(int)

RETURNS:1 if the node is loaded successfully; otherwise, 0.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.runAsync(AsyncQueue::ASYNC_THREAD,Unigine.CallbackBase,AsyncQueue::ASYNC_PRIORITY)
DESC:Schedules the specified callback to be executed on the given thread type. This allows executing custom logic in the specified thread managed by the engine. The priority parameter defines the scheduling order of tasks: CRITICAL (0) - Highest priority. Tasks with this level are scheduled for execution before all others. DEFAULT (1) - Standard priority. Used for general-purpose tasks that follow any critical ones. BACKGROUND (2) - Lowest priority. These tasks are only scheduled when no higher-priority tasks are pending. Use this method to offload operations such as geometry generation, file parsing, or image processing to a dedicated engine-managed thread.
PARAMS:thread_type:Type of thread to run the task on. | callback:Pointer to a callback object. The target function must have the following signature: void callback_function(). To pass the function as a callback, wrap it using MakeCallback(). | priority:Priority of the task execution.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.runFrameAsyncMultiThread(Unigine.CallbackBase2{int,int},int)
DESC:Executes the specified callback concurrently across multiple threads. The task is synchronized with the end of the current frame, and does not block the current thread. Intended for parallel execution of compute-heavy tasks that do not require immediate results but must complete within the current frame.
PARAMS:callback:Pointer to the callback that accepts two parameters:int thread_index - the index of the current thread (starting from 0).int thread_count - the total number of threads executing the task.These parameters allow the task to be split into independent chunks, by assigning a portion of work to each thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature: void callback(int thread_index, int thread_cound) | num_threads:Number of threads to use. If set to -1, the engine selects an optimal number based on available CPU cores.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.runFrameAsyncMultiThread(Unigine.CallbackBase2{int,int},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Executes the specified callback concurrently across multiple threads. The task is synchronized with the end of the current frame, and does not block the current thread. Once all threads have finished execution, the second provided callback is invoked. Intended for parallel execution of compute-heavy tasks that do not require immediate results but must complete within the current frame.
PARAMS:callback:Pointer to the callback that accepts two parameters:int thread_index - the index of the current thread (starting from 0).int thread_count - the total number of threads executing the task.These parameters allow the task to be split into independent chunks, by assigning a portion of work to each thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature: void callback(int thread_index, int thread_cound) | callback_done:Callback to be called once all threaded executions of callback have completed.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature: void callback_done() | num_threads:Number of threads to use. If set to -1, the engine selects an optimal number based on available CPU cores.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.runFrameSyncMultiThread(Unigine.CallbackBase2{int,int},int)
DESC:Executes the specified callback concurrently across multiple threads. The task is synchronized with the end of the current frame. The current thread is blocked until all tasks have completed. Intended for parallel execution of compute-heavy tasks that must complete within the current frame.
PARAMS:callback:Pointer to the callback that accepts two parameters:int thread_index - the index of the current thread (starting from 0).int thread_count - the total number of threads executing the task.These parameters allow the task to be split into independent chunks, by assigning a portion of work to each thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature: void callback(int thread_index, int thread_cound) | num_threads:Number of threads to use. If set to -1, the engine selects an optimal number based on available CPU cores.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.runAsyncMultiThread(Unigine.CallbackBase2{int,int},int)
DESC:Executes the specified function concurrently across multiple threads without blocking the current thread. Intended for parallel execution of compute-heavy tasks that do not require immediate results.
PARAMS:callback:Pointer to the callback that accepts two parameters:int thread_index - the index of the current thread (starting from 0).int thread_count - the total number of threads executing the task.These parameters allow the task to be split into independent chunks, by assigning a portion of work to each thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature: void callback(int thread_index, int thread_cound) | num_threads:Number of threads to use. If set to -1, the engine selects an optimal number based on available CPU cores.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.runAsyncMultiThread(Unigine.CallbackBase2{int,int},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Executes the specified function concurrently across multiple threads without blocking the current thread. Once all threads have finished execution, the second provided callback is invoked. Intended for parallel execution of compute-heavy tasks that do not require immediate results.
PARAMS:callback:Pointer to the callback that accepts two parameters:int thread_index - the index of the current thread (starting from 0).int thread_count - the total number of threads executing the task.These parameters allow the task to be split into independent chunks, by assigning a portion of work to each thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature: void callback(int thread_index, int thread_cound) | callback_done:Callback to be called once all threaded executions of callback have completed.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature: void callback_done() | num_threads:Number of threads to use. If set to -1, the engine selects an optimal number based on available CPU cores.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AsyncQueue.runSyncMultiThread(Unigine.CallbackBase2{int,int},int)
DESC:Executes the specified function concurrently across multiple threads and blocks the current thread until all threads finish.
PARAMS:callback:Pointer to the callback that accepts two parameters:int thread_index - the index of the current thread (starting from 0).int thread_count - the total number of threads executing the task.These parameters allow the task to be split into independent chunks, by assigning a portion of work to each thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature: void callback(int thread_index, int thread_cound) | num_threads:Number of threads to use. If set to -1, the engine selects an optimal number based on available CPU cores.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.ASYNC_THREAD_BACKGROUND
DESC:Background thread with the lowest priority. Rarely used by the engine itself, primarily intended for user-driven procedural operations such as geometry modification. Safe for long-running background tasks, as it does not interfere with streaming or other critical engine systems.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.ASYNC_THREAD_ASYNC
DESC:General-purpose async thread used by the engine for tasks like prefetching, landscape updates, data streaming, and other background operations. Overusing this thread may delay core engine systems.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.ASYNC_THREAD_GPU_STREAM
DESC:Specialized thread with a dedicated command queue for transferring data from RAM to VRAM. Used to asynchronously create GPU resources (e.g., Texture, MeshRender) from corresponding RAM objects ( Image, Mesh). Ideal for implementing custom data streaming system or dynamic GPU data updates.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.ASYNC_THREAD_FILE_STREAM
DESC:Dedicated thread for file I/O operations. Similar in priority to ASYNC, but separated to reduce contention between CPU work and disk access. Suitable for loading/saving geometry, streaming data from disk, or handling heavy I/O without affecting core async systems. Overloading this thread may impact streaming performance.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.ASYNC_THREAD_MAIN
DESC:Main thread of the engine. Required for any operation that interacts with scene objects or engine state directly. Use this thread when executing callbacks that must safely modify or access scene elements. Typically used for dispatching final-stage results from background tasks.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.ASYNC_THREAD_NEW
DESC:Creates a new isolated thread from the internal thread pool. Meant for custom user operations that must not block or interfere with existing engine threads. Ideal for long-running or experimental tasks. This thread runs independently and does not impact engine systems.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.NUM_ASYNC_THREADS
DESC:Number of predefined async thread types. Used internally to validate or iterate over thread type constants.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.ASYNC_PRIORITY_CRITICAL
DESC:Highest priority. Tasks with this level are scheduled for execution before all others.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.ASYNC_PRIORITY_DEFAULT
DESC:Standard priority. Used for general-purpose tasks that follow any critical ones.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.ASYNC_PRIORITY_BACKGROUND
DESC:Lowest priority. These tasks are only scheduled when no higher-priority tasks are pending.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AsyncQueue.ASYNC_THREAD_ASYNC_FRAME_POOL
DESC:Specialized thread pool intended for high-performance asynchronous tasks that must be completed within the duration of the current frame.
-

FILE:UnigineCamera.xml

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.#ctor
DESC:Constructor. Creates a new camera with default settings: Modelview, inverse modelview and offset matrices are 4×4 identity matrices. FOV is 60 degrees. Distance to the near clipping plane is 0.1 unit. Distance to the far clipping plane is 10000 units. Up direction vector is (0,0,1). Viewport, reflection, source and reverb masks are set to 00000001.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getDirectionFromScreen(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,float,float,float) const
DESC:Casts the ray from a certain position on the screen.
PARAMS:p0:Start coordinate of the ray. | p1:End coordinate of the ray. | screen_x:X-coordinate of screen, in the [0;1] range, where 0 is the left upper point, 1 is the right lower point. | screen_y:Y-coordinate of screen, in the [0;1] range, where 0 is the left upper point, 1 is the right lower point. | aspect:Screen's aspect ratio (height to width).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getDirectionFromScreen(float,float,float) const
DESC:Casts the ray from a certain position on the screen.
PARAMS:screen_x:X-coordinate of screen, in the [0;1] range, where 0 is the left upper point, 1 is the right lower point. | screen_y:Y-coordinate of screen, in the [0;1] range, where 0 is the left upper point, 1 is the right lower point. | aspect:Screen's aspect ratio (height to width).
RETURNS:Point coordinate.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setFov(float)
DESC:Sets a vertical field of view of the camera and updates the projection matrix. Horizontal FOV cannot be used since it varies depending on the viewport's aspect ratio. Setting FOV recalculates projection matrix with aspect ratio = 1. You can use the following formula to calculate horizontal FOV from the vertical one for the given aspect ratio (width/height): FOV_h = 2 × atan ( (width / height) × tan(FOV_v / 2)).
PARAMS:fov:New vertical field of view in degrees. The provided value will be saturated in the range [0;180].
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getFov const
DESC:Returns the current vertical field of view of the camera. Horizontal FOV cannot be used since it varies depending on the viewport's aspect ratio. You can use the following formula to calculate horizontal FOV from the vertical one for the given aspect ratio (width/height): FOV_h = 2 × atan ( (width / height) × tan(FOV_v / 2)).
RETURNS:Vertical field of view in degrees.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getIModelview const
DESC:Returns the inverted view matrix of the camera.
RETURNS:Inverse view matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setModelview(Unigine.Math.Mat4)
DESC:Updates a modelview and inverse modelview matrices for the camera.
PARAMS:modelview:New view matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getModelview const
DESC:Returns the current view matrix of the camera.
RETURNS:Current view matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setObliqueFrustum(bool)
DESC:Enables or disables obliqueness of the viewing frustum. It is recommended to set oblique viewing frustum using this method, as it doesn't affect the projection matrix. To specify the near clipping plane use the setObliqueFrustumPlane() method.
PARAMS:frustum:true to enable oblique viewing frustum; false to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.isObliqueFrustum const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the viewing frustum is oblique.
RETURNS:true if the viewing frustum is oblique; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setObliqueFrustumPlane(Unigine.Math.Vec4)
DESC:Sets the oblique near clipping plane of the viewing frustum. This method does not affect the projection matrix. To enable the oblique frustum use the setObliqueFrustum() method.
PARAMS:plane:World coordinates of the oblique near clipping plane to set (Nx, Ny, Nz, D), where Nx, Ny, Nz - coordinates of the plane normal, D - distance from the origin to the plane.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getObliqueFrustumPlane const
DESC:Returns the oblique near clipping plane of the viewing frustum.
RETURNS:World coordinates of the oblique near clipping plane to set (Nx, Ny, Nz, D), where Nx, Ny, Nz - coordinates of the plane normal, D - distance from the origin to the plane.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setOffset(Unigine.Math.mat4)
DESC:Sets an additional transformation (an offset matrix) for the camera. This transformation is applied after the modelview transformation. The offset matrix does not affect the view matrix or the position of the camera. For example, the offset matrix can be used to simulate camera shaking from an explosion.
PARAMS:offset:Offset matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getOffset const
DESC:Returns an additional transformation (an offset matrix) set for the camera. This transformation is applied after modelview transformation. The offset matrix does not affect the view matrix or the position of the camera. For example, it can be used to simulate camera shake from an explosion.
RETURNS:Offset matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setPosition(Unigine.Math.Vec3)
DESC:Sets a new position of the camera and updates the modelview and inverse modelview (its 3rd column) matrices.
PARAMS:position:Camera position in the world space.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getPosition const
DESC:Returns the current position of the camera. The position vector is stored in the 3rd column of the inverse view matrix.
RETURNS:Camera position in the world space.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setProjection(Unigine.Math.mat4)
DESC:Updates the current projection matrix. It is not recommended to use this method for setting obliqueness of the near clipping plane of the frustum, as in this case a number of features (such as clouds, shadows, TAA, a number of engine optimizations, etc.) will not function properly. Please, use the setObliqueFrustum() method instead. This method allows you to set your camera to use perspective or orthographic projection, depending on your project's requirements. For example, you can use the following code to set up orthographic projection or perspective projection for your camera depending on a flag value:
PARAMS:projection:Projection matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getProjection const
DESC:Returns the current projection matrix with unit (1.0) aspect ratio.
RETURNS:Projection matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getProjectionFromScreen(float,float,float,float,float) const
DESC:Creates a projection matrix out of 2 screen positions. This is required for the frame selection.
PARAMS:screen_x0:X-coordinate of the first screen position, in the [0;1] range, where 0 is the left upper point, 1 is the right lower point. | screen_y0:Y-coordinate of the first screen position, in the [0;1] range, where 0 is the left upper point, 1 is the right lower point. | screen_x1:X-coordinate of the second screen position, in the [0;1] range, where 0 is the left upper point, 1 is the right lower point. | screen_y1:Y-coordinate of the second screen position, in the [0;1] range, where 0 is the left upper point, 1 is the right lower point. | aspect:Screen's aspect ratio (height to width).
RETURNS:Projection matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setReflectionViewportMask(int)
DESC:Sets a bit mask for rendering reflections into the viewport. Reflections are rendered in the viewport if masks of reflective materials match this one (one bit at least).
PARAMS:mask:Integer, each bit of which is used to set a mask.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getReflectionViewportMask const
DESC:Returns the current bit mask for rendering reflections into the camera viewport. Reflections are rendered in the camera viewport if masks of reflective materials match this one (one bit at least).
RETURNS:Integer, each bit of which is used to set a mask.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setReverbMask(int)
DESC:Updates a bit mask that determines what reverberation zones can be heard. For sound to reverberate, at least one bit of this mask should match a reverb mask of the sound source and a reverb mask of the reverberation zone. Masks of a sound source and reverberation zone can match the camera's one in several bits, not necessarily one.
PARAMS:mask:Integer, each bit of which is a mask for reverberating sound sources and reverberation zones.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getReverbMask const
DESC:Returns the current bit mask that determines what reverberation zones can be heard. For sound to reverberate, at least one bit of this mask should match a reverb mask of the sound source and a reverb mask of the reverberation zone. Masks of a sound source and reverberation zone can match with the camera's one in several bits, not necessarily one.
RETURNS:Integer, each bit of which is used to set a mask for reverberating sound sources and reverberation zones.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getScreenPosition(float,float,Unigine.Math.Vec3,float) const
DESC:Projects the point in world coordinates to the screen. Screen coordinates are written into the first 2 variables passed to the method.
PARAMS:screen_x:X-coordinate of the screen position. | screen_y:Y-coordinate of the screen position. | point:Point coordinates. | aspect:Aspect ratio (screen height to width).
RETURNS:1 if the point has been projected successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setSourceMask(int)
DESC:Updates a bit mask that determines what sound sources can be heard. For a sound source to be heard, its mask should match this one in at least one bit. Plus, the volume of sound channel in which the sound plays (its number also depends on this mask) should not be equal to 0.
PARAMS:mask:Integer, each bit of which specifies a sound channel.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getSourceMask const
DESC:Returns a bit mask that determines what sound channels can be heard. For a sound source to be heard, its mask should match this one in at least one bit. Plus, the volume of sound channel in which the sound plays (its number also depends on this mask) should not be equal to 0.
RETURNS:Integer, each bit of which specifies a sound channel.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setUp(Unigine.Math.vec3)
DESC:Sets an up direction of the camera's viewport (i.e. tilt of the camera's viewport).
PARAMS:up:New upward direction vector. The vector is normalized to 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getUp const
DESC:Returns the current up direction of the camera's viewport (i.e. tilt of the camera's viewport).
RETURNS:Upward direction vector.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setViewportMask(int)
DESC:Sets a bit mask for rendering into the viewport. Object surfaces, materials, decals, lights and GUI objects will be rendered into the viewport only if their viewport masks match the camera's one (one matching bit is enough).
PARAMS:mask:Integer, each bit of which is used to set a mask.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getViewportMask const
DESC:Returns the current bit mask for rendering into the viewport. Object surfaces, materials, decals, lights and GUI objects will be rendered into the viewport only if their viewport mask matches the camera's one (one matching bit is enough).
RETURNS:Integer, each bit of which is used to set a mask.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setZFar(float)
DESC:Sets a distance to the far clipping plane of the camera's viewing frustum and updates the projection matrix.
PARAMS:zfar:New distance in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getZFar const
DESC:Returns the current distance to the far clipping plane of the camera's viewing frustum.
RETURNS:Distance in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setZNear(float)
DESC:Sets a distance to the near clipping plane of the camera's viewing frustum and updates the projection matrix.
PARAMS:znear:New distance in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getZNear const
DESC:Returns the current distance to the near clipping plane of the camera's viewing frustum.
RETURNS:Distance in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.clone const
DESC:Clones the current camera and saves it to the given camera instance.
RETURNS:Copy of the camera.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setFovMode(Camera::FOV_MODE)
DESC:Sets the value indicating the type of FOV that is used for the camera: For the classic camera, the vertical FOV should be set. In this case, FOV is directly set in degrees. For the physically-based camera, the horizontal FOV should be set. In this case, FOV is calculated depending on the film gate and focal length of the camera.
PARAMS:mode:FOV_MODE_VERTICAL for the camera with the vertical FOV; FOV_MODE_PHYSICALLY_BASED_CAMERA for the physically-based camera with the horizontal FOV.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getFovMode const
DESC:Sets the value indicating the type of FOV that is used for the camera.
RETURNS:0 if the camera with the vertical FOV is used; 1 if the physically-based camera with the horizontal FOV is used.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setFilmGate(float)
DESC:Sets a film gate for the physically-based camera with horizontal FOV.
PARAMS:gate:Film gate.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getFilmGate const
DESC:Returns a film gate for the physically-based camera with horizontal FOV.
RETURNS:Film gate.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setFocalLength(float)
DESC:Sets a focal length of the physically-based camera lens.
PARAMS:length:Camera lens focal length.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getFocalLength const
DESC:Returns the focal length of the physically-based camera lens.
RETURNS:Camera lens focal length.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getAspectCorrectedProjection(float) const
DESC:Returns projection matrix after correction for the specified aspect ratio. Currently fixed FOV component is taken into account.
PARAMS:aspect:Aspect ratio.
RETURNS:Projection matrix after correction for the specified aspect ratio.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getFovFixed const
DESC:Returns a value indicating which FOV component (horizontal or vertical) is currently fixed.
RETURNS:Current fixed FOV component, one of the FOV_FIXED_* values.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.addScriptableMaterial(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
DESC:Attaches a new scriptable material to the camera. To apply a scriptable material globally, use the method of the Render class. The order of execution for scripts assigned to scriptable materials is defined by material's number in the list of the camera.Scriptable materials applied globally have their expressions executed before the ones that are applied per-camera.
PARAMS:material:Scriptable material to be attached to the camera.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.insertScriptableMaterial(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
DESC:Inserts a new scriptable material into the list of the ones assigned to the camera. To apply a scriptable material globally, use the insertScriptableMaterial() method of the Render class. The order of execution for scripts assigned to scriptable materials is defined by material's number in the camera's list.Scriptable materials applied globally have their expressions executed before the ones that are applied per-camera.
PARAMS:num:Position at which a new scriptable material is to be inserted. | material:Scriptable material to be inserted.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.removeScriptableMaterial(int)
DESC:Removes the scriptable material with the specified number from the camera.
PARAMS:num:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getNumScriptableMaterials const
DESC:Returns the total number of scriptable materials attached to the camera.
RETURNS:Total number of scriptable materials attached to the camera.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.findScriptableMaterial(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material}) const
DESC:Returns the number of the specified scriptable material for the camera. This number is camera-specific (valid for this camera only) and determines the order in which the assigned expressions are executed. Scriptable materials applied globally have their expressions executed before the ones that are applied per-camera.
PARAMS:material:Scriptable material for which a number is to be found.
RETURNS:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials, or -1 if the specified material was not found.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setScriptableMaterial(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
DESC:Replaces the scriptable material with the specified number with the new scriptable material specified. The number of material determines the order in which the expressions assigned to it are executed. This number is camera-specific (valid for this camera only). Scriptable materials applied globally have their expressions executed before the ones that are applied per-camera.
PARAMS:num:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials. | material:New scriptable material to replace the one with the specified number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getScriptableMaterial(int) const
DESC:Returns a scriptable material attached to the camera by its number.
PARAMS:num:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials.
RETURNS:Scriptable material attached to the camera with the specified number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setScriptableMaterialEnabled(int,bool)
DESC:Enables or disables the scriptable material with the specified number. When a material is disabled (inactive), the scripts attached to it are not executed.
PARAMS:num:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials. | enabled:true to enable the scriptable material with the specified number, false to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getScriptableMaterialEnabled(int) const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the scriptable material with the specified number attached to the camera is enabled (active). When a material is disabled (inactive), the scripts attached to it are not executed.
PARAMS:num:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials.
RETURNS:true if the scriptable material with the specified number is enabled; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.swapScriptableMaterials(int,int)
DESC:Swaps two scriptable materials with specified numbers. The number of material determines the order in which the expressions assigned to it are executed. The number is camera-specific (valid for this camera only).
PARAMS:num_0:Number of the first scriptable material in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials. | num_1:Number of the second scriptable material in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.clearScriptableMaterials
DESC:Clears all scriptable materials attached to the camera.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.copy(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera}) const
DESC:Copies the parameters from the source camera to this camera instance.
PARAMS:camera:Smart pointer to the source camera.
RETURNS:Smart pointer to this camera.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.swap(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera})
DESC:Swaps the parameters between the specified camera and this camera instance.
PARAMS:camera:Camera smart pointer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setProjectionMode(Camera::PROJECTION_MODE)
DESC:Sets the projection mode: orthographic or perspective.
PARAMS:mode:The projection mode, PROJECTION_MODE_ORTHOGRAPHIC for the orthographic mode; PROJECTION_MODE_PERSPECTIVE for the perspective mode.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getProjectionMode const
DESC:Returns the current projection mode: orthographic or perspective.
RETURNS:The projection mode, PROJECTION_MODE_ORTHOGRAPHIC for the orthographic mode; PROJECTION_MODE_PERSPECTIVE for the perspective mode.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.setOrthoHeight(float)
DESC:Sets the height of the camera with the orthographic projection mode enabled.
PARAMS:height:The orthographic camera height.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Camera.getOrthoHeight const
DESC:Returns the current height of the camera with the orthographic projection mode enabled.
RETURNS:The orthographic camera height.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Camera.FOV_MODE_PHYSICALLY_BASED_CAMERA
DESC:FOV_h = 2 * atan(film_gate / (2 * focal_length)) * RAD2DEG
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Camera.FOV_MODE_VERTICAL
DESC:Vertical FOV mode. Vertical FOV of the camera is determined by the FOV value.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Camera.FOV_FIXED_HORIZONTAL
DESC:Horizontal FOV component is fixed.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Camera.FOV_FIXED_VERTICAL
DESC:Vertical FOV component is fixed.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Camera.PROJECTION_MODE_ORTHOGRAPHIC
DESC:Orthographic projection.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Camera.PROJECTION_MODE_PERSPECTIVE
DESC:Perspective projection.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.EngineExpression.ifps
DESC:Scaled inverse FPS value (the time in seconds it took to complete the last frame).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.EngineExpression.time
DESC:Current time spent in the game. It is counted off starting from the world loading and does not take game pauses into account.

FILE:UnigineComponentSystem.xml
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getClassName
DESC:Returns the name of the class associated with the component. The name is generated automatically in the COMPONENT macro.
RETURNS:Component class name.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponentDescription
DESC:Returns the component description. The description can be specified in the COMPONENT_DESCRIPTION macro.
RETURNS:Component description.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getPropertyName
DESC:Returns the name of the property associated with the component. The name is automatically generated in the COMPONENT_DEFINE macro: in this case, the propert name will be same as the class name. To specify a custom name, use the COMPONENT and PROP_NAME macros instead.
RETURNS:Property name.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getParentPropertyName
DESC:Returns the name of the parent property from which the current property associated with the component is inherited. The name is automatically generated in the COMPONENT_DEFINE macro.
RETURNS:Parent property name.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.setEnabled(int)
DESC:Enables or disables the component.
PARAMS:enable:Use 1 to enable the component, 0 - to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.isEnabled
DESC:Returns a value indicating whether the component is enabled.
RETURNS:1 if the component is enabled; otherwise 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.isInitialized
DESC:Returns a value indicating whether the component is initialized (its init() method was already called).
RETURNS:1 if the component is initialized; otherwise 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.isAutoSaveProperty
DESC:Returns a value indicating whether the property file associated with the component should be automatically generated each time C++ Component System is initialized or createPropertyFiles() method is called. By default all components have their property files re-generated automatically, this behavior might not be suitable, when you modify properties manually after creation. In this case you can add the following macro to the header file containing your component's declaration:
RETURNS:1 if the property file associated with the component should be automatically generated each time C++ Component System is initialized or createPropertyFiles() method is called; otherwise 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getNode
DESC:Returns the node, to which the component is attached.
RETURNS:Node, to which the component is attached.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getProperty
DESC:Returns the property associated with the component.
RETURNS:Property associated with the component.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getPropertyNum
DESC:Returns the number of the property associated with the component.
RETURNS:Number of the property in the list of properties assigned to the node.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.addComponent(NodePtr)
DESC:Adds the component to the specified node. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::addComponent() method.
PARAMS:node:Node, to which the component is to be added.
RETURNS:Pointer to the new added component, if it was successfully added to the specified node; otherwise nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.removeComponent(NodePtr)
DESC:Removes the component from the specified node. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::removeComponent() method.
PARAMS:node:Node, from which the component is to be removed.
RETURNS:1 if the component was successfully removed from the specified node; otherwise 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponent(NodePtr,bool)
DESC:Returns the first component of the specified type associated with the specified node. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponent() method.
PARAMS:node:Node, for which the component of this type is to be found. | enabled_only:Enabled flag: true to get enabled component only, false to get component in any case.
RETURNS:Pointer to the component if it exists; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponents(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Returns all components of this type assigned to the specified node and puts them to the specified buffer vector. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponents() method.
PARAMS:node:Node, whose components are to be retrieved. | components:Buffer vector, to which all found components of this type will be put.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponentInChildren(NodePtr,bool)
DESC:Returns the first component of this type found among all the children of the specified node (including the node itself). This method searches for the component in the following order: node itself node reference node's children children of node's children This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponentInChildren() method.
PARAMS:node:Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked for the components of this type. | enabled_only:Enabled flag: true to get enabled component only, false to get component in any case.
RETURNS:Pointer to the component if it exists; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponentsInChildren(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Searches for all components of this type down the hierarchy of the specified node and puts them to the given buffer vector. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponentsInChildren() method.
PARAMS:node:Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked for the components of this type. | components:Buffer vector, to which all found components of this type will be put.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponentInParent(NodePtr,bool)
DESC:Returns the first component of this type found among all predecessors and posessors of the specified node. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponentInParent() method.
PARAMS:node:Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked for the components of this type. | enabled_only:Enabled flag: true to get enabled component only, false to get component in any case.
RETURNS:Pointer to the component if it exists; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.getComponentsInParent(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Searches for all components of this type up the hierarchy of the specified node and puts them to the given buffer vector. This method is equivalent to ComponentSystem::getComponentsInParent() method.
PARAMS:node:Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked for the components of this type. | components:Buffer vector, to which all found components of this type will be put.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.setDestroyCallback(Unigine.CallbackBase)
DESC:Sets a callback function to be called before destroying the component. This function can be used to implement certain actions to be performed when a component is destroyed.
PARAMS:func:Callback function.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.clearDestroyCallback
DESC:Removes a destroy callback function previously set by the setDestroyCallback() method. This callback function can be used to implement certain actions to be performed when a component is destroyed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.save_property(char)
DESC:Saves all parameters of the property associated with the component to the specified prop-file.
PARAMS:name:Name of the target .prop-file.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.on_enable
DESC:This method is called by the Engine, when the component becomes enabled and active (both, node and property are enabled). You can override this method to implement some specific actions to be performed each time, when the component becomes enabled and active.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.on_disable
DESC:This method is called by the Engine, when the component becomes disabled (both, node and property are disabled). You can override this method to implement some specific actions to be performed each time, when the component becomes disabled and inactive.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.init
DESC:Engine calls this function on world initialization. Put you code for resources initialization during the world start here.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.update
DESC:Engine calls this function before updating each render frame. You can specify here all logic-related functions you want to be called every frame while your application executes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.postUpdate
DESC:Engine calls this function after updating each render frame. You can correct behavior after the state of the node has been updated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.updatePhysics
DESC:Engine calls this function before updating each physics frame. Here you can control physics, perform continuous physics-related operations (pushing a car forward depending on current motor's RPM, simulating a wind blowing constantly, perform immediate collision response, etc.). The engine calls updatePhysics() with the fixed rate (60 times per second by default) regardless of the fps number. Similar to the world script's updatePhysics() function.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.shutdown
DESC:Engine calls this function on world shutdown. Here you can clean up resources that were created during world script execution to avoid memory leaks.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentBase.is_equals(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml})
DESC:Returns a value indicating whether the two xml nodes are actually equal (have the same set of parameters with the same values and the same hierarchy).
PARAMS:xml1:First xml node. | xml2:Second xml node.
RETURNS:1 if the two specified xml nodes are equal; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.get
DESC:Returns a pointer to C++ Component System. This pointer must be obtained to access functions of C++ Component System:
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.initialize
DESC:Performs initialization of C++ Component System, registration of all components and creation of all necessary property files. This method should me called in the AppSystemLogic::init() method. If a property file for any component does not exist, it will be created automatically.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.addInitCallback(Unigine.CallbackBase)
DESC:Adds a callback which is called during ComponentSystem initialization.
PARAMS:callback:Callback pointer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.setEnabled(bool)
DESC:Enables or disables the C++ Component System. You can use it for performance debugging: enable or disable update(), postUpdate(), updatePhysics(), swap(), updateSync(), updateAsync() for all components.
PARAMS:enabled:true to enable the C++ Component System, false to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.isEnabled
DESC:Returns a value indicating whether the C++ Component System is enabled. You can use it for performance debugging: check if update(), postUpdate(), updatePhysics(), swap(), updateSync(), updateAsync() are enabled/disabled for all components.
RETURNS:true if the C++ Component System is enabled, false if it is disabled.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getNumComponents
DESC:Returns the total number of components registered in C++ Component System. This method is very slow and should not be used often.
RETURNS:Total number of registered components.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getNumNodesWithComponents
DESC:Returns the total number of nodes with components assigned.
RETURNS:Total number of nodes with components assigned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.createPropertyFile
DESC:Creates a property file for a registered component associated with the property with a given name.Parameters of each component are stored in a separate *.prop file. If this property file does not exist, it will be created in the data/ComponentSystem folder with a name obtained by the component's getPropertyName() method.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.initializeComponents(NodePtr)
DESC:Forces initialization of components associated with the given node in the currrent frame (it doesn't wait for the WorldLogic::update() callback execution).
PARAMS:node:Node for which the components need to be initialized.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.createPropertyFile(char)
DESC:Creates a property file for a registered component associated with the property with a given name. Parameters of each component are stored in a separate *.prop file. If this property file does not exist, it will be created in the data/ComponentSystem folder.
PARAMS:name:Name of the property associated with the component.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.createPropertyFiles
DESC:Creates property files for all registered components. Parameters of each component are stored in a separate *.prop file. If these property files do not exist, they will be created in the data/ComponentSystem folder.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.refreshProperty(char)
DESC:Rewrites the *.prop file for the specified property and reloads it in the Property Manager.
PARAMS:name:Property name.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.refreshProperty
DESC:Rewrites the property file for the specified component and reloads it in the Property Manager.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.registerComponent
DESC:Registers a user component derived from the ComponentBase class. Components must be registered in the AppSystemLogic::init() method. If a property file for the component does not exist, it will be created automatically. It is recommended to use the REGISTER_COMPONENT macro instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.unregisterComponent
DESC:Deletes a user component derived from the ComponentBase class.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.addComponent(NodePtr)
DESC:Adds the component to the specified node.
PARAMS:node:Node, to which the component is to be added.
RETURNS:Pointer to the new added component, if it was successfully added to the specified node; otherwise nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponent(NodePtr,bool)
DESC:Returns the first component of the specified type associated with the given node.
PARAMS:node:Node, for which the component of the specified type is to be found. | enabled_only:Enabled flag: true to get enabled component only, false to get component in any case.
RETURNS:Pointer to the component if any; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponents(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int)
DESC:Searches for all components of the specified type assigned to the specified node and puts them to the given buffer vector.
PARAMS:node:Node, for which the components of the specified type are to be found. | out_components:Buffer vector, to which all found components of the specified type will be added. | clear_vector:Flag indicating whether the buffer vector is to be cleared before adding the found components to it or not. Use 1 to clear the vector, 0 - to append new found components to the end of the vector. The default value is 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponentInChildren(NodePtr,bool)
DESC:Returns the first component of the specified type found among all the children of the specified node (including the node itself). This method searches for the component in the following order: node itself node reference node's children children of node's children
PARAMS:node:Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked for the specified type of component. | enabled_only:Enabled flag: true to get enabled component only, false to get component in any case.
RETURNS:Pointer to the component if any; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponentsInChildren(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int)
DESC:Searches for all components of the specified type down the hierarchy of the specified node and puts them to the given buffer vector.
PARAMS:node:Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked. | out_components:Buffer vector, to which all found components of the specified type will be added. | clear_vector:Flag indicating whether the buffer vector is to be cleared before adding the found components to it or not. Use 1 to clear the vector, 0 - to append new found components to the end of the vector. The default value is 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponentInParent(NodePtr,bool)
DESC:Returns the first component of the specified type found among all predecessors and posessors of the specified node.
PARAMS:node:Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked. | enabled_only:Enabled flag: true to get enabled component only, false to get component in any case.
RETURNS:Pointer to the component if any; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponentsInParent(NodePtr,Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int)
DESC:Searches for all components of the specified type up the hierarchy of the specified node and puts them to the given buffer vector.
PARAMS:node:Node, whose hierarchy is to be checked. | out_components:Buffer vector, to which all found components of the specified type will be added. | clear_vector:Flag indicating whether the buffer vector is to be cleared before adding the found components to it or not. Use 1 to clear the vector, 0 - to append new found components to the end of the vector. The default value is 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponentInWorld(bool)
DESC:Returns the first component of this type found in the current world.
PARAMS:enabled_only:Enabled flag: true to get enabled component only, false to get component in any case.
RETURNS:Pointer to the component if any; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getComponentsInWorld(Unigine.Vector{C*,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},bool)
DESC:Searches for all components of the specified type in the current world and puts them to the given buffer vector.
PARAMS:out_components:Buffer vector, to which all found components of the specified type will be added. | enabled_only:Enabled flag: true to get only enabled components, false to get all components.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.removeComponent(NodePtr)
DESC:Removes the component from the specified node.
PARAMS:node:Node, from which the component is to be removed.
RETURNS:1 if the component was successfully removed from the specified node; otherwise 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.setWarningLevel(int)
DESC:Sets the warning level for C++ Component System. Warnings can be very useful when debugging your application, e.g. to investigate Null Reference Exception cases.
PARAMS:level:New warning level to be set. One of the following values:WARNING_LEVEL::NONE - warning messages are disabled.WARNING_LEVEL::LOW - warning messages are generated only for serious cases.WARNING_LEVEL::HIGH - warning messages are generated for all cases including potential ones. At this level, for example, all Node/Property/Material parameters, that are empty at startup, will be reported.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentSystem.getWarningLevel
DESC:Returns the current warning level for C++ Component System. Warnings can be very useful when debugging your application, e.g. to investigate Null Reference Exception cases.
RETURNS:Current warning level. One of the following values:WARNING_LEVEL::NONE - warning messages are disabled.WARNING_LEVEL::LOW - warning messages are generated only for serious cases.WARNING_LEVEL::HIGH - warning messages are generated for all cases including potential ones. At this level, for example, all Node/Property/Material parameters, that are empty at startup, will be reported.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentVariable.getParameter const
DESC:Returns the pointer to the corresponding property parameter.
RETURNS:Pointer to the property parameter.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentVariable.size
DESC:Returns the number of elements in the array. This method is for the array and array structure component parameters.
RETURNS:Number of elements in the array.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ComponentVariable.operator[](int)
DESC:Returns the reference to the requested element. This method is for the array and array structure component parameters.
PARAMS:index:Position of the element to return.
RETURNS:Reference to the requested element.
