ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.load
DESC:Loads Engine startup configuration from the file. To change the path to the configuration file use the setPath() method.
RETURNS:true if the config is successfully loaded from the file; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.save const
DESC:Saves the current Engine startup configuration to the file. To change the path to the configuration file use the setPath() method.
RETURNS:true if the current configuration is successfully saved to the file; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.reset
DESC:Resets the settings in the Engine startup configuration file to the default.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.removePluginPath(int)
DESC:Removes a plugin path with the specified number from the list of the plugin paths specified in the .boot configuration file via the plugin_path element.A plugin path is a directory containing plugins to be automatically loaded at the Engine startup.
PARAMS:num:Number of the plugin path to be removed from the list of the specified plugin paths, in the range from 0 to the total number of plugin paths specified.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.swapPluginPath(int,int)
DESC:Swaps two plugin paths with the given numbers specified in the .boot configuration file.A plugin path is a directory containing plugins to be automatically loaded at the Engine startup. The list of these plugin paths can be obtained via the getNumPluginPaths() and getPluginPath(int num) methods. The order of loading plugins matters, you can rearrange the paths via swapPluginPath()
PARAMS:num0:Number of the first plugin path in the list of the specified plugin paths to be swapped, in the range from 0 to the total number of plugin paths specified. | num1:Number of the second plugin path in the list of the specified plugin paths to be swapped, in the range from 0 to the total number of plugin paths specified.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.getPluginPath(int)
DESC:Returns a plugin path with the given number specified in the .boot configuration file via the plugin_path element.A plugin path is a directory containing plugins to be automatically loaded at the Engine startup. The order of loading plugins matters, you can rearrange the paths via swapPluginPath().
PARAMS:num:Plugin path number in the list of the specified plugin paths, in the range from 0 to the total number of plugin paths specified.
RETURNS:Path to the plugins directory with the given number in the list of the plugin paths. Сan be absolute or specified relatively to the binary executable.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.setPluginPath(int,char)
DESC:Sets a new path for the item of the list of the plugin paths with the given number specified in the .boot configuration file via the plugin_path element.A plugin path is a directory containing plugins to be automatically loaded at the Engine startup. The order of loading plugins matters, you can rearrange the paths via swapPluginPath().
PARAMS:num:Plugin path number in the list of the specified plugin paths. | value:New path to be set for the specified item of the list of the plugin paths. Сan be specified relatively to the binary executable or as an absolute path.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.removeExternPlugin(int)
DESC:Removes a plugin with the specified number from the list of the plugins specified in the .boot configuration file via the extern_plugin element.
PARAMS:num:Number of the plugin to be removed from the list of the specified plugins, in the range from 0 to the total number of plugins specified.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.swapExternPlugin(int,int)
DESC:Swaps two plugins with the given numbers specified in the .boot configuration file.The list of these plugins can be obtained via the getNumExternPlugins() and getExternPlugin(int num) methods. The order of loading plugins matters, this method enables you to rearrange plugins to change loading order.
PARAMS:num0:Number of the first plugin in the list of the specified plugins to be swapped, in the range from 0 to the total number of plugins specified. | num1:Number of the second plugin in the list of the specified plugins to be swapped, in the range from 0 to the total number of plugins specified.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.getExternPlugin(int)
DESC:Returns the name of the plugin with the given number specified in the .boot configuration file via the extern_plugin element.The order of loading plugins matters, you can rearrange the paths via swapExternPlugin().
PARAMS:num:Number of the plugin in the list of the specified plugins, in the range from 0 to the total number of plugins specified.
RETURNS:Name of the plugin with the given number specified in the .boot configuration file. Plugin library name goes without any prefixes and postfixes (e.g., libNetwork_x64d.so is listed as "Network").
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BootConfig.setExternPlugin(int,char)
DESC:Sets a new name of the plugin with the given number specified in the .boot configuration file via the extern_plugin element.The order of loading plugins matters, you can rearrange the paths via swapExternPlugin().
PARAMS:num:Number of the plugin to be set in the list of the specified plugins, in the range from 0 to the total number of plugins specified. | value:Name of the plugin with the given number specified in the .boot configuration file. Plugin library name goes without any prefixes and postfixes (e.g., libNetwork_x64d.so is listed as "Network").
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Controls.#ctor(int)
DESC:Creates a smart pointer to Controls.
PARAMS:type:Type of the controls to be created.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Controls.setState(int,int)
DESC:Toggles the state of the given control on or off.
PARAMS:state:Control state number to update. Possible values are in range [STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration. | value:State value: positive value to "press" the control; 0 to release it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Controls.getState(int) const
DESC:Returns the state of a given control (pressed or unpressed).
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration.
RETURNS:1 if the control is pressed; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Controls.getStateByName(char) const
DESC:Returns the state of a given control (pressed or unpressed) by the control state name.
PARAMS:name:Name of the control state. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration.
RETURNS:1 if the control is pressed; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Controls.getStateName(int) const
DESC:Returns the name of a given control state as a string.
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration.
RETURNS:Name of the control state.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Controls.clearState(int)
DESC:Returns a control state and clears it to 0 (not pressed). This function allows to handle control only once even if it is kept pressed over several frames.
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration.
RETURNS:Returns the state of the given control: 1 if the control is pressed; otherwise,0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Controls.saveState(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream}) const
DESC:Saves controls settings into the stream. Example using saveState() and restoreState() methods:
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true if the controls settings are saved successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Controls.restoreState(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
DESC:Restores controls settings from the stream. Example using saveState() and restoreState() methods:
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true if the controls settings are restored successfully; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.setState(int,int)
DESC:Updates the state of a given control (sets the control on or off).
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [ STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration at the end of the article. | value:State value: positive value to "press" the control; 0 to release it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.getState(int)
DESC:Returns the state of a given control.
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [ STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration at the end of the article.
RETURNS:State value: positive value means the control is "pressed"; 0 means the control is released.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.setStateMouseButton(int,Input::MOUSE_BUTTON)
DESC:Sets a mouse button that switches a given state on and off.
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [ STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration at the end of the article. | button:Button that toggles the state, one of the preset MOUSE_BUTTON_ codes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.getStateMouseButton(int)
DESC:Returns a mouse button that switches a given state on and off.
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [ STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration at the end of the article.
RETURNS:Button that toggles the state, one of the preset MOUSE_BUTTON_ codes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.isStateMouseButton(Input::MOUSE_BUTTON)
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the given button assigned to the state.
PARAMS:button:Button that toggles the state, one of the preset MOUSE_BUTTON_ codes.
RETURNS:1 if the given button is assigned; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.getStateEvent(int)
DESC:Lets the user assign a key or a mouse button to a given state.
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [ STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration at the end of the article.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.isStateEvent
DESC:Returns a value indicating if a key or a mouse button is successfully assigned to a state.
RETURNS:1 if a key or a mouse button is already assigned; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.setStateKey(int,Input::KEY)
DESC:Sets a key that toggles a given state on and off.
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [ STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration at the end of the article. | key:Key that switches the state, one of the preset KEY_ codes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.getStateKey(int)
DESC:Returns a key that toggles a given state on and off.
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [ STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration at the end of the article.
RETURNS:Key that switches the state, one of the preset KEY_ codes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.isStateKey(Input::KEY)
DESC:Checks if a given key already acts as an application control. This is useful to avoid collisions between application controls and hot keys.
PARAMS:key:Key that switches the state, one of the preset KEY_ codes.
RETURNS:1 if the key is assigned to a state; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.getStateName(int)
DESC:Returns the name of the given control state.
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [ STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration at the end of the article.
RETURNS:Name of the given control state.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.getStateInfo(int) const
DESC:Returns the information about the given control state.
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [ STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration at the end of the article.
RETURNS:String containing information about the given control state.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.clearState(int)
DESC:Returns a control state and clears it to 0 (control is not pressed).
PARAMS:state:Control state number. Possible values are in range [ STATE_FORWARD;NUM_STATES]. For full list of available controls see Unigine::Controls:: Enumeration at the end of the article.
RETURNS:1 if the control is pressed; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.setRemoveGrabKey(Input::KEY)
DESC:Sets a new key to be used to switch off the grab mode of the mouse pointer (mouse pointer is bound to the application window). See this example for more information on mouse pointer modes and customization.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ControlsApp.getRemoveGrabKey const

DESC:Constructor. Creates a new 2d curve instance.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.#ctor(Unigine.Ptr{Curve2d})
DESC:Constructor. Initializes the curve by copying the specified source curve.
PARAMS:curve:Source curve.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.clear
DESC:Clears the curve removing all key points and tangents.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.copy(Unigine.Ptr{Curve2d})
DESC:Copies all the data (all key points and tangents) from the specified source curve.
PARAMS:curve:Source curve.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.addKey(Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Adds a new key point with the specified coordinates to the curve. Upon completion on this operation the CHANGED event is triggered.
PARAMS:point:Coordinates of the new key point to be added.
RETURNS:Number of the added key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.addKey(Unigine.Math.vec2,Unigine.Math.vec2,Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Adds a new key point with the specified coordinates and tangents to the curve. Upon completion on this operation the CHANGED event is triggered.
PARAMS:point:Coordinates of the new key point to be added. | left_tangent:Coordinates of the left tangent at the key point. | right_tangent:Coordinates of the right tangent at the key point.
RETURNS:Number of the added key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.removeKey(int)
DESC:Removes the key point with the specified number from the curve. Upon completion on this operation the CHANGED event is triggered.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.moveKey(int,Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Moves the key point with the specified number to a new position (preserving the tangents). Upon completion on this operation the CHANGED event is triggered. The index of key point will be updated automatically. This method can be used to implement dragging of keys on the curve. In case of moving multiple keys it is recommended to use the setKeyPoint() method to set new values for keys and then sort them all at once via the sortKeys() method to save performance.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve. | point:New coordinates of the key point.
RETURNS:New index of the key.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.sortKeys
DESC:Sorts all key points ov the curve by time (X axis) in the ascending order. Upon completion on this operation the CHANGED event is triggered.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.setKeyPoint(int,Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Sets new coordinates for the specified key point (tangents are unaffected). Upon completion on this operation the CHANGED event is triggered. This method unlike the moveKey() does not update the index of the key point automatically. It can be used to implement dragging of multiple keys to set new values for them along with subsequent sorting all keys at once via the sortKeys() method to save performance.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve. | point:New coordinates to be set for the specified point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.setKeyLeftTangent(int,Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Sets new coordinates for the left tangent at the specified key point of the curve. Upon completion on this operation the CHANGED event is triggered.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve. | point:New coordinates of the left tangent at the specified key point to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.setKeyRightTangent(int,Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Sets new coordinates for the right tangent at the specified key point of the curve. Upon completion on this operation the CHANGED event is triggered.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve. | point:New coordinates of the right tangent at the specified key point to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.getKeyPoint(int)
DESC:Returns the coordinates of the key point with the specified number.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve.
RETURNS:Current coordinates of the specified key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.getKeyLeftTangent(int)
DESC:Returns the current coordinates for the left tangent at the specified key point of the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve.
RETURNS:Current coordinates of the left tangent at the specified key point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Curve2d.getKeyRightTangent(int)
DESC:Returns the current coordinates for the right tangent at the specified key point of the curve.
PARAMS:index:Key point number, in the range from 0 to the total number of key points in the curve.
RETURNS:Current coordinates of the right tangent at the specified key point.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Curve2d.REPEAT_MODE_CLAMP
DESC:The value of the start or the end key is retained. Use this option if you don't want any changes before or after the effect created by the curve.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Curve2d.REPEAT_MODE_LOOP
DESC:The curve is tiled. The created effect is repeated cyclically. If the values of the first and the last key are different, the transition between the curves will be abrupt.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Curve2d.REPEAT_MODE_PING_PONG
DESC:Every next curve section is a reflection of the previous curve section. The created effect is repeated in the forward-and-backward manner.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Curve2d.NUM_REPEAT_MODES
DESC:Number of repeat modes.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Expression.getVariable(char)

PARAMS:name:Variable name.
RETURNS:Variable, if it exists; otherwise, 0.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Expression.isVariable(char)

RETURNS:1 if the variable exists; otherwise, 0.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.CustomSystemProxy.playJoystickForceFeedbackEffectConstant(int32_t,float)
DESC:Applies the constant force-feedback effect with the specified parameters to the joystick with the given ID. Force is applied at a constant level for the duration of the effect.
PARAMS:joy_id:Joystick ID. | force:Amount of force being applied by a force-feedback effect. The value in range [-1, 1]. Negative values mean that the initial direction of the force-feedback effect is towards the left, positive values — to the right.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.CustomSystemProxy.playJoystickForceFeedbackEffectRamp(int32_t,float,unsignedlong)
DESC:Applies the ramp force-feedback effect with the specified parameters to the joystick with the given ID. Force is applied gradually by being increased or decreased over the duration of the effect.
PARAMS:joy_id:Joystick ID. | force:Amount of force being applied by a force-feedback effect. The value in range [-1, 1]. Negative values mean that the initial direction of the force-feedback effect is towards the left, positive values — to the right. | duration_us:Force-feedback effect duration, in microseconds.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.CustomSystemProxy.playJoystickForceFeedbackEffectSineWave(int32_t,float,float,float,int,unsignedint,unsignedint,unsignedint,unsignedint)
DESC:Applies the sine-wave force-feedback effect with the specified parameters to the joystick with the given ID. Force is applied in a sine-wave pattern.
PARAMS:joy_id:Joystick ID. | force:Sustain value — the force value in the middle of the force-feedback effect in range [-1, 1]. Negative values mean that the initial direction of the force-feedback effect is towards the left, positive values — to the right. | attack_force:Value at the start of the attack, in range [0, 1]. | fade_force:Value at the end of the fade, in range [0, 1]. | phase:Positive phase shift, in degrees in range [0, 360]. | period_ms:Period of the wave, in ms. | attack_length_ms:Duration of the attack — time period in ms defining how long it takes to reach the force value (the value in the middle of the effect). | fade_length_ms:Duration of the fade out — time period in ms defining how long it takes to fall away from the force value (the value in the middle of the effect). | effect_duration_ms:Duration of the effect, in ms.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.CustomSystemProxy.playJoystickForceFeedbackEffectSquareWave(int32_t,float,float,float,int,unsignedint,unsignedint,unsignedint,unsignedint)
DESC:Applies the square-wave force-feedback effect with the specified parameters to the joystick with the given ID. Force is applied in a square-wave pattern.
PARAMS:joy_id:Joystick ID. | force:Sustain value — the force value in the middle of the force-feedback effect in range [-1, 1]. Negative values mean that the initial direction of the force-feedback effect is towards the left, positive values — to the right. | attack_force:Value at the start of the attack, in range [0, 1]. | fade_force:Value at the end of the fade, in range [0, 1]. | phase:Positive phase shift, in degrees in range [0, 360]. | period_ms:Period of the wave, in ms. | attack_length_ms:Duration of the attack — time period in ms defining how long it takes to reach the force value (the value in the middle of the effect). | fade_length_ms:Duration of the fade out — time period in ms defining how long it takes to fall away from the force value (the value in the middle of the effect). | effect_duration_ms:Duration of the effect, in ms.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.CustomSystemProxy.playJoystickForceFeedbackEffectTriangleWave(int32_t,float,float,float,int,unsignedint,unsignedint,unsignedint,unsignedint)
DESC:Applies the triangle-wave force-feedback effect with the specified parameters to the joystick with the given ID. Force is applied in a triangle-wave pattern.
PARAMS:joy_id:Joystick ID. | force:Sustain value — the force value in the middle of the force-feedback effect in range [-1, 1]. Negative values mean that the initial direction of the force-feedback effect is towards the left, positive values — to the right. | attack_force:Value at the start of the attack. Value in range [0, 1]. | fade_force:Value at the end of the fade. ENTRY:M:Unigine.CustomSystemProxy.playJoystickForceFeedbackEffectSawtoothUpWave(int32_t,float,float,float,int,unsignedint,unsignedint,unsignedint,unsignedint)

Value in range [0, 1]. | fade_force:Value at the end of the fade. Value in range [0, 1]. | phase:Positive phase shift, in degrees in range [0, 360]. | period_ms:Period of the wave, in ms. | attack_length_ms:Duration of the attack — time period in ms defining how long it takes to reach the force value (the value in the middle of the effect). | fade_length_ms:Duration of the fade out — time period in ms defining how long it takes to fall away from the force value (the value in the middle of the effect). | effect_duration_ms:Duration of the effect, in ms.

Value in range [0, 1]. | fade_force:Value at the end of the fade. Value in range [0, 1]. | phase:Positive phase shift, in degrees in range [0, 360]. | period_ms:Period of the wave, in ms. | attack_length_ms:Duration of the attack — time period in ms defining how long it takes to reach the force value (the value in the middle of the effect). | fade_length_ms:Duration of the fade out — time period in ms defining how long it takes to fall away from the force value (the value in the middle of the effect). | effect_duration_ms:Duration of the effect, in ms.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.CustomSystemProxy.playJoystickForceFeedbackEffectSpring(int32_t,float,float,float,float,float,float)
DESC:Applies the spring force-feedback effect with the specified parameters to the joystick with the given ID. Force is applied in opposition to a set state.
PARAMS:joy_id:Joystick ID. | left_force:Strength of the force-feedback effect that occurs when turning to the left. Value in range [0, 1]. | left_saturation:Maximum possible force for the force-feedback effect on turning left. Value in range [0, 1]. Not all devices support saturation. | right_force:Strength of the force-feedback effect that occurs when turning to the right. Value in range [0, 1]. | right_saturation:Maximum possible force for the force-feedback effect on turning right. Value in range [0, 1]. Not all devices support saturation. | offset:The offset from the zero reading of the appropriate sensor value at which the condition begins to be applied. For a spring effect, the neutral point - that is, the point along the axis at which the spring would be considered at rest - would be defined by the offset for the condition. | deadband:Zone around the offset of an axis at which the condition is not active. In the case of a spring that is at rest in the middle of an axis, the deadband enlarges this area of rest. Not all devices support deadband.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.CustomSystemProxy.playJoystickForceFeedbackEffectFriction(int32_t,float,float,float,float)
DESC:Applies the friction force-feedback effect with the specified parameters to the joystick with the given ID. Force is applied to mimic friction.
PARAMS:joy_id:Joystick ID. | left_force:Strength of the force-feedback effect that occurs when turning to the left. Value in range [0, 1]. | left_saturation:Maximum possible force for the force-feedback effect on turning left. Value in range [0, 1]. Not all devices support saturation. | right_force:Strength of the force-feedback effect that occurs when turning to the right. Value in range [0, 1]. | right_saturation:Maximum possible force for the force-feedback effect on turning right. Value in range [0, 1]. Not all devices support saturation.
-

DESC:Applies the damper force-feedback effect with the specified parameters to the joystick with the given ID. Force is applied to mimic a damper effect.
PARAMS:joy_id:Joystick ID. | left_force:Strength of the force-feedback effect that occurs when turning to the left. Value in range [0, 1]. | left_saturation:Maximum possible force for the force-feedback effect on turning left. Value in range [0, 1]. Not all devices support saturation. | right_force:Strength of the force-feedback effect that occurs when turning to the right. Value in range [0, 1]. | right_saturation:Maximum possible force for the force-feedback effect on turning right. Value in range [0, 1]. Not all devices support saturation.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Decal.setMaterial(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Decal.getMaterialInherit const
DESC:Inherits material for the decal (i.e. creates a material instance). Modifications made in a new material instance will not affect the source material. A child material will be created only once, all subsequent calls to this method will return the first created child material.
RETURNS:Smart pointer to the inherited material.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Decal.isMaterialInherited const

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Decal.setMaxFadeDistance(float)
DESC:Updates a maximum fade-out distance, across which the decal smoothly becomes invisible due to the alpha fading. It is counted starting from the maximum visibility distance value.
PARAMS:distance:A new minimum fade-out distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Decal.getMaxFadeDistance const

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Decal.setMaxVisibleDistance(float)
DESC:Updates the maximum visibility distance, starting at which the decal begins to fade out until becomes completely invisible.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Decal.getMaxVisibleDistance const
DESC:Returns a maximum visibility distance, starting at which the decal begins to fade out until becomes completely invisible.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.getMeshAsyncRAM
DESC:Returns the source mesh used for the object and loads it to memory (RAM) asynchronously.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.getMeshAsyncVRAM
DESC:Returns the render mesh used for the object and loads it to video memory (VRAM) asynchronously. At that, the static mesh will also be loaded to memory (RAM). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:A render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.getMeshDynamicRAM
DESC:Returns the procedural source mesh associated with the object and ensures it is loaded into system memory (RAM). This method is only available when the mesh is in the dynamic (PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC) mode. A procedural mesh is a mesh created via code and uses a specific streaming mode. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, the object stays in memory after creation and is only unloaded manually using deleteDynamicMesh() or when the procedural mode is changed.
RETURNS:A procedural source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.getMeshDynamicVRAM
DESC:Returns the procedural render mesh associated with the object and ensures it is loaded into video memory (VRAM). This method is only available when the mesh is in the dynamic (PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC) mode. A procedural mesh is a mesh created via code and uses a specific streaming mode. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, the object stays in memory after creation and is only unloaded manually using deleteDynamicMesh() or when the procedural mode is changed.
RETURNS:A procedural render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.loadAsyncVRAM
DESC:Asynchronously loads the mesh to video memory (VRAM) if the async streaming mode for meshes is enabled. Otherwise, the forced loading is performed. This method is recommended for implementing your own prefetch system (i.e. asynchronous pre-loading of meshes to video memory before they are used). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to VRAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.loadAsyncRAM
DESC:Asynchronously loads the mesh to memory (RAM) if the async streaming mode for meshes is enabled. Otherwise, the forced loading is performed. This method is recommended for implementing your own prefetch system (i.e. asynchronous pre-loading of meshes to video memory before they are used).
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to RAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.loadForceVRAM
DESC:Performs force-loading of the mesh to video memory (VRAM) immediately. The forced loading to VRAM is performed in the main thread. Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to VRAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.loadForceRAM
DESC:Performs force-loading of the mesh to memory (RAM) immediately.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to RAM, true will be returned.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.applyCopyMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int)
DESC:Copies all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.applyMoveMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
DESC:Moves all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately without memory allocation and data copying (move semantics). Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, this method behaves identically to its asynchronous variant.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to move vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was moved (transferred without copying) successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.applyMoveMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{MeshRender})
DESC:Moves all vertex and render data from the given mesh_ram and mesh_vram into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately using move semantics, without data copying or VRAM allocation. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:mesh_ram:Source mesh containing vertex data. | mesh_vram:Source mesh containing render data.
RETURNS:true if the data was moved (transferred without copying) successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.applyCopyMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int)
DESC:Copies all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster compared to the forced variant, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.applyMoveMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
DESC:Moves all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay, without memory allocation and data copying (move semantics). Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster compared to the forced variant, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.applyMoveMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{MeshRender})
DESC:Moves all vertex and render data from the given mesh_ram and mesh_vram into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously, without copying or allocating VRAM. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, this method behaves identically to its forced variant.
PARAMS:mesh_ram:Source mesh containing vertex data. | mesh_vram:Source mesh containing render data.
RETURNS:true if the data was moved successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.deleteDynamicMesh
DESC:Releases all memory used by the procedural mesh, including both VRAM and RAM. Works only when procedural mode is set to PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC.
RETURNS:true if the memory was released successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.runGenerateMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},int)
DESC:Starts asynchronous generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in a background thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh will be transferred to the object once complete, without blocking the main thread. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. Note that the callback is executed in a single dedicated thread controlled by the engine, it is not parallelized and must not spawn additional threads.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the modification was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.runGenerateMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Starts asynchronous generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in a background thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh will be transferred to the object once complete, without blocking the main thread. After the mesh has been applied to the object, the optional callback_done will be called. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. Note that the callback is executed in a single dedicated thread controlled by the engine, it is not parallelized and must not spawn additional threads.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | callback_done:Optional callback executed after geometry has been fully applied.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_done() | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.runGenerateMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},int)
DESC:Starts immediate (forced) generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in the main thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh is applied to the object as soon as generation completes. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.DecalMesh.runGenerateMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Starts immediate (forced) generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in the main thread and must create and fill a Mesh object with vertex data. Once the mesh is applied to the object, the optional callback_done is called on the main thread. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | callback_done:Optional callback executed after geometry has been fully applied.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_done() | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Dir.ATTRIBUTE_HIDDEN
DESC:File or directory is hidden. It is not included in an ordinary directory listing.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Dir.ATTRIBUTE_READONLY
DESC:File is read-only. You can read the file, but cannot write to it or delete it. This attribute is not honored on directories.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Dir.ATTRIBUTE_TEMPORARY
DESC:File that is being used for temporary storage. File systems avoid writing data back to mass storage if sufficient cache memory is available, because typically, an application deletes a temporary file after the handle is closed. In that scenario, the system can entirely avoid writing the data. Otherwise, the data is written after the handle is closed..

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Ellipsoid.getENUSurfacePoint(Unigine.Math.dvec3,Unigine.Math.dvec3)
DESC:Returns surface point by using tangent point coordinates.The Up-axis (Z+) direction in ENU points upward along the ellipsoid normal, while in UNIGINE implementation of ENU it goes from the Earth's center.
PARAMS:geodetic_origin:The origin in ellipsoid coordinates (latitude (degrees), longitude (degrees) and altitude (meters). | tangent_point:Tangent point coordinates to converted (curved) to surface coordinates (offset related to point of junction).

PARAMS:geodetic_origin:The origin in ellipsoid coordinates (latitude (degrees), longitude (degrees) and altitude (meters). | surface_point:Surface point coordinates to be converted (flatten) to tangent point (offset related to point of junction).

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Ellipsoid.toENU(Unigine.Math.dvec3,Unigine.Math.dvec3)
DESC:Converts geodetic coordinates to ENU (East, North, Up).The Up-axis (Z+) direction in ENU points upward along the ellipsoid normal, while in UNIGINE implementation of ENU it goes from the Earth's center.
PARAMS:geodetic_origin:The origin in ellipsoid coordinates (latitude (degrees), longitude (degrees) and altitude (meters). | geodetic_coords:Coordinates to be converted to ENU.
RETURNS:ENU coordinates.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Ellipsoid.toGeodetic(Unigine.Math.dvec3,int)
DESC:Converts Cartesian (ECF) coordinates to Ellipsoid.
PARAMS:ecf_coords:Cartesian ECF coordinates to be converted. | need_alt:Flag indicating if altitude is to be calculated. 1 to calculate altitude, 0 - to skip altitude calculation.The default value is 1.
RETURNS:Ellipsoid coordinates (latitude (degrees), longitude (degrees) and altitude (meters)
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Ellipsoid.toNED(Unigine.Math.dvec3,Unigine.Math.dvec3)
DESC:Converts geodetics coordinates to NED (North, East, Down).The Down-axis direction in NED points downward along the ellipsoid normal, while in UNIGINE implementation of NED it goes through the Earth's center.
PARAMS:geodetic_origin:The origin in ellipsoid coordinates (latitude (degrees), longitude (degrees) and altitude (meters). | geodetic_coords:Coordinates to be converted to NED.
RETURNS:NED coordinates.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Ellipsoid.MODE_ACCURATE
DESC:A calculation mode uses Vincenty's formula to calculate distances on the surface of the ellipsoid with a millimeter precision. It takes more time for calculation, but the accuracy of positioning is awesome.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Ellipsoid.MODE_FAST
DESC:A calculation mode is computed by using Great-circle distance formula. It works pretty fast, but you'll get positioning errors on big (~80000x80000 units) distances.
-

PARAMS:logic:EditorLogic instance.
RETURNS:true if the EditorLogic instance has been added successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.addPlugin(Plugin)
DESC:Adds a plugin to engine runtime by using a pointer to this plugin.
PARAMS:plugin:Plugin pointer.
RETURNS:true if the plugin ha been added successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.addPlugin(char)
DESC:Adds a plugin to engine runtime by its name.
PARAMS:name:Plugin name.
RETURNS:true if the plugin has been added successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.addSystemLogic(SystemLogic)
DESC:Adds a SystemLogic instance to Engine runtime.
PARAMS:logic:SystemLogic instance.
RETURNS:true if the SystemLogic instance has been added successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.addWorldLogic(WorldLogic)
DESC:Adds a WorldLogic instance to the engine runtime. Instances of the WorldLogic class should not be added while the world is loaded and the world script is being executed (as you can't change a world script while the world is loaded). In such a case the init() method shall not be called if the WorldLogic is added before opening the world.
PARAMS:logic:WorldLogic instance.
RETURNS:true if the WorldLogic instance has been added successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.findPlugin(char) const
DESC:Searches the index of the loaded plugin by its name.
PARAMS:name:Name of the plugin.
RETURNS:Index of the plugin if it is found, or -1 otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.main(SystemLogic,WorldLogic,EditorLogic)
DESC:Engine main loop. Replaces the following commands:
PARAMS:system:A SystemLogic instance. | world:A WorldLogic instance. | editor:An EditorLogic instance.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.removeEditorLogic(EditorLogic)

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.removeSystemLogic(SystemLogic)
DESC:Removes a SystemLogic instance from engine runtime.
PARAMS:logic:A SystemLogic instance.
RETURNS:true if the instance has been removed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.removeWorldLogic(WorldLogic)
DESC:Removes a WorldLogic instance from engine runtime. Instances of the WorldLogic class should not be removed while the world is loaded and the world script is being executed (as you can't change a world script while the world is loaded). In such a case the shutdown() method shall not be called if the WorldLogic is removed before closing the world.
PARAMS:logic:A WorldLogic instance.
RETURNS:true if the instance has been removed successfully; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.shutdown
DESC:Deletes the pointer to the existing engine instance.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.iterate
DESC:Engine iterate function (update, render, swap). This function must be called every frame.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.beginOutsideLoopRender
DESC:Starts a block of code where you can call Render class methods from outside the Engine's Loop. The end of this block should be marked with a call to the method.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.endOutsideLoopRender
DESC:Closes a block of code where you can call Render class methods from outside the Engine's Loop started with a call to the method.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.startFps
DESC:Starts the FPS counter if it was stopped. All function calls are placed into a stack, so the number of calls to this function should correspond to the number of calls to the stopFps() function.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Engine.stopFps
DESC:Stops the FPS counter. This function should be called if application window is hidden or some heavy non-rendering tasks are processing. All function calls are placed into a stack, so the number of calls to this function should correspond to the number of calls to the startFps() function.
-

DESC:Returns the current video context flags.
RETURNS:A set of current video context flags as an integer value.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.GCMODE_DEFAULT
DESC:Default C# garbage collector mode. In this case heavy spikes and excessive memory consumption are imminent if you don't manage your objects properly and do not use the Dispose() method.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.GCMODE_USE_MEMORY_PRESSURE
DESC:Passes the information about C++ memory consumption to C#. This results in more frequent GC calls preventing the application from eating too much memory right after startup and removing heavy spikes.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.GCMODE_EVERY_FRAME
DESC:The garbage collector is called every frame. This results in overall performance reduction, but removes heavy spikes.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.GCMODE_WORLD_SHUTDOWN
DESC:The garbage collector is called on closing the world. This mode is ideal if the number of memory allocations is your code is insignificant.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.BACKGROUND_UPDATE_DISABLED
DESC:Background update is disabled.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.BACKGROUND_UPDATE_RENDER_NON_MINIMIZED
DESC:Background update is enabled (rendering is performed when the window is out of focus, but stops if the window is minimized).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.BACKGROUND_UPDATE_RENDER_ALWAYS
DESC:Background update is always enabled (rendering is performed all the time, regardless of the window state.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.BUILD_CONFIG_DEBUG
DESC:Debug build configuration.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.BUILD_CONFIG_DEVELOPMENT
DESC:Development build configuration.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.BUILD_CONFIG_RELEASE
DESC:Release build configuration.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.PRECISION_PRECISION_DOUBLE
DESC:Double precision type.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Engine.PRECISION_PRECISION_FLOAT
DESC:Float precision type.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldAnimation.#ctor(Unigine.Math.vec3)
DESC:Creates a new Field Animation node of the specified size: If the Field Animation is of an ellipse shape, its radius values along the axes must be specified. Otherwise, dimensions of the cube must be specified.
PARAMS:size:A size of the Field Animation along X, Y and Z axes in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldAnimation.type
DESC:Returns the type of the object.
RETURNS:FieldAnimation type identifier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldHeight.#ctor
DESC:The default constructor. Creates a FieldHeight instance with the default size vec3(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f). By default, a heightmap texture is empty. Specify it after creating the FieldHeight by using an appropriate function.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldHeight.setTextureImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
DESC:Sets the given image as the heightmap texture of the FieldHeight.
PARAMS:image:Image instance with heightmap for FieldHeight.
RETURNS:1 if the texture is set successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldHeight.getTextureImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}) const
DESC:Grabs the texture for the FieldHeight (already loaded to GPU) and saves it into the given Image instance.
PARAMS:image:Image instance into which the texture will be saved.
RETURNS:1 if the texture has been grabbed successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldHeight.type
DESC:Returns the type of the object.
RETURNS:FieldHeight type identifier.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.FieldHeight.BLEND_ADDITIVE
DESC:Additive blending mode for the height field.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.FieldHeight.BLEND_MULTIPLICATIVE
DESC:Multiplicative blending mode for the height field.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldShoreline.#ctor
DESC:Default constructor. Creates a FieldShoreline instance with the default size vec3(512.0f, 512.0f, 512.0f). By default, a shoreline texture is empty. Specify it after creating the FieldShoreline by using an appropriate function.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldShoreline.bakeWaterLevel(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
DESC:Bakes shoreline for the current water level of the global water object and puts it to the specified image. This method generates a shoreline texture by finding intersections of the Global Water object with terrains (Landscape Terrain and Terrain Global)
PARAMS:image:Image instance to which the shoreline for the current water level is to be baked.
RETURNS:1 if the shoreline is baked successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldShoreline.setTextureImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
DESC:Sets the given image as the shoreline texture of the FieldShoreline.
PARAMS:image:Image instance with a shoreline texture for the FieldShoreline.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldShoreline.getTextureImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}) const
DESC:Grabs the texture for the FieldShoreline (already loaded to GPU) and saves it into the given Image instance.
PARAMS:image:Image instance into which the texture will be saved.
RETURNS:1 if the texture has been grabbed successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldShoreline.createShorelineDistanceField(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},int,int,int)
DESC:Creates a shoreline distance field with the specified parameters and puts it to the specified Image.
PARAMS:texture:Texture to which the shoreline distance field will be put. | shoreline_radius:Radius of the shoreline. | blur_radius:Radius of the blurred area. | downsample_resolution:Shoreline resolution.
RETURNS:1 if the field was created successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldShoreline.type
DESC:Returns the type of the object.
RETURNS:FieldShoreline type identifier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldSpacer.#ctor(Unigine.Math.vec3)
DESC:Creates a new Field Spacer of the specified size: If the Field Spacer is of an ellipse shape, its radius values along the axes must be specified. Otherwise, dimensions of the cube must be specified.
PARAMS:size:A size of the Field Spacer along X, Y and Z axes in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldSpacer.type
DESC:Returns the type of the object.
RETURNS:FieldSpacer type identifier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldWeather.#ctor
DESC:Constructor. Creates a new empty FieldWeather instance with default properties.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldWeather.setTextureImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
DESC:Sets the given image as the coverage texture of the FieldWeather.
PARAMS:image:Image instance with a coverage texture for the FieldWeather.
RETURNS:1 if the coverage texture was set successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldWeather.getTextureImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}) const
DESC:Grabs the coverage texture of the FieldWeather (already loaded to GPU) and saves it into the given Image instance.
PARAMS:image:Image instance into which the current coverage texture will be grabbed.
RETURNS:1 if the coverage texture was grabbed successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FieldWeather.type
DESC:Returns the type of the object.
RETURNS:FieldWeather type identifier.
-
FILE:UnigineFileSystem.xml
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getMount(char) const
DESC:Returns a mount point for the specified path. This method will return the root mount for all files located directly in the data folder or its subfolders.
PARAMS:path:File path, for which a mount point is to be found. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.
RETURNS:FileSystemMount class smart pointer on success; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getMount(Unigine.UGUID) const
DESC:Returns a mount point for the specified GUID. This method will return the root mount for all files located directly in the data folder or its subfolders.
PARAMS:guid:File GUID for which a mount point is to be found.
RETURNS:FileSystemMount class smart pointer on success; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getMounts(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{FileSystemMount},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Returns a list of all mount points currently used by the file system and puts the to the specified output buffer. This list will not include the root mount.
PARAMS:container:Output buffer to store the list of all currently used mount points.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getRootMount const
DESC:Returns the root mount of the file system. It mounts the data folder to the root of the virtual file system. The root mount cannot be unmounted.
RETURNS:FileSystemMount class smart pointer for the root mount of the virtual file system.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.createMount(char,char,int,Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},bool)
DESC:Adds a new mount point for the specified external folder/package, virtual path and access mode. All mounted files are automatically added as known to the virtual file system.
PARAMS:absolute_path:Absolute path to the mounted folder/package. | virtual_path:Virtual path to the folder to which the contents of the external folder/package is to be mounted. | access:Mount point access mode, one of the values. | exclusive_filters:List of wildcards (e.g., "*.jpg", "some_folder_*/") to be used to filter files in the mounted folder/package. | ignore_filters:List of wildcards (e.g., "*.tmp", "cache_*/") to be used to filter out files to be ignored in the mounted folder/package. | guidsdb_ignore_filters:List of wildcards (e.g., "*.tmp", "cache_*/") to be used to exclude files or directories from the GUIDs database. | save_file:A flag indicating whether a .umount file should be written to disk.
RETURNS:FileSystemMount class smart pointer, if it was created successfully; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.addMount(char)
DESC:Adds a new mount point using the data from the specified *.umount file.All mounted files are automatically added as known to the virtual file system.
PARAMS:umount_path:Absolute path to a *.umount file.
RETURNS:FileSystemMount class smart pointer, if it was created successfully; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.saveMountFile(char) const
DESC:Saves the specified *.umount file.
PARAMS:umount_path:Mount point file path.
RETURNS:true if the specified *.umount file is saved successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.removeMount(char)
DESC:Unmounts a mount point with a given path. The root mount cannot be removed.
PARAMS:path:Absolute path to the mounted folder/package.
RETURNS:true if the mount point with a given path is successfully unmounted; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.clearMounts
DESC:Unmounts all mount points. This method does not remove the root mount.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.loadPackage(char)
DESC:Loads an UNG or ZIP package into the file system. Note that the package should be mounted, otherwise it won't be loaded. UNG packages without password protection can be loaded even if the engine has built-in password for the file system packages. For example, it is possible to load both the core.ung package without a password and the my_assets.ung package protected with a password.
PARAMS:path:Package path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.
RETURNS:true if the package is loaded; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.loadPackage(char,char)
DESC:Loads a package with the specified extension (ung, zip, or pak) into the file system. Note that the package should be mounted, otherwise it won't be loaded. UNG packages without password protection can be loaded even if the engine has built-in password for the file system packages. For example, it is possible to load both the core.ung package without a password and the my_assets.ung package protected with a password.
PARAMS:path:Package path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path. | extension:Extension of a custom package, one of the following values:ungzippak
RETURNS:true if the package is loaded; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.removePackage(char)
DESC:Unloads an UNG or ZIP package from the file system.
PARAMS:path:Package path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.
RETURNS:true if the package is removed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getSupportedPackagesExtensions(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Returns a list of registered extensions that can be loaded as a package.
PARAMS:extensions:An array to store registered extensions.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getPackageVirtualFiles(char,Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Saves the list of names for all virtual files stored in the specified package to the specified string buffer.
PARAMS:path:Path to a custom package. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path. | files:String buffer to store the list of names for all virtual files stored in the specified package.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getPackageVirtualFiles(char,char,Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Saves the list of names for all virtual files stored in a package with the specified name and extension to the specified string buffer.
PARAMS:path:Path to a custom package. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path. | extension:Extension of a custom package, one of the following values:ungzippak | files:String buffer to store the list of names for all virtual files stored in the specified package.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.preloadExternPackage(Package)
DESC:Loads the custom package before the file system initialization. The method should be called before the Engine init.
PARAMS:package:Custom package instance.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.preloadExternPackage(char,Package)
DESC:Loads the custom package before the file system initialization and sets a virtual path to it. The method should be called before the Engine init.
PARAMS:virtual_path:Virtual path to a custom package. | package:Custom package instance.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.clearPreloadedExternPackages
DESC:Clears all preloaded custom packages (packages loaded before the file system initialization).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.addExternPackage(Package)
DESC:Adds a custom package to the virtual file system.
PARAMS:package:Custom package instance.
RETURNS:true if the package is added successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.addExternPackage(char,Package)
DESC:Adds a custom package to the virtual file system and assigns a virtual path to it. The virtual path is obtained by using the given path.
PARAMS:path:Path to a custom package. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path. | package:Custom package instance.
RETURNS:true if the package is added successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getVirtualFiles(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Saves the list of names for all known files registered in the file system to the specified string buffer.
PARAMS:files:String buffer to store the list of names for all known virtual files.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getVirtualFiles(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.UGUID,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Saves the list of GUIDs for all known files registered in the file system to the specified string buffer.
PARAMS:files:String buffer to store the list of GUIDs for all known virtual files.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.isVirtualFile(char) const
DESC:Checks if the given file is known to the virtual file system.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.
RETURNS:true if the file is known to the virtual file system; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.isVirtualFile(Unigine.UGUID) const
DESC:Checks if a file with the given GUID is known to the virtual file system and has a virtual path registered.
PARAMS:guid:File GUID.
RETURNS:true if the file is known to the virtual file system; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.addVirtualFile(char,Unigine.UGUID,bool)
DESC:Registers the regular file name as known virtual file with the given GUID and appends it to the map used for fast searching. This method should be used when you need to add, for example, a new content to the project.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder. | guid:File GUID. | must_exist:A flag indicating whether the specified file must exist.
RETURNS:true if the file name is appended successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.addVirtualFile(char,bool)
DESC:Registers the regular file name as known virtual file and appends it to the map used for fast searching. This method should be used when you need to add, for example, a new content to the project.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder. | must_exist:A flag indicating whether the specified file must exist.
RETURNS:File GUID if it was registered successfully or an empty GUID, otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.renameVirtualFile(char,char)
DESC:Renames the specified known virtual file.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder. | new_path:New path for the file.
RETURNS:true if the file is renamed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.renameVirtualFile(char,char,Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Renames the specified known file and assigns it the specified new GUID.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder. | new_path:New path for the file. | new_guid:New GUID for the file.
RETURNS:true if the file is renamed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.renameVirtualFile(Unigine.UGUID,char)
DESC:Renames the known virtual file with the given GUID.
PARAMS:guid:File GUID. | new_path:New path for the file.
RETURNS:true if the file is renamed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.renameVirtualFile(Unigine.UGUID,char,Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Renames the known virtual file with the given GUID and assigns it the specified new GUID.
PARAMS:guid:File GUID. | new_path:New path for the file. | new_guid:New GUID for the file.
RETURNS:true if the file is renamed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.removeVirtualFile(char)
DESC:Removes the virtual file with the given name.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.
RETURNS:true if the file is removed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.removeVirtualFile(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Removes the virtual file with the given GUID.
PARAMS:guid:GUID of the known virtual file to remove.
RETURNS:true if the file is removed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.changeVirtualFile(char)
DESC:Marks the virtual file with the given name as modified. The corresponding CALLBACK_FILE_CHANGED signal is emitted. This method is used to notify the Engine that a resource has been modified and needs to be updated.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.
RETURNS:true if the file is successfully marked as modified; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.changeVirtualFile(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Marks the virtual file with the given GUID as modified. The corresponding CALLBACK_FILE_CHANGED signal is emitted. This method is used to notify the Engine that a resource has been modified and needs to be updated.
PARAMS:guid:GUID of the known virtual file to remove.
RETURNS:true if the file is successfully marked as modified; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.removeNonExistingVirtualFiles
DESC:Removes all non-existing virtual files from the File System. These files aren't physically exist on the disk, however, they are added to the virtual file system. For example, it can be a blob or a cache file.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.isBlobFile(char) const
DESC:Checks if the given file is loaded to a blob.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.
RETURNS:true if the file is loaded to a blob successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.isBlobFile(Unigine.UGUID) const
DESC:Checks if a file with the given GUID is loaded to a blob.
PARAMS:guid:File GUID.
RETURNS:true if the file is loaded to a blob successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.addBlobFile(char)
DESC:Adds a file into a blob. It can be used for files that are frequently modified at run time (for example, images). After such file is loaded from a disk and written into a blob in the memory, its modifications can be saved fast into this blob.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.
RETURNS:true if the file is successfully added into a blob; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.addBlobFile(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Adds a file with the given GUID into a blob. It can be used for files that are frequently modified at run time (for example, images). After such file is loaded from a disk and written into a blob in the memory, its modifications can be saved fast into this blob.
PARAMS:guid:File GUID.
RETURNS:true if the file is successfully added into a blob; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.removeBlobFile(char)
DESC:Removes a file from the blob. Blobbing can be used for files that are frequently modified at run time (for example, images). After such file is loaded from a disk and written into a blob in the memory, its modifications can be saved fast into this blob.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.
RETURNS:true if the file is removed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.removeBlobFile(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Removes a file with the given GUID from the blob. Blobbing can be used for files that are frequently modified at run time (for example, images). After such file is loaded from a disk and written into a blob in the memory, its modifications can be saved fast into this blob.
PARAMS:guid:File GUID.
RETURNS:true if the file is removed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.isCacheFile(char) const
DESC:Checks if the given file is loaded into cache.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.
RETURNS:true if the file is added into cache; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.isCacheFile(Unigine.UGUID) const
DESC:Checks if a file with the given GUID is loaded into cache.
PARAMS:guid:File GUID.
RETURNS:true if the file is added into cache; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.addCacheFile(char)
DESC:Caches a file in the memory. It can be used for files that are accessed multiple times at run time (for example, textures are read two times in a row). Such files are loaded into the memory for faster reading.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.
RETURNS:true if the file is successfully added to cache; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.addCacheFile(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Caches a file in the memory with the given GUID. It can be used for files that are accessed multiple times at run time (for example, textures are read two times in a row). Such files are loaded into the memory for faster reading.
PARAMS:guid:File GUID.
RETURNS:true if the file is successfully added to cache; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.removeCacheFile(char)
DESC:Removes a cached file from the memory. Caching can be used for files that are accessed multiple times at run time (for example, textures are read two times in a row). Such files are loaded into the memory for faster reading.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.
RETURNS:true if the file is successfully removed from cache; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.removeCacheFile(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Removes a cached file with the given GUID from the memory. Caching can be used for files that are accessed multiple times at run time (for example, textures are read two times in a row). Such files are loaded into the memory for faster reading.
PARAMS:guid:File GUID.
RETURNS:true if the file is successfully removed from cache; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.isDiskFile(char) const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the specified file path is a path to a file on disk (i.e. not a package, a blob, or a cache file).
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getVirtualPath(char) const
DESC:Resolves a virtual path for the given file path. The following examples show particular cases of the method usage: If the given path is known for the virtual file system, the following can be returned: If the given path is unknown for the virtual file system, the following can be returned: If the given path is the path to a mounted file. Here mount_1 is the mount_1.umount mount point. Note that in the example below, the 1.tga asset has no runtime files. If an asset has a runtime file, the virtual path to this runtime file (stored in the .runtimes folder of the mount point) will be returned. If the given path is the path to a mounted file stored in the nested mount points. Here mount_1 and mount_2 are the mount_1.umount and mount_2.umount mount points correspondingly. Note that in the example below, the 1.tga asset has no runtime files. If an asset has a runtime file, the virtual path to this runtime file (stored in the .runtimes folder of the mount point) will be returned.

Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.isFileExist(char) const
DESC:Checks if the given file actually exists on the disk. Calling this method every frame in the main thread, especially for multiple files, may cause a performance hit. It is better to optimize such checks and move them to a separate thread.
PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystem.getMTime(char) const

PARAMS:path:File path. It can be a relative, absolute, network, or virtual path.If you want to specify a path to an asset, you should use the asset path format (asset://). Otherwise, if you specify the regular path to the asset, it will be treated as the path to its runtime file (if any) from the .runtimes folder.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemAssets.resolve(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Resolves a given GUID.
PARAMS:any_guid:Any file GUID.
RETURNS:Return GUID value is determined by the GUID specified in accordance with the following:Non-native asset file GUID -> GUID of its primary runtime file, if any; otherwise, asset file GUID.Any other file GUID -> file GUID as is.// if there is a primary runtime generatedresolve(asset_guid);//-> primary_guidresolve(primary_guid);//-> primary_guidresolve(runtime_guid);//-> runtime_guid// if there is no primary runtime generatedresolve(asset_guid);//-> asset_guidresolve(primary_guid);//-> primary_guidresolve(runtime_guid);//-> runtime_guid
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemAssets.resolveAsset(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Resolves a given GUID to a corresponding asset GUID, if any, or keeps the specified GUID as is.
PARAMS:any_guid:Any file GUID.
RETURNS:Return GUID value is determined by the GUID specified in accordance with the following:Primary runtime file GUID -> source asset file GUID.Generated runtime file GUID -> source asset file GUID.Non-native asset file GUID -> GUID as is.Any other file GUID -> GUID as is.resolveAsset(asset_guid);//-> asset_guidresolveAsset(primary_guid);//-> asset_guidresolveAsset(runtime_guid);//-> asset_guid
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemAssets.resolvePrimary(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Resolves a given GUID to a corresponding primary runtime GUID, if any.
PARAMS:any_guid:Any file GUID.
RETURNS:Return GUID value is determined by the GUID specified in accordance with the following:Any generated runtime file GUID -> GUID of the primary runtime file for the source asset.Non-native asset file GUID -> GUID of its primary runtime file, if any; otherwise, empty GUID.Any other file GUID -> empty GUID.// if there is a primary runtime generatedresolvePrimary(asset_guid);//-> primary_guidresolvePrimary(primary_guid);//-> primary_guidresolvePrimary(runtime_guid);//-> primary_guid// if there is no primary runtime generatedresolvePrimary(asset_guid);//-> empty guidresolvePrimary(runtime_guid);//-> empty guid
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemAssets.setRuntimePrimary(char,int,int)
DESC:Sets or unsets the generated runtime file, specified by the given non-native asset path and runtime index, as a primary one.
