ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemMount.setExclusiveFilters(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Sets the list of exclusive filters (whitelist) to be used to include only specific files when mounting. The filters are defined as wildcard masks (e.g., "*.jpg", "some_folder_*/"), and allow restricting the visible file set to those matching the specified patterns.
PARAMS:filters:List of wildcards to be used to filter files in the mounted folder/package.Maximum number of patterns that can be used is limited to 32.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemMount.getExclusiveFilters(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Returns the list of exclusive filters (whitelist) used to include only specific files when mounting. The filters are defined as wildcard masks (e.g., "*.jpg", "some_folder_*/"), and allow restricting the visible file set to those matching the specified patterns.
PARAMS:filters:List of wildcards currently used to filter files in the mounted folder/package.Maximum number of patterns that can be used is limited to 32.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemMount.getExclusiveFilters const
DESC:Returns the list of exclusive filters (whitelist) used to include only specific files when mounting. The filters are defined as wildcard masks (e.g., "*.jpg", "some_folder_*/"), and allow restricting the visible file set to those matching the specified patterns.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemMount.setIgnoreFilters(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Sets the list of ignore filters (blacklist) to be used to exclude certain files or directories from being stored in the GUIDs database. The filters are defined as wildcard masks (e.g., "*.tmp", "cache_*/"), and help prevent unnecessary files from being tracked or assigned GUIDs.
PARAMS:filters:List of wildcards to be used to filter out files to be ignored in the mounted folder/package.Maximum number of patterns that can be used is limited to 32.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemMount.getIgnoreFilters(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Returns the list of ignore filters (blacklist) used to exclude certain files or directories from being stored in the GUIDs database. The filters are defined as wildcard masks (e.g., "*.tmp", "cache_*/"), and help prevent unnecessary files from being tracked or assigned GUIDs.
PARAMS:filters:List of wildcards currently used to filter out files to be ignored in the mounted folder/package.Maximum number of patterns that can be used is limited to 32.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemMount.getIgnoreFilters const
DESC:Returns the list of ignore filters (blacklist) used to exclude certain files or directories from being stored in the GUIDs database. The filters are defined as wildcard masks (e.g., "*.tmp", "cache_*/"), and help prevent unnecessary files from being tracked or assigned GUIDs.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemMount.getVirtualFiles(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Returns the list of virtual paths to all files in the mounted folder/package. Contents of nested mount points inside the mounted folder will not be included in the list.
PARAMS:files:Output vector to store the list of files stored in the mounted folder/package.
-

PARAMS:path:Any file path.
RETURNS:true if the specified path is filtered out after applying exclusive and ignore filters if any; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemMount.setGuidsDBIgnoreFilters(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Sets the list of GUIDs database (guids.db) ignore filters (blacklist) to be used to exclude certain files or directories from being stored in the GUIDs database. The filters are defined as wildcard masks (e.g., "*.tmp", "cache_*/"), and help prevent unnecessary or temporary files from being tracked or assigned GUIDs.
PARAMS:filters:List of wildcards to be used to exclude files or directories from the GUIDs database.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemMount.getGuidsDBIgnoreFilters(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Returns the list of GUIDs database (guids.db) ignore filters (blacklist) used to exclude certain files or directories from being stored in the GUIDs database. The filters are defined as wildcard masks (e.g., "*.tmp", "cache_*/"), and help prevent unnecessary or temporary files from being tracked or assigned GUIDs.
PARAMS:filters:Output list of wildcards currently used to exclude files or directories from the GUIDs database.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.FileSystemMount.getGuidsDBIgnoreFilters const
DESC:Returns the list of GUIDs database (guids.db) ignore filters (blacklist) used to exclude certain files or directories from being stored in the GUIDs database. The filters are defined as wildcard masks (e.g., "*.tmp", "cache_*/"), and help prevent unnecessary or temporary files from being tracked or assigned GUIDs.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Game.setIFps(float)
DESC:Sets the scaled inverse FPS value (the time in seconds it took to complete the last frame). This function sets a fixed FPS that does not depend on the real FPS the hardware is capable of. That is, it forces constant frame time increments between rendered frames, used for animation/expression update etc. To remove the FPS limitation, use -1. The function is useful when grabbing the video reel with a fixed FPS value (for example, 25 frames per second).
PARAMS:ifps:Inverse FPS value (1/FPS) in seconds.-1 removes the FPS limitation.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Game.getIntersection(Unigine.Vec3,Unigine.Vec3,float,int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Math.Vec3)
DESC:Performs intersection to find if a pathfinding Obstacle is located within the cylinder between two points. The specified obstacles will be ignored. World space coordinates are used for this function.
PARAMS:p0:Start point. | p1:End point. | radius:Radius of the intersection cylinder. | mask:Obstacle intersection mask. The obstacle is ignored if its mask does not match. | exclude:Array with excluded obstacles. These obstacle nodes are ignored when performing intersection. | intersection:Intersection point.
RETURNS:Intersected obstacle.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Game.getIntersection(Unigine.Vec3,Unigine.Vec3,float,int,Unigine.Ptr{GameIntersection})
DESC:Performs intersection to find if a pathfinding obstacle is located within the cylinder between two points. World space coordinates are used for this function. The following example shows how you can get the intersection point (vec3) of the cylinder between two points with an obstacle. In this example we specify a cylinder from the point of the camera (vec3 p0) to the point of the mouse pointer (vec3 p1) with the specified radius. The executing sequence is the following: Define and initialize two points (p0 and p1) by using the Player::getDirectionFromScreen(). Create an instance of the GameIntersection class to get the intersection point coordinates. Check, if there is an intersection with an obstacle. The Game::getIntersection() function returns an intersected obstacle when the obstacle appears in the area of the cylinder. After that GameIntersection instance gets the point of the nearest intersection point and you can get it by using the getPoint() function.
PARAMS:p0:Start point. | p1:End point. | radius:Radius of the intersection cylinder. | mask:Obstacle intersection mask. The obstacle is ignored if its mask does not match. | intersection:GameIntersection class instance to put the result into.
RETURNS:Intersected obstacle.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Game.setScale(float)
DESC:Sets a value that is used to scale frame duration. It scales up or down the speed of rendering, physics and game logic. This function can be used to create effects of slow/accelerated motion. For example, if the scale equals 2, the rate of simulation of all effects (such as particles) speeds up to two times faster. As for physics, in reality it will be simulated with the same fixed physics FPS, but the number of iterations will be two times higher. It is possible to scale the physics FPS separately via engine.physics.setScale() function. This function scales the value set by the setIFps().
PARAMS:scale:Scaling factor. The provided values is clamped within the range [0;32].

ENTRY:M:Unigine.GeodeticPivot.setOriginBasis(int)
DESC:Sets a new origin basis for the GeodeticPivot object: If ORIGIN_BASIS_LOCAL is set, the binding to geo-coordinates is disabled. GeodeticPivot can be placed everywhere. If ORIGIN_BASIS_ENU is set, GeodeticPivot is placed to the world ECF position with ENU (East - North - Up) orientation according to the given latitude / longitude / altitude. The GeodeticPivot position is blocked. The Up-axis (Z+) direction in ENU points upward along the ellipsoid normal, while in UNIGINE implementation of ENU it goes from the Earth's center.
PARAMS:basis:One of the ORIGIN_BASIS_* variables.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.GeodeticPivot.getOriginBasis
DESC:Returns the origin basis set for the GeodeticPivot object: If ORIGIN_BASIS_LOCAL is set, the binding to geo-coordinates is disabled. GeodeticPivot can be placed everywhere. If ORIGIN_BASIS_ENU is set, GeodeticPivot is placed to the world ECF position with ENU (East - North - Up) orientation according to the given latitude / longitude / altitude. The GeodeticPivot position is blocked. The Up-axis (Z+) direction in ENU points upward along the ellipsoid normal, while in UNIGINE implementation of ENU it goes from the Earth's center.
RETURNS:One of the ORIGIN_BASIS_* variables.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.GeodeticsTransformer.setProjectionWkt(char,Unigine.dvec3,char,int)
DESC:Sets a projection by WKT description, which is used as the world coordinate projection, and defines a geodetic coordinate system.
PARAMS:projection_cs_wkt_string:Description of the projection in the OpenGIS WKT format. | world_origin_geo_coords:World origin in geodetic coordinates (lat,lon,alt). | geodetic_cs_string:Description of a geodetic coordinate system. | geodetic_cs_is_well_known:1 or 0.If set to 1, a well-known coordinate system description is used as the geodetic_cs_string argument.The following well-known text values are supported:WGS84 — same as EPSG:4326, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.WGS72 — same as EPSG:4322, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.NAD27 — same as EPSG:4267, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.NAD83 — same as EPSG:4269, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.EPSG:n — n is a GCS code from the horizontal coordinate system table.If set to 0, a detailed WKT description is used.
RETURNS:1 on success; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.GeodeticsTransformer.setProjectionEpsg(int,Unigine.dvec3,char,int)
DESC:Sets a projection by EPSG code, which is used as the world coordinate projection, and defines a geodetic coordinate system.
PARAMS:projection_cs_epsg_code:EPSG code of the projection. | world_origin_geo_coords:World origin in geodetic coordinates (lat,lon,alt). | geodetic_cs_string:Description of a geodetic coordinate system. | geodetic_cs_is_well_known:1 or 0.If set to 1, a well-known coordinate system description is used as the geodetic_cs_string argument.The following well-known text values are supported:WGS84 — same as EPSG:4326, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.WGS72 — same as EPSG:4322, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.NAD27 — same as EPSG:4267, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.NAD83 — same as EPSG:4269, but has no dependence on EPSG data files.EPSG:n — n is a GCS code from the horizontal coordinate system table.If set to 0, a detailed WKT description is used.
RETURNS:1 on success; otherwise, 0.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Gui.update
DESC:Updates GUI.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Gui.preRender
DESC:Method executed after the update() and before the render() function. This method is used to make necessary preparations for rendering (e.g. prepare a texture) after the update() and is called automatically for WidgetSpriteViewport and WidgetSpriteNode to ensure proper rendering of the widgets during render(). In case you implement a custom GUI or widgets using the WidgetExtern class you should put all such rendering preparations to and call preRender() for GUI manually after update().

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_CENTER
DESC:Widget is centered relative to its container.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_LEFT
DESC:Widget is aligned to the left side of its container.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_RIGHT
DESC:Widget is aligned to the right side of its container.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_TOP
DESC:Widget is aligned to the top of its container.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_BOTTOM
DESC:Widget is aligned to the bottom of its container.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_EXPAND
DESC:Widget occupies all available space inside its container.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_OVERLAP
DESC:Widget is rendered over other widgets, on the foreground (or over the contents of the parent container). Overlapping widgets are sorted between each other (i.e. pop up when focused on). This flag also makes the window movable.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_BACKGROUND
DESC:Widget is always placed under other widgets. If clicked on, it does not pop up. Use this flag together with ALIGN_OVERLAP one.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ALIGN_FIXED
DESC:Widget in focus stays on the background or on the foreground (depending on where it was created). This flag is valid only if GUI_ALIGN_OVERLAP is also set. Non-fixed overlapping windows can pop over the fixed ones, while the latter cannot do it.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ATTACH_LOG10

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ATTACH_MIN_EXPAND
DESC:Minimum value of the attached slider can be lowered.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.ATTACH_MAX_EXPAND
DESC:Maximum value of the attached slider can be raised.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_NONE
DESC:No blending is used for a widget.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ZERO
DESC:Components of each widget color are multiplied by zero.

DESC:Components of each widget color are multiplied by one.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_SRC_COLOR
DESC:Components of each widget color are multiplied by these factors (per component): (wR, wG, wB, wA) .
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_SRC_ALPHA
DESC:Components of each widget color are multiplied by wA.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA
DESC:Components of each widget color are multiplied by 1- wA.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_DEST_COLOR
DESC:Components of each widget color are multiplied by these factors (per component): (bR, bG, bB, bA) .
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_DEST_COLOR
DESC:Components of each widget color are multiplied by these factors (per component): (1 - bR, 1 - bG, 1 - bB, 1 - bA) .
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_DEST_ALPHA
DESC:Components of each widget color are multiplied by bA.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Gui.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_DEST_ALPHA
DESC:Components of each widget color are multiplied by 1- bA.

DESC:Constructor. Creates a UGUID from the given source value. UGUID is generated using the SHA1 algorithm.
PARAMS:value_:Source character.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.UGUID.operator<=(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Indicates whether the UGUID value is less than or equal to the source UGUID value.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.UGUID.operator==(Unigine.UGUID)
DESC:Equality. Indicates whether the UGUID value is equal to the source UGUID value.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Hasher class.create(Type)

PARAMS:offset:Pixel offset:offset = image_width * Y + X, (0 , 0) - top left corner of the image. | value:RGBA color of a pixel with the specified ID.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.get(size_t,Unigine.Math.dvec4) const
DESC:Gets a value for a pixel by its offset and puts it to the target buffer value.
PARAMS:offset:Pixel offset:offset = image_width * Y + X, (0 , 0) - top left corner of the image. | value:Target buffer to receive an RGBA color of a pixel with the specified ID.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.get(Unigine.Math.ivec2,int) const
DESC:Returns image data for the specified pixel coordinates and mipmap offset as a four-component vector.
PARAMS:coord:Pixel coordinates (X, Y) - X in range [0; width], Y in range [0; height]. | offset:Mipmap offset value.
RETURNS:A vec4 vector (R, G, B, A) containing image data for the specified pixel coordinates, with components normalized in the [0.0f; 1.0f] range.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.get(Unigine.Math.ivec2,int,Unigine.Math.vec4,Unigine.Math.vec4,Unigine.Math.vec4,Unigine.Math.vec4) const
DESC:Returns image data for the specified pixel coordinates and mipmap offset (along with neighboring pixels) as a set of four-component vectors.
PARAMS:coord:Pixel coordinates (X, Y) - X in range [0; width], Y in range [0; height]. | offset:Mipmap offset value. | p00:A vec4 vector (R, G, B, A) containing image data for the specified pixel coordinates (X, Y), with components normalized in the [0.0f; 1.0f] range. | p01:A vec4 vector (R, G, B, A) containing image data for the neighboring pixel coordinates (X, Y+1), with components normalized in the [0.0f; 1.0f] range. | p10:A vec4 vector (R, G, B, A) containing image data for the neighboring pixel coordinates (X+1, Y), with components normalized in the [0.0f; 1.0f] range. | p11:A vec4 vector (R, G, B, A) containing image data for the neighboring pixel coordinates (X+1, Y+1), with components normalized in the [0.0f; 1.0f] range.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.get8F(Unigine.Math.ivec2,Unigine.Math.vec4) const
DESC:Returns a set of 8-bit float values stored in the specified image pixel and neighboring ones and puts them to the output vector.
PARAMS:coord:Pixel coordinates (X, Y) - X in the [0; width] range, Y in the [0; height] range. | p:Output vec4 vector (P00, P01, P10, P11) to receive 8-bit float values stored in the specified image pixel and neighboring ones:P00 - (X, Y)P01 - (X, Y+1)P10 - (X+1, Y)P11 - (X+1, Y+1)Values are normalized in the [0.0f; 1.0f] range.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.get8F(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
DESC:Returns an 8-bit float value stored in the specified pixel of the image.
PARAMS:coord:Pixel coordinates (X, Y) - X in the [0; width] range, Y in the [0; height] range.
RETURNS:An 8-bit float value stored in the specified pixel of the image normalized in the [0.0f; 1.0f] range.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getPixelsCubeArray(int,int,int) const
DESC:Returns the pointer to the array of pixels with the given mipmap level and image layer for the Cube Array image.
PARAMS:face:Face number in range from 0 to 5. | layer:Number of the image layer. | level:Mipmap level in range from 0 to the total number of mipmaps. This is an optional argument.
RETURNS:Pointer to the array of pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getPixelsSize(int,int,int)
DESC:Returns the size of all pixels for the image of the specified format and size.
PARAMS:format:Image format identifier. See the FORMAT_* variables. | w:Image width, in pixels. | h:Image width, in pixels.
RETURNS:Size of all pixels of the specified image, in bytes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.isRawFormat const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the image is uncompressed (stored in R8, RG8, RGB8, RGBA8, R16, RG16, RGB16, RGBA16, R16F, RG16F, RGB16F, RGBA16F, R32F, RG32F, RGB32F, RGBA32F, RGB565, RGBA4, RGB5A1 or RGB10A2 format).
RETURNS:true if the image is uncompressed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.isRawFormat(int)
DESC:Returns a value indicating if a given format is an uncompressed format (R8, RG8, RGB8, RGBA8, R16, RG16, RGB16, RGBA16, R16F, RG16F, RGB16F, RGBA16F, R32F, RG32F, RGB32F, RGBA32F, RGB565, RGBA4, RGB5A1 or RGB10A2).
PARAMS:format:Image format identifier. See the FORMAT_* variables.
RETURNS:true if the specified format is an uncompressed format; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getSize const
DESC:Returns the current image size.
RETURNS:Image size, in bytes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getSize(int) const
DESC:Returns the current image size.
PARAMS:level:Mipmap level in range from 0 to the total number of mipmaps.
RETURNS:Image size in bytes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getStride(int) const
DESC:Returns the image stride on a given mipmap level.
PARAMS:level:Mipmap level in range from 0 to the total number of mipmaps.
RETURNS:Image stride in bytes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getDepthStride(int) const
DESC:Returns the image depth stride on a given mipmap level.
PARAMS:level:Mipmap level in range from 0 to the total number of mipmaps.
RETURNS:Image depth stride in bytes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getTypeName(int)
DESC:Returns the name of the image type by its identifier.
PARAMS:type:Image type. One of the IMAGE_* types.
RETURNS:Image type name: 2D for a 2D image, 3D for a 3D image, Cube for a cube image, 2D_Array for a 2D Array.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.isUCharFormat const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the image is stored in an unsigned char format (R8, RG8, RGB8, RGBA8, DXT1, DXT3, DXT5, ATI1 or ATI2).
RETURNS:true if the image is in unsigned char format; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.isUCharFormat(int)
DESC:Returns a value indicating if a given format is an unsigned char format (R8, RG8, RGB8, RGBA8, DXT1, DXT3, DXT5, ATI1 or ATI2).
PARAMS:format:Image format identifier. See the FORMAT_* variables.
RETURNS:true if the specified format is an unsigned char format; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.isUShortFormat const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the image is stored in an unsigned short format (R16, RG16, RGB16 or RGBA16).
RETURNS:true if the image is in unsigned short format; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.isUShortFormat(int)
DESC:Returns a value indicating if a given format is an unsigned short format (R16, RG16, RGB16 or RGBA16).
PARAMS:format:Image format identifier. See the FORMAT_* variables.
RETURNS:true if the specified format is an unsigned short format; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getWidth(int) const
DESC:Returns the image width on a given mipmap level.
PARAMS:level:Mipmap level in range from 0 to the total number of mipmaps. This is an optional argument.
RETURNS:Image width if the image exists (its width is larger than 0); otherwise, 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.blend(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int,int,int,int,int,float,bool)
DESC:Blends the specified image with the current one. Blending takes place within a specified region. If the safe flag is set to 1, rendering of the blended images won't be performed outside the destination image boundaries. Compressed, combined, half-float and float formats are not supported. Images of different formats can be blended as follows: R8 with R8, RG8; RG8 with RG8, RGB8; RGB8 with RGB8, RGBA8; RGBA8 with RGBA8 only; R16 with R16, RG16; RG16 with RG16, RGB16; RGB16 with RGB16, RGBA16; RGBA16 with RGBA16 only;
PARAMS:image:Source image to be blended with the current image. | x0:X coordinate of a position in the current image. | y0:Y coordinate of a position in the current image. | x1:X coordinate of a position in a source image, which is blended with the current image. | y1:Y coordinate of a position in a source image, which is blended with the current image. | width:Width of the blending region. | height:Height of the blending region. | scale:Scale of blending:If blended images are of the same format, the blended image is multiplied by scale value and is added to the destination image.If a source image has one more channel compared to the current one, it will serve as alpha value. This channel value is multiplied by scale and is used to alpha blend the images.The default scale value is 1.0f. | safe:true for safe blending with respect to destination image boundaries; otherwise, false.
RETURNS:Returns 1 if blending is successful; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.blur(int,float,int)
DESC:Filters the image using two-pass Gaussian blur. Only the 2D or cube image can be blurred. Compressed and combined image formats are not supported.
PARAMS:radius:Blur filter radius, the number of neighbouring source pixels that are averaged for each blurred destination pixel. For example, if Radius = 2, two pixels from each side are taken and the blurring kernel is 5 x 5 pixels. | gamma:Gamma correction value. If 1 is provided, no gamma correction is applied. This is an optional argument. | level:Mip level for which the blurring effect is applied. This is an optional argument.
RETURNS:true if the image was successfully blurred or the size of blur filter is 0; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.sharpen(float,float,float,bool,int)
DESC:Sharpens the image. Only the 2D or cube image can be sharpened. Compressed and combined image formats are not supported.
PARAMS:radius:Sharpen filter radius, the number of neighbouring source pixels (or subpixels) that are averaged for each sharpened destination pixel. | intensity:Filter intensity value. | gamma:Gamma correction value. If 1 is provided, no gamma correction is applied. This is an optional argument. | sharp_only_lightness:true to adjust sharpness of the lightness value only, false to sharpen all HSL values. This is an optional argument. | level:Mip level for which the sharpening effect is applied. This is an optional argument.
RETURNS:true if the image was successfully sharpened or the size of sharpen filter is 0; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.clear
DESC:Clears all data associated with the image and resets its type, format, size to default. Also the number of image layers and mipmaps is set to 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.combine(int)
DESC:Converts the image to a combined format. The following conversions are available: RGB8 to RGB565 RGBA8 to RGBA4 if the format is specified as RGBA4; otherwise, RGBA8 is converted to RGB5A1 by default RGBA16 to RGB10A2
PARAMS:new_format:Combined format to convert the image into. This is an optional argument. If no format is specified, default conversion will be performed.
RETURNS:true if the conversion into the combined format is successful; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.combineMipmaps
DESC:Combines the loaded 2D image with the mipmap image. Only one mipmap image can be combined. Compressed image formats cannot be combined.
RETURNS:true if the image and a mipmap are successfully combined; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.compare(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int,int,int,int,int,int)
DESC:Compares a region of a specified image with a specified region of the current image. Compressed, combined, half-float and float formats are not supported.
PARAMS:image:Source image to compare the loaded image with. | x0:X coordinate on the loaded image. | y0:Y coordinate on the loaded image. | x1:X coordinate on the source image. | y1:Y coordinate on the source image. | width:Width of a region to compare. | height:Height of a region to compare. | threshold:A threshold to compare.
RETURNS:true if the regions match; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.compress(int)
DESC:Converts the image to a compressed format. The following conversions are available: R8 to ATI1 RG8 to ATI2 RGB8 to DXT1 RGBA8 to DXT3, DXT5(by default) ZLC1 to ZLC1 ZLC2 to ZLC2
PARAMS:new_format:Format to compress the image into. This is an optional argument. If no format is specified, default conversion will be performed.
RETURNS:true if the image is compressed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.convertToFormat(int)
DESC:Converts the image to a specified format. Compressed and combined images are automatically decompressed/decombined.
PARAMS:new_format:Target format to convert the image into. See the variables.
RETURNS:true if the conversion is successful; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.convertToType(int)
DESC:Converts the image to a specified type. The following conversions are possible:
PARAMS:type:Type for conversion. One of the IMAGE_* types.
RETURNS:true if the conversion is successful; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.assignFrom(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
DESC:Copies the data from the specified source image. The size of the image shall be updated according to the size of the source image (unlike the resizeFrom() method).
PARAMS:src_image:Source image.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.resizeFrom(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},Image::FILTER)
DESC:Copies the data from the specified source image, resizing the source. The source image shall be resized (enlarged/shrinked) to fit the size of the image.
PARAMS:src_image:Source image. | filter:Filter type to be used: linear or point. The default filter is linear. See the Unigine::Image Enumerations with FILTER_* prefixes.
RETURNS:true if the data was successfully copied from the source image; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.copy(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int)
DESC:Copies data from the specified source image according to the specified layer parameter. Depending on the image and the source image types the layer parameter either defines the index of the layer/face to copy data FROM (source), or the index of the layer/face to copy data TO (destination):
PARAMS:src_image:Source image. | layer:Zero-based index defining layer/face TO or FROM which the data is to be copied.
RETURNS:true if the data is copied successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.copy(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int)
DESC:Copies a given channel from the specified image to the specified image channel.
PARAMS:src_image:Source image. | dest_channel:Destination channel. | src_channel:Source channel.
RETURNS:true if the channel is copied successfully from the source image; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.copy(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int,int,int,int,int,bool)
DESC:Copies a data fragment with specified width, height, and coordinates from the source image.
PARAMS:src_image:Source image, from which a fragment is to be copied. | x_dst:X coordinate of a position in the image, to which the data fragment is to be copied. | y_dst:Y coordinate of a position in the image, to which the data fragment is to be copied. | x_src:X coordinate of a position in a source image, starting from which the data fragment is to be copied. | y_src:Y coordinate of a position in a source image, starting from which the data fragment is to be copied. | width:Width of the fragment to be copied from the source image, in pixels. | height:Height of the fragment to be copied from the source image, in pixels. | safe:true for safe copying with respect to destination image boundaries; otherwise, false.The safe flag doesn't provide safe copying with respect to source image boundaries.
RETURNS:true if the specified fragment was successfully copied from the source image; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.copyFast(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},size_t,size_t,size_t,size_t,size_t,size_t)
DESC:Copies a data fragment with specified width, height, and coordinates from the source image.
PARAMS:src_image:Source image, from which a fragment is to be copied. | x_dst:X coordinate of a position in the image, to which the data fragment is to be copied. | y_dst:Y coordinate of a position in the image, to which the data fragment is to be copied. | x_src:X coordinate of a position in a source image, starting from which the data fragment is to be copied. | y_src:Y coordinate of a position in a source image, starting from which the data fragment is to be copied. | w:Width of the fragment to be copied from the source image, in pixels. | h:Height of the fragment to be copied from the source image, in pixels.
RETURNS:true if the specified fragment was successfully copied from the source image; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.create2D(int,int,int,int,bool,bool)
DESC:Creates an empty 2D image filled with black color.
PARAMS:width:Required width, in pixels. | height:Required height, in pixels. | format:Required format. See the FORMAT_* variables. | num_mipmaps:Number of mipmaps to create. This is an optional argument. If the value is smaller than 1, an assertion is raised. | clear:Positive number to fill the image with black color, 0 not to fill. This optional argument can be set to 0 if new data will fully overwrite the data existing in the memory. | allocate:Positive number to allocate memory for the created image. This value should be always set to 1.
RETURNS:true if 2D image is successfully created; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.create2DArray(int,int,int,int,int,bool,bool)
DESC:Creates an empty 2D texture array filled with black color.
PARAMS:width:Required width, in pixels. | height:Required height, in pixels. | num_layers:Number of texture layers. | format:Required format. See the FORMAT_* variables. | num_mipmaps:Number of mipmaps to create. This is an optional argument. If the value is smaller than 1, an assertion is raised. | clear:Positive number to fill the texture array with black color, 0 not to fill. This optional argument can be set to 0 if new data will fully overwrite the data existing in the memory. | allocate:Positive number to allocate memory for the created image. This value should be always set to 1.
RETURNS:true if 2D texture array is successfully created; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.create3D(int,int,int,int,int,bool,bool)
DESC:Creates an empty 3D image filled with black color.
PARAMS:width:Required width, in pixels. | height:Required height, in pixels. | depth:Required depth. | format:Required format. See the IMAGE_FORMAT_* variables. | num_mipmaps:Number of mipmaps to create. This is an optional argument. If the value is smaller than 1, an assertion is raised. | clear:Positive number to fill the image with black color, 0 not to fill. This optional argument can be set to 0 if new data will fully overwrite the data existing in the memory. | allocate:Positive number to allocate memory for the created image. This value should be always set to 1.
RETURNS:true if 3D image is successfully created; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.create3DTurbulence(int,float,int,int)
DESC:Creates a 3D turbulence image (RGBA8).
PARAMS:size:3D image size, in pixels. Width, height, and depth are equal. | scale:Scaling factor applied to the displacement amount. | frequency:Base frequency, determines how rapidly the displacement amount changes. Increasing this value creates more turbulence. | seed:Specifies the initial number used for noise generation. Different Seed values produce different random variations and can be useful in changing the result. Keep in mind, that you should use the same Seed value when you want to retain the same variations.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.createCube(int,int,int,int,bool,bool)
DESC:Creates the empty cube image filled with black color.
PARAMS:width:Image width, in pixels. | height:Image height, in pixels. | format:Texture format. See the FORMAT_* variables. | num_mipmaps:Number of mipmaps to create. This is an optional argument. | clear:true to fill the image with black color, false is not to fill. This optional argument can be set to false if new data will fully overwrite the data existing in the memory. | allocate:true to allocate memory for the created image. This value should be always set to true.
RETURNS:true if the cube image is successfully created; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.createCubeArray(int,int,int,int,int,bool,bool)
DESC:Creates the empty cube array image filled with black color.
PARAMS:width:Image width, in pixels. | height:Image height, in pixels. | num_layers:Number of image layers. | format:Texture format. See the FORMAT_* variables. | num_mipmaps:Number of mipmaps to create. This is an optional argument. | clear:1 to fill the image with black color, false is not to fill. This optional argument can be set to false if new data will fully overwrite the data existing in the memory. | allocate:true to allocate memory for the created image. This value should be always set to true.
RETURNS:true if the cube array image is successfully created; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.createMipmaps(Image::FILTER,float)
DESC:Generates mipmaps for the image. Mipmaps cannot be created for compressed and combined image formats.
PARAMS:filter:Filter type to be used: linear or point. The default filter is linear. See the Unigine::Image Enumerations with FILTER_* prefixes. | gamma:Gamma correction value. If 1 is provided, no gamma correction is applied. This is an optional argument.
RETURNS:true if the mipmaps are generated successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.createMipmapsCubeGGX(Image::GGX_MIPMAPS_QUALITY)
DESC:Generates GGX mipmaps on CPU with the specified quality, of course slower and with lower quality than on GPU but it provides the result synchronously (actually this should be the only case, when this method is to be used).
PARAMS:quality:Quality of GGX mipmaps. One of the GGX_MIPMAPS_QUALITY values.
RETURNS:true if the mipmaps are generated successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.removeMipmaps
DESC:Removes mipmaps generated for the image.
RETURNS:true if mipmaps generated for the image are removed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.decombine
DESC:Automatically converts the image from the combined format to a correct one. The following conversions are available: RGB565 to RGB8 RGBA4 to RGBA8 RGB5A1 to RGBA8 RGB10A2 to RGBA16
RETURNS:true if the image is successfully converted from the combined format; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.decombineMipmaps
DESC:Decombines the loaded 2D-image and the mipmap images. The number of mipmaps must be larger than 1. Compressed image formats cannot be decombined.
RETURNS:true if the 2D-image and mipmap image are successfully decombined; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.decompress
DESC:Decompresses the image from the compressed format to a correct one. The following conversions are available: DXT1 to RGB8 DXT1 without alpha data to RGB8 DXT3 to RGBA8 DXT5 to RGBA8 ATI1 to R8 ATI2 to RG8
RETURNS:true if the image was successfully decompressed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.extrude(int)
DESC:Extrudes contour of the image in the alpha=0 region on the given number of pixels. Only images of the RGBA8 and RGBA16 formats can be extruded.
PARAMS:pixels:Number of contour pixels.
RETURNS:true if the image contour is successfully extruded; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.flipX
DESC:Flips the 2D image horizontally. Compressed and combined image formats are not supported.
RETURNS:true if the image is successfully flipped; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.flipY
DESC:Flips the 2D image vertically. Compressed and combined image formats are not supported.
RETURNS:true if the image is successfully flipped; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.hasMipmaps const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the source image has mipmaps.
RETURNS:true if the image has mipmaps; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.info(char)
DESC:Retrieves information about the specified image by it's path and stores it into current Image instance. The following file formats are supported: *.texture *.tga *.jpg *.png *.dds *.psd *.ies tif *.tif *.tiff
PARAMS:path:Name of the image file.
RETURNS:true if the information was successfully retrieved and recognized; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.invert
DESC:Inverts values of all the image channels. Only R8, RG8, RGB8, RGBA8, R16, RG16, RGB16, RGBA16, R32F, RG32F, RGB32F and RGBA32F formats can be inverted.
RETURNS:true if the image is inverted successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.load(char,int)
DESC:Loads an image from a specified file. The following file formats are supported.
PARAMS:file:Name of the image file. | mip_offset:Mipmap offset value for the loaded image.
RETURNS:true if the image is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.load(char)
DESC:Loads an image from the specified file. The following file formats are supported.
PARAMS:file:Name of the image file.
RETURNS:true if the image is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.load(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
DESC:Loads an image from a specified stream. The following file formats are supported.
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true if the image is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.load(unsignedchar,int)
DESC:Loads the image from raw data.
PARAMS:data:Set of raw data. | size:Raw data size, in bytes.
RETURNS:true if the image is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.normalize
DESC:Creates a three-component normal map out of the image.
RETURNS:true if normalization was successful; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.resize(int,int,Image::FILTER)
DESC:Resizes the image. Only the 2D or cube image can be resized. Compressed and combined image formats cannot be resized.
PARAMS:new_width:New image width. | new_height:New image height. | filter:Filter type to be used: linear or point. The default filter is linear. See the Unigine::Image Enumerations with FILTER_* prefixes.
RETURNS:true if the image is resized successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.rotate(int)
DESC:Rotates the image by a given angle (with the step of 90 degrees). Only the 2D or cube image can be rotated. Compressed and combined image formats cannot be rotated.
PARAMS:angle:Angle, that will be multiplied by the step (angle * 90) to set the image rotation degree.
RETURNS:true if the image is rotated successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.save(char) const
DESC:Saves the image to a file with the specified name. The following file formats are supported.
PARAMS:file:Name of the file to save image data to.
RETURNS:true if the image is saved successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.save(char,float) const
DESC:Saves the image to a specified file. The following file formats are supported.
PARAMS:file:Name of a file with extension into which data will be saved. | quality:Quality of JPG compression in range [0;1].
RETURNS:true if the image is saved successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.save(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream}) const
DESC:Saves the image data (either compressed or uncompressed) to the specified stream. Current image compression is to be used.
PARAMS:stream:Pointer to the stream.
RETURNS:true if the image is successfully saved to the specified stream; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.sign
DESC:Converts the image from unsigned type to signed char. Only R8, RG8, RGB8, RGBA8, R16, RG16, RGB16, RGBA16, ATI1 and ATI2 formats can be converted.
RETURNS:true if the image has been converted successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.swap(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
DESC:Swaps the data of the current image with the source image.
PARAMS:image:Source image.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.toPixel(Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Converts a vec4 color vector (R, G, B, A) to Pixel color.
PARAMS:color:Color vec4 vector (R, G, B, A) with components normalized in range [0.0f; 1.0f]
RETURNS:Pixel color represented by a Pixel structure.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.toPixel(int,Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Converts a vec4 color vector (R, G, B, A) to Pixel color depending on the specified image format.
PARAMS:format:Image format identifier. See the FORMAT_* variables. | color:Color vec4 vector (R, G, B, A) with components normalized in range [0.0f; 1.0f]
RETURNS:Pixel color represented by a Pixel structure.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.toVec4(Image::Pixel)
DESC:Converts Pixel color to a vec4 color vector (R, G, B, A).
PARAMS:pixel:Pixel color represented by a Pixel structure.
RETURNS:Color vec4 vector (R, G, B, A). Each component is normalized in range [0.0f; 1.0f]
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.toVec4(int,Image::Pixel)
DESC:Converts Pixel color to a vec4 color vector (R, G, B, A) depending on the specified image format.
PARAMS:format:Image format identifier. See the FORMAT_* variables. | p:Pixel color represented by a Pixel structure.
RETURNS:Color vec4 vector (R, G, B, A). Each component is normalized in range [0.0f; 1.0f]
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getNumChannels(int)
DESC:Returns the number of channels for the specified image format.
PARAMS:format:Image format identifier. See the FORMAT_* variables.
RETURNS:Number of channels for the specified image format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getPixelSize(int)
DESC:Returns the pixel size for the specified image format. Not available for compressed image formats (DXT1, DXT3, DXT5, ATI1, ATI2).
PARAMS:format:Image format identifier. See the FORMAT_* variables.
RETURNS:Pixel size for the specified image format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getBlockSize(int)
DESC:Returns the block size for the specified image format. Available for compressed image formats only (DXT1, DXT3, DXT5, ATI1, ATI2).
PARAMS:format:Image format identifier. See the FORMAT_* variables.
RETURNS:Block size for the specified image format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.invertChannel(unsignedchar)
DESC:Inverts the values stored in the specified channel. Channels of images of half (FORMAT_R16F to FORMAT_RGBA16F) and float (FORMAT_R32F to FORMAT_RGBA32F) formats cannot be inverted.
PARAMS:channel:Number of the channel to be inverted, in the range from 0 to the total number of channels.
RETURNS:true if the specified channel is inverted successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.saveDDS(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream}) const
DESC:Saves the DDS image to a specified stream.
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true if the DDS image is saved successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.loadDDS(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
DESC:Loads a DDS image from a specified stream.
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true if the DDS image is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Image.getRawFormat(int)

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_RGBA16

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_RG16F
DESC:Non-compressed float format. Stores data in two 16-bit channels (red, green).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_RGB16F
DESC:Non-compressed float format. Stores data in three 16-bit channels (red, green, blue).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_RGBA16F

-

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_RGBA4

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_RGB5A1

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_RGB10A2

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_RG11B10F

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_DXT1
DESC:A DXT1 compressed image file format. Compresses RGB images by a factor of 6:1 compared to RGB8. Uses 4×4 blocks for color interpolation and stores color values in 16 bits per pixel (R5:G6:B5). Can also store 1-bit alpha data; in this case, compresses images by a factor of 8:1 compared to RGBA8. This format is not recommended for storing normal maps.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_DXT3
DESC:A DXT3 compressed image file format. Compresses RGBA images by a factor of 4:1 compared to RGBA8. Stores RGB color values as the DXT1 format and uses four more bits for alpha data. Color values are interpreted as not having been pre-multiplied by alpha. Alpha values are not interpolated. Recommended for images with sharp alpha transitions.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_DXT5
DESC:A DXT5 compressed image file format. Compresses RGBA images by a factor of 4:1 compared to RGBA8. Stores RGB color values as the DXT1 format and uses four more bits for alpha data. Color values are interpreted as not having been pre-multiplied by alpha. Alpha values are interpolated. Recommended for images with smooth alpha transitions.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_ATI1
DESC:An ATI1 compressed image file format. Compresses single-channel images by a factor of 2:1 compared to R8. Compression is the same as the one used for alpha data in the DXT5 format. Supported by all graphics cards compatible with DirectX 10; additionally, all ATI graphics cards since X800.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FORMAT_ATI2
DESC:An ATI2 compressed image file format. Compresses two-channel images by a factor of 2:1 compared to RG8. Compression for each channel is the same as the one used for alpha data in the DXT5 format. Supported by all graphics cards compatible with DirectX 10; additionally, all ATI graphics cards since X800.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.AUTO_IMAGE_TYPE
DESC:Image type is set automatically.

DESC:A 2D texture.
-

DESC:A 3D texture.
-

DESC:A cube texture.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.IMAGE_2D_ARRAY
DESC:A 2D texture array. Each texture of the array has its own mipmap levels, which is the difference between it and a 3D image.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.IMAGE_CUBE_ARRAY
DESC:A cube texture array.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FILE_COMPRESSION_DISABLE
DESC:Image data is uncompressed.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FILE_COMPRESSION_ZLC_LOW
DESC:Fast compression used for images stored in the system memory (based on zlib library).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FILE_COMPRESSION_ZLC_HIGH
DESC:Compression used for images stored in the system memory (based on zlib library). It is used when a smaller file size is required, compared to ZLC LOW (compression is slower).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FILE_COMPRESSION_LZ4_LOW
DESC:LZ4 lossless data compression algorithm that is focused on compression and decompression speed. It belongs to the LZ77 family of byte-oriented compression schemes (greater file size, faster comression).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Image.FILE_COMPRESSION_LZ4_HIGH
DESC:LZ4 lossless data compression algorithm that is focused on compression and decompression speed. It belongs to the LZ77 family of byte-oriented compression schemes (smaller file size, slower comression).
-

DESC:High quality of GGX mipmaps.

DESC:Ultra quality of GGX mipmaps.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Import.doImport(Import::ImporterID,char,char)

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Importer.onImportNodeChild(Unigine.Ptr{ImportProcessor},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},Unigine.Ptr{ImportNode},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},Unigine.Ptr{ImportNode})

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Importer.onImportAnimation(Unigine.Ptr{ImportProcessor},Unigine.Ptr{MeshAnimation},Unigine.Ptr{ImportMesh},Unigine.Ptr{ImportAnimation})

The metadata for the mesh that needs to be imported. | import_animation:ImportAnimation structure pointer. The metadata for the animation that needs to be imported.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.processScene(Unigine.Ptr{ImportScene})
DESC:Performs scene processing: modifies the metadata of scene elements or files generated in the process of importing the scene. This method is used by pre-processors and post-processors. To customize actions to be performed on scene processing, when implementing a custom pre- or post-processor, you can override the method.
PARAMS:scene:Scene to be processed.
RETURNS:true if the specified scene is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.processTexture(Unigine.Ptr{ImportTexture})
DESC:Performs texture processing: saves the specified generated texture to a corresponding file in the output directory. To customize actions to be performed on texture processing, when implementing a custom import processor, you can override the method.
PARAMS:import_texture:Instance of the ImportTexture class containing information about the imported texture.
RETURNS:true if the specified texture is successfully imported to a file; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.processMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{ImportMesh})
DESC:Performs mesh processing: saves the specified generated mesh to a corresponding *.mesh file in the output directory. To customize actions to be performed on mesh processing, when implementing a custom import processor, you can override the method.
PARAMS:mesh:UNIGINE's mesh instance generated for the specified imported mesh. | import_mesh:Instance of the ImportMesh class containing information about the imported mesh.
RETURNS:true if the specified mesh is successfully imported to a file; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.processLight(Unigine.Ptr{Light},Unigine.Ptr{ImportLight})
DESC:Performs light processing: saves the specified generated light source to a corresponding file in the output directory. To customize actions to be performed on light processing, when implementing a custom import processor, you can override the method.
PARAMS:light:UNIGINE's light instance generated for the specified imported light. | import_light:Instance of the ImportLight class containing information about the imported light.
RETURNS:true if the specified light is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.processCamera(Unigine.Ptr{Player},Unigine.Ptr{ImportCamera})
DESC:Performs camera processing: saves the specified generated player to a corresponding file in the output directory. To customize actions to be performed on camera processing, when implementing a custom import processor, you can override the method.
PARAMS:camera:UNIGINE's player instance generated for the specified imported camera. | import_camera:Instance of the ImportCamera class containing information about the imported camera.
RETURNS:true if the specified camera is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.processAnimation(Unigine.Ptr{MeshAnimation},Unigine.Ptr{ImportAnimation})
DESC:Performs mesh animation processing: saves the specified generated mesh animation to a corresponding file in the output directory. To customize actions to be performed on mesh animation processing, when implementing a custom import processor, you can override the method.
PARAMS:animation:UNIGINE's mesh animation instance generated for the specified imported animation. | import_animation:Instance of the ImportAnimation class containing information about the imported animation.
RETURNS:true if the specified animation is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.processAnimation(Unigine.Ptr{MeshAnimation},Unigine.Ptr{ImportMesh},Unigine.Ptr{ImportAnimation})
DESC:Performs mesh animation processing: saves the specified generated mesh animation to a corresponding file in the output directory. To customize actions to be performed on mesh animation processing, when implementing a custom import processor, you can override the method.
PARAMS:animation:UNIGINE's mesh animation instance generated for the specified imported animation. | import_mesh:Instance of the ImportMesh class containing information about the imported mesh. | import_animation:Instance of the ImportAnimation class containing information about the imported animation.
RETURNS:true if the specified animation is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.processNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},Unigine.Ptr{ImportNode})
DESC:Performs node processing: saves the specified generated node to a corresponding *.node file in the output directory. To customize actions to be performed on node processing, when implementing a custom import processor, you can override the method.
PARAMS:node:UNIGINE's node instance generated for the specified imported node. | import_node:Instance of the ImportNode class containing information about the imported node.
RETURNS:true if the specified node is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.processNodeChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},Unigine.Ptr{ImportNode},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},Unigine.Ptr{ImportNode})
DESC:Performs node processing: saves the specified generated node along with the specified child to a corresponding *.node file in the output directory. To customize actions to be performed on node processing, when implementing a custom import processor, you can override the method.
PARAMS:node_parent:Target UNIGINE's node instance to store the specified imported parent node. | import_node_parent:Instance of the ImportNode class containing information about the imported parent node. | import_node_child:Instance of the ImportNode class containing information about the imported child node.
RETURNS:true if the specified parent node with its specified child node is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.processMaterial(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material},Unigine.Ptr{ImportMaterial})

RETURNS:true if the specified material is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.onProcessScene(Unigine.Ptr{ImportScene})
DESC:Scene processing event handler function. This function is called each time when the function is called. You can specify your custom actions to be performed: modify the metadata of scene elements (pre-process) or files generated in the process of importing the scene (post-process). This method is used by pre-processors and post-processors.
PARAMS:scene:Scene to be processed.
RETURNS:true if the specified scene is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.onProcessTexture(Unigine.Ptr{ImportTexture})

PARAMS:import_texture:Instance of the ImportTexture class containing information about the imported texture.
RETURNS:true if the specified texture is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-

PARAMS:mesh:UNIGINE's mesh instance generated for specified imported mesh. | import_mesh:Instance of the ImportMesh class containing information about the imported mesh.
RETURNS:true if the specified mesh is successfully processed; otherwise, false.

PARAMS:light:UNIGINE's light instance generated for specified imported light. | import_light:Instance of the ImportLight class containing information about the imported light.
RETURNS:true if the specified light is successfully processed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.onProcessCamera(Unigine.Ptr{Player},Unigine.Ptr{ImportCamera})
DESC:Camera processing event handler function. This function is called each time when the function is called. You can specify your custom actions to be performed on camera processing.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.onProcessAnimation(Unigine.Ptr{MeshAnimation},Unigine.Ptr{ImportAnimation})

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.onProcessAnimation(Unigine.Ptr{MeshAnimation},Unigine.Ptr{ImportMesh},Unigine.Ptr{ImportAnimation})

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.onProcessNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},Unigine.Ptr{ImportNode})

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ImportProcessor.onProcessNodeChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},Unigine.Ptr{ImportNode},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},Unigine.Ptr{ImportNode})
DESC:Node processing event handler function for node hierarchies. This function is called each time when the function is called. You can specify your custom actions to be performed on node processing (e.g. assigning properties to node's children).

DESC:Returns the actions cast to the touch event.
PARAMS:index:Touch input index. | events:The buffer with touch input events.
RETURNS:Number of touch input events.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getKeyEvent(Input::KEY)
DESC:Returns the currently processed keyboard input event.
PARAMS:key:One of the preset KEY_ codes.
RETURNS:Keyboard input event, or nullptr if there are no events for the specified key in the current frame.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getKeyEvents(Input::KEY,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{InputEventKeyboard},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Returns the buffer with events for the specified key.
PARAMS:key:One of the preset KEY_ codes. | events:The buffer with input events.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getKeyName(Input::KEY) const
DESC:Returns the specified key name.
PARAMS:key:One of the preset KEY_ codes.
RETURNS:Key name.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getKeyByName(char) const
DESC:Returns the key by its name.
PARAMS:name:Key name.
RETURNS:One of the preset KEY_ codes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getMouseButtonEvent(Input::MOUSE_BUTTON)
DESC:Returns the mouse motion input event for the specified button.
PARAMS:button:One of the preset MOUSE_BUTTON_ codes.
RETURNS:Mouse motion input event.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getMouseButtonName(Input::MOUSE_BUTTON) const
DESC:Returns the mouse button name.
PARAMS:button:One of the preset MOUSE_BUTTON_ codes.
RETURNS:Mouse button name.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getMouseButtonByName(char) const
DESC:Returns the mouse button by its name.
PARAMS:name:Mouse button name.
RETURNS:One of the preset MOUSE_BUTTON_ codes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getEventsBuffer(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{InputEvent},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Returns the buffer with the input events for the specified frame.
PARAMS:frame:Number of frame for which the buffer of input events is to be obtained. Input events are stored for the last 60 frames. 0 is the current frame, 1 is the previous frame, etc. | events:The buffer with input events.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.sendEvent(Unigine.Ptr{InputEvent})
DESC:Creates a user event and dispatches it to the Engine.
PARAMS:e:Input event.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.setEventsFilter(Unigine.Ptr{InputEvent})
DESC:Sets a callback function to be executed on receiving input events. This input event filter enables you to reject certain input events for the Engine and get necessary information on all input events.
PARAMS:func:Input event callback.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.isModifierEnabled(Input::MODIFIER) const
DESC:Returns the value indicating if the specified modifier is enabled.
PARAMS:modifier:One of the preset MODIFIER_ codes.
RETURNS:true if the modifier is enabled; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.keyToUnicode(Input::KEY) const
DESC:Returns the specified key transformed to unicode.
PARAMS:key:One of the preset KEY_ codes.
RETURNS:Unicode symbol.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.unicodeToKey(unsignedint) const
DESC:Returns the specified key transformed to unicode.
PARAMS:unicode:Unicode symbol.
RETURNS:One of the preset KEY_ codes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.setMouseCursorSkinCustom(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
DESC:Sets a custom image to be used for the mouse cursor.
PARAMS:image:Image containing pointer shapes to be set for the mouse cursor (e.g., select, move, resize, etc.).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.setMouseCursorSkinSystem
DESC:Sets the current OS cursor skin (pointer shapes like select, move, resize, etc.).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.setMouseCursorSkinDefault
DESC:Sets the default Engine cursor skin (pointer shapes like select, move, resize, etc.).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.setMouseCursorCustom(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int)
DESC:Sets a custom image for the OS mouse cursor. The image must be of the square size and RGBA8 format.
PARAMS:image:Cursor image to be set. | x:X coordinate of the cursor's hot spot. | y:Y coordinate of the cursor's hot spot.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.clearMouseCursorCustom
DESC:Clears the custom mouse cursor set via the setMouseCursorCustom() method.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.updateMouseCursor
DESC:Updates the mouse cursor. This method should be called after making changes to the mouse cursor to apply them all together. After calling this method the cursor shall be updated in the next frame.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getKeyLocalName(Input::KEY) const
DESC:Returns the name for the specified key taken from the currently selected keyboard layout. The returned value is affected by the modifier such as Shift.
PARAMS:key:One of the preset KEY_ codes.
RETURNS:Localized name for the specified key.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getMouseButtonEvents(Input::MOUSE_BUTTON,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{InputEventMouseButton},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Returns the number of input events for the specified mouse button and puts the events to the specified output buffer.
PARAMS:button:One of the preset MOUSE_BUTTON_ codes. | events:Buffer with input events.
RETURNS:Number of input events for the specified mouse button.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getForceMousePosition
DESC:Returns the absolute mouse position obtained from the OS.
RETURNS:The absolute mouse position.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.isKeyText(Input::KEY) const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the given key has a corresponding printable symbol (current Num Lock state is taken into account). For example, pressing 2 on the numpad with Num Lock enabled produces "2", while with disabled Num Lock the same key acts as a down arrow. Keys like Esc, PrintScreen, BackSpace do not produce any printable symbol at all.
PARAMS:key:One of the preset KEY_ codes.
RETURNS:true if the key value is a symbol; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getModifierName(Input::MODIFIER) const
DESC:Returns the name of the key modifier by its scancode.
PARAMS:modifier:Scancode of the modifier.
RETURNS:Key name of the modifier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getModifierByName(char) const
DESC:Returns the scancode of the key modifier by its name.
PARAMS:name:Key name of the modifier.
RETURNS:Scancode of the modifier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Input.getVRDevice(int) const
DESC:Returns the VR device by its number.
PARAMS:num:Number of the VR device.
RETURNS:VR device.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.setFilter(float)
DESC:Sets a filter value used to correct the current state of the analog axis relative to the previous one. Axis states are interpolated for thumbsticks and triggers.
PARAMS:filter:Filter value for interpolation between axis states. The provided value is clamped to a range [0;1].Filter value of 0 means there is no interpolation and the current value is not corrected.Filter value of 1 means the previous state is used instead of the current one.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.getFilter const
DESC:A filter value used to correct the current state of the analog axis (thumbsticks and triggers) relative to the previous one: Filter value of 0 means there is no interpolation and the current value is not corrected. Filter value of 1 means the previous state is used instead of the current one.
RETURNS:The filter of the gamepad.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.getAxesLeft const
DESC:Returns a vector of axes of the left thumbstick. When a thumbstick is in the center position, this value is [0,0]. The values correspond to the following thumbstick positions: First value corresponds to the X axis. Negative values indicate the left position; positive values indicate right. Second value corresponds to the Y axis. Negative values indicate the down position; positive values indicate up.
RETURNS:A vector of two values in the [-1;1] range.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.getAxesLeftDelta const
DESC:Returns a vector of delta values of the left thumbstick axes — the difference between the values in the previous and the current frames.
RETURNS:Vector of delta axes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.getAxesRight const
DESC:Returns a vector of axes of the right thumbstick. When a thumbstick is in the center position, this value is [0,0]. The values correspond to the following thumbstick positions: First value corresponds to the X axis. Negative values indicate the left position; positive values indicate right. Second value corresponds to the Y axis. Negative values indicate the down position; positive values indicate up.
RETURNS:A vector of two values in the [-1;1] range.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.getAxesRightDelta const
DESC:Returns a vector of delta values of the right thumbstick axes — the difference between the values in the previous and the current frames.
RETURNS:Vector of delta axes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.getTriggerLeft const
DESC:Returns an axis state value (the position) of the left trigger. 0 means the trigger is not pressed; 1 means the trigger is pressed to the maximum.
RETURNS:Value in range [0; 1].
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.getTriggerLeftDelta const
DESC:Returns the delta value of the left trigger — the difference between the values in the previous and the current frame.
RETURNS:Left trigger delta.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.getTriggerRight const
DESC:Returns an axis state value (the position) of the right trigger. 0 means the trigger is not pressed; 1 means the trigger is pressed to the maximum.
RETURNS:Value in range [0; 1].
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.getTriggerRightDelta const
DESC:Returns the delta value of the right trigger — the difference between the values in the previous and the current frame.
RETURNS:Right trigger delta.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputGamePad.setVibration(float,float,float)
DESC:Sets the amount of vibration for the right (high-frequency) and left (low-frequency) motors for the time period specified in milliseconds.
PARAMS:low_frequency:Vibration value in the [0.0f; 1.0f] range for the left (low-frequency) motor. | high_frequency:Vibration value in the [0.0f; 1.0f] range for the right (high-frequency) motor. | duration_ms:Vibration period duration, in milliseconds.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.InputJoystick.playForceFeedbackEffectSpring(float,float,float,float,float,float)
DESC:Applies the spring force-feedback effect with the specified parameters to the joystick. Force is applied in opposition to a set state.
PARAMS:left_force:Strength of the force-feedback effect that occurs when turning to the left. Value in range [0, 1]. | left_saturation:Maximum possible force for the force-feedback effect on turning left. Value in range [0, 1]. Not all devices support saturation. | right_force:Strength of the force-feedback effect that occurs when turning to the right. Value in range [0, 1]. | right_saturation:Maximum possible force for the force-feedback effect on turning right. Value in range [0, 1]. Not all devices support saturation. | offset:The offset from the zero reading of the appropriate sensor value at which the condition begins to be applied. For a spring effect, the neutral point - that is, the point along the axis at which the spring would be considered at rest - would be defined by the offset for the condition. | deadband:Zone around the offset of an axis at which the condition is not active. In the case of a spring that is at rest in the middle of an axis, the deadband enlarges this area of rest. Not all devices support deadband.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.InputVRDevice.TRANSFORM_TYPE_AIM
DESC:(OpenXR only) A pose that allows applications to point in the world using the input source, according to the platform’s conventions for aiming with that kind of source. The aim pose is defined as follows: For tracked hands: The ray that follows platform conventions for how the user aims at objects in the world with their entire hand, with +Y up, +X to the right, and -Z forward. The ray chosen will be runtime-dependent, often a ray emerging from the hand at a target pointed by moving the forearm. For handheld motion controllers: The ray that follows platform conventions for how the user targets objects in the world with the motion controller, with +Y up, +X to the right, and -Z forward. This is usually for applications that are rendering a model matching the physical controller, as an application rendering a virtual object in the user’s hand likely prefers to point based on the geometry of that virtual object. The ray chosen will be runtime-dependent, although this will often emerge from the frontmost tip of a motion controller.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.InputVRDevice.TRANSFORM_TYPE_GRIP
DESC:A pose that allows applications to reliably render a virtual object held in the user’s hand, whether it is tracked directly or by a motion controller. The grip pose is defined as follows: The grip position: For tracked hands: The user’s palm centroid when closing the fist, at the surface of the palm. For handheld motion controllers: A fixed position within the controller that generally lines up with the palm centroid when held by a hand in a neutral position. This position should be adjusted left or right to center the position within the controller’s grip. The grip orientation’s +X axis: When you completely open your hand to form a flat 5-finger pose, the ray that is normal to the user’s palm (away from the palm in the left hand, into the palm in the right hand). The grip orientation’s -Z axis: When you close your hand partially (as if holding the controller), the ray that goes through the center of the tube formed by your non-thumb fingers, in the direction of little finger to thumb. The grip orientation’s +Y axis: orthogonal to +Z and +X using the right-hand rule.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.InputVRDevice.TRANSFORM_TYPE_MESH
DESC:A pose (grip_surface) that allows applications to reliably anchor visual content relative to the user’s physical hand, whether the user’s hand is tracked directly or its position and orientation is inferred by a physical controller. The grip_surface pose is defined as follows: The grip_surface position: The user’s physical palm centroid, at the surface of the palm. For the avoidance of doubt, the palm does not include fingers. The grip_surface orientation’s +X axis: When a user is holding the controller and straightens their index fingers pointing forward, the ray that is normal (perpendicular) to the user’s palm (away from the palm in the left hand, into the palm in the right hand). The grip_surface orientation’s -Z axis: When a user is holding the controller and straightens their index finger, the ray that is parallel to their finger’s pointing direction. The grip_surface orientation’s +Y axis: orthogonal to +Z and +X using the right-hand rule.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.InputVRDevice.TRANSFORM_TYPE_PINCH
DESC:Pinch pose designed for interacting with a small object within arm’s reach using a finger and thumb with a "pinch" gesture. For example, turning a key to open a lock or moving the knob on a slider control are interactions suited to the "pinch" pose.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.InputVRDevice.TRANSFORM_TYPE_POKE
DESC:Poke pose designed for interactions using a fingertip to touch and push a small object. For example, pressing a push button with a fingertip, swiping to scroll a browser view, or typing on a virtual keyboard are interactions suited to the "poke" pose.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.InputVRDevice.TRANSFORM_TYPE_GAZE
DESC:Gaze pose represents the user's gaze direction and is designed for interactions based on real time user's eye tracking. The gaze pose is typically used for interactions such as pointing, object selection, UI targeting, and attention-based interaction. It provides a natural method for determining user intent based on what they are currently looking at in the scene. The gaze pose is defined as follows: The gaze position: The center point between the user's eyes (when eye tracking is active), or an estimated point between the eyes based on head tracking. The gaze orientation's -Z axis: The direction in which the user is looking. When eye tracking is available, this reflects the user's actual line of sight; otherwise, it aligns with the forward direction of the head. The gaze orientation's +Y axis: Generally upward from the user's face. The gaze orientation's +X axis: To the right from the user's perspective, forming a right-handed coordinate system. This feature is only available for OpenXR devices.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.addExternClass(char,ExternClassBase,int)

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.addExternDefine(char,int)

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.addExternFunction(char,ExternFunctionBase,int)

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.addExternLibrary(char,int)
DESC:Adds an external library namespace to UnigineScript. All external variables and functions with names like library.function() will be treated as library functions.
PARAMS:name:Name of the library. | group_id:ID of the group.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.addExternVariable(char,ExternVariableBase,int)
DESC:Adds an external user variable to UnigineScript.
PARAMS:name:Name of the variable. | extern_variable:Pointer to the external variable. | group_id:ID of the group.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.addGroup(char)
DESC:Adds a new group with the specified name. This group is assigned as an argument to the element via the following methods: addExternDefine() addExternLibrary() addExternVariable() addExternFunction() addExternClass() If the same group is added to several elements (definitions, libraries, variables, functions, classes), all of them can be removed from interpreter at once via removeGroup().
PARAMS:group_name:Name of the group.
RETURNS:ID of the group.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.error(char)
DESC:Interpreter error function.
PARAMS:format:Format string. It is similar to the format string for printf() in C.
-

-

DESC:Removes an external definition with the specified name from UnigineScript. This function is similar to #undef Foo.
PARAMS:name:Name of the definition.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.removeExternFunction(char)
DESC:Removes an external user function from UnigineScript.
PARAMS:name:Name of the function.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.removeExternLibrary(char)
DESC:Removes an external library namespace from UnigineScript.
PARAMS:name:Name of the library.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.removeExternVariable(char)
DESC:Removes an external user variable from UnigineScript.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Interpreter.removeGroup(char)
DESC:Removes all the elements (definitions, libraries, variables, functions, classes) added via addExternDefine(), addExternLibrary(), addExternVariable(), addExternFunction() and addExternClass() methods that belong to the specified group.
PARAMS:group_name:Name of the group.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Light.allocateLensFlares(int)
DESC:Allocate a buffer for a given number of lens flares to be created. With this function, memory can be allocated once rather than in chunks, making the creation faster. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
PARAMS:num:Number of lens flares to be created in the allocated buffer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Light.addLensFlare
DESC:Add a new lens flare for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Light.getLensFlare(int)
DESC:Returns the given lens flare from the list of the ones used for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
PARAMS:num:Lens flare number.
RETURNS:Light lens flare smart pointer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Light.cloneLensFlare(int)
DESC:Creates a clone of the lens flare with a given number in the list of lens flares used for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
PARAMS:num:Number of lens flare to be cloned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Light.removeLensFlare(int)
DESC:Removes the lens flare with a given number from the list of lens flares used for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.
PARAMS:num:Number of lens flare to be removed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Light.clearLensFlares
DESC:Clears the list of lens flares used for the per-light lens flare effect. The lens flare effect must be enabled for the light source. This feature is available only for: Omni Lights, Projected Lights and World Lights.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Light.restoreStateLight(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})

ENTRY:M:Unigine.LightVoxelProbe.getVideoMemoryUsage
DESC:Returns a value defining how much memory the light texture takes according to its size. The memory is calculated in accordance to the following formula: Memory = SizeX × SizeY × SizeZ × Sides × FormatMemory SizeX, SizeY, SizeZ - the dimensions of the 3D light texture, in voxels. Sides - number of sides of each voxel, equal to 6. FormatMemory - a memory usage amount for the texture in RGBA16 format, equal to 8.
RETURNS:A texture memory usage, in bytes.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.LightVoxelProbe.BAKE_QUALITY_HIGH

ENTRY:F:Unigine.LightVoxelProbe.BAKE_QUALITY_MEDIUM

ENTRY:F:Unigine.LightVoxelProbe.BLEND_ALPHA_BLEND
