-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Node.getHierarchySpatialBoundBox(bool) const
DESC:Returns a bounding box with world coordinates that takes all children and physics into account. This bounding box is used by the spatial tree.
PARAMS:only_enabled_nodes:Set true to obtain the result taking into account only the nodes in the hierarchy that are enabled, or false - to take into account all nodes in the hierarchy regardless of theirenabled state.
RETURNS:The bounding box with world coordinates.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Node.getHierarchySpatialBoundSphere(bool) const
DESC:Returns a bounding sphere with world coordinates that takes all children and physics into account. This bounding sphere is used by the spatial tree.
PARAMS:only_enabled_nodes:Set true to obtain the result taking into account only the nodes in the hierarchy that are enabled, or false - to take into account all nodes in the hierarchy regardless of theirenabled state.
RETURNS:The bounding sphere with world coordinates.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Node.updateSpatialTree
DESC:Updates node bounds in the spatial tree in the current frame. This method can be used in case you use some custom logic affecting node bounds or position and need to have your changes to be taken into account in the current frame, as well as to process such changes for your custom nodes ( ObjectExtern, NodeExtern) which are otherwise ignored. Calling this method enables you to apply changes for this node fast without complete tree recalculation. But you should be aware that node bounds fast-updated this way might be inaccurate (they can only be expanded, as shrinking will require tree recalculation). In case you need to have 100% accurate bounds in the current frame, call the method. You can also simply tell the spatial tree to update node bounds in the next frame via the method.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Node.updateSpatialTreeDelayed
DESC:Mark node bounds in the spatial tree to be updated in the next frame (all bounds will be 100% accurate in this case unlike for the method). This method can be used in case you use some custom logic affecting node bounds or position, as well as to process such changes for your custom nodes ( ObjectExtern, NodeExtern) which are otherwise ignored. The changes will only be applied in the next frame, in case you need to have your changes to be taken into account right in the current frame use the method for 100% accurate bounds (slow), or the fast method which only expands node bounds if necessary.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Node.getWorldTrigger(int)
DESC:Returns one of the World Triggers inside which the node is located at the moment by its number. For any node in the world, you can check whether it is currently inside any World Trigger and access any of such triggers by simply calling this method.
PARAMS:num:Number of the World Trigger in the list of World Triggers inside which the node is located at the moment.
RETURNS:World Trigger with the specified number inside which the node is located at the moment.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Node.getLostNodePropertyGUID(int) const
DESC:Returns the GUID of a lost property assigned to the node. If for some reason a property assigned to the specified slot of the node is missing, this method can be used to get it's GUID.
PARAMS:num:Target property slot number.
RETURNS:Lost property GUID.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Node.renderBounds(bool,bool)
DESC:Renders the node bounds. The method is applied for checking the actual size of the CPU-rendered node bounds that may differ from the GPU-rendered mesh size, if the latter has been modified by the shader. For nodes that consist of multiple mesh instances (Clutter, Cluster) rendering of each individual mesh bound is also available.
PARAMS:render_node_bound:true to enable rendering of the node bounds, false to disable it. | render_instance_bound:true to enable bound rendering for each individual mesh instance (applicable for Clutter and Cluster nodes), false to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Node.getIDFromFile const
DESC:Returns the node ID from the *.node or a *.world file if the node has been loaded from this file.
RETURNS:Node ID from the *.node or a *.world file. For the node created via code, -1 is returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Node.applyReplacePaths
DESC:Restores the engine's ability to replace baked textures (lightmap, shadow map) inside Node References in runtime. This method is to be applied if hierarchy inside a Node Reference or a path to the baked texture has been modified thus causing rendering of an unsuitable lightmap or a shadow map.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Node.getNodes(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Takes a node collection, clears it, and then adds all existing nodes to it. This includes nodes from the world and other sources, such as cached nodes or nodes currently being loaded via AsyncQueue.
PARAMS:nodes:Node сollection.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Ptr{ObjectIntersectionTexCoord},int) const
DESC:Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a given surface. If the function returns true the data about the texture coordinates of the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersectionTexCoord object. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
PARAMS:p0:Line start point coordinates (local). | p1:Line end point coordinates (local). | v:ObjectIntersectionTexCoord class instance to store corresponding intersection data. | surface:Surface number.
RETURNS:true if there is an intersection with a given surface; otherwise, false.

If the function returns true the data about the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersection object and the number of the first intersected surface will be put to the return variable. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
PARAMS:p0:Line start point coordinates (local). | p1:Line end point coordinates (local). | mask:Intersection mask. | v:ObjectIntersection class instance to store corresponding intersection data. | ret_surface:Intersected surface index.
RETURNS:true if there is an intersection; otherwise, false.

DESC:Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a given surface. If the function returns true the data about the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersection object. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
PARAMS:p0:Line start point coordinates (local). | p1:Line end point coordinates (local). | v:ObjectIntersection class instance to store corresponding intersection data. | surface:Surface number.

DESC:Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a surface with a given intersection mask. If the function returns true the data about the normal at the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersectionNormal object and the number of the first intersected surface will be put to the return variable. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
PARAMS:p0:Line start point coordinates (local). | p1:Line end point coordinates (local). | mask:Intersection mask. | v:ObjectIntersectionNormal class instance to store corresponding intersection data. | ret_surface:Intersected surface index.
RETURNS:true if there is an intersection; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,int,Unigine.Ptr{ObjectIntersectionTexCoord},int) const
DESC:Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a surface with a given intersection mask. If the function returns true the data about the texture coordinates of the intersection point will be put to ObjectIntersectionNormal object and the number of the first intersected surface will be put to the return variable. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
PARAMS:p0:Line start point coordinates (local). | p1:Line end point coordinates (local). | mask:Intersection mask. | v:ObjectIntersectionTexCoord class instance to store corresponding intersection data. | ret_surface:Intersected surface index.
RETURNS:true if there is an intersection; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,int,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec4,int,int,int) const
DESC:Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a surface with a given intersection mask. If the function returns true the data about the intersection (point, normal and texture coordinates) and the number of the first intersected surface will be put to corresponding return variables. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
PARAMS:p0:Line start point coordinates (local). | p1:Line end point coordinates (local). | mask:Intersection mask. | ret_point:Intersection point coordinates (object's local coordinate system). Pass NULL if this parameter is not required. | ret_normal:Coordinates of the normal vector to the intersection point. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required. | ret_texcoord:Texture coordinates of the intersection point (vec4, where vec4.xy is for the first (0) UV channel, vec4.zw is for the second (1) UV channel). Pass NULL if this parameter is not required. | ret_index:Intersected triangle number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required. | ret_instance:Intersected instance number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.Intersected instance number can be obtained for the following classes:ObjectMeshSkinnedObjectMeshClusterObjectMeshSplineCluster | ret_surface:Intersected surface number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.
RETURNS:true if there is at least one intersection found; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec4,int,int,int) const
DESC:Checks if there is an intersection between a line and a given surface. If the function returns true the data about the intersection (point, normal and texture coordinates) will be put to corresponding return variables. The following objects have individual parameters, that control accuracy of intersection detection for them: ObjectLandscapeTerrain ObjectWaterGlobal
PARAMS:p0:Line start point coordinates (local). | p1:Line end point coordinates (local). | ret_point:Intersection point coordinates (object's local coordinate system). Pass NULL if this parameter is not required. | ret_normal:Coordinates of the normal vector to the intersection point. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required. | ret_texcoord:Texture coordinates of the intersection point (vec4, where vec4.xy is for the first (0) UV channel, vec4.zw is for the second (1) UV channel). Pass NULL if this parameter is not required. | ret_index:Intersected triangle number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required. | ret_instance:Intersected instance number. Pass NULL if this parameter is not required.Intersected instance number can be obtained for the following classes:ObjectMeshSkinnedObjectMeshClusterObjectMeshSplineCluster | surface:Surface number.
RETURNS:true if there is an intersection with a given surface; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.setMinFadeDistance(float,int)
DESC:Updates the minimum fade-in distance of a given surface. Over this distance the surface smoothly becomes visible due to alpha fading. It is counted starting from the minimum visibility distance.
PARAMS:distance:Minimum fade-in distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead. The default value is 0. | surface:Surface number.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.getMinFadeDistance(int) const
DESC:Returns the minimum fade-in distance of a given surface. Over this distance the surface smoothly becomes visible due to alpha fading. It is counted starting from the minimum visibility distance.
PARAMS:surface:Surface number.
RETURNS:Minimum fade-in distance, in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.setMaxFadeDistance(float,int)
DESC:Updates the maximum fade-out distance of a given surface. Over this distance the surface smoothly becomes invisible due to alpha fading. It is counted off starting from the maximum visibility distance.
PARAMS:distance:Maximum fade-out distance, in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead. The default value is 0. | surface:Surface number.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.getMaxFadeDistance(int) const

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.setSoundOcclusion(float,int)
DESC:Sets a new sound occlusion value for the specified surface of the object, that determines how much it affects sounds in case of occlusion. For a sound source to be occluded by the specified surface, at least one bit of its occlusion mask should match the occlusion mask of the sound source. Sound occlusion must be enabled.
PARAMS:occlusion:Occlusion value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] to be set for the specified surface.0.0f - no occlusion, sound volume will stay the same in case of occlusion by the surface.1.0f - maximum occlusion, sound will not be heard at all in case of occlusion by the surface.The default value is0.0f. | surface:Surface number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.getSoundOcclusion(int) const
DESC:Returns the current sound occlusion value for the specified surface of the object, that determines how much it affects sounds in case of occlusion. For a sound source to be occluded by the specified surface, at least one bit of its occlusion mask should match the occlusion mask of the sound source. Sound occlusion must be enabled.
PARAMS:surface:Surface number.
RETURNS:Current occlusion value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] set for the specified surface.0.0f - no occlusion, sound volume will stay the same in case of occlusion by the surface.1.0f - maximum occlusion, sound will not be heard at all in case of occlusion by the surface.The default value is0.0f.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.setSoundOcclusionMask(int,int)
DESC:Sets a new sound occlusion mask for the specified surface of the object. For a sound source to be occluded by the specified surface, at least one bit of this mask should match the occlusion mask of the sound source. Each surface has its own occlusion value, that determines how much it affects sounds in case of occlusion. Sound occlusion must be enabled.
PARAMS:mask:Integer, each bit of which is a mask for sound source occlusion. | surface:Surface number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.getSoundOcclusionMask(int) const
DESC:Returns sound occlusion mask for the specified surface of the object. For a sound source to be occluded by the specified surface, at least one bit of this mask should match the occlusion mask of the sound source. Each surface has its own occlusion value, that determines how much it affects sounds in case of occlusion. Sound occlusion must be enabled.
PARAMS:surface:Surface number.
RETURNS:Integer, each bit of which is a mask for sound source occlusion.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.setPhysicsFriction(float,int)
DESC:Sets the coefficient of friction for the specified surface. This coefficient allows to model more rough rubbing of surfaces and is opposite to the body's movement direction. Friction parameter values of both surfaces being in contact are considered. The resulting calculated friction depends on the objects' masses and gravity, and the angle between contacting surfaces. The higher the value, the less tendency the body has to slide. Friction is calculated by the contact between physical bodies.
PARAMS:value:Friction coefficient value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] to be set for the specified surface. | surface:Surface number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.getPhysicsFriction(int) const
DESC:Returns the current coefficient of friction for the specified surface. This coefficient allows to model more rough rubbing of surfaces and is opposite to the body's movement direction. Friction parameter values of both surfaces being in contact are considered. The resulting calculated friction depends on the objects' masses and gravity, and the angle between contacting surfaces. The higher the value, the less tendency the body has to slide. Friction is calculated by the contact between physical bodies.
PARAMS:surface:Surface number.
RETURNS:Current friction coefficient value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] set for the specified surface.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.setPhysicsRestitution(float,int)
DESC:Sets the coefficient of restitution for the specified surface. This coefficient determines the degree of relative kinetic energy retained after a collision. It defines how bouncy the object is by contacting with another object. It depends on the elasticity of the materials of colliding bodies. The simulated restitution, like friction, considers the total value for both objects being in contact. The maximum value of 1.0f models elastic collision. Objects bounce off according to the impulse they get by contact. The minimum value of 0.0f models inelastic collision. Objects do not bounce at all. Restitution is calculated by the contact between physical bodies.
PARAMS:value:Restitution coefficient value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] to be set for the specified surface. | surface:Surface number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Object.getPhysicsRestitution(int) const
DESC:Returns the current coefficient of restitution for the specified surface. This coefficient determines the degree of relative kinetic energy retained after a collision. It defines how bouncy the object is by contacting with another object. It depends on the elasticity of the materials of colliding bodies. The simulated restitution, like friction, considers the total value for both objects being in contact. The maximum value of 1.0f models elastic collision. Objects bounce off according to the impulse they get by contact. The minimum value of 0.0f models inelastic collision. Objects do not bounce at all. Restitution is calculated by the contact between physical bodies.
PARAMS:surface:Surface number.
RETURNS:Current restitution coefficient value in the range [0.0f, 1.0f] set for the specified surface.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.setTexCoord(int,Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Updates texture coordinates of a given billboard. The default is vec4(1,1,0,0). The first pair of coordinates (x and x) sets texture scale by X and Y axes. For example, by the scale of 2 the texture is repeated twice on the billboard. The second pair (z and w) set texture offset along X and Y axes. For example, by the offset of 0.5 along X axis the texture is repositioned to the right (so that the edge of the texture is rendered in the center).
PARAMS:num:Billboard number in range from 0 to the total number of billboards. | texcoord:Texture coordinates.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.getTexCoord(int) const
DESC:Returns the texture coordinates of a given billboard. The default is vec4(1,1,0,0). The first pair of coordinates (x and x) sets texture scale by X and Y axes. For example, by the scale of 2 the texture is repeated twice on the billboard. The second pair (z and w) set texture offset along X and Y axes. For example, by the offset of 0.5 along X axis the texture is repositioned to the right (so that the edge of the texture is rendered in the center).
PARAMS:num:Billboard number in range from 0 to the total number of billboards.
RETURNS:Texture coordinates.
-

DESC:Saves the object's state to the specified stream. This method saves all object's parameters including the list of billboards.To save the object's billboards only, use saveStateBillboards(). Saving into the stream requires creating a blob to save into. To restore the saved state the restoreStateSelf() method is used:
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true on success; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.restoreStateSelf(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
DESC:Restores the object's state from the specified stream. This method restores all object's parameters including the list of billboards. To restore the object's billboards only, use restoreStateBillboards(). Restoring from the stream requires creating a blob to save into and saving the state using the saveStateSelf() method:
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true on success; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.saveStateBillboards(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream}) const
DESC:Saves the state of the object's billboards to the specified stream. Saving into the stream requires creating a blob to save into. To restore the saved state the restoreStateBillboards() method is used:
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true on success; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectBillboards.restoreStateBillboards(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
DESC:Restores the state of the object's billboards from the specified stream. Restoring from the stream requires creating a blob to save into and saving the state using the saveStateBillboards() method:
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true on success; otherwise, false.

Each attribute consists of:An offset of the vertex in bytes, depends on the vertex type and size.Type of the vertex: TYPE_FLOAT, TYPE_HALF, TYPE_UCHARSize of the vertex: can be 1,2,3,4 for float type; 2,4 for half type; 4 for UChar typeWhen it goes to shader, 0 -attribute always comes with the size of 4, no matter what size is specified in the method. DESC:Sets the maximum grass bending parameters (rendered in areas with the highest density according to the mask). Bend angles (mean and spread) are defined for four diffuse texture columns. The resulting value is determined as follows: Result = Mean + Random * Spread, where Random is a random value in range from -1 to 1.

DESC:Sets the minimum grass bending parameters (rendered in areas with the lowest density according to the mask). Bend angles (mean and spread) are defined for four diffuse texture columns. The resulting value is determined as follows: Result = Mean + Random * Spread, where Random is a random value in range from -1 to 1.
PARAMS:mean:Vector of mean values of grass bending angles to be set for four diffuse texture columns. | spread:Vector of spread values of grass bending angles to be set for four diffuse texture columns.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.setCutoutIntersectionMask(int)
DESC:Sets a new cutout intersection mask. This mask allows you to cut out the grass in the areas of intersection with objects and decals (e.g. can be used to remove grass under houses or from the surface of roads projected using decals). The grass will be cut out by objects and decals that have their intersection mask matching this one (one bit at least). To set intersection masks the following methods can be used: for decals use getIntersectionMask() for objects use getIntersectionMask()
PARAMS:mask:Integer, each bit of which is a mask.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGrass.getCutoutIntersectionMask const

This mask allows you to cut out the grass in the areas of intersection with objects and decals (e.g. can be used to remove grass under houses or from the surface of roads projected using decals). The grass will be cut out by objects and decals that have their intersection mask matching this one (one bit at least). To set intersection masks the following methods can be used: for decals use getIntersectionMask() for objects use getIntersectionMask()
RETURNS:Integer, each bit of which is a mask.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.getMeshCurrentVRAM
DESC:Returns the current render mesh used for the object and loaded to video memory (VRAM).
RETURNS:A current render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.getMeshForceRAM
DESC:Returns the source mesh used for the object and loads it to memory (RAM) immediately.
RETURNS:A source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.getMeshForceVRAM
DESC:Returns the render mesh used for the object and loads it to video memory (VRAM) immediately. At that, the static mesh will also be loaded to memory (RAM). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:A render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.getMeshAsyncRAM
DESC:Returns the source mesh used for the object and loads it to memory (RAM) asynchronously.
RETURNS:A source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.getMeshAsyncVRAM
DESC:Returns the render mesh used for the object and loads it to video memory (VRAM) asynchronously. At that, the static mesh will also be loaded to memory (RAM). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:A render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.getMeshDynamicRAM
DESC:Returns the procedural source mesh associated with the object and ensures it is loaded into system memory (RAM). This method is only available when the mesh is in the dynamic (PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC) mode. A procedural mesh is a mesh created via code and uses a specific streaming mode. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, the object stays in memory after creation and is only unloaded manually using deleteDynamicMesh() or when the procedural mode is changed.
RETURNS:A procedural source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.getMeshDynamicVRAM
DESC:Returns the procedural render mesh associated with the object and ensures it is loaded into video memory (VRAM). This method is only available when the mesh is in the dynamic (PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC) mode. A procedural mesh is a mesh created via code and uses a specific streaming mode. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, the object stays in memory after creation and is only unloaded manually using deleteDynamicMesh() or when the procedural mode is changed.
RETURNS:A procedural render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.loadAsyncVRAM
DESC:Asynchronously loads the mesh to video memory (VRAM) if the async streaming mode for meshes is enabled. Otherwise, the forced loading is performed. This method is recommended for implementing your own prefetch system (i.e. asynchronous pre-loading of meshes to video memory before they are used). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to VRAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.loadAsyncRAM
DESC:Asynchronously loads the mesh to memory (RAM) if the async streaming mode for meshes is enabled. Otherwise, the forced loading is performed. This method is recommended for implementing your own prefetch system (i.e. asynchronous pre-loading of meshes to memory before they are used).
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to RAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.loadForceVRAM
DESC:Performs force-loading of the mesh to video memory (VRAM) immediately. The forced loading to VRAM is performed in the main thread. Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to VRAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.loadForceRAM
DESC:Performs force-loading of the mesh to memory (RAM) immediately.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to RAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.setMeshProceduralMode(ObjectMeshStatic::PROCEDURAL_MODE,int)
DESC:Sets the procedural mode for the mesh. The specified mode defines how procedural data is stored, updated, and unloaded.
PARAMS:mode:One of the PROCEDURAL_MODE to apply to the mesh. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags that control how vertex and index data are stored for the mesh render.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.getMeshProceduralMode const
DESC:Returns a value indicating which procedural mode assigned to the mesh. The value corresponds to one of the available PROCEDURAL_MODE types, determining how procedural data is stored, updated, and unloaded.
RETURNS:Current procedural mode of the mesh.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.isMeshNull const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the source mesh used for the object is null (does not exist, unassigned, not loaded, etc.).

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.isMeshLoadedRAM const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to memory (RAM).

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.isMeshLoadedVRAM const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to video memory (VRAM).
RETURNS:true if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to VRAM; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.createCopyMeshRAM const
DESC:Creates and returns a copy of the source mesh used by the object, loading it directly from disk if it is not present in cache. This method does not stream the copied mesh into memory cache, resulting in lower RAM usage.
RETURNS:A copy of the source mesh, or nullptr if source mesh is not presented in RAM or its file path is invalid.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.getCopyMeshRAM(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}) const
DESC:Retrieves a copy of the source mesh used by the object and writes it to the provided mesh object. If the mesh is not present in cache, it is loaded directly from disk. This method does not stream the copied mesh into memory cache, resulting in lower RAM usage.
PARAMS:result:Object that will receive a copy of the source mesh.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, false if source mesh is not present in RAM or its file path is invalid.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.isMeshProceduralDone const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if all asynchronous operations on the procedural mesh have completed.
RETURNS:true if no asynchronous geometry operation is active, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.isMeshProceduralActive const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if an asynchronous operation on the procedural mesh is currently in progress.
RETURNS:true if an asynchronous geometry operation is active, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.isMeshProceduralDynamic const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the current procedural mode is PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC.
RETURNS:true if PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC is active, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.applyCopyMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int)
DESC:Copies all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.applyMoveMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
DESC:Moves all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately without memory allocation and data copying (move semantics). In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, this method behaves identically to its asynchronous variant. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to move vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was moved (transferred without copying) successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.applyMoveMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{MeshRender})
DESC:Moves all vertex and render data from the given mesh_ram and mesh_vram into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately using move semantics, without data copying or VRAM allocation. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:mesh_ram:Source mesh containing vertex data. | mesh_vram:Source mesh containing render data.
RETURNS:true if the data was moved (transferred without copying) successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.applyCopyMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int)
DESC:Copies all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster compared to the forced variant, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.applyMoveMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
DESC:Moves all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay, without memory allocation and data copying (move semantics). Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster compared to the forced variant, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.applyMoveMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{MeshRender})
DESC:Moves all vertex and render data from the given mesh_ram and mesh_vram into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously, without copying or allocating VRAM. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, this method behaves identically to its forced variant.
PARAMS:mesh_ram:Source mesh containing vertex data. | mesh_vram:Source mesh containing render data.
RETURNS:true if the data was moved successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.deleteDynamicMesh
DESC:Releases all memory used by the procedural mesh, including both VRAM and RAM. Works only when procedural mode is set to PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC.
RETURNS:true if the memory was released successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.runGenerateMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},int)
DESC:Starts asynchronous generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in a background thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh will be transferred to the object once complete, without blocking the main thread. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. Note that the callback is executed in a single dedicated thread controlled by the engine, it is not parallelized and must not spawn additional threads.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the modification was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.runGenerateMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Starts asynchronous generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in a background thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh will be transferred to the object once complete, without blocking the main thread. After the mesh has been applied to the object, the optional callback_done will be called. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. Note that the callback is executed in a single dedicated thread controlled by the engine, it is not parallelized and must not spawn additional threads.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | callback_done:Optional callback executed after geometry has been fully applied.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_done() | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.runGenerateMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},int)
DESC:Starts immediate (forced) generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in the main thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh is applied to the object as soon as generation completes. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectGuiMesh.runGenerateMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Starts immediate (forced) generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in the main thread and must create and fill a Mesh object with vertex data. Once the mesh is applied to the object, the optional callback_done is called on the main thread. Works only when procedural mode is enabled
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | callback_done:Optional callback executed after geometry has been fully applied.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_done() | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Landscape.asyncTextureDraw(int,Unigine.UGUID,Unigine.Math.ivec2,Unigine.Math.ivec2,int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Commences an asynchronous GPU-based drawing operation with forced pre-loading of terrain data within the specified bounding box (all landscape layer maps). The drawing operation represents modification of the texture buffer of the specified size taken at specified coordinates and combining data layers defined by the specified flags. The operation itself is to be implemented in the TextureDraw event handler. This method can be used for implementing GPU-based terrain modification (e.g. brushes) that requires additional data beyond the area specified by coords and resolution parameters as well as the data of other landscape layer maps (e.g. a copy brush).
PARAMS:operation_id:Draw operation ID. | file_guid:GUID of the landscape layer map file to be modified. | coord:Coordinates of the upper left corner of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes. | resolution:Resolution of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes. | flags_file_data:Data layer mask. A combination of FLAGS_FILE_DATA_* flags indicating data layers to be affected (heights, albedo, certain masks). | bounds_preload_lmaps:Bounding box (world) specifying the area containing terrain tiles (all landscape layer maps) to be loaded to memory prior to making modifications.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Landscape.asyncTextureDraw(int,Unigine.UGUID,Unigine.Math.ivec2,Unigine.Math.ivec2,int)
DESC:Commences an asynchronous GPU-based drawing operation. PARAMS:operation_id:Draw operation ID. | file_guid:GUID of the landscape layer map file to be modified. | coord:Coordinates of the upper left corner of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes. | resolution:Resolution of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes. | flags_file_data:Data layer mask. A combination of FLAGS_FILE_DATA_* flags indicating data layers to be affected (heights, albedo, certain masks).

DESC:Commences an asynchronous GPU-based drawing operation. The drawing operation represents modification of the texture buffer of the specified size taken at specified coordinates and combining all data layers. The operation itself is to be implemented in the TextureDraw event handler. This method can be used for implementing GPU-based terrain modification (e.g. brushes).
PARAMS:file_guid:GUID of the landscape layer map file to be modified. | coord:Coordinates of the upper left corner of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes. | resolution:Resolution of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Landscape.asyncTextureDraw(int,Unigine.UGUID,Unigine.Math.ivec2,Unigine.Math.ivec2,int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Commences an asynchronous GPU-based drawing operation with forced pre-loading of terrain data within the specified bounding boxes, including both landscape layer maps and virtual textures. The drawing operation represents a modification of the texture buffer of the specified size taken at specified coordinates and combining data layers defined by the specified flags. Preloaded virtual texture data includes surface color (albedo), surface details (normal), and geometry height information (height) used for terrain tessellation. The operation is linked to the provided operation ID and is to be implemented in the TextureDraw event handler. This method can be used for implementing GPU-based terrain modifications (e.g. brushes) that require comprehensive access to both landscape layer maps and detailed virtual texture data beyond the target area.
PARAMS:operation_id:Draw operation ID. | file_guid:GUID of the landscape layer map file to be modified. | coord:Coordinates of the upper left corner of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes. | resolution:Resolution of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes. | flags_file_data:Data layer mask. A combination of FLAGS_FILE_DATA_* flags indicating data layers to be affected (heights, albedo, certain masks). | bounds_preload_lmaps:Bounding box (world) specifying the area containing terrain tiles (all landscape layer maps) to be loaded to memory prior to making modifications. | bounds_preload_vtextures:Bounding box (world) specifying the area containing terrain tiles (virtual textures, including surface color, normals, and height data) to be loaded to memory prior to making modifications.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Landscape.asyncTextureDraw(Unigine.UGUID,Unigine.Math.ivec2,Unigine.Math.ivec2,int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Commences an asynchronous GPU-based drawing operation with forced pre-loading of terrain data within the specified bounding boxes, including both landscape layer maps and virtual textures. Preloaded virtual texture data includes surface color (albedo), surface details (normal), and geometry height information (height) used for terrain tessellation. The operation is to be implemented in the TextureDraw event handler. This method can be used for implementing GPU-based terrain modifications (e.g. brushes) that require comprehensive access to both landscape layer maps and detailed virtual texture data beyond the target area.
PARAMS:file_guid:GUID of the landscape layer map file to be modified. | coord:Coordinates of the upper left corner of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes. | resolution:Resolution of the landscape layer map data segment to be modified along the X and Y axes. | flags_file_data:Data layer mask. ENTRY:M:Unigine.Landscape.filesClose(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.UGUID,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Closes .lmap files for all landscape layer maps and reloads the ones with specified GUIDs. This method should be called before making any changes (modification, deletion, renaming) to .lmap files of the landscape terrain object to avoid conflicts, as these files are streamed continuosly by the Engine. Thus, by calling this method you inform the Engine that it should stop streaming terrain data. The list informs the Engine which files are no longer valid and should be reloaded or removed. As you're done with modification you should call the filesOpen() method to resume streaming operations.
PARAMS:reload_files:List of GUIDs of .lmap files to be reloaded. This list should contain .lmap files, that were deleted or having their data changed (albedo, heights, masks). If there are no such files, you can simply call the filesClose() method.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Landscape.filesClose
DESC:Closes .lmap files for all landscape layer maps.This method should be called before making any changes (modification, deletion, renaming) to .lmap files of the landscape terrain object to avoid conflicts, as these files are streamed continuosly by the Engine. Thus, by calling this method you inform the Engine that it should stop streaming terrain data. As you're done with modification you should call the filesOpen() method to resume streaming operations.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Landscape.filesOpen
DESC:Opens .lmap files for all landscape layer maps.This method should be called after making any changes (modification, deletion, renaming) to .lmap files of the landscape terrain object. Prior to making such modifications the filesClose() method should be called.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Landscape.MULTIPLICATIVE

ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeLayerMap.setCulling(bool)
DESC:Sets a value indicating if heights data of the layer map is to be used for culling precalculation. In order to define which parts of the terrain are to be rendered a culling test is required. This test is performed on the basis of a precalculated low-detail height map, combining heights data of all landscape layer maps having a significant impact on the result. Precalculation is performed on the CPU side, so processing a large number of landscape layer maps may reduce performance. Moreover, some layer maps may be used as decals (i.e. their impact on the resulting height map is insignificant). For such cases you can simply disable this option to avoid unnecessary calculations. Disabling this option for a single
PARAMS:culling:true to use the layer map for culling, false - to ignore it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeLayerMap.isCulling const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if heights data of the layer map is to be used for culling precalculation. In order to define which parts of the terrain are to be rendered a culling test is required. This test is performed on the basis of a precalculated low-detail height map, combining heights data of all landscape layer maps having a significant impact on the result. Precalculation is performed on the CPU side, so processing a large number of landscape layer maps may reduce performance. Moreover, some layer maps may be used as decals (i.e. their impact on the resulting height map is insignificant). For such cases you can simply disable this option to avoid unnecessary calculations.
RETURNS:true if heights data of the layer map is to be used for culling precalculation; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeMapFileCreator.run(bool,bool)
DESC:Runs the landscape map file creation process. You can set callbacks to be fired in the beginning, upon completion and during the process to monitor progress and display statistics. Creates the landscape map file path if it doesn’t exist yet (including subdirectories).
PARAMS:is_empty:true to create an empty .lmap file (e.g., when you create a layer map to be manually sculpted from scratch using brushes), false - to get necessary data from the sources and put them to the generated .lmap file. | is_safe:true to make the Engine automatically call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods when performing operations (before modifying an .lmap file the Engine should release files via filesClose(), while after modification fileOpen() should be called), false - to call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods manually.The Landscape class has two overloads for the filesClose() method:filesClose() - to be called in case of moving an .lmap file (no data reloading is performed as the file itself was not modified - saves time on reloading data)filesClose(reload_files) - to be called in case of deleting or modifying an .lmap file.When is_safe = true the Engine shall always call filesClose(reload_files) with complete data reloading.
RETURNS:true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeMapFileCompression.compress(bool)
DESC:Starts the landscape map file compression process.
PARAMS:is_safe:true to make the Engine automatically call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods when performing operations (before modifying an .lmap file the Engine should release files via filesClose(), while after modification fileOpen() should be called), false — to call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods manually.The Landscape class has two overloads for the filesClose() method:filesClose() — to be called in case of moving an .lmap file (no data reloading is performed as the file itself was not modified — saves time on reloading data)filesClose(reload_files) — to be called in case of deleting or modifying an .lmap file.When is_safe = true the Engine shall always call filesClose(reload_files) with complete data reloading.
RETURNS:true if the compression operation is successful; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeMapFileCompression.decompress(bool)
DESC:Starts the landscape map file decompression process.
PARAMS:is_safe:true to make the Engine automatically call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods when performing operations (before modifying an .lmap file the Engine should release files via filesClose(), while after modification fileOpen() should be called), false — to call filesClose()/fileOpen() methods manually.The Landscape class has two overloads for the filesClose() method:filesClose() — to be called in case of moving an .lmap file (no data reloading is performed as the file itself was not modified — saves time on reloading data)filesClose(reload_files) — to be called in case of deleting or modifying an .lmap file.When is_safe = true the Engine shall always call filesClose(reload_files) with complete data reloading.
RETURNS:true if the decompression operation is successful; otherwise, false.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.getMask(int) const
DESC:Returns information stored for the point in the detail mask with the specified number. To get valid detail mask information via this method, engage mask data for the fetch/intersection request.
PARAMS:num:Number of the detail mask in the [0; 19] range.
RETURNS:Value for the point stored in the detail mask with the specified number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.setUsesMask(int,bool)
DESC:Sets a value indicating if data of the specified detail mask is engaged in the fetch/intersection request. When the data type is engaged, you can obtain it via the corresponding get() method. Disengaging unnecessary data when performing requests saves some performance (e.g., you can engage albedo data only if you need only color information at a certain point). Enable this option to get detail mask data for the point.
PARAMS:num:Detail mask number in the [0; 19] range. | value:true to engage data of the specified detail mask in the fetch/intersection request, false - to disengage.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.isUsesMask(int) const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if data of the specified detail mask is engaged in the fetch/intersection request. When the data type is engaged, you can obtain it via the corresponding get() method. Disengaging unnecessary data when performing requests saves some performance (e.g., you can engage albedo data only if you need only color information at a certain point). Enable this option to get detail mask data for the point.
PARAMS:num:Detail mask number in the [0; 19] range.
RETURNS:true if data of the specified detail mask is engaged in the fetch/intersection request; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.fetchForce
DESC:Fetches terrain data in forced mode for the point specified by the setFetchPosition(). You can use the fetchAsync() method to reduce load, when an instant result is not required.
RETURNS:true if terrain data was successfully obtained for the specified point; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.fetchForce(Unigine.Math.Vec2)
DESC:Fetches terrain data in forced mode for the specified point. You can use the fetchAsync() method to reduce load, when an instant result is not required.
PARAMS:position:Coordinates of the point.
RETURNS:true if terrain data was successfully obtained for the specified point; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.intersectionForce
DESC:Performs tracing along the line from the p0 point specified by the setIntersectionPositionBegin() to the p1 point specified by the setIntersectionPositionEnd() to find an intersection with the terrain in forced mode. You can use the intersectionAsync() method to reduce load, when an instant result is not required.
RETURNS:true if an intersection with the terrain was found; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.intersectionForce(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3)
DESC:Performs tracing along the line from the p0 point to the p1 point to find an intersection with the terrain in forced mode. You can use the intersectionAsync() method to reduce load, when an instant result is not required.
PARAMS:p0:Coordinates of the p0 point. | p1:Coordinates of the p1 point.
RETURNS:true if an intersection with the terrain was found; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.fetchAsync(bool)
DESC:Fetches terrain data for the point specified by the setFetchPosition() in asynchronous mode (the corresponding task shall be put to the queue, to wait until the result is obtained use the wait() method). For an instant result use the fetchForce() method.
PARAMS:critical:true to set high priority for the fetch task, false - to set normal priority.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.fetchAsync(Unigine.Math.Vec2,bool)
DESC:Fetches terrain data for the specified point in asynchronous mode (the corresponding task shall be put to the queue, to wait until the result is obtained use the wait() method). For an instant result use the fetchForce() method.
PARAMS:position:Coordinates of the point. | critical:true to set high priority for the fetch task, false - to set normal priority.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.intersectionAsync(bool)
DESC:Performs tracing along the line from the p0 point specified by the setIntersectionPositionBegin() to the p1 point specified by the setIntersectionPositionEnd() to find an intersection with the terrain in asynchronous mode (the corresponding task shall be put to the queue, to wait until the result is obtained use the wait() method). For an instant result use the intersectionForce() method.
PARAMS:critical:true to set high priority for the intersection task, false - to set normal priority.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeFetch.intersectionAsync(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,bool)

For an instant result use the intersectionForce() method.
PARAMS:p0:Coordinates of the p0 point. | p1:Coordinates of the p1 point. | critical:true to set high priority for the intersection task, false - to set normal priority.

DESC:Creates a new LandscapeImages object to store the data for a terrain area of the specified resolution.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeImages.getMask(int)
DESC:Returns mask data as an RGBA8 image.Each detail mask can be represented by a single-channel image. For optimization purposes detail mask data is stored in blocks - RGBA8 images (each containing 4 masks, one mask per each channel). There are 5 blocks, as the terrain has 20 detail masks available. Thus, the data of the 9th detail mask shall be stored in the R-channel of the third block (index = 2).
PARAMS:num:Masks data block index.
RETURNS:Image (RGBA8) containing mask data.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.LandscapeImages.getOpacityMask(int)
DESC:Returns opacity information for mask data as an RGBA8 image. Each mask can be represented by a single-channel image. For optimization purposes opacity information for mask data is stored in blocks - RGBA8 images (each containing 4 masks, one mask per each channel). There are 5 blocks, as the terrain has 20 detail masks available. Thus, the data of the 9th detail mask shall be stored in the R-channel of the third block (index = 2).
PARAMS:num:Masks data block index.
RETURNS:Image (RGBA8) containing opacity information for mask data.
-

DESC:Returns opacity information for mask data as an RGBA8 texture. Each mask can be represented by a single-channel texture. For optimization purposes opacity information for mask data is stored in blocks - RGBA8 textures (each containing 4 masks, one mask per each channel). There are 5 blocks, as the terrain has 20 detail masks available. Thus, the data of the 9th detail mask shall be stored in the R-channel of the third block (index = 2).
PARAMS:num:Masks data block index.
RETURNS:Texture (RGBA8) containing opacity information for mask data.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.getMeshDynamicRAM
DESC:Returns the procedural source mesh associated with the object and ensures it is loaded into system memory (RAM). This method is only available when the mesh is in the dynamic () mode. A procedural mesh is a mesh created via code and uses a specific streaming mode. In dynamic mode, the object constantly remains in memory after creation and is only unloaded manually using or when the procedural mode is changed.
RETURNS:A procedural source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.getMeshDynamicVRAM
DESC:Returns the procedural render mesh associated with the object and ensures it is loaded into video memory (VRAM). This method is only available when the mesh is in the dynamic () mode. A procedural mesh is a mesh created via code and uses a specific streaming mode. In dynamic mode, the object constantly remains in memory after creation and is only unloaded manually using or when the procedural mode is changed.
RETURNS:A procedural render mesh used for the object.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.loadAsyncVRAM
DESC:Asynchronously loads the mesh to video memory (VRAM) if the async streaming mode for meshes is enabled. Otherwise, the forced loading is performed. This method is recommended for implementing your own prefetch system (i.e. asynchronous pre-loading of meshes to video memory before they are used). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to VRAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.loadAsyncRAM
DESC:Asynchronously loads the mesh to memory (RAM) if the async streaming mode for meshes is enabled. Otherwise, the forced loading is performed. This method is recommended for implementing your own prefetch system (i.e. asynchronous pre-loading of meshes to memory before they are used).
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to RAM, true will be returned.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.loadForceRAM

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.applyCopyMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int)

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.applyMoveMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
DESC:Moves all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately without memory allocation and data copying (move semantics). Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, this method behaves identically to its asynchronous variant.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to move vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was moved (transferred without copying) successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.applyMoveMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{MeshRender})
DESC:Moves all vertex and render data from the given mesh_ram and mesh_vram into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately using move semantics, without data copying or VRAM allocation. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:mesh_ram:Source mesh containing vertex data. | mesh_vram:Source mesh containing render data.
RETURNS:true if the data was moved (transferred without copying) successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.applyCopyMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int)
DESC:Copies all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster compared to the forced variant, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.applyMoveMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
DESC:Moves all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay, without memory allocation and data copying (move semantics). Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster compared to the forced variant, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.applyMoveMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{MeshRender})
DESC:Moves all vertex and render data from the given mesh_ram and mesh_vram into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously, without copying or allocating VRAM. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, this method behaves identically to its forced variant.
PARAMS:mesh_ram:Source mesh containing vertex data. | mesh_vram:Source mesh containing render data.
RETURNS:true if the data was moved successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.deleteDynamicMesh
DESC:Releases all memory used by the procedural mesh, including both VRAM and RAM. Works only when procedural mode is set to PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC.
RETURNS:true if the memory was released successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.runGenerateMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},int)
DESC:Starts asynchronous generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in a background thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh will be transferred to the object once complete, without blocking the main thread. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. Note that the callback is executed in a single dedicated thread controlled by the engine, it is not parallelized and must not spawn additional threads.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the modification was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.runGenerateMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Starts asynchronous generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in a background thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh will be transferred to the object once complete, without blocking the main thread. After the mesh has been applied to the object, the optional callback_done will be called. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. Note that the callback is executed in a single dedicated thread controlled by the engine, it is not parallelized and must not spawn additional threads.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | callback_done:Optional callback executed after geometry has been fully applied.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_done() | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.runGenerateMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},int)
DESC:Starts immediate (forced) generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in the main thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh is applied to the object as soon as generation completes. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.runGenerateMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Starts immediate (forced) generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in the main thread and must create and fill a Mesh object with vertex data. Once the mesh is applied to the object, the optional callback_done is called on the main thread. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | callback_done:Optional callback executed after geometry has been fully applied.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_done() | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-

DESC:Draft quality preset for lightmaps.

DESC:Global quality preset set in the Bake Lighting settings.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.LIGHTMAP_MODE_SURFACE
DESC:Reuse an already baked lightmap texture from another surface. Can be used for LODs.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.LIGHTMAP_MODE_CUSTOM
DESC:Use a custom lightmap texture for the surface.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.LIGHTMAP_MODE_UNIQUE
DESC:Bake a unique lightmap texture for the surface.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.SURFACE_CUSTOM_TEXTURE_MODE_UNIQUE
DESC:Use a unique custom texture for the surface.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.SURFACE_CUSTOM_TEXTURE_MODE_SURFACE
DESC:Use the custom texture from another surface. This option is intended for use with LODs having the same UV maps.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB
DESC:In this mode, all procedural data is stored in memory as a temporary Blob. VRAM and RAM are loaded directly from this Blob, which the engine can unload when needed by itself. Modifications are faster compared to FILE mode, but at the cost of increased RAM usage. Rendered (visible) meshes are stored uncompressed for optimal performance, while non-visible meshes are compressed to save memory.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE
DESC:In this mode, procedural mesh data is stored as temporary files on disk. Each time a procedural mesh is modified, the corresponding file is updated. This allows the engine to unload both RAM and VRAM when needed, at the cost of slightly lower performance due to disk I/O operations. Configuration is available through *.boot or Console, but only takes effect at engine startup: mesh_procedural_path: defines the path where temporary procedural files are stored. mesh_procedural_read_only: disables writing to disk. Disabling procedural mode for a mesh will delete its corresponding file. When multiple engine instances share the same mesh_procedural_path, one instance may delete files that are still in use by another.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC
DESC:This mode is optimized for high-speed dynamic modifications. Provides the fastest performance, but with the highest RAM and VRAM usage. Meshes are not automatically unloaded, manual memory cleanup is required using . If a mesh is being streamed while modified, this may lead to a crash. This mode is intended only for a small number of lightweight objects that are updated very frequently.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshStatic.PROCEDURAL_MODE_DISABLE
DESC:Disables procedural mode. No procedural data is stored or managed.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.setFadeDistance(float)
DESC:Sets the distance up to which meshes handled by the mesh cluster will be fading out (that is, fewer meshes will be rendered instead of all). The distance is measured starting from the visible distance. The default is 0. Using fade distance allows the objects to disappear one by one until up to the fade distance only a few left. It makes the disappearing smooth and much less noticeable.
PARAMS:distance:Fading distance for meshes in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getFadeDistance const
DESC:Returns the distance up to which meshes handled by the mesh cluster will be fading out. The default is 0.
RETURNS:Fading distance for meshes in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.setMeshPath(char)
DESC:Sets a path to the mesh hadled by the Mesh Cluster. Does not update mesh immediately using the new path. If the mesh is in the procedural mode, it will be reset.
PARAMS:path:New path to the source .mesh-file to be set.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshPath const

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.addMeshTransform

RETURNS:Number of the last added mesh instance.
