ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.setMeshTransform(int,Unigine.Math.mat4)
DESC:Sets the transformation for the given mesh instance.
PARAMS:num:Mesh instance number. | transform:Mesh transformation matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshTransform(int) const
DESC:Returns the transformation of the given mesh instance.
PARAMS:num:Mesh instance number.
RETURNS:Mesh transformation matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.removeMeshTransform(int)
DESC:Removes the transformation of the specified mesh instance from the cluster.
PARAMS:num:Mesh instance number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.removeMeshTransformFast(int)
DESC:Removes the transformation of the specified mesh instance from the cluster.
PARAMS:num:Mesh instance number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getNumMeshes const
DESC:Returns the total number of meshes handled by the mesh cluster.
RETURNS:Number of meshes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.setVisibleDistance(float)
DESC:Sets the distance up to which meshes handled by the mesh cluster will be rendered. The default is infinity (in this case, fade distance will be ignored).
PARAMS:distance:Visibility distance for meshes in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getVisibleDistance const
DESC:Returns the distance up to which meshes handled by the mesh cluster are rendered. The default is infinity (in this case, fade distance is ignored).
RETURNS:Visibility distance for meshes in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.clearMeshes
DESC:Deletes all meshes currently baked into mesh cluster.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.createMeshes(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.Mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Creates meshes in accordance with the transformations vector (world coordinates) and bakes them into the cluster. All baked meshes are identical to the source mesh and have the same material applied to their surfaces.
PARAMS:world_transforms:Transformations vector in world coordinates.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.appendMeshes(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.Mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Appends new meshes with transformations stored in the specified vector (world coordinates) and bakes them into the cluster. All baked meshes are identical to the source mesh and have the same material applied to their surfaces.
PARAMS:world_transforms:Transformations vector in world coordinates.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.type
DESC:Returns the type of the node.
RETURNS:Node type identifier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.removeClusterTransforms(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox)
DESC:Removes cluster meshes, found within the specified bounding box, from the cluster.
PARAMS:bb:Bounding box defining the area, within which the cluster meshes are to be removed from the cluster.
RETURNS:true if cluster meshes, found within the specified bounding box are successfully removed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.removeClusterTransformsFromSphere(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundSphere)
DESC:Removes cluster meshes, found within the specified bounding sphere, from the cluster.
PARAMS:bb:Bounding sphere defining the area, for which the transformations of cluster meshes are to be collected.
RETURNS:true if cluster meshes, found within the specified bounding sphere are successfully removed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.detachClusterTransforms(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Detaches cluster meshes found within the area specified by the given bounding box from the cluster and puts their transformations (local coordinates) to the specified buffer.
PARAMS:bb:Bounding box defining the area, within which the cluster meshes are to be detached from the cluster. | transforms:Buffer to store transformations of detached cluster meshes.
RETURNS:true if cluster meshes have been detached from the cluster; otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.detachClusterWorldTransforms(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.Mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Detaches cluster meshes found within the area specified by the given bounding box from the cluster and puts their transformations (world coordinates) to the specified buffer.
PARAMS:bb:Bounding box defining the area, within which the cluster meshes are to be detached from the cluster. | transforms:Buffer to store transformations of detached cluster meshes.
RETURNS:true if cluster meshes have been detached from the cluster; otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.detachClusterWorldTransformsFromSphere(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundSphere,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.Mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Detaches cluster meshes found within the area specified by the given bounding box from the cluster and puts their transformations (world coordinates) to the specified buffer.
PARAMS:bb:Bounding sphere defining the area, for which the transformations of cluster meshes are to be collected. | transforms:Buffer to store transformations of cluster meshes, in world coordinates.
RETURNS:true if cluster meshes have been detached from the cluster; otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getClusterTransforms(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Collects transformations (local coordinates) for all cluster meshes within the area specified by the given bounding box and puts them to the specified buffer.
PARAMS:bounds:Bounding box defining the area, for which the transformations of cluster meshes are to be collected. | transforms:Buffer to store transformations of cluster meshes.
RETURNS:true, if there are transformations of cluster meshes; or false, if there are no transformations of cluster meshes found.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getClusterWorldTransforms(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.Mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Collects transformations (world coordinates) for all cluster meshes within the area specified by the given bounding box and puts them to the specified buffer.
PARAMS:bounds:Bounding box defining the area, for which the transformations of cluster meshes are to be collected. | transforms:Buffer to store transformations of cluster meshes, in world coordinates.
RETURNS:true, if there are transformations of cluster meshes; or false, if there are no transformations of cluster meshes within the specified area.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getClusterWorldTransformsFromSphere(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundSphere,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.Mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Collects transformations (world coordinates) for all cluster meshes within the area specified by the given bounding sphere and puts them to the specified buffer.
PARAMS:bounds:Bounding sphere defining the area, for which the transformations of cluster meshes are to be collected. | transforms:Buffer to store transformations of cluster meshes, in world coordinates.
RETURNS:true, if there are transformations of cluster meshes; or false, if there are no transformations of cluster meshes within the specified area.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getInstancesFromSphere(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundSphere,Unigine.Vector{int,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Returns the indices of instances inside the bounding sphere. The returned list of instance indices is unsorted.
PARAMS:bb:Bounding sphere defining the area within which instances are to be collected. | instances:Vector containing instance indices.
RETURNS:true, if there is at least one instance inside the bounding sphere; or false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshCurrentRAM const
DESC:Returns the current source mesh used for the object and loaded to memory (RAM).
RETURNS:A current source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshCurrentVRAM
DESC:Returns the current render mesh used for the object and loaded to video memory (VRAM).
RETURNS:A current render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshForceRAM
DESC:Returns the source mesh used for the object and loads it to memory (RAM) immediately.
RETURNS:A source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshForceVRAM
DESC:Returns the render mesh used for the object and loads it to video memory (VRAM) immediately. At that, the static mesh will also be loaded to memory (RAM). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:A render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshAsyncRAM
DESC:Returns the source mesh used for the object and loads it to memory (RAM) asynchronously.
RETURNS:A source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshAsyncVRAM
DESC:Returns the render mesh used for the object and loads it to video memory (VRAM) asynchronously. At that, the static mesh will also be loaded to memory (RAM). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:A render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshDynamicRAM
DESC:Returns the procedural source mesh associated with the object and ensures it is loaded into system memory (RAM). This method is only available when the mesh is in the dynamic (PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC) mode. A procedural mesh is a mesh created via code and uses a specific streaming mode. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, the object stays in memory after creation and is only unloaded manually using deleteDynamicMesh() or when the procedural mode is changed.
RETURNS:A procedural source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshDynamicVRAM
DESC:Returns the procedural render mesh associated with the object and ensures it is loaded into video memory (VRAM). This method is only available when the mesh is in the dynamic (PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC) mode. A procedural mesh is a mesh created via code and uses a specific streaming mode. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, the object stays in memory after creation and is only unloaded manually using deleteDynamicMesh() or when the procedural mode is changed.
RETURNS:A procedural render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.loadAsyncVRAM
DESC:Asynchronously loads the mesh to video memory (VRAM) if the async streaming mode for meshes is enabled. Otherwise, the forced loading is performed. This method is recommended for implementing your own prefetch system (i.e. asynchronous pre-loading of meshes to video memory before they are used). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to VRAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.loadAsyncRAM
DESC:Asynchronously loads the mesh to memory (RAM) if the async streaming mode for meshes is enabled. Otherwise, the forced loading is performed. This method is recommended for implementing your own prefetch system (i.e. asynchronous pre-loading of meshes to memory before they are used).
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to RAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.loadForceVRAM
DESC:Performs force-loading of the mesh to video memory (VRAM) immediately. The forced loading to VRAM is performed in the main thread. Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to VRAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.loadForceRAM
DESC:Performs force-loading of the mesh to memory (RAM) immediately.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to RAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.isMeshNull const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the source mesh used for the object is null (does not exist, unassigned, not loaded, etc.).
RETURNS:true if the source mesh used for the object is null; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.isMeshLoadedRAM const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to memory (RAM).
RETURNS:true if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to RAM; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.isMeshLoadedVRAM const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to video memory (VRAM).
RETURNS:true if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to VRAM; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.createCopyMeshRAM const
DESC:Creates and returns a copy of the source mesh used by the object, loading it directly from disk if it is not present in cache. This method does not stream the copied mesh into memory cache, resulting in lower RAM usage.
RETURNS:A copy of the source mesh, or nullptr if source mesh is not presented in RAM or its file path is invalid.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getCopyMeshRAM(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}) const
DESC:Retrieves a copy of the source mesh used by the object and writes it to the provided mesh object. If the mesh is not present in cache, it is loaded directly from disk. This method does not stream the copied mesh into memory cache, resulting in lower RAM usage.
PARAMS:result:Object that will receive a copy of the source mesh.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, false if source mesh is not present in RAM or its file path is invalid.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.isMeshProceduralDone const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if all asynchronous operations on the procedural mesh have completed.
RETURNS:true if no asynchronous geometry operation is active, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.isMeshProceduralActive const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if an asynchronous operation on the procedural mesh is currently in progress.
RETURNS:true if an asynchronous geometry operation is active, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.isMeshProceduralDynamic const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the current procedural mode is PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC.
RETURNS:true if PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC is active, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.setMeshProceduralMode(ObjectMeshStatic::PROCEDURAL_MODE,int)
DESC:Sets the procedural mode for the mesh. The specified mode defines how procedural data is stored, updated, and unloaded.
PARAMS:mode:One of the PROCEDURAL_MODE to apply to the mesh. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags that control how vertex and index data are stored for the mesh render.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.getMeshProceduralMode const
DESC:Returns a value indicating which procedural mode assigned to the mesh. The value corresponds to one of the available PROCEDURAL_MODE types, determining how procedural data is stored, updated, and unloaded.
RETURNS:Current procedural mode of the mesh.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.applyCopyMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int)
DESC:Copies all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.applyMoveMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
DESC:Moves all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately without memory allocation and data copying (move semantics). Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, this method behaves identically to its asynchronous variant.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to move vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was moved (transferred without copying) successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.applyMoveMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{MeshRender})
DESC:Moves all vertex and render data from the given mesh_ram and mesh_vram into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately using move semantics, without data copying or VRAM allocation. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:mesh_ram:Source mesh containing vertex data. | mesh_vram:Source mesh containing render data.
RETURNS:true if the data was moved (transferred without copying) successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.applyCopyMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int)
DESC:Copies all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster compared to the forced variant, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.applyMoveMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
DESC:Moves all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay, without memory allocation and data copying (move semantics). Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster compared to the forced variant, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.applyMoveMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{MeshRender})
DESC:Moves all vertex and render data from the given mesh_ram and mesh_vram into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously, without copying or allocating VRAM. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, this method behaves identically to its forced variant.
PARAMS:mesh_ram:Source mesh containing vertex data. | mesh_vram:Source mesh containing render data.
RETURNS:true if the data was moved successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.deleteDynamicMesh
DESC:Releases all memory used by the procedural mesh, including both VRAM and RAM. Works only when procedural mode is set to PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC.
RETURNS:true if the memory was released successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.runGenerateMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},int)
DESC:Starts asynchronous generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in a background thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh will be transferred to the object once complete, without blocking the main thread. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. Note that the callback is executed in a single dedicated thread controlled by the engine, it is not parallelized and must not spawn additional threads.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the modification was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.runGenerateMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Starts asynchronous generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in a background thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh will be transferred to the object once complete, without blocking the main thread. After the mesh has been applied to the object, the optional callback_done will be called. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. Note that the callback is executed in a single dedicated thread controlled by the engine, it is not parallelized and must not spawn additional threads.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | callback_done:Optional callback executed after geometry has been fully applied.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_done() | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.runGenerateMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},int)
DESC:Starts immediate (forced) generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in the main thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh is applied to the object as soon as generation completes. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshCluster.runGenerateMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Starts immediate (forced) generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in the main thread and must create and fill a Mesh object with vertex data. Once the mesh is applied to the object, the optional callback_done is called on the main thread. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | callback_done:Optional callback executed after geometry has been fully applied.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_done() | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.#ctor(char)
DESC:ObjectMeshClutter constructor. Creates a clutter using the path to the source mesh provided.
PARAMS:path:Path to the source mesh file.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.#ctor
DESC:Default ObjectMeshClutter constructor. Creates an empty clutter.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setAngle(float)
DESC:Sets the angle cosine that defines the slope steepness appropriate for positioning meshes.
PARAMS:angle:Slope angle cosine. The provided value will be clipped in range [0;1].
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getAngle const
DESC:Returns the current angle cosine that defines the slope steepness appropriate for positioning meshes.
RETURNS:Slope angle cosine.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setCollision(bool)
DESC:Sets a value indicating if collisions with the object should be taken into account. If the collision parameter is set to 0, the new geometry will never be generated by collision detection request.
PARAMS:collision:true to take collisions into account and make the object important for physics; false to allow collisions only with already generated geometry.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getCollision const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if collisions with the object should be taken into account. If the return value is false the new geometry will never be generated by collision detection request.
RETURNS:1 if collisions are taken into account; 0 if collisions are allowed only with already generated geometry.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setDensity(float)
DESC:Sets the density factor that defines the number of meshes per square unit. The number of clutter elements in each cell is determined by the clutter Size along X and Y axes, as well as by Density and Step values. Relationship between these values in internal calculations may result in an invisible clutter. When setting these values, please consider this information.
PARAMS:density:Density factor. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getDensity const
DESC:Returns the current density factor that defines the number of meshes per square unit.
RETURNS:Density factor.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setFadeDistance(float)
DESC:Sets the distance up to which meshes scattered by the mesh clutter will be fading out (that is, fewer meshes will be rendered instead of all). The distance is measured starting from the visible distance. In order for a fade distance to be applied, visibility distance should not be infinite.
PARAMS:distance:Distance of fading for meshes in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getFadeDistance const
DESC:Returns the current distance up to which meshes scattered by the mesh clutter are fading out (that is, fewer meshes will be rendered instead of all). The distance is measured starting from the visible distance. In order for a fade distance to be applied, visibility distance should not be infinite.
RETURNS:Distance of nodes fading in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setIntersection(bool)
DESC:Sets a value indicating whether meshes should be scattered upon the ground (along its relief): either the terrain or a mesh set as a parent node.
PARAMS:intersection:Positive number to enable intersection; 0 to disable.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getIntersection const
DESC:Returns a value indicating whether meshes are scattered upon the ground (along its relief): either the terrain or a mesh set as a parent node.
RETURNS:1 if intersection is enabled; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskFlipX(int)
DESC:Flip the mask by X axis.
PARAMS:value:Positive value to flip the mask; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaskFlipX const
DESC:Returns a flag indicating if a mask is flipped by X axis.
RETURNS:Positive value if the mask is flipped; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskFlipY(int)
DESC:Flip the mask by Y axis.
PARAMS:value:Positive value to flip the mask; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaskFlipY const
DESC:Returns a flag indicating if a mask is flipped by Y axis.
RETURNS:Positive value if the mask is flipped; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},bool)
DESC:Sets an image (in R8 format) as a mask, that defines placement of meshes.
PARAMS:image:Image smart pointer. | invalidate:Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all mesh clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
RETURNS:1 if the mask image is successfully set; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaskImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}) const
DESC:Writes the image that is currently used as a mask for placement of meshes to the given buffer.
PARAMS:image:Image smart pointer.
RETURNS:1 if the mask image is successfully written into the buffer; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskImageName(char,bool)
DESC:Sets the path to a mask image (in R8 format) that defines the placement of meshes.
PARAMS:image_name:Path to the mask image. | invalidate:Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all mesh clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskImageName(char)
DESC:Sets the path to a mask image (in R8 format) that defines the placement of meshes.
PARAMS:name:Path to the mask image (in R8 format).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaskImageName const
DESC:Returns the path to a mask image (in R8 format) that defines the placement of meshes.
RETURNS:Path to the mask image.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskInverse(int)
DESC:Specifies if clutter meshes should be rendered inside or outside the mask mesh contour.
PARAMS:inverse:0 to render clutter meshes inside the mask mesh contour; 1 to render them outside.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaskInverse const
DESC:Returns a flag indicating if clutter meshes are rendered inside or outside the mask mesh contour.
RETURNS:0 if clutter meshes are rendered inside the mask mesh contour; 1 if outside.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskMaxValue(int)
DESC:Sets the maximum value of the mask application range.
PARAMS:value:Maximum mask value, [0;255].
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaskMaxValue const
DESC:Returns the maximum value of the mask application range.
RETURNS:Maximum mask value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskMesh(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},bool)
DESC:Sets a mesh to be used as a mask on-the-fly. Limitations: Before the method is called, another mesh must be set via setMaskMeshName() first. If the world is reloaded, the mesh set via setMaskMeshName() will be loaded. If the memory limit is exceeded, the new mesh might be replaced with the mesh set via setMaskMeshName().
PARAMS:mesh:Pointer to the mesh. | invalidate:Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all mesh clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
RETURNS:1 if the mesh is set successfully; otherwise - 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaskMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}) const
DESC:Copies the current mask mesh (if it exists) to the specified target mesh.
PARAMS:mesh:Pointer to the mesh to copy the current mask mesh to.
RETURNS:1 if mesh mask exists; otherwise - 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskMeshName(char,bool)
DESC:Sets a mesh to be used as a mask for the mesh clutter. This mesh should be plane.
PARAMS:mesh_name:Path to the *.mesh file. | invalidate:Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all mesh clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskMeshName(char)
DESC:Sets a mesh to be used as a mask for the mesh clutter. This mesh should be plane.
PARAMS:name:Path to the *.mesh file.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.createClutterTransforms
DESC:Creates transformations for all clutter meshes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaskMeshName const
DESC:Returns the name (path) of the current mesh used as a mask for the mesh clutter. This mesh should be plane.
RETURNS:Path to the *.mesh file.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaskMinValue(int)
DESC:Sets the minimum value of the mask application range.
PARAMS:value:Minimum mask value, [0;255].
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaskMinValue const
DESC:Returns the minimum value of the mask application range.
RETURNS:Minimum mask value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setTerrainMask(int)
DESC:Sets a new Landscape Terrain mask to be used to define placement of meshes.
PARAMS:mask:Index of Landscape Terrain mask to be used to define placement of meshes, in the [0; 19] range.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getTerrainMask const
DESC:Returns the index of the Landscape Terrain mask currently used to define placement of meshes.
RETURNS:Index of the Landscape Terrain mask currently used to define placement of meshes, in the [0; 19] range.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMaxScale(float,float)
DESC:Sets the scale for meshes in the areas with high density (according to the mask). With the minimum scale it is possible to automatically render, for example, big trees in the center of the forest. A spread value allows you to control the range of scales relative to the mean value.
PARAMS:mean:Scale mean value. | spread:Maximum spread value to randomly upscale or downscale objects.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaxScaleMean const
DESC:Returns the scale mean value for meshes in the areas with high density (according to the mask).
RETURNS:Scale mean value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMaxScaleSpread const
DESC:Returns the scale spread value that controls the range of mesh scales in the areas with high density (according to the mask).
RETURNS:Scale spread value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMeshesRotation(Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3)
DESC:Sets the parameters of pseudo-random rotation of meshes along X, Y and Z axes.
PARAMS:mean:Mean values of meshes rotation angles, in degrees. | spread:Maximum spread values of meshes rotation angles, in degrees.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshesRotationMean const
DESC:Returns the vector of mean values of meshes rotation along X, Y and Z axes.
RETURNS:Mean values of meshes rotation angles, in degrees.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshesRotationSpread const
DESC:Returns the vector of spread values of meshes rotation along X, Y and Z axes.
RETURNS:Maximum spread values of meshes rotation angles, in degrees.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMeshPath(char)
DESC:Sets a path to the mesh scattered by the mesh clutter. Does not update mesh immediately using the new path. If the mesh is in the procedural mode, it will be reset.
PARAMS:path:New path to the source .mesh-file to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshPath const
DESC:Returns the path to the source .mesh-file of the mesh scattered by mesh clutter.
RETURNS:Path to the source .mesh-file.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMinScale(float,float)
DESC:Sets the scale for meshes in the areas with low density (according to the mask). With the minimum scale it is possible to automatically render, for example, small trees at the forest border. A spread value allows you to control the range of scales relative to the mean value.
PARAMS:mean:Scale mean value. | spread:Maximum spread value to randomly upscale or downscale objects.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMinScaleMean const
DESC:Returns the scale mean value for meshes in the areas with low density (according to the mask).
RETURNS:Scale mean value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMinScaleSpread const
DESC:Returns the scale spread value that controls the range of mesh scales in the areas with low density (according to the mask).
RETURNS:Scale spread value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setOffset(float,float)
DESC:Sets the vertical offset that determines the placement of meshes above or below the surface.
PARAMS:mean:Mean value of the offset in units. | spread:Spread value of the offset in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getOffsetMean const
DESC:Returns the current mean value of the vertical offset that determines the placement of meshes above or below the surface.
RETURNS:Mean value of the offset in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getOffsetSpread const
DESC:Returns the current spread value of the vertical offset that determines the placement of meshes above or below the surface.
RETURNS:Spread value of the offset in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setOrientation(bool)
DESC:Sets a value indicating whether meshes should be oriented along the normals of the ground (either the terrain or a mesh set as a parent node).
PARAMS:orientation:Positive number to enable orientation; 0 to disable.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getOrientation const
DESC:Returns a value indicating whether meshes are oriented along the normals of the ground (either the terrain or a mesh set as a parent node).
RETURNS:1 if orientation is enabled; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setSeed(int)
DESC:Sets the seed for pseudo-random positioning of meshes.
PARAMS:seed:Number used to initialize a pseudo-random sequence. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getSeed const
DESC:Returns the seed used for pseudo-random positioning of meshes.
RETURNS:Number used to initialize a pseudo-random sequence.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setSizeX(float)
DESC:Sets the width of the mesh clutter along the X-coordinate. The number of clutter elements in each cell is determined by the clutter Size along X and Y axes, as well as by Density and Step values. Relationship between these values in internal calculations may result in an invisible clutter. When setting these values, please consider this information.
PARAMS:sizex:X-coordinate width in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getSizeX const
DESC:Returns the current width of the mesh clutter along the X-coordinate.
RETURNS:X-coordinate width in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setSizeY(float)
DESC:Sets the length of the mesh clutter along the Y-coordinate. The number of clutter elements in each cell is determined by the clutter Size along X and Y axes, as well as by Density and Step values. Relationship between these values in internal calculations may result in an invisible clutter. When setting these values, please consider this information.
PARAMS:sizey:Y-coordinate length in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getSizeY const
DESC:Returns the current length of the mesh clutter along the Y-coordinate.
RETURNS:Y-coordinate length in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getSpawnCount const
DESC:Returns the number of cells to be generated.
RETURNS:Number of cells to be generated if the scene generation is not completed; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setStep(float)
DESC:Sets the step for cells used to render mesh clutter. The number of clutter elements in each cell is determined by the clutter Size along X and Y axes, as well as by Density and Step values. Relationship between these values in internal calculations may result in an invisible clutter. When setting these values, please consider this information.
PARAMS:step:Step for clutter cells in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getStep const
DESC:Returns the step for cells used to render meshes scattered by the mesh clutter.
RETURNS:Step for clutter cells in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setThreshold(float)
DESC:Sets the density threshold (for a mask) starting from which meshes are rendered if placed dense enough.
PARAMS:threshold:Density threshold. The provided value will be clipped in range [0;1].
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getThreshold const
DESC:Returns the current density threshold (for a mask) starting from which meshes are rendered if placed dense enough.
RETURNS:Density threshold.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setVisibleDistance(float)
DESC:Sets the distance up to which meshes scattered by the mesh clutter will be rendered.
PARAMS:distance:Distance of visibility for meshes in units. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getVisibleDistance const
DESC:Returns the current distance up to which meshes scattered by the mesh clutter are rendered.
RETURNS:Distance of visibility for meshes in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.invalidate
DESC:Invalidates all mesh clutter cells. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.invalidate(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox)
DESC:Invalidates all mesh clutter cells within the area specified by the given bounding box. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
PARAMS:bounds:Bounding box, defining the area, where mesh clutter cells will be regenerated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.type
DESC:Returns the node type.
RETURNS:Node type identifier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.clearClutterExcludes
DESC:Restores all cells removed by the calls to the setClutterExclude() method. Restored cells will be regenerated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setClutterExclude(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,int)
DESC:Removes all cells within the area specified by the given bounding box. Generation of these cells will be skipped. This method can be used to replace some parts of the clutter with modified meshes (e.g., broken trees within the area around the shell crater in the forest).
PARAMS:bounds:Bounding box, defining the area, where mesh clutter cells will not be generated. | exclude:Exclude flag. Set 1 to remove all mesh clutter cells within the area; otherwise, set 0 to restore the removed ones. Restored cells will be regenerated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getClutterTransforms(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},bool,bool) const
DESC:Collects transformations for all clutter meshes in the generated cells within the area specified by the given bounding box and puts them to the specified buffer. Generation of clutter cells is performed in separate threads. Some of the cells may have their lifetime expired. Therefore, the content of certain cells might be unavailable at the moment, such cells are considered as not generated.
PARAMS:bounds:Bounding box, defining the area, for which the transformations of clutter meshes are to be collected. | transforms:Buffer to store transformations of clutter meshes. | precise:Precision flag:1 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the specified bounding box0 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the cells intersected by the specified bounding box | force:Force flag.1 - regenerate all cells within the area, that were not generated, before collecting transformations for the meshes inside them.0 - transformations will be collected only for the meshes inside the clutter cells, that were generated.
RETURNS:true, if there are transformations of clutter meshes; or false, if there are no transformations of clutter meshes found.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getClutterTransforms(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Collects transformations for all clutter meshes within the generated cells and puts them to the specified buffer. Generation of clutter cells is performed in separate threads. Some of the cells may have their lifetime expired. Therefore, the content of certain cells might be unavailable at the moment, such cells are considered as not generated.
PARAMS:transforms:Buffer to store transformations of clutter meshes.
RETURNS:true, if there are transformations of clutter meshes; or false, if there are no transformations of clutter meshes found.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getClutterWorldTransforms(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.Mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},bool,bool) const
DESC:Collects transformations (in world coordinates) for all clutter meshes in the generated cells within the area specified by the given bounding box and puts them to the specified buffer. Generation of clutter cells is performed in separate threads. Some of the cells may have their lifetime expired. Therefore, the content of certain cells might be unavailable at the moment, such cells are considered as not generated.
PARAMS:bounds:Bounding box, defining the area, for which the transformations of clutter meshes are to be collected. | transforms:Buffer to store transformations of clutter meshes, in world coordinates. | precise:Precision flag:1 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the specified bounding box0 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the cells intersected by the specified bounding box | force:Force flag.1 - regenerate all cells within the area, that were not generated, before collecting transformations for the meshes inside them.0 - transformations will be collected only for the meshes inside the clutter cells, that were generated.
RETURNS:true, if there are transformations of clutter meshes; or false, if there are no transformations of clutter meshes found.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getClutterWorldTransforms(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.Mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Collects transformations (in world coordinates) for all clutter meshes within the generated cells and puts them to the specified buffer. Generation of clutter cells is performed in separate threads. Some of the cells may have their lifetime expired. Therefore, the content of certain cells might be unavailable at the moment, such cells are considered as not generated.
PARAMS:transforms:Buffer to store transformations of clutter meshes, in world coordinates.
RETURNS:true, if there are transformations of clutter meshes; or false, if there are no transformations of clutter meshes found.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getClutterLocalTransforms(Unigine.Math.BoundBox,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Math.mat4,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int,int) const
DESC:Collects transformations (in local coordinates) for all clutter meshes within the generated cells and puts them to the specified buffer. Generation of clutter cells is performed in separate threads. Some of the cells may have their lifetime expired. Therefore, the content of certain cells might be unavailable at the moment, such cells are considered as not generated.
PARAMS:bounds:Bounding box, defining the area, for which the transformations of clutter meshes are to be collected. | transforms:Buffer to store transformations of clutter meshes, in local coordinates. | precise:Precision flag:1 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the specified bounding box0 - transformations will be collected for clutter meshes within the cells intersected by the specified bounding box | force:Force flag.1 - regenerate all cells within the area, that were not generated, before collecting transformations for the meshes inside them.0 - transformations will be collected only for the meshes inside the clutter cells, that were generated.
RETURNS:true, if there are transformations of clutter meshes; or false, if there are no transformations of clutter meshes found.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setCutoutIntersectionMask(int)
DESC:Sets a new cutout intersection mask. This mask allows you to cut out clutter objects in the areas of intersection with other objects and decals (e.g. can be used to remove vegetation under houses or from the surface of roads projected using decals). Clutter objects will be cut out by objects and decals that have their intersection mask matching this one (one bit at least). To set intersection masks the following methods can be used: for decals use getIntersectionMask() for objects use getIntersectionMask()
PARAMS:mask:Integer, each bit of which is a mask.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getCutoutIntersectionMask const
DESC:Returns the current cutout intersection mask. This mask allows you to cut out clutter objects in the areas of intersection with other objects and decals (e.g. can be used to remove vegetation under houses or from the surface of roads projected using decals). Clutter objects will be cut out by objects and decals that have their intersection mask matching this one (one bit at least). To set intersection masks the following methods can be used: for decals use getIntersectionMask() for objects use getIntersectionMask()
RETURNS:Integer, each bit of which is a mask.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setCutoutInverse(int)
DESC:Sets a value indicating whether the clutter objects should be rendered inside or outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask.
PARAMS:inverse:0 to render clutter objects outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask; 1 to render the clutter objects inside these areas.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getCutoutInverse const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the clutter objects is rendered inside or outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask.
RETURNS:0 if clutter objects are rendered outside the areas determined by the cutout intersection mask; 1 if inside.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshCurrentRAM const
DESC:Returns the current source mesh used for the object and loaded to memory (RAM).
RETURNS:A current source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshCurrentVRAM
DESC:Returns the current render mesh used for the object and loaded to video memory (VRAM).
RETURNS:A current render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshForceRAM
DESC:Returns the source mesh used for the object and loads it to memory (RAM) immediately.
RETURNS:A source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshForceVRAM
DESC:Returns the render mesh used for the object and loads it to video memory (VRAM) immediately. At that, the static mesh will also be loaded to memory (RAM). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:A render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshAsyncRAM
DESC:Returns the source mesh used for the object and loads it to memory (RAM) asynchronously.
RETURNS:A source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshAsyncVRAM
DESC:Returns the render mesh used for the object and loads it to video memory (VRAM) asynchronously. At that, the static mesh will also be loaded to memory (RAM). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:A render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshDynamicRAM
DESC:Returns the procedural source mesh associated with the object and ensures it is loaded into system memory (RAM). This method is only available when the mesh is in the dynamic (PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC) mode. A procedural mesh is a mesh created via code and uses a specific streaming mode. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, the object stays in memory after creation and is only unloaded manually using deleteDynamicMesh() or when the procedural mode is changed.
RETURNS:A procedural source mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshDynamicVRAM
DESC:Returns the procedural render mesh associated with the object and ensures it is loaded into video memory (VRAM). This method is only available when the mesh is in the dynamic (PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC) mode. A procedural mesh is a mesh created via code and uses a specific streaming mode. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, the object stays in memory after creation and is only unloaded manually using deleteDynamicMesh() or when the procedural mode is changed.
RETURNS:A procedural render mesh used for the object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.loadAsyncVRAM
DESC:Asynchronously loads the mesh to video memory (VRAM) if the async streaming mode for meshes is enabled. Otherwise, the forced loading is performed. This method is recommended for implementing your own prefetch system (i.e. asynchronous pre-loading of meshes to video memory before they are used). Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to VRAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.loadAsyncRAM
DESC:Asynchronously loads the mesh to memory (RAM) if the async streaming mode for meshes is enabled. Otherwise, the forced loading is performed. This method is recommended for implementing your own prefetch system (i.e. asynchronous pre-loading of meshes to memory before they are used).
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to RAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.loadForceVRAM
DESC:Performs force-loading of the mesh to video memory (VRAM) immediately. Loading to VRAM must be performed in the main thread only.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to VRAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.loadForceRAM
DESC:Performs force-loading of the mesh to memory (RAM) immediately.
RETURNS:true if the mesh is loaded successfully, otherwise false. If the mesh is already loaded to RAM, true will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setMeshProceduralMode(ObjectMeshStatic::PROCEDURAL_MODE,int)
DESC:Sets the procedural mode for the mesh. The specified mode defines how procedural data is stored, updated, and unloaded.
PARAMS:mode:One of the PROCEDURAL_MODE to apply to the mesh. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags that control how vertex and index data are stored for the mesh render.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getMeshProceduralMode const
DESC:Returns a value indicating which procedural mode assigned to the mesh. The value corresponds to one of the available PROCEDURAL_MODE types, determining how procedural data is stored, updated, and unloaded.
RETURNS:Current procedural mode of the mesh.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.isMeshNull const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the source mesh used for the object is null (does not exist, unassigned, not loaded, etc.).
RETURNS:true if the source mesh used for the object is null; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.isMeshLoadedRAM const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to memory (RAM).
RETURNS:true if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to RAM; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.isMeshLoadedVRAM const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to video memory (VRAM).
RETURNS:true if the source mesh used for the object is loaded to VRAM; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.createCopyMeshRAM const
DESC:Creates and returns a copy of the source mesh used by the object, loading it directly from disk if it is not present in cache. This method does not stream the copied mesh into memory cache, resulting in lower RAM usage.
RETURNS:A copy of the source mesh, or nullptr if source mesh is not presented in RAM or its file path is invalid.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getCopyMeshRAM(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}) const
DESC:Retrieves a copy of the source mesh used by the object and writes it to the provided mesh object. If the mesh is not present in cache, it is loaded directly from disk. This method does not stream the copied mesh into memory cache, resulting in lower RAM usage.
PARAMS:result:Object that will receive a copy of the source mesh.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, false if source mesh is not present in RAM or its file path is invalid.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.isMeshProceduralDone const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if all asynchronous operations on the procedural mesh have completed.
RETURNS:true if no asynchronous geometry operation is active, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.isMeshProceduralActive const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if an asynchronous operation on the procedural mesh is currently in progress.
RETURNS:true if an asynchronous geometry operation is active, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.isMeshProceduralDynamic const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the current procedural mode is PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC.
RETURNS:true if PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC is active, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.applyCopyMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int)
DESC:Copies all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.applyMoveMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
DESC:Moves all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately without memory allocation and data copying (move semantics). Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, this method behaves identically to its asynchronous variant.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to move vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was moved (transferred without copying) successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.applyMoveMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{MeshRender})
DESC:Moves all vertex and render data from the given mesh_ram and mesh_vram into the object's procedural mesh forcibly, executing the operation immediately using move semantics, without data copying or VRAM allocation. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:mesh_ram:Source mesh containing vertex data. | mesh_vram:Source mesh containing render data.
RETURNS:true if the data was moved (transferred without copying) successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.applyCopyMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{ConstMesh},int)
DESC:Copies all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster compared to the forced variant, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the mesh was copied successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.applyMoveMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},int)
DESC:Moves all vertex data from the given mesh into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay, without memory allocation and data copying (move semantics). Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster compared to the forced variant, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads.
PARAMS:mesh:Source mesh to copy vertex data from. | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.applyMoveMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{MeshRender})
DESC:Moves all vertex and render data from the given mesh_ram and mesh_vram into the object's procedural mesh asynchronously, without copying or allocating VRAM. The operation is not forced and is executed in the background with no noticeable delay. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_FILE and PROCEDURAL_MODE_BLOB, this method performs faster, as file writes and memory operations are offloaded to background threads. In PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC, this method behaves identically to its forced variant.
PARAMS:mesh_ram:Source mesh containing vertex data. | mesh_vram:Source mesh containing render data.
RETURNS:true if the data was moved successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.deleteDynamicMesh
DESC:Releases all memory used by the procedural mesh, including both VRAM and RAM. Works only when procedural mode is set to PROCEDURAL_MODE_DYNAMIC.
RETURNS:true if the memory was released successfully, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.runGenerateMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},int)
DESC:Starts asynchronous generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in a background thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh will be transferred to the object once complete, without blocking the main thread. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. Note that the callback is executed in a single dedicated thread controlled by the engine, it is not parallelized and must not spawn additional threads.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the modification was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.runGenerateMeshProceduralAsync(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Starts asynchronous generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in a background thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh will be transferred to the object once complete, without blocking the main thread. After the mesh has been applied to the object, the optional callback_done will be called. Works only when procedural mode is enabled. Note that the callback is executed in a single dedicated thread controlled by the engine, it is not parallelized and must not spawn additional threads.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | callback_done:Optional callback executed after geometry has been fully applied.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_done() | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.runGenerateMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},int)
DESC:Starts immediate (forced) generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in the main thread and must create and fill a mesh object with new data. The generated mesh is applied to the object as soon as generation completes. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.runGenerateMeshProceduralForce(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}},Unigine.CallbackBase,int)
DESC:Starts immediate (forced) generation of procedural mesh data. The callback_generate function is executed in the main thread and must create and fill a Mesh object with vertex data. Once the mesh is applied to the object, the optional callback_done is called on the main thread. Works only when procedural mode is enabled.
PARAMS:callback_generate:Callback function responsible for creating and filling the source mesh. Executed in the main thread.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_generate(Ptr&lt;Mesh&gt; mesh) | callback_done:Optional callback executed after geometry has been fully applied.The function must be wrapped using MakeCallback() and have the following signature:void callback_done() | mesh_render_flags:Optional usage flags for MeshRender.
RETURNS:true if the generation was completed and applied successfully, otherwise false
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.setIntersectionMask(int)
DESC:Sets a new intersection mask for the world clutter. This mask can be used to cut out areas intersected by the world clutter from grass, mesh clutter and another world clutter (e.g. to remove grass or forest from the surface of roads projected using decals). The areas will be cut out only if intersection masks of grass and clutter objects matches this mask (one bit at least).
PARAMS:mask:The intersection mask - an integer, each bit of which is a mask.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshClutter.getIntersectionMask const
DESC:Returns the current intersection mask for the world clutter. This mask can be used to cut out areas intersected by the world clutter from grass, mesh clutter and another world clutter (e.g. to remove grass or forest from the surface of roads projected using decals). The areas will be cut out only if intersection masks of grass and clutter objects matches this mask (one bit at least).
RETURNS:Current intersection mask - an integer, each bit of which is a mask.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.getSkinnedNormal(int,int,int) const

To get the total number of vertex tangent entries for the surface target, call the getNumTangents() method. | index:Coordinate index of the vertex.if -1 is passed, the coordinate index will be obtained for the first vertex having its triangle index equal to the specified triangle vertex number. | surface:Mesh surface number.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.getSkinnedTangent(int,int,int) const

RETURNS:Skinned tangent.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.copyLayer(int,int)
DESC:Copies source layer bones transformations to the destination layer. The copying conditions are the following: If the destination layer has more bones than the source one, it will keep its former transformations. If the source layer has more bones than destination one, those bones will be added to the destination layer.
PARAMS:dest:Number of the destination layer in the range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method. | src:Number of the source layer in range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.findBone(char) const
DESC:Searches for a bone with a given name.
PARAMS:name:Bone name.
RETURNS:Bone number if found; otherwise, -1.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.findSurfaceTarget(int,char) const
DESC:Searches for a surface morph target with a given name.
PARAMS:surface:Mesh surface number. | name:Name of the morph target.
RETURNS:Number of the morph target, if exists; otherwise, -1.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.importLayer(int)
DESC:Copies the current bone state to the given animation layer.
PARAMS:layer:Animation layer number.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.inverseLayer(int,int)
DESC:Copies inverse transformations of bones from the source layer to the destination layer. Destination layer is not cleared before transformations are written to it.
PARAMS:dest:Number of the destination layer in the range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method. | src:Number of the source layer in the range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.lerpLayer(int,int,int,float)
DESC:Copies interpolated bone transformations from two source layers to a destination layer. If there is no bone in one of the source layers, the bone transformation from another one will be copied to the destination layer without interpolation.
PARAMS:dest:Number of the destination layer in the range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method. | layer0:Number of the first source layer in the range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method. | layer1:Number of the second source layer in range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method. | weight:Interpolation weight.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.mulLayer(int,int,int,float)
DESC:Copies multiplied bone transformations from two source layers to the destination layer.
PARAMS:dest:Number of the destination layer in the range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method. | layer0:Number of the first source layer in the range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method. | layer1:Number of the second source layer in the range from 0 to the total number of animation layers.To get the total number of animation layers, use the getNumLayers() method. | weight:Interpolation weight.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.setLayerFrame(int,float,int,int)
DESC:Sets a frame for the given animation layer.
PARAMS:layer:Animation layer number. | frame:Frame number in the "from-to" interval. If the float argument is passed, animation is interpolated between nearby frames. 0 means the from frame. For larger values, a residue of a modulo (from-to) is calculated. If a negative value is provided, interpolation will be done from the current frame to the from frame. | from:Start frame. -1 means the first frame of the animation. | to:End frame. -1 means the last frame of the animation.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.setRetargeting(Unigine.Ptr{BonesRetargeting},char,char)
DESC:Applies the animation of a source mesh to the bones of the target mesh using bones retargeting.
PARAMS:bones_retargeting:Instance of the BonesRetargeting class that describes how animation of source mesh bones is retargeted in order to be applied to the bones of the target mesh. | anim_path:Path to the animation file. The path can be represented by either a path to the file or its GUID, which is the recommended approach. After loading the animation, its internal representation is identified by the path when using setLayerAnimationFilePath , etc. When you import your model with animations from an FBX container, the following path to your *.anim files should be used: &lt;path_to_your_fbx_file&gt;/&lt;file.fbx&gt;/&lt;your_anim_file.anim&gt;For example: object-&gt;setLayerAnimationFilePath(0,"models/soldier/soldier.fbx/run.anim"); | mesh_path:Path to the target mesh file, to which animation is to be applied.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.removeRetargeting(char,char)
DESC:Disables the application of the retargeted animation to the bones of the target mesh.
PARAMS:anim_path:Path to the animation file. The path can be represented by either a path to the file or its GUID, which is the recommended approach. After loading the animation, its internal representation is identified by the path when using setLayerAnimationFilePath , etc. When you import your model with animations from an FBX container, the following path to your *.anim files should be used: &lt;path_to_your_fbx_file&gt;/&lt;file.fbx&gt;/&lt;your_anim_file.anim&gt;For example: object-&gt;setLayerAnimationFilePath(0,"models/soldier/soldier.fbx/run.anim"); | mesh_path:Path to the target mesh file, to which animation is applied.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.getRetargeting(char,char)
DESC:Returns the bones retargeting of the specified animation applied to the specified mesh.
PARAMS:anim_path:Path to the animation file. The path can be represented by either a path to the file or its GUID, which is the recommended approach. After loading the animation, its internal representation is identified by the path when using setLayerAnimationFilePath , etc. When you import your model with animations from an FBX container, the following path to your *.anim files should be used: &lt;path_to_your_fbx_file&gt;/&lt;file.fbx&gt;/&lt;your_anim_file.anim&gt;For example: object-&gt;setLayerAnimationFilePath(0,"models/soldier/soldier.fbx/run.anim"); | mesh_path:Path to the target mesh file, to which animation is applied.
RETURNS:Instance of the BonesRetargeting class that describes how animation of source mesh bones is retargeted in order to be applied to the bones of the target mesh if it is applied, otherwise nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.isRetargeting(char,char)
DESC:Returns the value indicating if there is bones retargeting between the specified animation and the target mesh.
PARAMS:anim_path:Path to the animation file. The path can be represented by either a path to the file or its GUID, which is the recommended approach. After loading the animation, its internal representation is identified by the path when using setLayerAnimationFilePath , etc. When you import your model with animations from an FBX container, the following path to your *.anim files should be used: &lt;path_to_your_fbx_file&gt;/&lt;file.fbx&gt;/&lt;your_anim_file.anim&gt;For example: object-&gt;setLayerAnimationFilePath(0,"models/soldier/soldier.fbx/run.anim"); | mesh_path:Path to the target mesh file, to which animation is applied.
RETURNS:true if there is bones retargeting between the specified animation and the target mesh, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.getAnimationResourceID(char) const
DESC:Returns the unique animation ID using the path to it. This method also loads the animation if it hasn't been loaded yet.
PARAMS:path:Path to the animation file. The path can be represented by either a path to the file or its GUID, which is the recommended approach. After loading the animation, its internal representation is identified by the path when using setLayerAnimationFilePath , etc. When you import your model with animations from an FBX container, the following path to your *.anim files should be used: &lt;path_to_your_fbx_file&gt;/&lt;file.fbx&gt;/&lt;your_anim_file.anim&gt;For example: object-&gt;setLayerAnimationFilePath(0,"models/soldier/soldier.fbx/run.anim");

ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.BONE_SPACE_LOCAL
DESC:Coordinates relative to the parent bone.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.BONE_SPACE_OBJECT
DESC:Coordinates relative to the skinned mesh object.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.BONE_SPACE_WORLD
DESC:World coordinates.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.NODE_SPACE_LOCAL
DESC:Local transformation of the node.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.NODE_SPACE_WORLD
DESC:World transformation of the node.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.BIND_MODE_ADDITIVE
DESC:Bind node's transformation is added to the current transformation of the bone.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.BIND_MODE_OVERRIDE
DESC:Replace bone's transformation with the transformation of the bind node.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.ANIM_FRAME_USES_NONE
DESC:No frame components are to be used.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.ANIM_FRAME_USES_POSITION
DESC:Only position is to be used.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.ANIM_FRAME_USES_ROTATION
DESC:Only rotation is to be used.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.ANIM_FRAME_USES_SCALE
DESC:Only scale is to be used.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.ANIM_FRAME_USES_ALL
DESC:All frame components are to be used.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.ANIM_FRAME_USES_POSITION_AND_ROTATION
DESC:Only position and rotation are to be used.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.ANIM_FRAME_USES_POSITION_AND_SCALE
DESC:Only position and scale are to be used.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.ANIM_FRAME_USES_ROTATION_AND_SCALE
DESC:Only rotation and scale are to be used.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.CHAIN_CONSTRAINT_BONE_ROTATIONS
DESC:At every solver application step, bone rotation constraints are applied to the chain if they have been previously configured.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.CHAIN_CONSTRAINT_POLE_VECTOR
DESC:The specified pole vector is applied for the IK/LookAt chain. For the IK chain, the pole vector defines the bend plane. For the LookAt chain, the pole vector defines the plane of the UP axis. This constraint is applied after applying the solver.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.CHAIN_CONSTRAINT_NONE
DESC:No constraints applied to the IK/LookAt chain. The chain transforms are kept as is after applying the solver.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.INTERPOLATION_ACCURACY_HIGH
DESC:The slerp function is used for rotations.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.INTERPOLATION_ACCURACY_MEDIUM
DESC:Linear interpolation with quaternion normalization (nlerp) is applied to rotation, but the interpolation coefficient is adjusted to be approximated to the uniform angular rotation rate.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.ObjectMeshSkinned.INTERPOLATION_ACCURACY_LOW
DESC:Linear interpolation with quaternion normalization (nlerp) is applied.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.#ctor

ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.setNameMapping(char,char)

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.findEqualNameMapping
DESC:Performs a search and automatically maps source and target bones by matching names.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.getSrcBoneName(int) const
DESC:Returns the name of the source bone by its index.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.getDstBoneName(int) const
DESC:Returns the name of the target bone by its index.
PARAMS:index:Index of the target bone.
RETURNS:Name of the target bone with the specified index.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.setBoneMode(char,BonesRetargeting::MODE)

ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.getBoneMode(char) const

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.setBoneCustomProportion(char,float)
DESC:Sets a new custom proportion value for the source bone with the specified name.
PARAMS:src_name:Name of the source bone. | proportion:New proportion value to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.getBoneCustomProportion(char) const
DESC:Returns the current custom proportion value for the source bone with the specified name.
PARAMS:src_name:Name of the source bone.
RETURNS:The custom proportion value for the bone.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.isBoneCustomProportion(char) const
DESC:Checks if the custom proportion is set for the specified bone.
PARAMS:src_name:Name of the source bone.
RETURNS:true if the bone proportion is custom, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.removeBoneCustomProportion(char)
DESC:Removes the custom proportion for the source bone with the specified name.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.getDstBoneBySrcBone(char) const

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BonesRetargeting.getSrcBoneByDstBone(char) const
