ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.compressImage(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int,int)
DESC:Converts the image to a specified compressed format. The result is to be processed in the callback function specified. If compression by the GPU is not supported, the Image::compress() method will be called instead.
PARAMS:on_compressed:Callback function to be fired on compressing an image. | image:Image to compress. | quality:Compression quality:0 - fast compression, low compressed image quality.1 - high compressed image quality, slow compression (by default). | new_image_format:Compressed texture format: one of the Texture::FORMAT_* variables. This is an optional argument. If no format is specified, default conversion will be performed (depending on the type of the source image). | use_mip_maps:Flag indicating whether texture mipmaps should be generated for the compressed image: 1 to generate mipmaps, 0 not to generate. This is an optional argument. If no value is specified, mipmaps will be generated only if the source image has the mipmaps.
RETURNS:1 if the image has been compressed successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.compressTexture(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int,int)
DESC:Compresses the given texture to the specified format. The result is to be processed in the callback function specified. Only 2d and 2d array textures can be compressed.
PARAMS:on_compressed:Callback function to be called on compressing the texture where you can get the result. | texture:Source texture to compress. | destination:Image into which the compressed texture will be saved. | quality:Compression quality:0 - fast compression, low compressed image quality.1 - high compressed image quality, slow compression (by default). | new_texture_format:Compressed texture format: one of the Texture::FORMAT_* variables. This is an optional argument. If no format is specified, default conversion will be performed (depending on the type of the source image). | use_mip_maps:Flag indicating whether texture mipmaps should be generated for the compressed image: 1 to generate mipmaps, 0 not to generate. This is an optional argument. If no value is specified, mipmaps will be generated only if the source image has the mipmaps.
RETURNS:1 if the texture has been compressed successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.asyncCompressTexture(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}},Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},int,int,int)
DESC:Performs asynchronous compression of the specified texture and transfers it to CPU side (Image). The method enables you to specify a callback function in which you can process the obtained result (resulting Image).Only 2d and 2d array textures can be compressed.
PARAMS:on_compressed:Callback function to be called in the main thread upon completion of the transfer operation where you can get the result. | on_compressed:The function should have the following signature: void func(ImagePtr image). You can pass nullptr if this callback is not needed. | on_compressed_async:Callback function to be called right in the async thread upon completion of the transfer operation where you can get the result. | on_compressed_async:The function should have the following signature: void func(ImagePtr image). You can pass nullptr if this callback is not needed. | texture:Source texture to be transferred to an Image (GPU -&gt; CPU). | quality:Compression quality:0 - fast compression, low compressed image quality.1 - high compressed image quality, slow compression (by default). | new_texture_format:Compressed texture format: one of the variables. This is an optional argument. If no format is specified, default conversion will be performed (depending on the type of the source). | use_mip_maps:Flag indicating whether texture mipmaps should be generated for the compressed image: 1 to generate mipmaps, 0 not to generate. This is an optional argument. If no value is specified, mipmaps will be generated only if the source has mipmaps.
RETURNS:1 if the source texture has been compressed and transferred to CPU successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.asyncCompressImage(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}},Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int,int)
DESC:Performs asynchronous compression of the specified image. The method enables you to specify a callback function in which you can process the obtained result (resulting Image).Only 2d and 2d array images can be compressed.
PARAMS:on_compressed:Callback function to be called in the main thread upon completion of the compress operation where you can get the result. | on_compressed:The function should have the following signature: void func(ImagePtr image). You can pass nullptr if this callback is not needed. | on_compressed_async:Callback function to be called right in the async thread upon completion of the compress operation where you can get the result. | on_compressed_async:The function should have the following signature: void func(ImagePtr image). You can pass nullptr if this callback is not needed. | image:Image to be compressed. | quality:Compression quality:0 - fast compression, low compressed image quality.1 - high compressed image quality, slow compression (by default). | new_image_format:Compressed image format: one of the variables. This is an optional argument. If no format is specified, default conversion will be performed (depending on the type of the source). | use_mip_maps:Flag indicating whether mipmaps should be generated for the compressed image: 1 to generate mipmaps, 0 not to generate. This is an optional argument. If no value is specified, mipmaps will be generated only if the source image has the mipmaps.
RETURNS:1 if the source image has been compressed successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.transferTextureToImage(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture})
DESC:Transfers the specified source texture to an Image (from GPU to CPU side). The method enables you to specify a callback function in which you can process the obtained result (resulting Image). The result will be obtained at the swap stage of the same frame (calls CPU-GPU synchronization).
PARAMS:on_transfered:Callback function to be called upon completion of the transfer operation where you can get the result. | on_transfered:The function should have the following signature: void func(ImagePtr image). | src:Source texture to be transferred to an Image (GPU -&gt; CPU).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.asyncTransferTextureToImage(Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}},Unigine.CallbackBase1{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture})
DESC:Transfers the specified source texture to an Image (from GPU to CPU side) asynchronously, without CPU-GPU synchronization. The method enables you to specify a callback function in which you can process the obtained result (resulting Image). The result will be obtained later in one of the subsequent frames.
PARAMS:on_transfered:Callback function to be called in the main thread upon completion of the transfer operation where you can get the result. | on_transfered:The function should have the following signature: void func(ImagePtr image). You can pass nullptr if this callback is not needed. | on_transfered_async:Callback function to be called right in the async thread upon completion of the transfer operation where you can get the result. | on_transfered_async:The function should have the following signature: void func(ImagePtr image). You can pass nullptr if this callback is not needed. | src:Source texture to be transferred to an Image (GPU -&gt; CPU).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.asyncTransferStructuredBuffer(Unigine.CallbackBase1{void},Unigine.CallbackBase1{void},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.StructuredBuffer})
DESC:Transfers the data of the specified source structured buffer from GPU to CPU side asynchronously, without CPU-GPU synchronization. The method enables you to specify a callback function in which you can process the obtained result. The result will be obtained later in one of the subsequent frames.
PARAMS:on_transfered:Callback function to be called in the main thread upon completion of the transfer operation where you can get the result. | on_transfered:The function should have the following signature: void func(void *buffer). You can pass nullptr if this callback is not needed. | on_transfered_async:Callback function to be called right in the async upon completion of the transfer operation where you can get the result. | on_transfered_async:The function should have the following signature: void func(void *buffer). You can pass nullptr if this callback is not needed. | src:Source structured buffer to be transferred (GPU -&gt; CPU).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.transferStructuredBuffer(Unigine.CallbackBase1{void},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.StructuredBuffer})
DESC:Transfers the data of the specified source structured buffer from GPU to CPU side. The method enables you to specify a callback function in which you can process the obtained result. The result will be obtained at the swap stage of the same frame (calls CPU-GPU synchronization).
PARAMS:on_transfered:Callback function to be called in the main thread upon completion of the transfer operation. | on_transfered:The function should have the following signature: void func(void *buffer). | src:Source structured buffer to be transferred (GPU -&gt; CPU).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.createMipmapsCubeGGXImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},Render::GGX_MIPMAPS_QUALITY)

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.createMipmapsCubeGGXTexture(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},Render::GGX_MIPMAPS_QUALITY,bool)

PARAMS:texture:Cubemap texture. TEXTURE_CUBE or TEXTURE_CUBE_ARRAY types are accepted. | quality:Quality of GGX mipmaps. One of the GGX_MIPMAPS_QUALITY values. | realtime:true if the operation should be performed in real-time mode; otherwise - false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.createShorelineDistanceField(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int,int)
DESC:Grabs a shoreline distance field texture with the specified parameters.
PARAMS:image:Texture to grab a shoreline texture to. | mask:An R16 mask texture Image. Each pixel of the mask has the following color value:0 if water level at this point of the grid is above the terrain level; otherwise, 65535. | shoreline_radius:Shoreline radius value within the [4; 128] range. Padding distance (from the shore to the beginning of swash zone). | blur_radius:Blur radius value within the [0; 32] range. Higher values make shoreline smoother. | downsample_resolution:Texture resolution value, can be one of the following: 16, 32, 64, 128, 256, 512, 1024, 2048.
RETURNS:1 if the shoreline distance field texture is grabbed successfully; otherwise, 0.

DESC:Renders the 2D texture of the given node in accordance with the specified parameters. The viewport position is taken from the camera created via Camera class. The node can be rendered using the specific type of lighting and environment cubemap.
PARAMS:camera:Camera to be used. | node:Node to be rendered. | texture:Texture to save the result to. | width:Width of the texture, in units. | height:Height of the texture, in units. | hdr:HDR flag. This parameter determines the format of the 2D texture:1 - texture format will be set to RGBA16F. It means that the HDR texture buffer will store pixel values outside the [0;1] range (i.e. both negative and positive values).0 - texture format will be set to RGBA8. | skip_flags:Skip the effects. One of the SKIP_* variables should be specified. 0 enables all the effects. | light_usage:Sets the light sources that will affect the node (one of the USAGE_*_LIGHTING Viewport class variables). | environment_texture_name:Path to the environment cubemap to be used. Takes effect if the first (auxiliary light) or second (node light) lighting mode is used (see the light_usage argument above). In case LightWorld is used (zero mode), the environment cubemap used for the current world will be used.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.setDebugMaterial(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
DESC:Replaces the debug material with the specified number with the new debug material specified. The number of material determines the order in which the expressions assigned to it are executed.
PARAMS:num:Debug material number in the range from 0 to the total number of debug materials. | material:New debug material to replace the one with the specified number.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.getDebugMaterial(int) const

PARAMS:num:Debug material number in the range from 0 to the total number of debug materials.
RETURNS:Debug material applied globally with the specified number.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.insertDebugMaterial(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
DESC:Inserts a new global debug material to the list of globally applied debug materials.
PARAMS:num:Position at which a new debug material is to be inserted. | material:Debug material to be inserted into the list of globally applied debug materials.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.findDebugMaterial(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material}) const
DESC:Returns the number of the specified debug material applied globally. This number determines the order in which the assigned expressions are executed.
PARAMS:material:Debug material for which a number is to be found.
RETURNS:Debug material number in the range from 0 to the total number of debug materials, or -1 if the specified material was not found.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.addDebugMaterial(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
DESC:Adds a new global debug material.
PARAMS:material:Debug material to be applied globally.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.removeDebugMaterial(int)
DESC:Removes the global debug material with the specified number.
PARAMS:num:Debug material number in the range from 0 to the total number of debug materials.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.swapDebugMaterials(int,int)
DESC:Swaps two debug materials with specified numbers. The number of material determines the order in which the expressions assigned to it are executed.
PARAMS:num_0:Number of the first debug material in the range from 0 to the total number of debug materials. | num_1:Number of the second debug material in the range from 0 to the total number of debug materials.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.setDebugMaterialEnabled(int,bool)
DESC:Enables or disables the debug material with the specified number. When a material is disabled (inactive), the scripts attached to it are not executed.
PARAMS:num:Debug material number in the range from 0 to the total number of debug materials. | enabled:1 to enable the debug material with the specified number, 0 to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Render.getDebugMaterialEnabled(int) const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the debug material with the specified number is enabled (active). When a material is disabled (inactive), the scripts attached to it are not executed.
PARAMS:num:Debug material number in the range from 0 to the total number of debug materials.
RETURNS:1 if the debug material with the specified number is enabled; otherwise, 0.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.VIEWPORT_MODE_PANORAMA_CURVED_360
DESC:Enables rendering of the viewport as a panorama with curved edges with an angle of 360 degrees.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.VIEWPORT_MODE_PANORAMA_LINEAR_180
DESC:Enables rendering of the viewport as a linear panorama without distortion at the edges with an angle of 180 degrees.
-

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.VIEWPORT_MODE_PANORAMA_FISHEYE_EQUDISTANT

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.VIEWPORT_MODE_PANORAMA_FISHEYE_STEREOGRAPHIC
DESC:Enables rendering of the viewport as an stereographic spherical panorama (fisheye).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.VIEWPORT_MODE_PANORAMA_FISHEYE_EQUISOLID

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.VIEWPORT_MODE_STEREO_INTERLACED

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.VIEWPORT_MODE_STEREO_HORIZONTAL
DESC:Enables the horizontal stereo mode that is supported on mobile devices.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.VIEWPORT_MODE_STEREO_VERTICAL

DESC:Provides the highest performance gain while still maintaining an image quality representative of native rendering. 3.0x per dimension.
-

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_A
DESC:DLSS Preset A. Intended for Performance/Balanced/Quality modes. An older variant best suited to combat ghosting for elements with missing inputs, such as motion vectors.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_B
DESC:DLSS Preset B. Intended for Ultra Performance mode. Similar to Preset A but for Ultra Performance mode.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_C
DESC:DLSS Preset C: Intended for Performance/Balanced/Quality modes. Generally favors current frame information; well suited for fast-paced game content.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_D
DESC:DLSS Preset D (2nd preferred): Default preset for Performance/Balanced/Quality modes; generally favors image stability.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_E
DESC:DLSS Preset E (most preferred): Intended for Performance/Balanced/Quality modes. Preset for most performance and image stability.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_F
DESC:DLSS Preset F: Default preset for Ultra Performance and DLAA modes.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_G
DESC:DLSS Preset G: Unused.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_H
DESC:DLSS Preset H: Unused.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_I
DESC:DLSS Preset I: Unused.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_J
DESC:DLSS Preset J: The baseline Transformer-based DLSS, delivering a substantial improvement in image quality compared to the other Presets' CCN-based model.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_PRESET_K
DESC:DLSS Preset K: A further improvement upon Preset J, best image quality preset at a higher performance cost.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_NUM_PRESETS
DESC:Total number of DLSS presets.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_MODE_ULTRA_PERFORMANCE
DESC:The Ultra Performance quality mode that provides frames per second at the cost of internal resolution and output visuals. It may result in soft, blurry graphics because of the large gap between internal render and the output resolution.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_MODE_MAX_PERFORMANCE
DESC:The Max Performance quality mode that prioritizes frame rate over resolution. It is recommended for users with 1440p/2K monitors, providing better performance with minimal effort.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_MODE_BALANCED
DESC:The Balanced quality mode that balances render and output resolution trying to provide the best possible frame rate or the frame rate you request in the app settings.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_MODE_MAX_QUALITY
DESC:The Max Quality quality mode that prioritizes visual quality over frame rate. It renders the image internally at the closest resolution possible to the target resolution.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_MODE_DLAA
DESC:The DLAA quality mode which is an AI-powered tool to eliminate jagged edges in video apps, maintaining native resolution unlike DLSS. It improves image quality with less performance cost than traditional methods.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_DLSS_NUM_MODES
DESC:Total number of DLSS modes.
-

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Render.RENDER_UPSCALE_MODE_DLSS

ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getNum const
DESC:Returns the number of the preset.
RETURNS:Preset number. Available values: 0, 1, 2.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setIntensity(float)
DESC:Sets the intensity of the given preset. The preset intensity is used to blend the given environment preset with the other ones. Presets overlay each other: the first preset overlays the zero one, the second overlays the first and the zero ones.
PARAMS:intensity:Intensity of the preset.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getIntensity const
DESC:Returns the intensity of the preset. The preset intensity is used to blend the environment preset with the other ones. Presets overlay each other: the first preset overlays the zero one, the second overlays the first and the zero ones.
RETURNS:Intensity of the preset.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setScatteringMieLUTName(char)
DESC:Sets the path to the Mie LUT texture (the texture for setting the color of the light round the sun) for the preset. The Mie texture is used for both sun and moon.
PARAMS:name:Path to the texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getScatteringMieLUTName const
DESC:Returns the path to the Mie LUT texture (the texture for setting the color of the light round the sun) set for the preset. The Mie texture is used for both sun and moon.
RETURNS:Path to the texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setScatteringLightColorLUTName(char)
DESC:Sets the path to the light color texture (the texture defining the color of the LightWorld for different times of the day) for the preset.
PARAMS:name:Path to the texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getScatteringLightColorLUTName const
DESC:Returns the path to the light color texture (the texture defining the color of the LightWorld for different times of the day).
RETURNS:Path to the texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setScatteringBaseLUTName(char)
DESC:Sets the path to the base LUT texture (the texture defining the base color of the sky) for the preset.
PARAMS:name:Path to the texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getScatteringBaseLUTName const
DESC:Returns the path to the base LUT texture (the texture defining the base color of the sky) set for the preset.
RETURNS:Path to the texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazeMaxDistance(float)
DESC:Sets the distance starting at which the haze becomes completely solid, so nothing will be seen behind. For large terrains it is recommended to the this parameter equal to your camera's Far parameter. This is required for distant objects to fade into the distance instead of being cut sharply.
PARAMS:distance:Haze maximum visibility distance.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazeMaxDistance const
DESC:Returns the distance starting at which the haze becomes completely solid, so nothing will be seen behind.
RETURNS:Haze maximum visibility distance.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazeColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Sets the color of the haze for the preset. This function will take effect only if the HAZE_SOLID mode is set via setEnvironmentHazeMode().
PARAMS:color:Haze color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazeColor const
DESC:Returns the haze color for the preset. This function will return color only if the HAZE_SOLID mode is set via setEnvironmentHazeMode().
RETURNS:Haze color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazeDensity(float)
DESC:Sets the density of the haze for the preset.
PARAMS:density:Haze density.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazeDensity const
DESC:Returns the haze density set for the preset.
RETURNS:Haze density.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setReflectionIntensity(float)
DESC:Sets intensity of the environment reflection for the preset. 0 value means no environment reflection for the preset. It is recommended to use the default value of the parameter to keep the image realistic.
PARAMS:intensity:Intensity value of the environment reflection.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getReflectionIntensity const
DESC:Returns the intensity of the environment reflections for the preset. 0 value means no environment reflections for the preset.
RETURNS:The intensity value of the environment reflections.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setSkyIntensity(float)
DESC:Sets intensity of the environment sky for the preset. 0.0f value means no environment sky for the preset. It is recommended to use the default value of the parameter to keep the image realistic. If, for example, the sky looks too dark in contrast with lighting from it, you should check exposure and tone mapping settings before changing the environment intensity.
PARAMS:intensity:Intensity value of the environment sky.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getSkyIntensity const
DESC:Returns the intensity of the environment sky set for the preset.
RETURNS:Intensity value of the environment sky.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setAmbientIntensity(float)
DESC:Sets the intensity of the environment ambient lighting for the preset. 0 value means no environment ambient lighting for the preset. The higher the value, the more ambient lighting affects environment. It is recommended to use the default value of the parameter to keep the image realistic.
PARAMS:intensity:Intensity value of the environment ambient lighting. The value can be greater than 1.0f (useful for dark scenes).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getAmbientIntensity const
DESC:Returns the intensity of the environment ambient lighting for the preset. 0 value means no environment ambient lighting for the preset. The higher the value, the more ambient lighting affects environment.
RETURNS:The intensity value of environment ambient lighting. The value can be greater than 1.0f.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setTexture(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture})
DESC:Sets the cubemap defining the environment color for the preset. This texture is used for imitating landscape reflections and lighting in accordance with the ground mask.
PARAMS:texture:Cubemap defining the environment color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getTexture const
DESC:Returns the cubemap defining the environment color set for the preset. This texture is used for imitating landscape reflections and lighting in accordance with the ground mask.
RETURNS:Cubemap defining the environment color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setTextureName(char)
DESC:Sets the path to the cubemap defining the environment color for the preset. This texture is used for imitating landscape reflections and lighting in accordance with the ground mask.
PARAMS:name:Path to the cubemap defining the environment color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getTextureName const
DESC:Returns the path to the cubemap defining the environment color set for the preset. This texture is used for imitating landscape reflections and lighting in accordance with the ground mask.
RETURNS:Path to the cubemap defining the environment color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setTextureColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Sets the environment color multiplier for the preset. The alpha channel defines visibility of the environment cubemap above scattering. The color multiplier is required when you need to display a sky with a photo texture and dynamic gradients at the same time.
PARAMS:color:The environment color multiplier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getTextureColor const
DESC:Returns the environment color multiplier set for the preset. The alpha channel defines visibility of the environment cubemap above scattering. The color multiplier is required when you need to display a sky with a photo texture and dynamic gradients at the same time.
RETURNS:The environment color multiplier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setTextureRotation(Unigine.Math.vec3)
DESC:Sets rotation of the environment texture along three axes.
PARAMS:rotation:Rotation of the texture along X, Y, Z axes, in degrees.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getTextureRotation const
DESC:Returns rotation of the environment texture along three axes, in degrees.
RETURNS:Rotation of the texture along X, Y, Z axes, in degrees.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setTextureBlur(float)
DESC:Sets the blur intensity for the environment texture. This value can be used to make blurred panorama at the background. Reflections and ambient lighting aren't blurred.
PARAMS:blur:Blur intensity.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getTextureBlur const
DESC:Returns the blur intensity for the environment texture. Reflections and ambient lighting aren't blurred.
RETURNS:Blur intensity.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getMoonTextureIntensity const
DESC:Returns the intensity multiplier of the Moon texture. It allows increasing/reducing brightness of the Moon.
RETURNS:Intensity of the Moon texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setMoonTextureIntensity(float)
DESC:Sets the intensity multiplier of the Moon texture. It allows increasing/reducing brightness of the Moon.
PARAMS:intensity:Intensity of the Moon texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setSunTextureColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Sets the color multiplier for the current Sun texture. By default, it is (1,1,1,1).
PARAMS:color:Color multiplier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getMoonAngularSize const
DESC:Returns the current angular size of the Moon in degrees as seen from the Earth. By default, the size of the Moon is 0.5 degrees.
RETURNS:Angular size of the Moon.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getSunTextureIntensity const
DESC:Returns the intensity multiplier of the Sun texture. It allows increasing/reducing brightness of the Sun.
RETURNS:Intensity of the sun texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getMoonTextureColor const
DESC:Returns the color multiplier of the Moon texture.
RETURNS:Color multiplier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setSunTextureName(char)
DESC:Sets the Sun texture with the given name.
PARAMS:name:Name of the Sun texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setMoonTextureColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Sets the color multiplier for the current Moon texture. By default, it is (1,1,1,1).
PARAMS:color:Color multiplier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setSunTextureIntensity(float)
DESC:Sets the intensity multiplier of the Sun texture. It allows increasing/reducing brightness of the Sun.
PARAMS:intensity:Intensity of the Sun texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setMoonAngularSize(float)
DESC:Sets the angular size of the Moon in degrees. The value is set for an observer on the Earth. By default, the size of the Moon is 0.5 degrees as seen from the Earth..
PARAMS:size:Angular size of the Moon.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getSunTextureColor const
DESC:Returns the color multiplier of the Sun texture. By default, it is (1,1,1,1).
RETURNS:Color multiplier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setMoonTextureName(char)
DESC:Sets a name of the Moon texture.
PARAMS:name:Name of the Moon texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setSunAngularSize(float)
DESC:Sets the angular size of the Sun in degrees. The value is set for an observer on the Earth. By default, the size of the Sun is 0.5 degrees as seen from the Earth.
PARAMS:size:Angular size of the Sun.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getSunAngularSize const
DESC:Returns the angular size of the Sun in degrees as seen from the Earth. By default, the size of the Sun is 0.5 degrees.
RETURNS:Angular size of the Sun.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getSunTextureName const
DESC:Returns the name of the Sun texture.
RETURNS:Name of the Sun texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getMoonTextureName const
DESC:Returns the name of the Moon texture.
RETURNS:Name of the Moon texure.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazePhysicalStartHeight(float)
DESC:Sets a new reference height value for the two parameters (Half Visibility Distance and Half Faloff Height).
PARAMS:height:New reference height value to be set, in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazePhysicalStartHeight const
DESC:Returns the current reference height value for the two parameters (Half Visibility Distance and Half Faloff Height).
RETURNS:Current reference height value, in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazePhysicalHalfVisibilityDistance(float)
DESC:Sets the distance to the boundary at which the visibility comprises 50%. There is no zero-visibility in the real world, so the half-visibility boundary is used to adjust haze distance.
PARAMS:distance:New distance value to be set, in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazePhysicalHalfVisibilityDistance const
DESC:Returns the current distance to the boundary at which the visibility comprises 50%. There is no zero-visibility in the real world, so the half-visibility boundary is used to adjust haze distance.
RETURNS:Current distance to the boundary at which the visibility comprises 50%, in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazePhysicalHalfFalloffHeight(float)
DESC:Sets the height of the haze density gradient. The higher the value, the longer the haze desity reduces as the height grows, making the transition between the clear sky and haze smoother.
PARAMS:height:New height of the haze density gradient to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazePhysicalHalfFalloffHeight const
DESC:Returns the current height of the haze density gradient. The higher the value, the longer the haze desity reduces as the height grows, making the transition between the clear sky and haze smoother.
RETURNS:Current height of the haze density gradient.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazePhysicalAmbientLightIntensity(float)
DESC:Sets the new intensity of the impact of the ambient lighting on haze (how much the ambient lighting affects the haze).
PARAMS:intensity:New value of intensity of the ambient lighting impact to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazePhysicalAmbientLightIntensity const
DESC:Returns the current intensity of the impact of the ambient lighting on haze (how much the ambient lighting affects the haze).
RETURNS:Current value of intensity of the ambient lighting impact.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazePhysicalAmbientColorSaturation(float)
DESC:Sets the new intensity of the ambient color's contribution to the haze (how much the sunlight affects the haze).
PARAMS:saturation:New value of intensity of the ambient color's contribution to the haze to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazePhysicalAmbientColorSaturation const
DESC:Returns the current intensity of the ambient color's contribution to the haze (how much the sunlight affects the haze).
RETURNS:Current value of intensity of the ambient color's contribution to the haze.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazePhysicalSunLightIntensity(float)
DESC:Sets the new intensity of the impact of the sunlight on haze (how much the sunlight affects the haze).
PARAMS:intensity:New value of intensity of the sunlight impact to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazePhysicalSunLightIntensity const
DESC:Returns the current intensity of the impact of the sunlight on haze defining how much the sunlight affects the haze.
RETURNS:Current value of intensity of the sunlight impact.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazePhysicalSunColorSaturation(float)
DESC:Sets the new intensity of the impact of the sunlight on haze (how much the sunlight affects the haze). "Sunlight color" here does not simply mean the color multiplier of the WorldLight source, but rather the Scattering LUT Light Color.
PARAMS:saturation:New value of intensity of the sunlight color's contribution to the haze to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazePhysicalSunColorSaturation const
DESC:Returns the current intensity of the impact of the sunlight on haze (how much the sunlight affects the haze).
RETURNS:Current intensity of the sunlight color's contribution to the haze.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.setHazeScatteringMieIntensity(float)
DESC:Sets the minimum Mie intensity value for geometry-occluded areas. This value specifies the fraction of Mie intensity visible when the surface is viewed from straight on. Setting this value to 1 disables the Fresnel effect. You can use this parameter together with Mie Frontside Intensity and Mie Fresnel Power to control light occlusion from World light sources. Works for both, opaque and transparent objects.
PARAMS:intensity:New minimum Mie intensity value for geometry-occluded areas to be set in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderEnvironmentPreset.getHazeScatteringMieIntensity const
DESC:Returns the current minimum Mie intensity value for geometry-occluded areas. This value specifies the fraction of Mie intensity visible when the surface is viewed from straight on. Setting this value to 1 disables the Fresnel effect. You can use this parameter together with Mie Frontside Intensity and Mie Fresnel Power to control light occlusion from World light sources. Works for both, opaque and transparent objects.
RETURNS:Current minimum Mie intensity value for geometry-occluded areas in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BIND_ALL
DESC:A flag indicating that texture should be bound to all shaders.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BIND_FRAGMENT
DESC:A flag indicating that texture should be bound to fragment shaders only.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_NONE
DESC:None blending factor.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_ZERO
DESC:Zero blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by (0, 0, 0, 0).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_ONE
DESC:One blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by (1, 1, 1, 1).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_SRC_COLOR
DESC:Source color blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by the source color.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR
DESC:Inverse source color blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the source color.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_SRC_ALPHA
DESC:Source alpha blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by the alpha value of the source.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA
DESC:Inverse source alpha blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the alpha value of the source.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_DEST_COLOR
DESC:Destination color blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by the destination color.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_DEST_COLOR
DESC:Inverse destination color blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the destination color.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_DEST_ALPHA
DESC:Destination alpha blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by the alpha value of the destination.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_DEST_ALPHA
DESC:Inverse destination alpha blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the alpha value of the destination.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_SRC1_COLOR
DESC:Source color blending factor (for dual source blending). Each component of the color is multiplied by the source color.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC1_COLOR
DESC:Inverse source color blending factor (for dual source blending). Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the source color.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_SRC1_ALPHA
DESC:Source alpha blending factor. Each component of the color is multiplied by the alpha value of the source.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_ONE_MINUS_SRC1_ALPHA
DESC:Inverse source alpha blending factor (for dual source blending). Each component of the color is multiplied by the inverse of the alpha value of the source.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BUFFER_ALL
DESC:Buffer mask indicating that all color channels, depth, and stencil buffers are available for rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BUFFER_ALPHA
DESC:Buffer mask indicating that A channel of the buffer is available for rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BUFFER_BLUE
DESC:Buffer mask indicating that B channel of the buffer is available for rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BUFFER_COLOR
DESC:Buffer mask indicating that all color channels of the buffer are available for rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BUFFER_DEPTH
DESC:Buffer mask indicating that depth buffer is available for rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BUFFER_DEPTH_STENCIL
DESC:Buffer mask indicating that depth and stencil buffers are available for rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BUFFER_GREEN
DESC:Buffer mask indicating that G channel of the buffer is available for rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BUFFER_NONE
DESC:Buffer mask indicating that all color channels, depth, and stencil buffers are not available for rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BUFFER_RED
DESC:Buffer mask indicating that R channel of the buffer is available for rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BUFFER_STENCIL
DESC:Buffer mask indicating that stencil buffer is available for rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.CULL_BACK
DESC:A flag indicating that back-facing polygons should be culled.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.CULL_FRONT
DESC:A flag indicating that front-facing polygons should be culled.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.CULL_NONE
DESC:A flag tat disables the polygon culling.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.DEPTH_ALWAYS
DESC:A flag indicating depth function that performs the comparison which always succeeds (always passes).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.DEPTH_EQUAL
DESC:A flag indicating depth function that performs the comparison which is an equal-to operation (passes if the incoming depth value is equal to the stored depth value).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.DEPTH_NOT_EQUAL
DESC:A flag indicating depth function that performs the comparison which is a not-equal-to operation (passes if the incoming depth value is not equal to the stored depth value).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.DEPTH_GEQUAL
DESC:A flag indicating depth function that performs the comparison which is a greater-than or equal-to operation (passes if the incoming depth value is greater than or equal to the stored depth value).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.DEPTH_LEQUAL
DESC:A flag indicating depth function that performs the comparison which is a less-than or equal-to operation (passes if the incoming depth value is less than or equal to the stored depth value).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.DEPTH_NONE
DESC:A flag that disables the depth comparison function.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.FILL_SOLID
DESC:A flag that specifies how polygons will be rasterized (the interior of the polygon is filled)
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.FILL_WIREFRAME
DESC:A flag that specifies how polygons will be rasterized (boundary edges of the polygon are drawn as line segments.)
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.FRONT_CCW
DESC:Counterclockwise orientation mode of the front-facing polygon.s
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.FRONT_CW
DESC:Clockwise orientation mode of the front-facing polygons.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.FRONT_INVERT
DESC:Back-facing mode for polygons.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_KEEP
DESC:A flag indicating stencil buffer operation that does not update the entry in the stencil buffer (stencil value unchanged).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_INCR
DESC:A flag indicating stencil buffer operation that increments the stencil-buffer entry (stencil value incremented).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_DECR
DESC:A flag indicating stencil buffer operation that decrements the stencil-buffer entry (stencil value decremented).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_REPLACE
DESC:A flag indicating stencil buffer operation that replaces the stencil-buffer entry with a reference value (stencil value replaced by stencil reference value).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_NONE
DESC:A flag that disables the stencil test.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_LESS
DESC:A flag indicating stencil function that performs a comparison which is a less-than operation (passes if reference value is less than stencil buffer).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_EQUAL
DESC:A flag indicating stencil function that performs a comparison which is an equal-to operation (passes if reference value is equal to stencil buffer).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_LESS_EQUAL
DESC:A flag indicating stencil function that performs a comparison which is a less-than-or-equal-to operation (passes if reference value is less than or equal to stencil buffer).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_GREATER
DESC:A flag indicating stencil function that performs a comparison which is a greater-than operation (passes if reference value is greater than stencil buffer).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_NOT_EQUAL
DESC:A flag indicating stencil function that performs a comparison which is an not-equal-to operation (passes if reference value is not equal to stencil buffer).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_GREATER_EQUAL
DESC:A flag indicating stencil function that performs a comparison which is a greater-than-or-equal-to operation (passes if reference value is greater than or equal to stencil buffer).
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.STENCIL_ALWAYS
DESC:A flag indicating stencil function that performs the comparison which always succeeds.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_OP_ADD
DESC:ADD blending operation: source and destination colors are added to each other. O = sS + dD. The source and dest are multiplied by blending parameters.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_OP_SUBTRACT
DESC:SUBTRACT blending operation: subtracts the destination from the source. O = sS - dD. The source and dest are multiplied by blending parameters.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_OP_REVERSE_SUBTRACT
DESC:REVERSE SUBTRACT blending operation: subtracts the source from the destination. O = dD - sS. The source and dest are multiplied by blending parameters.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_OP_MIN
DESC:MIN blending operation: output color is the componentwise minimum value of the source and dest colors. So for RGB it means that Or = min(Sr, Dr), Og = min(Sg, Dg), and so forth.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.RenderState.BLEND_OP_MAX
DESC:MAX blending operation: output color is the componentwise maximum value of the source and dest colors. So for RGB it means that Or = max(Sr, Dr), Og = max(Sg, Dg), and so forth.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Shader.compileCompute(char,char,unsignedlonglong)
DESC:Compiles the shader with the specified compute subshader. The additional COMPUTE value is added automatically to the defines argument. This function is the same as the compile() function called only with the compute argument.
PARAMS:compute:Compute subshader path. | defines:User defines (for example, "OPENGL", "DIRECT3D11", or any other). | key_cache:Key cache.
RETURNS:true if the shader compiled successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Shader.compileVertFrag(char,char,char,unsignedlonglong)
DESC:Compiles the shader with the specified vertex and fragment subshaders. The additional VERTEX and FRAGMENT values are added automatically to the defines argument. This function is the same as the compile() function called only with the vertex and fragment arguments.
PARAMS:vertex:Vertex subshader path. | fragment:Fragment subshader path. | defines:User defines (for example, "OPENGL", "DIRECT3D11", or any other). | key_cache:Key cache.
RETURNS:true if the shader compiled successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Shader.compileVertGeomFrag(char,char,char,char,unsignedlonglong)
DESC:Compiles the shader with the specified vertex, geometry, and fragment subshaders. The additional VERTEX, GEOMETRY, and FRAGMENT values are added automatically to the defines argument. This function is the same as the compile() function called only with the vertex, fragment, and geometry arguments.
PARAMS:vertex:Vertex subshader path. | geometry:Geometry subshader path. | fragment:Fragment subshader path. | defines:User defines (for example, "OPENGL", "DIRECT3D11", or any other). | key_cache:Key cache.
RETURNS:true if the shader compiled successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Shader.compileShader(char,char,unsignedlonglong)
DESC:Compiles the shader that includes subshaders. Depending on the types of the subshaders defined in the shader file, additional values are added to the defines argument automatically: VERTEX, CONTROL, EVALUATE, GEOMETRY, FRAGMENT.
PARAMS:shader:Shader path. | defines:User defines (for example, "OPENGL", "DIRECT3D11", or any other). | key_cache:Key cache.
RETURNS:trueif the shader with all the subshaders compiled successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Shader.validateShader(Shader::SUB_SHADER,char,char)
DESC:Validates the shader (whether it can be compiled or not).
PARAMS:type:Subshader type. | shader:Shader path. | defines:User defines (for example, "OPENGL", "DIRECT3D11", or any other).
RETURNS:true if the shader can be compiled; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Shader.WARNING_MODE_DISABLE
DESC:All shader compilation warnings are ignored. Using this mode is not recommended as it may result in driver and OS crashes, so you use it at your own risk.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Shader.WARNING_MODE_SOFT
DESC:All shader compilation warnings are printed to log, but ignored. You can use this mode if you have checked and you're absolutely sure that the warnings do not cause driver or OS crashes.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Shader.WARNING_MODE_HARD
DESC:All warnings are treated as errors. This level is used by default.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Signal.#ctor
DESC:
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Signal.#ctor(Signal)
DESC:
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Signal.#ctor(Signal)
DESC:
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Signal.add(Unigine.CallbackBase)
DESC:Adds a callback function to be fired when the signal is invoked (subscription for the signal). Callback functions can be used to determine specific actions to be performed when the signal is invoked.
RETURNS:ID of the added callback, if the callback was added successfully; otherwise, nullptr. This ID can be used to remove this callback when necessary.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Signal.remove(void)
DESC:Removes the specified callback from the list of callbacks associated with the signal. Callback functions can be used to determine specific actions to be performed when the signal is invoked.
PARAMS:id:Callback ID obtained when adding it.
RETURNS:true if the callback with the given ID was removed successfully; otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Signal.clear
DESC:Clears the list of callbacks subscribed for the signal (all subscriptions are removed).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Signal.empty const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the list of subscriptions for the signal is empty.
RETURNS:true if the list of subscriptions for the signal is empty otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Signal.size const
DESC:Returns the total number of callback functions subscribed for the signal.
RETURNS:Number of subscriptions for the signal.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Signal.invoke(Ts)
DESC:Invokes the signal. Callback functions subscribed for this signal are executed according to their order in the list.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Signal.swap(Signal,Signal)
DESC:Swaps the two specified signals.
PARAMS:first:First signal. | second:Second signal.
-
FILE:UnigineSounds.xml
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setAdaptation(float)
DESC:Sets sound occlusion with the specified adaptation time.
PARAMS:adaptation:Time for sound adaptation to a filter, used when the sound source becomes occluded or other way round.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getAdaptation
DESC:Returns the current time set for sound adaptation, that is used when the sound source becomes occluded or other way round.
RETURNS:Time for sound adaptation to a filter.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setAttenuation(int)
DESC:Sets the specified sound attenuation mode. Attenuation is the ability of a sound to lower in volume as the player moves away from it.
PARAMS:attenuation:One of the ATTENUATION_* variables. The default value is ATTENUATION_LINEAR_CLAMPED.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getAttenuation
DESC:Returns the current sound attenuation mode.
RETURNS:One of the ATTENUATION_* variables.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setData(char)
DESC:Sets user data associated with the world. This string is written directly into a *.world file, into the data child tag of the sound tag, for example:
PARAMS:data:New user data. Data can contain an XML formatted string
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getData
DESC:Returns user string data associated with the world. This string is written directly into the data tag of the *.world file, into the data child tag of the sound tag, for example:
RETURNS:User data. Data can contain an XML formatted string.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setDoppler(float)
DESC:Sets the Doppler factor. This parameter allows you to exaggerate or tone-down the Doppler shift effect. By default, it is set to 1.0f.
PARAMS:doppler:Doppler factor.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getDoppler
DESC:Returns the current Doppler factor. This parameter allows you to exaggerate or tone-down the Doppler shift effect. The default value is 1.0f.
RETURNS:Doppler factor.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setEnabled(int)
DESC:Enables or disables all sounds in the scene.
PARAMS:enabled:true to enable all sounds, false to disable them.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.isEnabled
DESC:Returns a value indicating if sounds in the scene are enabled.
RETURNS:true if sounds are enabled; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setHRTF(int)
DESC:Enables or disables the HRTF (Head Related Transfer Function) mode. This mode provides imitation of the surround sound for the stereo wired headset.
PARAMS:hrtf:true to enable binaural sound; false to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.isHRTF
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the binaural HRTF (Head Related Transfer Function) sound is enabled. An HRTF provides imitation of the surround sound for the stereo wired headset.
RETURNS:true if the binaural sound is enabled; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setSourceReverbMode(int)
DESC:Sets sound reverberation mode.
PARAMS:mode:Reverberation mode. One of the REVERB_* variables. The default value is REVERB_MULTIPLE.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getSourceReverbMode
DESC:Returns current sound reverberation mode.
RETURNS:Current sound reverberation mode. One of the REVERB_* variables. The default value is REVERB_MULTIPLE.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setSourceOcclusion(int)
DESC:Enables or disables occlusion for sounds. When enabled, the sound will be occluded when there are other nodes between the listener and the sound source.
PARAMS:occlusion:true to enable occlusion for sounds, false to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.isSourceOcclusion
DESC:Returns a value indicating if occlusion for sounds is enabled. When enabled, the sound will be occluded when there are other nodes between the listener and the sound source.
RETURNS:true if sound occlusion for sounds is enabled; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setScale(float)
DESC:Set the time scale for the sound playing.
PARAMS:scale:Sound time scale. The provided value is clamped in the range [0; 2].
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getScale
DESC:Returns the current time scale for the sound playing.
RETURNS:Sound time scale.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setSourceLimit(int,int)
DESC:Limits the number of simultaneously played sound sources per one mixer channel. This setting is also available in the Editor global sound settings.
PARAMS:source:Number of the mixer channel (from 0 to 31). | limit:The maximum number of sound sources that can be played simultaneously.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getSourceLimit(int)
DESC:Returns the current number of simultaneously played sound sources per one mixer channel.
PARAMS:source:Number of the mixer channel (from 0 to 31).
RETURNS:The maximum number of sound sources that can be played simultaneously.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setSourceVolume(int,float)
DESC:Sets the volume of the specified mixer channel.
PARAMS:source:Number of the mixer channel (from 0 to 31). | volume:Channel volume. The provided value is clamped within [0;1] range, where 0 means muted sound and 1 is the maximum volume.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getSourceVolume(int)
DESC:Returns the current volume of the specified mixer channel.
PARAMS:source:Number of the mixer channel (from 0 to 31).
RETURNS:Volume of the specified mixer channel. The returning value is in range [0;1], where 0 means muted sound and 1 is the maximum volume.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getTotalTime
DESC:Returns the total time of asynchronous loading sounds.
RETURNS:The total time value, milliseconds.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setVelocity(float)
DESC:Sets the velocity value the Doppler shift calculation is based upon. By default, it is set to 343.3f. If you have players moving really fast, then you may want to adjust this to prevent the Doppler shift from distorting the sound too much.
PARAMS:velocity:New velocity value for the Doppler shift calculation to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getVelocity
DESC:Returns the current velocity value the Doppler shift calculation is based upon. By default, it is set to 343.3f. If you have players moving really fast, then you may want to adjust this to prevent the Doppler shift from distorting the sound too much.
RETURNS:Current velocity value for the Doppler shift calculation.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.setVolume(float)
DESC:Sets the sound volume. By default, it is set to 1.0f.
PARAMS:volume:Sound volume. 0 means the muted sound, 1 means the maximum volume.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.getVolume
DESC:Returns the current sound volume. The default value is 1.0f.
RETURNS:Sound volume. 0 means the muted sound, 1 means the maximum volume.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.loadSettings(char,bool)
DESC:Loads the sound settings from the given file.
PARAMS:name:Path to a sound settings file (*.sound). | clear:Clear flag. Set true to clear settings before loading (new settings shall be applied right after loading them), or false not to clear.
RETURNS:true if the sound settings are loaded successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.loadWorld(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml})
DESC:Loads a sound state from the Xml. The sound state includes such settings as the volume, velocity, adaptation, Doppler factor, time scale and number of sound sources and their volumes.
PARAMS:xml:Xml smart pointer.
RETURNS:true if the sound state is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.renderWorld(int)
DESC:Forces update of the sound system: all sound changes (such as play() or stop() events and change of parameters) will be applied at once. The sound thread is updated at 30 FPS. Imagine, you have a sound sample playing and you want to update the time, from which the sample should be played. But playback won't stop immediately, so the a new time value won't be set. You need force updating of the sound thread after stopping it:
PARAMS:force:true to force update of the sound system; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.saveSettings(char,int)
DESC:Saves the current sound settings to the given file.
PARAMS:name:Path to a sound settings file (*.sound). | force:Force flag indcating if forced saving of sound settings is enabled.
RETURNS:true if the sound settings are saved successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.saveState(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
DESC:Saves a sound state into the stream. The sound state includes such settings as the volume, velocity, adaptation, Doppler factor, time scale and number of sound sources and their volumes. Example using saveState() and restoreState() methods:
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true if the sound state is saved successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.restoreState(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
DESC:Restores a sound state from the stream. The sound state includes such settings as the volume, velocity, adaptation, Doppler factor, time scale and number of sound sources and their volumes. Example using saveState() and restoreState() methods:
PARAMS:stream:Stream smart pointer.
RETURNS:true if the sound state is restored successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Sound.saveWorld(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml},int)
DESC:Saves a sound state into the given Xml node. The sound state includes such settings as the volume, velocity, adaptation, Doppler factor, time scale and number of sound sources and their volumes.
PARAMS:xml:Xml smart pointer. | force:Force flag indicating if forced saving of the sound state is enabled.
RETURNS:true if the sound state is saved successfully; otherwise, false.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AmbientSource.#ctor(char,int)
DESC:Constructor. Creates a new ambient sound source using a given sound file.
PARAMS:name:Path to the sound file. | stream:Positive value to create a streaming source, 0 to create a static source. If the flag is set, the sample will not be fully loaded into memory. Instead, its successive parts will be read one by one into a memory buffer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AmbientSource.play
DESC:Starts playing the sample.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AmbientSource.stop
DESC:Stops playback. This function saves the playback position so that playing of the file can be resumed from the same point. The playback won't stop immediately, as the sound thread is updated at 30 FPS. So, when you need to perform operations that require stopping of the playback (for example, updating the time, from which the sample should be played), you need to force update the sound thread after stopping the playback.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SoundReverb.#ctor(Unigine.Math.vec3)
DESC:Constructor. Creates a new reverberation zone of specified size.
PARAMS:size:Size of the reverberation zone in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SoundReverb.type
DESC:Returns the type of the node.
RETURNS:Sound type identifier.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SoundSource.#ctor(char,int)
DESC:Constructor. Creates a new world sound source using a given sound sample file.
PARAMS:name:Path to the sound sample file. | stream:Positive value to create a streaming source, 0 to create a static source. If the flag is set, the sample will not be fully loaded into memory. Instead, its successive parts will be read one by one into a memory buffer.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SoundSource.play
DESC:Starts playing the sample.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SoundSource.stop
DESC:Stops playback. This function doesn't reset the playback position so that playing of the file can be resumed from the same point. The playback won't stop immediately, as the sound thread is updated at 30 FPS. So, when you need to perform operations that require stopping of the playback (for example, updating the time, from which the sample should be played), you need to force update the sound thread after stopping the playback.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SoundSource.type
DESC:Returns the type of the node.
RETURNS:Sound type identifier.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineGraph.removePoint(int,bool)
DESC:Removes a point with a given index from the spline graph.
PARAMS:index:Point index. | merge:Merge flag. When there are two segments attached to the point, use true to merge these segments into one; false removes all segments attached to the point (by default).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineGraph.splitPoint(int)
DESC:Splits the point with the specified index into N points, where N is the number of segments attached to the point. The number of points in the graph shall increase by N-1. All new points will be attached to the corresponding segments.
PARAMS:index:Point index.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineGraph.weldPoints(Unigine.Vector{int,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Merges all points with given indices into one. All common segments between these points shall be removed. All points with given indices are removed from the graph, except for the one having the minimum index value, all segments shall be attached to this point. Resulting point shall be moved to the position of the first point in the given array.
PARAMS:indices:Array containing indices of points to be merged into one.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineGraph.removeSegment(int,bool)
DESC:Removes the segment with a given index.
PARAMS:index:Segment index. | with_points:Use true to remove segment with its starting and ending points, or false to remove the segment only.Points will be removed only in case if they do not belong to other segments. After removal, the last element of the vector of spline graph segments shall be moved to the position of the one removed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineGraph.save(char) const
DESC:Saves the spline graph to the specified XML-file.

RETURNS:true if the spline graph was successfully saved; otherwise, false.

DESC:Inserts a new point into the given segment. The point is parametrically specified on the T (times axis) in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range from the segment's start point.
PARAMS:segment_index:Segment index. | new_point_t:Coordinate of the new point to be added along the horizontal T (times) axis in the range [0.0f, 1.0f].

ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.LOADER_TYPE_X509_CACERT
DESC:X.509 certificate issued by a Certification Agency.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.LOADER_TYPE_RSA_KEY
DESC:RSA key.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_NONE
DESC:The TLS/SSL I/O operation completed.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_SSL
DESC:A non-recoverable, fatal error in the SSL library occurred, usually a protocol error. The OpenSSL error queue contains more information on the error. If this error occurs then no further I/O operations should be performed on the connection.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_WANT_READ
DESC:Error code returned when the last operation was a read operation from a nonblocking BIO. It means that not enough data was available at this time to complete the operation. If at a later time the underlying BIO has data available for reading the same function can be called again.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_WANT_WRITE
DESC:Error code returned when the last operation was a write to a nonblocking BIO and it was unable to sent all data to the BIO. When the BIO is writable again, the same function can be called again.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_WANT_X509_LOOKUP
DESC:The operation did not complete because an application callback has asked to be called again. The TLS/SSL I/O function should be called again later. Details depend on the application.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_SYSCALL
DESC:Some non-recoverable, fatal I/O error occurred. The OpenSSL error queue may contain more information on the error. For socket I/O on Unix systems, consult errno for details. If this error occurs then no further I/O operations should be performed on the connection.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_ZERO_RETURN
DESC:The TLS/SSL peer has closed the connection for writing by sending the close_notify alert. No more data can be read. Note that SSL_ERROR_ZERO_RETURN does not necessarily indicate that the underlying transport has been closed.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_WANT_CONNECT
DESC:The operation did not complete; the same TLS/SSL I/O function should be called again later. The underlying BIO was not connected yet to the peer and the call would block in connect(). The SSL function should be called again when the connection is established.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_WANT_ACCEPT
DESC:The operation did not complete; the same TLS/SSL I/O function should be called again later. The underlying BIO was not connected yet to the peer and the call would block in accept(). The SSL function should be called again when the connection is established.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_WANT_ASYNC
DESC:The operation did not complete because an asynchronous engine is still processing data. The TLS/SSL I/O function should be called again later. The function must be called from the same thread that the original call was made from.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_WANT_ASYNC_JOB
DESC:The asynchronous job could not be started because there were no async jobs available in the pool. The application should retry the operation after a currently executing asynchronous operation for the current thread has completed.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_ERROR_WANT_CLIENT_HELLO_CB
DESC:The operation did not complete because an application callback set by SSL_CTX_set_client_hello_cb() has asked to be called again. The TLS/SSL I/O function should be called again later. Details depend on the application.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_OK
DESC:Hadnshake operation was successful.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_HANDSHAKE_FAILED
DESC:Hadnshake operation failed.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_CTX_METHOD_TLS
DESC:General-purpose version-flexible SSL/TLS methods. The actual protocol version used will be negotiated to the highest version mutually supported by the client and the server. Currently supported protocols are TLS 1.0, TLS 1.1, and TLS 1.2.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_CTX_METHOD_TLS_1_0
DESC:Transport Layer Security Version 1.0 protocol.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_CTX_METHOD_TLS_1_1
DESC:Transport Layer Security Version 1.1 protocol.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_CTX_METHOD_TLS_1_2
DESC:Transport Layer Security Version 1.2 protocol.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_CTX_METHOD_DTLS
DESC:Version-flexible DTLS methods. Currently supported protocols are DTLS 1.0 and DTLS 1.2.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_CTX_METHOD_DTLS_1
DESC:Datagram Transport Layer Security Version 1.0 protocol.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SSLSocket.SSL_CTX_METHOD_DTLS_1_2
DESC:Datagram Transport Layer Security Version 1.2 protocol.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Blob.compress(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream},int)
DESC:Compresses the blob and writes it into the given stream. This method uses zlib compression which is better than Lz4 (see the compressLz4() method), but significantly slower.
PARAMS:dest:Destination stream. | quality:Compression quality (0 is for fast compression, 1 is for a small size).
RETURNS:1 if the data is compressed successfully; otherwise, 0.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Stream.readToken
DESC:Reads a token from the stream. A token is a single word delimited by white space or a string in quotes, for example, "word" or "many words". A token is read starting from the current position up to the white space or line feed ("\n"), or if the first character is a double quote mark (") up to the second double quote mark (returned token will not contain any quotes). The maximum length of the string is 4096 bytes.
RETURNS:Received token.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.File.open(char,char,bool) const
DESC:Opens a file with a given access mode: rb to open file for reading; wb to create a new file. r - Open for reading only. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file. r+ - Open for reading and writing. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file. w - Truncate file to zero length or create file for writing. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file. w+ - Open for reading and writing. The file is created if it does not exist, otherwise it is truncated to zero length. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file. a - Open for appending (writing at end of file). The file is created if it does not exist. The stream is positioned at the end of the file. a+ - Open for reading and appending (writing at end of file). The file is created if it does not exist. The initial file position for reading is at the beginning of the file, but output is always appended to the end of the file. b - For binary files. Otherwise, the file is deemed a text file, and Windows replaces \n with \n\r in text files.
PARAMS:name:Name of the file to open. | mode:Access mode.
RETURNS:true if the file is opened (or created, if the wb access mode is specified) successfully; otherwise, false.
-

If the socket is blocking (either by default, or set intentionally), the timeout period is defined either by OS. This method blocks the thread in which it is called, regardless of whether the socket is set as blocking or non-blocking.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.String class.format(char,va_list)
DESC:Returns a stack of formatted strings. A format string is composed of zero or more ordinary characters (excluding %) that are copied directly to the result string and control sequences, each of which results in fetching its own parameter. Each control sequence consists of a percent sign (%) followed by one or more of these elements, in order: An optional number, a width specifier, that says how many characters (minimum) this conversion should result in. An optional precision specifier that says how many decimal digits should be displayed for floating-point numbers. A type specifier that says what type the argument data should be treated as. Possible types: c: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as a character with that ASCII value. d or i: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as a (signed) decimal number. o: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as an octal number. u: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as an unsigned decimal number. x: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as a hexadecimal number (with lower-case letters). X: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as a hexadecimal number (with upper-case letters). f: the argument is treated as a float and presented as a floating-point number. g: the same as e or f, the shortest one is selected. G: the same as E or F, the shortest one is selected. e: the argument is treated as using the scientific notation with lower-case 'e' (e.g. 1.2e+2). E: the argument is treated as using the scientific notation with upper-case 'E' (e.g. 1.2E+2). s: the argument is treated as and presented as a string. p: the argument is treated as and presented as a pointer address. %: a literal percent character. No argument is required.
PARAMS:format:Format string. | argptr:Arguments pointer.
RETURNS:Stack of formatted strings.
-

An optional precision specifier that says how many decimal digits should be displayed for floating-point numbers. A type specifier that says what type the argument data should be treated as. Possible types: c: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as a character with that ASCII value. d or i: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as a (signed) decimal number. o: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as an octal number. u: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as an unsigned decimal number. x: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as a hexadecimal number (with lower-case letters). X: the argument is treated as an integer and presented as a hexadecimal number (with upper-case letters). f: the argument is treated as a float and presented as a floating-point number. g: the same as e or f, the shortest one is selected. ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderTarget.bindUnorderedAccessTexture2DArray(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},bool,bool,int,int)
DESC:Binds the specified layer of a 2D texture array on the specified mipmap level to the specified slot for unordered access.
PARAMS:slot:Texture slot. | texture:Unordered access 2D texture array to be bound. | writeonly:Access flag. true to use the texture for writing only, otherwise false. | atomic:Set true to bind the texture with the GL_32UI format; otherwise — false. This flag is to be set for OpenGL only. | layer:Number of the 2D texture array layer. With the default value of -1, all layers of the texture on a specified mip level are bound. | mip:Mipmap level number in the range from 0 to the total number of mipmaps.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderTarget.bindUnorderedAccessTextureCube(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},bool,bool,int,int)
DESC:Binds the specified face of a texture cube on the specified mipmap level to the specified slot for unordered access.
PARAMS:slot:Texture slot. | texture:Unordered access texture cube to be bound. | writeonly:Access flag. true to use the texture for writing only, otherwise false. | atomic:Set true to bind the texture with the GL_32UI format; otherwise — false. This flag is to be set for OpenGL only. | face:The face of the cube. With the default value of -1, all faces of the texture on a specified mip level are bound. | mip:Mipmap level number in the range from 0 to the total number of mipmaps.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderTarget.bindUnorderedAccessTextureCubeArray(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},bool,bool,int,int,int)
DESC:Binds the specified layer and face of a texture cube on the specified mipmap level to the specified slot for unordered access.
PARAMS:slot:Texture slot. | texture:Unordered access texture cube array to be bound. | writeonly:Access flag. true to use the texture for writing only, otherwise false. | atomic:Set true to bind the texture with the GL_32UI format; otherwise — false. This flag is to be set for OpenGL only. | layer:Number of the texture cube array layer. | face:The face of the cube. With the default value of -1, all faces of the texture on a specified mip level are bound. | mip:Mipmap level number in the range from 0 to the total number of mipmaps.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RenderTarget.bindUnorderedAccessTexture3D(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},bool,bool,int,int)
DESC:Binds the specified layer of a 3D texture on the specified mipmap level to the specified slot for unordered access.
PARAMS:slot:Texture slot. | texture:Unordered access 3D texture to be bound. | writeonly:Access flag. true to use the texture for writing only, otherwise false. | atomic:Set true to bind the texture with the GL_32UI format; otherwise — false. This flag is to be set for OpenGL only. | depth:3D texture depth layer. With the default value of -1, all depth layers of the texture on a specified mip level are bound. | mip:Mipmap level number in the range from 0 to the total number of mipmaps.
