ENTRY:M:Unigine.Texture.setImage2D(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int,int)
DESC:Sets texture data using the data of the specified 2D or 2D array image. The following conditions must be satisfied: Both texture and image types must be either 2D or 2D_ARRAY. Texture resolution must be greater or equal to the image resolution. Image and texture mipmap counts must be equal (the same is for layer counts of 2D arrays).
PARAMS:image:Source image to be used for setting texture data. | offset_x:Offset along the X axis (in pixels) starting from which the data of the specified image is to be taken. The following condition must be satisfied: offset_x &lt; texture_width - image_width. | offset_y:Offset along the Y axis (in pixels) starting from which the data of the specified image is to be taken. The following condition must be satisfied: offset_y &lt; texture_height - image_height. | texture_format:Texture format identifier (see the FORMAT_* variables), or -1 - auto-detect.
RETURNS:true if the data was set successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Texture.setImageLayer(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int,int)
DESC:Sets the data of the specified layer of the 2D texture array using the data of the specified 2D image. The following conditions must be satisfied: Texture and image must have the same resolution. Image and texture mipmap counts must be equal (the same is for layer counts of 2D arrays).
PARAMS:image:Source image to be used for setting the data of the 2D texture array layer. | layer:Number of the 2D texture array layer, for which the data is to be set. | texture_format:Texture format identifier (see the FORMAT_* variables), or -1 - auto-detect.
RETURNS:true if the data was set successfully; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Texture.render2D(float,float,float,float)
DESC:Renders 2D texture. This function creates 4 vertices (2 polygons) by using 2 X-coordinates and 2 Y-coordinates and sends it to be rendered.
PARAMS:x0:The first X-coordinate. | y0:The first Y-coordinate. | x1:The second X-coordinate. | y1:The second Y-coordinate.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Texture.render2DArray(int,float,float,float,float)
DESC:Renders 2D Array texture. This function creates 4 vertices (2 polygons) of the texture layer by using 2 X-coordinates and 2 Y-coordinates and sends it to be rendered.
PARAMS:layer:The number of layer. | x0:The first X-coordinate. | y0:The first Y-coordinate. | x1:The second X-coordinate. | y1:The second Y-coordinate.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Texture.render2DScreen(float,float,float,float)
DESC:Renders 2D Screen texture. This function creates 3 vertices (1 polygon) and and sends texture to be rendered inside the polygon to avoid artifacts on the edge of 2 polygons if the anti-aliasing is used.
PARAMS:x0:The first X-coordinate. | y0:The first Y-coordinate. | x1:The second X-coordinate. | y1:The second Y-coordinate.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Texture.renderCube(int,float,float,float,float)
DESC:Renders Cube texture. This function creates 4 vertices (2 polygons) of the given face of the cube texture by using 2 X-coordinates and 2 Y-coordinates and sends it to be rendered.
PARAMS:face:The face of the cube. | x0:The first X-coordinate. | y0:The first Y-coordinate. | x1:The second X-coordinate. | y1:The second Y-coordinate.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Texture.renderCubeArray(int,int,float,float,float,float)
DESC:Renders Cube Array texture. This function creates 4 vertices (2 polygons) of the given face of the cube texture layer by using 2 X-coordinates and 2 Y-coordinates and sends it to be rendered.
PARAMS:face:The face of the cube. | layer:The layer number. | x0:The first X-coordinate. | y0:The first Y-coordinate. | x1:The second X-coordinate. | y1:The second Y-coordinate.

DESC:Copy constructor. Initializes the object by copying the raw value from another atomic object, ensuring atomic consistency.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator Type() const
DESC:Implicitly converts the AtomicInteger object to a value of type Type. Internally calls fetch() to return a thread-safe snapshot of the current value.
RETURNS:Returns copy of the current value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getUnsafeRawValue
DESC:Provides direct, non-synchronized access to the internal raw value. Calling this bypasses all thread safety and must only be used when external synchronization is guaranteed by the caller.
RETURNS:Returns a reference to the internal raw value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getUnsafeRawValue const

DESC:Returns a pointer to the internal raw value.

-

DESC:Const-qualified version of getRawValuePtr(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getUnsafeValue
DESC:Provides direct, non-synchronized access to the internal logical value, reinterpreted from the raw data. Unsafe in multithreaded contexts unless externally synchronized.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getUnsafeValue const

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getValuePtr

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.getValuePtr const

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetch const
DESC:Retrieves the current value in a lock-free, thread-safe manner. Performs an atomic read of the raw internal storage and reinterprets the result.
RETURNS:Returns copy of the stored value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.store(Type)
DESC:Stores a new value by writing its raw binary representation atomically into internal storage. Ensures thread-safe write access without locks.
PARAMS:v:The new value to store.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator=(Type)
DESC:Copy assignment operator. Stores the new value atomically by calling store().
PARAMS:v:The new value to assign.
RETURNS:Returns the assigned value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator=(AtomicInteger)
DESC:Copy assignment operator. Atomically replaces the internal value with the one from another atomic object.
PARAMS:v:Another atomic to copy from.
RETURNS:Returns the copied value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.swap(Type)
DESC:Atomically replaces the current value with a new one and returns the old value.
PARAMS:v:The new value to set.
RETURNS:Returns the value that was stored before swap.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.compareAndSwap(Type,Type)
DESC:Performs a lock-free compare-and-swap operation. If the current value equals old_value, it is replaced with new_value.
PARAMS:old_value:Expected current value. | new_value:New value to assign if the current matches the expected.
RETURNS:Returns true if the internal value was updated; false if the current value did not match old_value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.spinLock(Type,Type)
DESC:Continuously attempts to atomically swap the value from old_value to new_value using compareAndSwap().
PARAMS:old_value:Expected current value. | new_value:New value to assign if the current matches the expected.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.waitValue(Type)
DESC:Blocks the current thread in a spin loop until the internal value becomes equal to the provided one. Internally calls spinLock(v, v) and rechecks after each failure.
PARAMS:v:The value to wait for.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchAdd(Type)
DESC:Atomically adds value to the current atomic value and returns the previous value.
PARAMS:v:The value to add.
RETURNS:Returns the value held before the addition.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchSub(Type)
DESC:Atomically subtracts value from the current atomic value and returns the previous value.
PARAMS:v:The value to subtract.
RETURNS:Returns the value held before the subtraction.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchAnd(Type)
DESC:Atomically performs a bitwise AND with value and returns the previous value.
PARAMS:v:The value to AND with.
RETURNS:Returns the value before the operation.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchOr(Type)
DESC:Atomically performs a bitwise OR with value and returns the previous value.
PARAMS:v:The value to OR with.
RETURNS:Returns the value before the operation.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchXor(Type)
DESC:Atomically performs a bitwise XOR with value and returns the previous value.
PARAMS:v:The value to XOR with.
RETURNS:Returns the value before the operation.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchInc

RETURNS:The value held before the increment.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.fetchDec
DESC:Atomically decrements the current value by 1.
RETURNS:The value held before the decrement.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator+=(Type)
DESC:Atomically adds value to the current value and returns the result after the addition.
PARAMS:v:The value to add.
RETURNS:The updated value after the addition.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator-=(Type)
DESC:Atomically subtracts value from the current value and returns the result after the subtraction.
PARAMS:v:The value to subtract.
RETURNS:The updated value after the subtraction.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator++(int)
DESC:Postfix increment. Atomically increments the current value by 1.
PARAMS::dummy parameter to distinguish from the prefix version.
RETURNS:The value before the increment.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator--(int)
DESC:Postfix decrement. Atomically decrements the current value by 1.
PARAMS::dummy parameter to distinguish from the prefix version.
RETURNS:The value before the decrement.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator++
DESC:Prefix increment. Atomically increments the current value by 1.
RETURNS:The value after the increment.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator--
DESC:Prefix decrement. Atomically decrements the current value by 1.
RETURNS:The value after the decrement.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator&=(Type)
DESC:Atomically performs a bitwise AND with value and updates the current value.
PARAMS:v:The value to AND with.
RETURNS:The updated value after the operation.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator|=(Type)
DESC:Atomically performs a bitwise OR with value and updates the current value.
PARAMS:v:The value to OR with.
RETURNS:The updated value after the operation.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicInteger.operator^=(Type)
DESC:Atomically performs a bitwise XOR with value and updates the current value.
PARAMS:v:The value to XOR with.
RETURNS:The updated value after the operation.

DESC:Blocks the current thread in a spin loop until the internal value becomes equal to the provided one. Internally calls spinLock(v, v) and rechecks after each failure.
PARAMS:v:The value to wait for.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.fetchAdd(long)
DESC:Atomically moves the pointer forward by a given number of positions.
PARAMS:v:The number of elements to add; internally multiplied by sizeof(*Type). (e.g. If Type = int* and v = 2, the pointer is advanced by 2 * 4 = 8 bytes.
RETURNS:Returns the value held before the addition.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.fetchSub(long)
DESC:Atomically moves the pointer backward by a given number of positions.
PARAMS:v:The number of elements to subtract; internally multiplied by sizeof(*Type). (e.g. If Type = int* and v = 2, the pointer is moved backward by 2 * 4 = 8 bytes.
RETURNS:Returns the value held before the subtraction.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.fetchInc
DESC:Atomically increments the pointer by one position.
RETURNS:Returns the value held before the increment.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.fetchDec
DESC:Atomically decrements the pointer by one position.
RETURNS:Returns the value held before the decrement.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator+=(long)
DESC:Atomically moves the pointer by a given number of positions.
PARAMS:v:The number of elements to add; internally multiplied by sizeof(*Type). (e.g. If Type = int* and v = 2, the pointer is advanced by 2 * 4 = 8 bytes.
RETURNS:Returns the value held after the addition.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator-=(long)
DESC:Atomically moves the pointer backward by a given number of positions.
PARAMS:v:The number of elements to subtract; internally multiplied by sizeof(*Type). (e.g. If Type = int* and v = 2, the pointer is moved backward by 2 * 4 = 8 bytes.
RETURNS:Returns the value held after the subtraction.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator++(int)
DESC:Atomically decrements the pointer by one position (postfix form).
PARAMS::dummy parameter to distinguish from the prefix version.
RETURNS:Postfix increment. Returns the value held before the decrement.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator--(int)
DESC:Atomically increments the pointer by one position (postfix form).
PARAMS::dummy parameter to distinguish from the prefix version.
RETURNS:Postfix decrement. Returns the value held before the increment.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator++
DESC:Prefix increment. Atomically increments the pointer by one position.
RETURNS:Returns the value held after the increment.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicPointer.operator--
DESC:Prefix decrement. Atomically decrements the pointer by one position.
RETURNS:Returns the value held after the decrement.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AtomicPointer.isLockFree
DESC:Indicates that the implementation is lock-free and performs atomic operations without using mutexes.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AtomicPointer.SIZE_TYPE
DESC:Represents the size (in bytes) of the object pointed to by the pointer type &lt;Type&gt;

ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.AtomicWithMutex
DESC:Default constructor. Initializes the internal value with its default constructor.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.AtomicWithMutex(Type)
DESC:Constructor. Initializes the internal value with the provided input.
PARAMS:v:Initial value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.AtomicWithMutex(AtomicWithMutex)
DESC:Copy constructor. Locks both source and destination mutexes to safely copy the provided value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.operator Type()
DESC:Implicitly converts the AtomicWithMutex object to a value of type Type. Internally calls fetch() to return a thread-safe snapshot of the current value.
RETURNS:Returns copy of the current value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getUnsafeValue
DESC:Provides direct, non-synchronized access to the internal value. Calling this bypasses all thread safety and must only be used when external synchronization is guaranteed by the caller.
RETURNS:Returns non-thread-safe reference to the stored value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getUnsafeValue const
DESC:Const-qualified version of getUnsafeValue(). Provides read-only, non-thread-safe access to the stored value.
RETURNS:Returns non-thread-safe const reference to the stored value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getValuePtr
DESC:Returns a raw pointer to the internal value without locking. Unsafe in multithreaded contexts unless externally synchronized.
RETURNS:Returns pointer to the internal value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getValuePtr const
DESC:Const-qualified version of getValuePtr().
RETURNS:Returns const pointer to the internal value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getMutex
DESC:Provides direct access to the internal mutex object. This allows external code to manually lock or unlock the mutex.
RETURNS:Returns the reference to the mutex used for protecting the internal value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.getMutex const
DESC:Const-qualified version of getMutex().
RETURNS:Returns the const reference to the mutex used for protecting the internal value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.fetch const
DESC:Retrieves the current value in a thread-safe manner. Acquires the mutex, copies the internal value, then releases the mutex. Preferred over direct access when consistent reads are required.
RETURNS:Returns copy of the stored value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.store(Type)
DESC:Sets the internal value to a new value in a thread-safe way. The entire assignment is protected by the mutex to avoid race conditions with readers or other writers.
PARAMS:v:The new value to store.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.operator=(Type)
DESC:Thread-safe assignment operator that stores a new value internally. Equivalent to calling store().
PARAMS:v:The new value to assign.
RETURNS:Returns a const reference to the assigned value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.operator=(AtomicWithMutex)
DESC:Thread-safe copy assignment from another AtomicWithMutex. Locks both the source and destination mutexes to prevent data races.
PARAMS:v:Another AtomicWithMutex to copy from.
RETURNS:Returns the copied value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.swap(Type)
DESC:Atomically replaces the current value with a new one and returns the old value.
PARAMS:v:The new value to set.
RETURNS:Returns the value that was stored before swap.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.compareAndSwap(Type,Type)
DESC:Performs a compare-and-swap operation. If the current value equals old_value, it is replaced with new_value.
PARAMS:old_value:Expected current value. | new_value:New value to assign if the current matches the expected.
RETURNS:true if the internal value was updated; false if the current value did not math old_value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.spinLock(Type,Type)
DESC:Continuously attempts to atomically swap the value from old_value to new_value using compareAndSwap().
PARAMS:old_value:Expected current value. | new_value:New value to assign if the current matches the expected.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.waitValue(Type)
DESC:Blocks the current thread in a spin loop until the internal value becomes equal to the provided one. Internally calls spinLock(v, v) and rechecks after each failure.
PARAMS:v:The value to wait for.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.AtomicWithMutex.isLockFree
DESC:Indicates that this implementation is not lock-free, unlike standard atomic types such as std::atomic.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BackoffSpinner.BackoffSpinner
DESC:Constructor. Creates a new Backoff Spinner.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.BackoffSpinner.spin
DESC:Implements adaptive backoff by progressively increasing wait intervals. Begins with exponentially growing CPU pause instructions based on an internal counter; after reaching a threshold, yields to allow other threads to execute. Increments the backoff counter on each invocation.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.CPUShader.runSync(int)
DESC:Runs CPU shader code synchronously. This method is blocking. No additional threads are created, as the Engine's thread pool is used.
PARAMS:threads_count:Number of threads to be used. The default value of -1 sets an optimum number of threads calculated for the particular PC.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.CPUShader.runAsync(int)
DESC:Runs CPU shader code asynchronously. This method is non-blocking. No additional threads are created, as the Engine's thread pool is used.
PARAMS:threads_count:Number of threads to be used. The default value of -1 sets an optimum number of threads calculated for the particular PC.
-

-

-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.MutexAdvance
DESC:Default constructor. Initializes the internal mutex and sets the lock state to unlocked.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.lock
DESC:Acquires the internal mutex and marks the lock state as active.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.unlock
DESC:Releases the internal mutex and marks the lock state as inactive.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.tryLock
DESC:Attempts to acquire the lock without blocking. First checks the internal flag for a fast-path rejection, then tries to acquire the underlying mutex.
RETURNS:Returns true if the lock was successfully acquired, false otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.isLocked
DESC:Returns the current lock status of the mutex by checking the internal flag.
RETURNS:Returns true if the lock is currently held, false otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.waitForce
DESC:Forces the current thread to wait by acquiring and immediately releasing the lock.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexAdvance.wait
DESC:Waits for the mutex to be released if it is currently locked. Returns immediately if the lock is not held.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexCriticalSection.MutexCriticalSection
DESC:Constructor. Initializes the internal CRITICAL_SECTION object.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexCriticalSection.~MutexCriticalSection
DESC:Destructor. Destroys the internal CRITICAL_SECTION object.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexCriticalSection.lock
DESC:Acquires the critical section, blocking the calling thread if necessary until the lock becomes available.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexCriticalSection.tryLock
DESC:Attempts to acquire the critical section without blocking.
RETURNS:Returns true if the lock was succesfully acquired; false otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexCriticalSection.unlock
DESC:Releases the critical section, allowing other threads to enter.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexSlim.MutexSlim
DESC:Constructor. Initializes the internal SRWLOCK by calling WinAPI::InitializeSRWLock.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexSlim.~MutexSlim
DESC:Destructor. Asserts that the lock is not held during destruction.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexSlim.lock
DESC:Acquires the slim lock in exclusive (write) mode. Blocks the calling thread if the lock is already held.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexSlim.tryLock
DESC:Attempts to acquire the slim lock in exclusive mode without blocking.
RETURNS:Returns true if the mutex was successfully locked, false otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.MutexSlim.unlock
DESC:Releases the exclusive slim lock.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexSpin.MutexSpin
DESC:Default constructor. Initializes the internal lock state to unlocked.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexSpin.lock
DESC:Acquires the spinlock by continuously checking the internal lock variable until it becomes available. Once the lock is acquired, sets the lock state.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexSpin.tryLock
DESC:Attempts to acquire the spinlock without blocking.
RETURNS:Returns true if the lock was successfully acquired; false if the lock is already held by another thread.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexSpin.unlock
DESC:Releases the spinlock by setting the internal lock variable to the unlocked state.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexSpin.isLocked const
DESC:Checks whether the spinlock is currently held by any thread.
RETURNS:Returns true if the spinlock is currently locked; false otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.MutexSpin.wait
DESC:Spins until the lock becomes free without attempting to acquire it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.UnixAPI.MutexPThread.MutexPThread
DESC:Constructor. Initializes the internal pthread_mutex_t with default attributes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.UnixAPI.MutexPThread.~MutexPThread
DESC:Destructor. Destroys the internal mutex. Must not be called while the mutex is locked.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.UnixAPI.MutexPThread.lock
DESC:Blocks the calling thread until the mutex becomes available and then locks it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.UnixAPI.MutexPThread.tryLock
DESC:Attempts to lock the mutex without blocking.
RETURNS:Returns true if the mutex was successfully locked, false otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.UnixAPI.MutexPThread.unlock
DESC:Releases the mutex, allowing other threads to acquire it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.ReentrantMutexBase
DESC:Default constructor. Initializes the internal state, setting the lock as available.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.lock
DESC:Acquires the mutex. If the current thread already owns the lock, increments the reentrancy depth instead of re-locking the underlying mutex.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.tryLock
DESC:Attempts to acquire the mutex without blocking. If the current thread already owns the lock, increments the reentrancy depth.
RETURNS:Returns true if if the mutex was successfully acquired; false if the mutex is currently held by another thread.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.unlock
DESC:Releases the mutex. If the lock has been acquired multiple times by the same thread, decrements the reentrancy depth. Once the depth reaches zero, releases the underlying mutex and clears thread ownership.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.isLocked
DESC:Checks whether the mutex is currently considered locked by any thread.
RETURNS:Ruturns true if the mutex is locked; false otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.waitForce
DESC:Forces the current thread to wait until the mutex becomes available by acquiring and then immediately releasing the lock.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.ReentrantMutexBase.wait
DESC:Waits for the mutex to be released by another thread. If the mutex is currently unowned or already owned by the calling thread, the method returns immediately. Otherwise, it blocks by calling waitForce().
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.RWMutexSlim
DESC:Constructor. Initializes the internal SRWLOCK by calling WinAPI::InitializeSRWLock.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.~RWMutexSlim
DESC:Destructor. Asserts that the lock is not held during destruction.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.lockRead
DESC:Acquires a shared (read) lock. Multiple threads can hold the read lock concurrently.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.tryLockRead
DESC:Attempts to acquire a shared (read) lock without blocking.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.unlockRead
DESC:Releases a shared (read) lock previously acquired.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.lockWrite
DESC:Acquires an exclusive (write) lock. Blocks until no other thread holds a read or write lock.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.tryLockWrite
DESC:Attempts to acquire an exclusive (write) lock without blocking.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.unlockWrite
DESC:Releases an exclusive (write) lock previously acquired.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.lock
DESC:Alias for lockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSlim to be used in generic locking interfaces.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.tryLock
DESC:Alias for tryLockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSlim to be used in generic locking interfaces.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WinAPI.RWMutexSlim.unlock
DESC:Alias for unlockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSlim to be used in generic locking interfaces.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.RWMutexSpin
DESC:Default constructor. Initializes the internal lock state with no active readers or writers.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.lockRead
DESC:Acquires a shared (read) lock. Multiple threads can acquire read access concurrently as long as no writer holds the lock.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.tryLockRead
DESC:Attempts to acquire a read lock without blocking. Fails if a writer currently holds the lock.
RETURNS:Returns true if the read lock was successfully acquired; false otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.unlockRead
DESC:Releases a previously acquired read lock by decrementing the reader count.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.lockWrite
DESC:Acquires an exclusive (write) lock. Blocks until no other thread holds a read or write lock.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.tryLockWrite
DESC:Attempts to acquire a write lock without blocking. Succeeds only if no readers or writers currently hold the lock.
RETURNS:Returns true if the write lock was successfully acquired; false otherwise.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.unlockWrite
DESC:Releases a previously acquired write lock by resetting the writer flag.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.lock
DESC:Alias for lockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSpin to be used in generic locking interfaces.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.tryLock
DESC:Alias for tryLockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSpin to be used in generic locking interfaces.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.RWMutexSpin.unlock
DESC:Alias for unlockWrite(). Allows RWMutexSpin to be used in generic locking interfaces.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Utils.date(char,longlong)
DESC:Returns given time as a string. The content of format string with format specifiers expanded with the corresponding values that represent the time described in time.
PARAMS:format:Format string containing any combination of regular characters and special format specifiers. These format specifiers are replaced by the function to the corresponding values to represent the time specified in timeptr. They all begin with a percentage (%) sign, and are as follows:SpecifierReplaced byExample%aAbbreviated weekday nameThu%bAbbreviated month nameAug%dDate and time representation equivalent to %a %b %D, %h:%mThu Aug 23, 14:55%sSecond (00-61)15%mMinute (00-59)55%hHour (00-24)14%DMonth day (1-31)25%MMonth (1-12)11%YYear2016%WWeek day (1-7)5%A % sign% | time:Time value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Utils.date(char)
DESC:Returns current time as a string. The content of format string with format specifiers expanded with the corresponding values that represent the current time.
PARAMS:format:Format string containing any combination of regular characters and special format specifiers. These format specifiers are replaced by the function to the corresponding values to represent the time specified in timeptr. They all begin with a percentage (%) sign, and are as follows:SpecifierReplaced byExample%aAbbreviated weekday nameThu%bAbbreviated month nameAug%dDate and time representation equivalent to %a %b %D, %h:%mThu Aug 23, 14:55%sSecond (00-61)15%mMinute (00-59)55%hHour (00-24)14%DMonth day (1-31)25%MMonth (1-12)11%YYear2016%WWeek day (1-7)5%A % sign%
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Utils.loadObjectMesh(char)

PARAMS:name:Path to the mesh.
RETURNS:Pointer to the node corresponding to the loaded mesh; 0 if the mesh cannot be loaded.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.#ctor
DESC:Creates a new viewport with default settings. We don't recommend creating a viewport every frame, as such approach is unoptimal and exhaust GPU resources. Create viewports in instead, to have them cached for further use.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.appendSkipFlags(int)
DESC:Appends specified skip flags to the list of currently used ones.
PARAMS:flags:Skip flags to append.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.checkSkipFlags(int)
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the specified skip flags are set for the current viewport.
PARAMS:flags:Skip flags to check.
RETURNS:1 if the skip flags are set; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.removeSkipFlags(int)
DESC:Removes specified skip flags from the list of currently used ones.
PARAMS:flags:Skip flags to remove.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.render(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera})
DESC:Renders an image from the specified camera. This method is used to integrate the engine to a 3rd party renderer. To render an image from the camera to the RenderTarget interface, do the following:
PARAMS:camera:Camera an image from which should be rendered.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.render(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},int,int)
DESC:Renders an image of the specified size from the specified camera to the current rendering target.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | width:Image width, in pixels. | height:Image height, in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderEngine(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera})
DESC:Renders an Engine viewport for the specified camera to the current rendering target. This method renders a splash screen and provides an image in accordance with panoramic and stereo rendering settings.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderTexture2D(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture})
DESC:Renders an image from the camera to the specified 2D texture.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | texture:Target 2D texture to save the result to.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderTexture2D(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},int,int,bool)
DESC:Renders an image of the specified size from the camera to a 2D texture.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | texture:Target 2D texture to save the result to. | width:Texture width, in pixels. | height:Texture height, in pixels. | hdr:HDR flag.This parameter determines the format of the 2D texture:1 - texture format will be set to RGBA16F0 - texture format will be set to RGBA8
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderTextureCube(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},bool)
DESC:Renders the image from the camera to the cubemap texture.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | texture:Target Cube texture to save the result to. | local_space:A flag indicating if the camera angle should be used for the cube map rendering.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderTextureCube(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},int,bool,bool)
DESC:Renders the image from the camera to the cube map of the specified size.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | texture:Target cube map to save the result to. | size:Cube map edge size. | hdr:HDR flag.This parameter determines the format of the 2D texture:1 - texture format will be set to RGBA16F0 - texture format will be set to RGBA8 | local_space:A flag indicating if the camera angle should be used for the cube map rendering.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node})
DESC:Renders the given node with all children to the current rendering target.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | node:Node to be rendered.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderNode(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,int)
DESC:Renders the given node with all children to the current rendering target.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | node:Node to be rendered. | width:Image width, in pixels. | height:Image height, in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderNodeTexture2D(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},int,int,bool)
DESC:Renders the given node with all children to the 2D texture of the specified size.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | node:Pointer to the node to be rendered. | texture:Target 2D texture to save the result to. | width:Texture width, in pixels. | height:Texture height, in pixels. | hdr:HDR flag.This parameter determines the format of the 2D texture:1 - texture format will be set to RGBA16F0 - texture format will be set to RGBA8
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderNodeTexture2D(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture})
DESC:Renders the given node with all children to the specified 2D texture.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | node:Pointer to the node to be rendered. | texture:Target 2D texture to save the result to.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderNodes(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Renders given nodes with all their children to the current rendering target.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | nodes:List of the nodes to be rendered.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderNodes(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},int,int)
DESC:Renders given nodes with all their children to the current rendering target of the specified size.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | nodes:List of the nodes to be rendered. | width:Image width, in pixels. | height:Image height, in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderNodesTexture2D(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},int,int,int)
DESC:Renders given nodes with all their children to the 2D texture of the specified size.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | nodes:List of the nodes to be rendered. | texture:Target 2D texture to save the result to. | width:Texture width, in pixels. | height:Texture height, in pixels. | hdr:HDR flag.This parameter determines the format of the 2D image:1 - texture format will be set to RGBA16F0 - texture format will be set to RGBA8
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderNodesTexture2D(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture})
DESC:Renders given nodes with all their children to the specified 2D texture.
PARAMS:camera:Camera, an image from which should be rendered. | nodes:List of the nodes to be rendered. | texture:Target 2D texture to save the result to.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderStereo(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},char)
DESC:Renders a stereo image in the current viewport.
PARAMS:camera_left:Camera that renders an image for the left eye. | camera_right:Camera that renders an image for the right eye. | stereo_material:List of names of stereo materials to be used.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderStereoPeripheral(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Camera},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Texture},char)
DESC:Renders a stereo image for HMDs having context (peripheral) and focus displays. This method saves performance on shadows and reflections along with other optimizations reducing rendering load, such as reduced resolutions for textures.
PARAMS:camera_left:Camera that renders an image for the left context (low-res) display. | camera_right:Camera that renders an image for the right context (low-res) display. | camera_focus_left:Camera that renders an image for the left focus (high-res) display. | camera_focus_right:Camera that renders an image for the right focus (high-res) display. | texture_left:Texture to save the image rendered for the left context (low-res) display. | texture_right:Texture to save the image rendered for the right context (low-res) display. | texture_focus_left:Texture to save the image rendered for the left focus (high-res) display. | texture_focus_right:Texture to save the image rendered for the right focus (high-res) display. | stereo_material:List of names of stereo materials to be used.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.setStereoHiddenAreaMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh})
DESC:Sets custom meshes to be used for culling pixels, that are not visible in VR. Requires render_stereo_hidden_area = 2
PARAMS:hidden_area_mesh_left:Mesh representing hidden area for the left eye. | hidden_area_mesh_right:Mesh representing hidden area for the right eye.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.clearStereoHiddenAreaMesh
DESC:Clears meshes that represent hidden areas for both, left and right eye. Hidden areas are used for culling pixels, that are not visible in VR
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.setEnvironmentTexturePath(char)
DESC:Sets the path to the cubemap defining the environment color for the viewport. This texture is used for imitating landscape reflections and lighting in accordance with the ground mask.
PARAMS:name:Path to the cubemap defining the environment color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.getEnvironmentTexturePath
DESC:Returns the path to the cubemap defining the environment color set for the viewport. This texture is used for imitating landscape reflections and lighting in accordance with the ground mask.
RETURNS:Path to the cubemap defining the environment color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.resetEnvironmentTexture
DESC:Resets the current environment texture to the default one.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.renderVREngine
DESC:Renders the VR viewport if VR is enabled, taking into account the vr mirror mode set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.lockResources
DESC:Locks resources (such as temporal old textures) in the current viewport so they won't be reused or released.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.unlockResources
DESC:Unlocks resources (such as temporal old textures) in the current viewport so they can be reused and released by the engine.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Viewport.isLockedResources const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if resources (such as temporal old textures) in the current viewport are locked and won't be reused or released.
RETURNS:true if the resources are locked; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_SHADOWS
DESC:Skip shadows rendering in the viewport.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_VISUALIZER
DESC:Skip rendering of the visualizer in the viewport. This flag is set by default for a new viewport.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_POSTEFFECTS
DESC:Skip rendering of post effects in the viewport.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_DYNAMIC_REFLECTIONS
DESC:Skip rendering of dynamic reflections in the viewport.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_VELOCITY_BUFFER
DESC:Skip rendering to the velocity buffer for the viewport.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_SRGB
DESC:Skip rendering of the srgb color space.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_FORMAT_RG11B10
DESC:Skip rendering of RG11B10 formats in the viewport.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_TRANSPARENT
DESC:Skip rendering of transparent objects in the viewport.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_STREAMING
DESC:Disables data streaming in the process of rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_AUTO_EXPOSURE
DESC:Disables auto exposure in the process of rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_AUTO_WHITE_BALANCE
DESC:Disables auto white balance in the process of rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.SKIP_OCCLUSION_QUERY
DESC:Disables occlusion queries in the process of rendering.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.USAGE_WORLD_LIGHT
DESC:Use lighting from the LightWorld set in the current loaded world.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.USAGE_AUX_LIGHT
DESC:Use lighting from the auxiliary virtual scene containing one LightWorld (with 45, 45 and 45 degrees slope angles), scattering is not used.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.USAGE_NODE_LIGHT
DESC:Use the node lighting.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.RENDER_DEPTH
DESC:Render only depth.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Viewport.RENDER_DEPTH_GBUFFER

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Visualizer.clear
DESC:Clears all internal primitives created by calls to renderSmth functions. These primitives are accumulated in the internal buffer and then rendered together. This method can be used to render several viewports with visualizer.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Visualizer.renderPoint2D(Unigine.Math.vec2,float,Unigine.Math.vec4,float,float) const
DESC:Renders a 2D point of a given size and color. 2D points are rendered in the screen plane; coordinates of the upper left corner are (0; 0), of the lower right corner—(1; 1).
PARAMS:v:Point coordinates. | size:Point size in range [0;1]. The point size is set in proportion to the screen resolution. | color:Point color. | order:Z-order value for the rendered element. An element having a lower order shall be rendered over the one having a higher one. | duration:Time period (in seconds) during which the rendered element shall be displayed. The default value of 0 means that the visualizer is rendered for 1 frame only.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Visualizer.renderPoint3D(Unigine.Math.Vec3,float,Unigine.Math.vec4,bool,float,bool) const
DESC:Renders a 3D point of a given size and color. 3D points are rendered in the world space.
PARAMS:v:Point coordinates. | size:Point size in range [0;1]. The point size is set in proportion to the screen resolution. | color:Point color. | screen_space:Flag indicating the type of dimensions to be used:false - use the world space dimensionstrue - use the screen space dimensions | duration:Time period (in seconds) during which the rendered element shall be displayed. The default value of 0 means that the visualizer is rendered for 1 frame only. | depth_test:true to enable depth testing for the element (if it should be obscured by elements closer to the camera); false — to disable it.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Visualizer.renderMessage2D(Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,char,Unigine.Math.vec4,int,int,float)
DESC:Renders a message in a given color. Message position is specified in screen coordinates.
PARAMS:position:Coordinates of the anchor point of the message, each in [0;1] range. | center:Message alignment. The first two values in the vector set the offset, the third one is ignored. For example, vec3(-1,-1,0) sets the offset of the center of the message to its upper left edge. vec3(1,1,0) - to the lower right corner. | str:Message text to display. | color:Color, in which the message will be rendered. | outline:1 to use font outlining, 0 not to use. | font_size:Font size. | duration:Time period (in seconds) during which the rendered element shall be displayed. The default value of 0 means that the visualizer is rendered for 1 frame only.
-

PARAMS:position:Coordinates of the anchor point of the message (in world coordinates). | center:Message alignment. The first two values in the vector set the offset, the third one is ignored. For example, vec3(-1,-1,0) sets the offset of the center of the message to its upper left edge. vec3(1,1,0) - to the lower right corner. | str:Message text to display. | color:Color, in which the message will be rendered. | outline:1 to use font outlining, 0 not to use. | font_size:Font size. | duration:Time period (in seconds) during which the rendered element shall be displayed. The default value of 0 means that the visualizer is rendered for 1 frame only.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.hasFeatureMixedReality const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the mixed reality mode is available. Mixed reality enables you to combine real-world view from front-facing cameras mounted on the headset with the VR image rendered. This feature is available for the Varjo devices only. If VR is not initialized, the function will return false.
RETURNS:true if the feature is available; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.hasFeatureMotionPrediction const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if motion prediction is available. This feature is available for the Varjo devices only. It allows the engine to submit the velocity from the GBuffer to the Varjo Composer. If VR is not initialized, the function will return false.
RETURNS:true if the feature is available; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.hasFeatureFoveatedRendering const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if foveated rendering is available. This feature is available for the Varjo devices only. Foveated rendering enhances performance by using the eye tracking functionality in Varjo headsets: it decreases the image quality in the peripheral areas where the user is not looking. Foveation allows applications to render fewer pixels and achieve a better VR experience. If VR is not initialized, the function will return false.
RETURNS:true if the feature is available; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.clearScriptableMaterials(VR::EYE_TYPE)
DESC:Removes all scriptable materials assigned to the target eye.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.getNumScriptableMaterials(VR::EYE_TYPE)
DESC:Returns the number of scriptable materials currently assigned to the specified eye.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye.
RETURNS:Number of scriptable materials currently assigned to the specified eye.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.getScriptableMaterial(VR::EYE_TYPE,int) const
DESC:Returns the scriptable material assigned to the target eye by the number. The material's number determines the order in which the expressions assigned to it are executed.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye. | num:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials.
RETURNS:Scriptable material assigned to the target eye.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.setScriptableMaterial(VR::EYE_TYPE,int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
DESC:Replaces the specified scriptable material with a new scriptable material by its number for the target eye. The material's number determines the order in which the expressions assigned to it are executed. Scriptable materials applied globally have their expressions executed before the ones that are applied per-eye.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye. | num:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials. | material:New scriptable material to replace the one with the specified number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.insertScriptableMaterial(VR::EYE_TYPE,int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
DESC:Inserts a new scriptable material at the specified position for the target eye. The material's number determines the order in which the expressions assigned to it are executed. To apply a scriptable material globally, use the method of the Render class. Scriptable materials applied globally have their expressions executed before the ones that are applied per-eye.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye. | num:Position at which the new scriptable material is to be inserted. | material:Scriptable material to be inserted.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.findScriptableMaterial(VR::EYE_TYPE,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material}) const
DESC:Returns the number of the specified scriptable material for the target eye. The material's number determines the order in which the expressions assigned to it are executed. Scriptable materials applied globally have their expressions executed before the ones that are applied per-eye.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye. | material:Scriptable material for which the number is to be found.
RETURNS:The number of the specified scriptable material for the target eye.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.addScriptableMaterial(VR::EYE_TYPE,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Material})
DESC:Adds the specified scriptable material to the target eye's material list. The material's number determines the order in which the expressions assigned to it are executed. To apply a scriptable material globally, use the method of the Render class. Scriptable materials applied globally have their expressions executed before the ones that are applied per-eye.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye. | material:Scriptable material to add.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.removeScriptableMaterial(VR::EYE_TYPE,int)
DESC:Removes the scriptable material with the specified number from the target eye's material list.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye. | num:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.swapScriptableMaterials(VR::EYE_TYPE,int,int)
DESC:Swaps two scriptable materials with the specified numbers in the target eye's material list. The material's number determines the order in which the expressions assigned to it are executed.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye. | num_0:Number of the first scriptable material in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials. | num_1:Number of the second scriptable material in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.setScriptableMaterialEnabled(VR::EYE_TYPE,int,bool)
DESC:Enables or disables the scriptable material with the specified number for the target eye. When a material is disabled (inactive), the scripts attached to it are not executed.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye. | num:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials. | enabled:true to enable the scriptable material with the specified number, false to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.VR.getScriptableMaterialEnabled(VR::EYE_TYPE,int) const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the scriptable material with the specified number is enabled (active) for the target eye. When a material is disabled (inactive), the scripts attached to it are not executed.
PARAMS:eye:Target eye. | num:Scriptable material number in the range from 0 to the total number of scriptable materials.
RETURNS:true if the scriptable material with the specified number is enabled; otherwise, false.

PARAMS:w:Widget to attach. | format:Format string or values entered into the attached widget. If none specified, "%d" is implied. This is an optional parameter. | multiplier:Multiplier value, which is used to scale values provided by the attached widget. This is an optional parameter. | flags:Attachment flags: one of the Gui:: Enumeration with ATTACH_* prefixes. This is an optional parameter.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Widget.arrange
DESC:Rearranges the widget and its children to lay them out neatly. This function forces to recalculate widget size and allows to get updated GUI layout data in the current frame. If this function is not called, widget modifications made in the current update() will be available only in the next frame (i.e. with one-frame lag), as GUI is calculated and rendered after the script update() function has been executed.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.Widget.LIFETIME_WORLD
DESC:Lifetime of the widget or user interface is managed by the world. The widget/user interface will be deleted automatically on closing the world.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Widget.LIFETIME_WINDOW
DESC:Lifetime of the widget or user interface is managed by the window. The widget/user interface will be deleted automatically on deleting the window.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Widget.LIFETIME_ENGINE
DESC:Lifetime of the widget or user interface is managed by the Engine. The widget/user interface will be deleted automatically on Engine shutdown. When using this lifetime management type, the GUI instance can be empty for the widget: it will be assigned automatically when adding the widget to a window. For a user interface, the Gui instance must be set via the setGui() method.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.Widget.LIFETIME_MANUAL
DESC:Lifetime of the widget or user interface is managed by the user. The widget/user interface should be deleted manually. When using this lifetime management type, the GUI instance can be empty for the widget: it will be assigned automatically when adding the widget to a window. For a user interface, the Gui instance must be set via the setGui() method.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.#ctor(Unigine.Ptr{Gui},char)
DESC:Constructor. Creates a button with a given label and adds it to the specified GUI.
PARAMS:gui:GUI, to which the new button will belong. | str:Button label. This is an optional parameter.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.#ctor(char)
DESC:Constructor. Creates a button with a given label and adds it to the Engine GUI.
PARAMS:str:Button label. This is an optional parameter.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.setBackground(int)
DESC:Sets a value indicating if a background texture should be rendered for the button. By default, the background texture is always rendered. The default is 1.
PARAMS:background:1 to render the background texture, 0 not to render. The default is 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.getBackground const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if a background texture is rendered for the button. The default is 1.
RETURNS:1 if a background texture is rendered; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.setImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
DESC:Sets a new image for the button.The button is automatically stretched or shrinked to match the size of the current image. When you resize the button the size of the image does not change. In case you need to create a type of button widget with an auto-adjusted image size, or image rotation, please consider Widget Sprite instead.
PARAMS:image:Image to set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.getImage const
DESC:Returns the current button image.The button is automatically stretched or shrinked to match the size of the current image. When you resize the button the size of the image does not change. In case you need to create a type of button widget with an auto-adjusted image size, or image rotation, please consider Widget Sprite instead.
RETURNS:Button image.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.setText(char)
DESC:Sets a button text label.
PARAMS:text:Button label.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.getText const
DESC:Returns the button text label.
RETURNS:Button label.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.setTextAlign(int)
DESC:Sets alignment of the button label.
PARAMS:align:One of the Gui:: Enumeration with ALIGN_* prefixes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.getTextAlign const
DESC:Returns alignment of the button label.
RETURNS:Alignment of the button label: one of the Gui:: Enumeration with ALIGN_* prefixes.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.setTexture(char)
DESC:Sets a new texture to be used as the button image.The button is automatically stretched or shrinked to match the size of the current image. When you resize the button the size of the image does not change. In case you need to create a type of button widget with an auto-adjusted image size, or image rotation, please consider Widget Sprite instead.
PARAMS:texture:Path to a texture file.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.getTexture const
DESC:Returns the path to the current button image texture.The button is automatically stretched or shrinked to match the size of the current image. When you resize the button the size of the image does not change. In case you need to create a type of button widget with an auto-adjusted image size, or image rotation, please consider Widget Sprite instead.
RETURNS:Path to the button image texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.setToggleable(bool)
DESC:Sets a value indicating if the button is a toggle button or a simple one.
PARAMS:toggleable:1 to make the button a toggle button, 0 to make it a simple one. The default is 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.isToggleable const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the button is a toggle button or a simple one. The default is 0.
RETURNS:1 if the button is a toggle button; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.setToggled(bool)
DESC:Sets a state of the toggle button.
PARAMS:toggled:1 to press the button, 0 to release it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.isToggled const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the toggle button is pressed.
RETURNS:true if the button is pressed; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.setButtonColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Sets the color to be used for the button.
PARAMS:color:Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.getButtonColor const
DESC:Returns the current color for the button.
RETURNS:Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.setStyleImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
DESC:Sets a button skin image.
PARAMS:image:Image to set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.getStyleImage const
DESC:Returns the button skin image.
RETURNS:Button skin image.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.setStyleTexture(char)
DESC:Sets a button skin texture.
PARAMS:texture:Path to a texture file.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetButton.getStyleTexture const
DESC:Returns the path to the button skin texture.
RETURNS:Path to a texture file.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.#ctor(Unigine.Ptr{Gui})

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.#ctor

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.setImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getImage const

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getLine(int) const
DESC:Returns the canvas element ID of the line by its number.
PARAMS:num:Line number in range from 0 to the total number lines.
RETURNS:Canvas element ID of the line.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.setLineColor(int,Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Updates the color of the specified line.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line. | color:Line color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getLineColor(int) const
DESC:Returns the current color of the specified line.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getLineIndex(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the index of the point of the line segment by its number.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line. | num:The number of the index of the point of the line segment.
RETURNS:Index of the point of the line segment.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getLineIntersection(int,int,float) const
DESC:Checks whether the specified point (e.g. the mouse cursor) intersects with lines drawn in the canvas widget.
PARAMS:x:X coordinate of the point. | y:Y coordinate of the point. | distance:Point radius acceptable for detecting intersection.
RETURNS:Number of the first intersected line with the highest rendering order in the array of lines. If no intersections are found, -1 will be returned.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.setLineOrder(int,int)
DESC:Updates the rendering order of the given line (the higher the value, the later the line will be rendered atop other elements).
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line. | order:Rendering order.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getLineOrder(int) const
DESC:Returns the rendering order of the given line (the higher the value, the later the line is rendered atop other elements).
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line.
RETURNS:Rendering order.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getLinePoint(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the coordinates of the specified line segment point.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line. | num:Number of the line segment point.
RETURNS:Segment point coordinates.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.setLineTransform(int,Unigine.Math.mat4)
DESC:Updates the transformation matrix of the specified line.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line. | transform:Transformation matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getLineTransform(int) const
DESC:Returns the current transformation matrix of the specified line.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getNumLineIndices(int) const
DESC:Returns the total number of indices set for the points that form line segments.

RETURNS:The number of indices set for the points that form line segments.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getNumLinePoints(int) const
DESC:Returns the number of the points that create line segments.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line.
RETURNS:Number of line segment points.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getNumLines const
DESC:Returns the number of lines drawn in the canvas widget.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getNumPolygonIndices(int) const
DESC:Returns the total number of indices set for points of the specified polygon.
PARAMS:polygon:Canvas element ID of the polygon.
RETURNS:The number of indices set for points that form polygons.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getNumPolygonPoints(int) const
DESC:Returns the number of points that form the specified polygon.
PARAMS:polygon:Canvas element ID of the polygon.
RETURNS:Number of polygon points.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getNumPolygons const
DESC:Returns the number of polygons drawn in the canvas widget.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getNumTexts const
DESC:Returns the number of text strings drawn in the canvas widget.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getPolygon(int) const
DESC:Returns the canvas element ID of the polygon by its index.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getPolygonBlendDestFunc(int) const
DESC:Returns the blending mode of the destination color for the specified polygon.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.setPolygonBlendFunc(int,int,int)
DESC:Updates the blending coefficients for specified polygon.
PARAMS:polygon:Canvas element ID of the polygon. | src:Blending mode for the source screen buffer color (one of the BLEND_*). | dest:Blending mode for the destination polygon color (one of the BLEND_*).

DESC:Returns the blending mode of the source screen buffer color for the specified polygon.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getPolygonImage(int)
DESC:Returns the current image set for a given polygon.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getPolygonIndex(int,int) const
DESC:Returns the index of the point of the polygon by its number.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getPolygonIntersection(int,int) const
DESC:Checks whether the specified point (e.g. the mouse cursor) intersects with widget polygons.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getPolygonOrder(int) const
DESC:Returns the rendering order of the given polygon (the higher the value, the later the polygon is rendered atop other elements).

PARAMS:text:Canvas element ID of the text string. | outline:Outline offset:Positive values set offset in the bottom-right corner direction.Negative values set offset in the top-left corner direction (the outline will overlap widget text).0 is not to use outlining.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getTextOutline(int) const

RETURNS:Positive value if the outline is offset in the bottom-right corner direction. Negative value if the outline is offset in the top-left corner direction. 0 if font is not outlined.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.getTextTransform(int) const
DESC:Returns the current transformation matrix of the specified text.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.setTexture(char)
DESC:Sets the texture that will be used by default for new polygons added to the canvas widget.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.addLine(int)
DESC:Adds a new line to the canvas widget. By default, it is rendered in white color.
PARAMS:order:Rendering order (the higher the value, the later the line will be rendered atop other elements).
RETURNS:Canvas element ID for the added line.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.addLineIndex(int,int)
DESC:Adds an index for the point of the line segment in the canvas widget. Notice that before adding indices, you should add all points that form the line.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line. | index:Index of the point of the line segment.
RETURNS:The number of the added index in the array of line indices.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.addLinePoint(int,Unigine.Math.vec3)
DESC:Adds a new segment to the line in the canvas widget.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line. | point:Segment point coordinates.
RETURNS:Number of the added line segment point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.addLinePoint(int,Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Adds a new segment to the line in the canvas widget.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line. | point:Segment point coordinates.
RETURNS:Number of the added line segment point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.setLinePoint(int,int,Unigine.Math.vec3)
DESC:Sets a line segment in the canvas widget.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line. | num:Index of the point in the array of line points. | point:Line point coordinates.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.setLinePoint(int,int,Unigine.Math.vec2)
DESC:Sets a line segment in the canvas widget.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line. | num:Index of the point in the array of line points. | point:Line point coordinates.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.addPolygon(int)
DESC:Adds a new polygon to the canvas widget. By default, it is rendered in white color. Texture tiling mode is disabled.
PARAMS:polygon:Rendering order (the higher the value, the later the polygon will be rendered atop other elements).
RETURNS:Canvas element ID for the added polygon.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.addPolygonIndex(int,int)
DESC:Adds an index for the point of the polygon in the canvas widget. Notice that before adding indices, you should add all points that form the polygon.
PARAMS:polygon:Canvas element ID of the polygon. | index:Index of the point of the polygon.
RETURNS:The number of the added index in the array of polygon indices.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.addText(int)
DESC:Adds a new text string to the canvas widget. By default, it is rendered in white color. If a font size is not set for the canvas widget, a default one is used. No shadow is cast from a text (no outlining). Text width and height on the canvas widget are equal to 0.
PARAMS:order:Rendering order (the higher the value, the later the text will be rendered atop other elements).
RETURNS:Canvas element ID of the added text string.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.clear
DESC:Clears the canvas widget: deletes all drawn lines, polygons and text.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.clearLineIndices(int)
DESC:Clears the array of indices set for points that form the given line.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.clearLinePoints(int)
DESC:Deletes all points that make up a given line.
PARAMS:line:Canvas element ID of the line.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.clearPolygonIndices(int)
DESC:Clears the array of indices set for points that form the given polygon.
PARAMS:polygon:Canvas element ID of the polygon.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.clearPolygonPoints(int)
DESC:Deletes all points that make up a given polygon.
PARAMS:polygon:Canvas element ID of the polygon.
-

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.removePolygonPoint(int,int)

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetCanvas.removeText(int)

PARAMS:value:Position of the scroller. The minimum value is 0, the maximum value is the difference between the object width and the frame width.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getHScrollValue const
DESC:Returns the current position (and also automatically the size) of the horizontal scroller. That is, it returns the width of the currently invisible area that determines the size of the slider.
RETURNS:Position of the horizontal scroller.

DESC:Sets widget paddings for all sides. Padding clears an area around the content of a widget (inside of it).
PARAMS:l:Left-side padding in pixels. | r:Right-side padding in pixels. | t:Top padding in pixels. | b:Bottom padding in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getPaddingBottom const
DESC:Returns the current bottom padding for the widget content.
RETURNS:Bottom padding in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getPaddingLeft const
DESC:Returns the current left-side padding for the widget content.
RETURNS:Left-side padding in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getPaddingRight const
DESC:Returns the current right-side padding for the widget content.
RETURNS:Right-side padding in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getPaddingTop const
DESC:Returns the current top padding for the widget content.
RETURNS:Top padding in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getScrollScale const
DESC:Returns the divisor used to convert integer values into floating point values.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.setSpace(int,int)
DESC:Sets a space between the widgets in the box and between them and the box border.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getSpaceX const
DESC:Returns the horizontal space between the widgets in the box and between them and the box border.
RETURNS:Horizontal space.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getSpaceY const
DESC:Returns the vertical space between the widgets in the box and between them and the box border.
RETURNS:Vertical space.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.setVScrollEnabled(bool)
DESC:Sets a value indicating if vertical scrolling is enabled.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.isVScrollEnabled const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if vertical scrolling is enabled.
RETURNS:Positive number if scrolling is enabled; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getVScrollFrameSize const
DESC:Returns the height of the currently visible area.
RETURNS:Height of the visible area in pixels.
-

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getVScrollHidden const

-

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getVScrollStepSize const
DESC:Returns the step of the vertical scroller. This step is used to increment the scroll position.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.setVScrollValue(int)
DESC:Sets the position (and also the size) of the vertical scroller. That is, it sets the height of the currently invisible area that determines the size of the slider.
PARAMS:value:Position of the scroller. The minimum value is 0, the maximum value is the difference between the object height and the frame height.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getVScrollValue const
DESC:Returns the current position (and also the size) of the vertical scroller. That is, it returns the height of the currently invisible area that determines the size of the slider.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getBorderColor const

RETURNS:Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.setBackgroundColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Sets the background color to be used for the widget.
PARAMS:color:Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getBackgroundColor const
DESC:Returns the current background color used for the widget.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.setHscrollColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Sets the color to be used for the widget's horizontal scroll.
PARAMS:color:Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getHscrollColor const
DESC:Returns the current color used for the widget's horizontal scroll.
RETURNS:Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.setVscrollColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Sets the color to be used for the widget's vertical scroll.
PARAMS:color:Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getVscrollColor const
DESC:Returns the current color used for the widget's vertical scroll.
RETURNS:Four-component vector specifying the color in the RGBA format.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.setBackground(int)
DESC:Sets a value indicating if a background should be rendered.
PARAMS:background:1 to render a background, 0 not to render.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getBackground const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the background is rendered.
RETURNS:1 if the background is rendered, 0 if not.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getVScroll const
DESC:Returns the vetical scroller object.
RETURNS:Vetical scroller.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.getHScroll const
DESC:Returns the horizontal scroller object.
RETURNS:Horizontal scroller.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.ALWAYS_HIDE_NO_BOUNDS
DESC:Scroll bar is always hidden and its size is not added to widget bounds.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.ALWAYS_HIDE
DESC:Scroll bar is always hidden. In this mode, though a bar itself is not rendered, the scroll bar bounds are still taken into account when the widget bounds are calculated.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.AUTO_HIDE
DESC:Scroll bar is automatically hidden when necessary. For example, if the container area is big enough to show all elements, the scroll bar is not rendered. And vice versa, if not all elements can be shown at once, a scroll bar is rendered.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.WidgetScrollBox.ALWAYS_RENDER
DESC:Scroll bar is always rendered.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getBlendDestFunc const

DESC:Returns the blending mode of the source screen buffer colour set for the first (bottom) layer of the sprite.
RETURNS:Blending mode (one of the BLEND_* variables).

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.setBufferMask(int)

PARAMS:mask:Current channel mask (one of the BUFFER_* pre-defined variables).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getBufferMask const
DESC:Returns the current channel mask for the whole sprite.
RETURNS:Current channel mask (one of the BUFFER_* pre-defined variables).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.setColor(Unigine.Math.vec4)

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getColor const
DESC:Returns the current color set for the first (bottom) layer of the sprite.
RETURNS:Modulation color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.setImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},int)
DESC:Sets a loaded into memory image for the first (bottom) layer of the sprite. This layer always exists in the sprite. An additional flag can be set in case the sprite image is going to be updated often or even each frame (for optimized memory management).Not available for the WidgetSpriteViewport !
PARAMS:image:Pointer to the image. | dynamic:Positive number if the image will be updated each frame; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getImage const
DESC:Returns the loaded into memory image that is currently set for the first (bottom) layer of the sprite.Not available for the WidgetSpriteViewport !
RETURNS:Pointer to the image.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getLayerBlendDestFunc(int) const
DESC:Returns the blending mode of the destination widget colour set for a given layer of the sprite.
PARAMS:layer:Layer number in range from 0 to the total number of sprite layers.
RETURNS:Blending mode (one of the BLEND_* variables).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.setLayerBlendFunc(int,int,int)
DESC:Sets blending coefficients for a given layer of the sprite.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getLayerBlendSrcFunc(int) const
DESC:Returns the blending mode of the source screen buffer colour set for a given layer of the sprite.

RETURNS:Blending mode (one of the BLEND_* variables).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.setLayerBufferMask(int,int)
DESC:Sets a channel mask for a given layer of the sprite. If a mask for a channel exists, one can draw in this channel. The default is BUFFER_ALL.
PARAMS:layer:Layer number in range from 0 to the total number of sprite layers. | mask:Channel mask. One of the BUFFER_* pre-defined variables.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getLayerBufferMask(int) const
DESC:Returns the current channel mask set for a given layer of the sprite.
PARAMS:layer:Layer number in range from 0 to the total number of sprite layers.
RETURNS:Channel mask. One of the BUFFER_* pre-defined variables.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.setLayerColor(int,Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Sets a color for a given layer of the sprite.
PARAMS:layer:Layer number in range from 0 to the total number of sprite layers. | color:Modulation color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getLayerColor(int) const
DESC:Returns the current color set for a given layer of the sprite.
PARAMS:layer:Layer number in range from 0 to the total number of sprite layers..
RETURNS:Modulation color.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.setLayerEnabled(int,bool)
DESC:Sets a value indicating if the layer is enabled for rendering.
PARAMS:layer:Layer number in range from 0 to the total number of sprite layers. | enabled:true to enable the layer; false to disable it.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getLayerTexture(int) const

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.setTexCoord(Unigine.Math.vec4)
DESC:Sets the coordinates of the texture for the first (bottom) layer of the sprite. This layer always exists in the sprite.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getTexCoord const

RETURNS:Texture coordinates. The first pair of coordinates (x and y) is for the upper left corner, the second pair (z and w) is for the lower right corner.

PARAMS:texture:Path to the texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getTexture const
DESC:Returns the texture from a file that is currently set for the first (bottom) layer of the sprite.
RETURNS:Path to the texture.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.setTransform(Unigine.Math.mat4)

PARAMS:transform:Transformation matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getTransform const
DESC:Returns the current transformation matrix set for the first (bottom) layer of the sprite.
RETURNS:Transformation matrix.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.setWrapRepeat(int)
DESC:Sets texture tiling for the first (bottom) layer of the sprite. This layer always exists in the sprite. The default is 0 (no tiling). To see tiling in effect, you need to transform sprite texture coordinates via setTexCoord().
PARAMS:repeat:1 to enable texture tiling; 0 to disable it.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WidgetSprite.getWrapRepeat const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if texture tiling is enabled for the first (bottom) layer of the sprite.
RETURNS:1 if texture tiling is enabled; 0 if disabled.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getIcon const
