RETURNS:1 if the icon for the window is returned successfully, otherwise 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.show
DESC:Enables rendering of the engine window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.hide
DESC:Disables rendering of the engine window. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setFocus
DESC:Sets the focus to the window.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setSystemFocus
DESC:Sets the focus to the engine window. This method is applied to a separate or parent window, for nested windows use setFocus().
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.minimize
DESC:Minimizes the engine window to an iconic representation. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.maximize
DESC:Makes the engine window as large as possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.restore
DESC:Restores the size and position of the minimized or maximized engine window via the system proxy. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getHitTestResult(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
DESC:Returns a value indicating in which area of the engine window the mouse is located. This method is used for interaction with system windows only, i.e. it cannot be used for nested windows.
PARAMS:global_pos:Global coordinates of the hit-test point.
RETURNS:Value indicating the window area, one of the HITTEST_* values.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getHitTestResultName(EngineWindow::HITTEST) const
DESC:Returns the string representation of the hit test result value.
PARAMS:hit_test:Value indicating the window area, one of the HITTEST_* values.
RETURNS:The string representation of the hit test result value (e.g., HITTEST_RESIZE_RIGHT is RESIZE RIGHT).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toTop
DESC:Makes the window appear on top of all other windows. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.isGlobalChildOf(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup})
DESC:Returns the value specifying if the current window is a part of a hierarchy of the specified window.
PARAMS:group:Window to be checked.
RETURNS:true if the current window is globally a child of the specified one, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.updateGuiHierarchy
DESC:Updates the hierarchy for all widgets — the widgets are arranged, expanded to the required sizes and then their positions are updated. Updating the hierarchy may be required, for example, for getting the screen position immediately after the widget has been added to the hierarchy. For a separate window, the hierarchy in self gui is updated; for a nested window, the hierarchy in self gui of the global parent group is updated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getDroppedItem(int) const
DESC:Returns the absolute path to the file or folder dropped to the window.
PARAMS:index:Index of the dropped file or folder.
RETURNS:Absolute path to the dropped file or folder.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.screenshot(char)
DESC:Creates a screenshot after the rendering stage is completed. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, using this method for a nested window is not allowed.
PARAMS:path:Path to save the screenshot.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.setModal(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
DESC:Sets the current window modal to the specified parent window. Both the parent and the child windows must be separate. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, a nested window can't be a parent for a modal window.
PARAMS:parent_window:Parent window.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.addModalWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
DESC:Adds the argument window as modal to the current window. Both the parent and the child windows must be separate. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, a nested window can't be a parent for a modal window.
PARAMS:window:Window to be added as modal.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.removeModalWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
DESC:Removes the argument modal window from this window. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, a nested window can't be a parent for a modal window.
PARAMS:window:Engine window.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getModalWindow(int) const
DESC:Returns the modal window for this window by its index. The concept of modal assumes that if a window has modal children, it cannot be closed. Any other interaction with a parent window is possible. This method should be applied to a separate or parent window, for a nested window it will return nullptr.
PARAMS:index:Index of the modal window.
RETURNS:Modal window.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.unstack
DESC:Removes the current window from a parent group.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.close
DESC:Deletes the window if this window is not a modal parent or a member of a fixed group. If a window is a member of a fixed group, it cannot be closed (i.e. deleted).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
DESC:Returns the value indicating if the mouse is hovering over the window.
PARAMS:global_mouse_pos:Global screen coordinates of the mouse relative to the main display.
RETURNS:true if the mouse hovers over the current window, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getClientIntersection(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
DESC:Returns the value indicating if the mouse is hovering over the client area of the window.
PARAMS:global_mouse_pos:Global screen coordinates of the mouse relative to the main display.
RETURNS:true if the mouse hovers over the client area of the window, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.getClient9Area(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
DESC:Returns the area over which the mouse hovers, one of the nine areas into which the window is segmented.
PARAMS:global_mouse_pos:Global screen coordinates of the mouse relative to the main display.
RETURNS:One of the nine segments the screen area is split into.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.get9AreaName(EngineWindow::AREA) const
DESC:Returns the name of the screen segment as a string.
PARAMS:area:One of the nine segments the screen area is split into.
RETURNS:The string representation of the segment value (e.g., AREA_TOP_LEFT is TOP LEFT).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.globalToLocalUnitPosition(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
DESC:Transforms the global screen coordinates in pixels into logical units relative to the window client area.
PARAMS:global_pos:The position in global coordinates.
RETURNS:The coordinates in logical units relative to the window client area.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.localUnitToGlobalPosition(Unigine.Math.ivec2) const
DESC:Transforms the position in logical units relative to the window client area into the global screen coordinates in pixels.
PARAMS:unit_pos:The coordinates in logical units relative to the window client area.
RETURNS:The position in global coordinates.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toRenderSize(int)
DESC:Transforms the unit value to the pixel value.
PARAMS:unit_size:Size in logical units.
RETURNS:Size in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toUnitSize(int)
DESC:Transforms the pixel value to the unit value.
PARAMS:render_size:Size in pixels.
RETURNS:Size in logical units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toRenderSize(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
DESC:Transforms the unit value to the pixel value.
PARAMS:unit_size:Size in logical units.
RETURNS:Size in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindow.toUnitSize(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
DESC:Transforms the pixel value to the unit value.
PARAMS:render_size:Size in pixels.
RETURNS:Size in logical units.
-

DESC:Top left area of the window split into 9 parts.

DESC:None of the areas of the window split into 9 parts is selected.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.EngineWindow.ENGINE_WINDOW
DESC:Engine window.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.EngineWindow.ENGINE_WINDOW_VIEWPORT
DESC:Engine viewport window.

DESC:Engine window group.

ENTRY:F:Unigine.EngineWindow.NUM_ENGINE_WINDOWS
DESC:Total number of engine windows.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.#ctor(EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,Unigine.Math.ivec2,int)
DESC:Constructor. Creates the window group of the specified type and size with the specified flags.
PARAMS:group_type:The type of the group. | size:The size of the window group. | flags:Mask containing window flags.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.#ctor(EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,int,int,int)
DESC:Constructor. Creates the window group of the specified type and size with the specified flags.
PARAMS:group_type:The type of the group. | width:Window width. | height:Window height. | flags:Mask containing window flags.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.#ctor(EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,char,int,int,int)
DESC:Constructor. Creates the window group of the specified type and size with the specified title and flags.
PARAMS:group_type:The type of the group. | window_title:The title of the window, in UTF-8 encoding. | width:Window width. | height:Window height. | flags:Mask containing window flags.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getGroupType const
DESC:Returns the window group type set in the constructor — vertical, horizontal, tab arrangement of windows, or an independent window inside a group.
RETURNS:The window group type.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setFixed(bool)
DESC:Sets a value specifying if windows can be added to this group or removed from it.
PARAMS:fixed:true to disable adding or removing windows from this group, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.isFixed const
DESC:Returns a value specifying if windows can be added to this group or removed from it.
RETURNS:true if adding or removing windows from this group is disabled, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setAutoDeleteMode(EngineWindowGroup::AUTO_DELETE_MODE)
DESC:Sets the automatic window deletion mode.
PARAMS:mode:The automatic window deletion mode.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getAutoDeleteMode const
DESC:Returns the automatic window deletion mode.
RETURNS:The automatic window deletion mode.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.add(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},int)
DESC:Adds a window at a specified index. The window becomes nested (i.e. its borders, style, title bar, etc. are disabled). If the group is fixed, a window won't be added to the group and the console will display a corresponding warning.
PARAMS:window:Window to be added. | target_index:The window order. If no index is set, the window is added as the last one.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.remove(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
DESC:Removes the specified window from the group. The window's settings are the same as before adding it to the group. If the group is fixed, a window won't be removed from the group and the console will display a corresponding warning.
PARAMS:window:Window to be removed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.removeByIndex(int)
DESC:Removes the window at a specified index from the group. The window's settings are the same as before adding it to the group. If the group is fixed, a window won't be removed from the group and the console will display a corresponding warning.
PARAMS:index:The index of the window to be removed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getNumNestedWindows const
DESC:Returns the total number of nested windows in the group.
RETURNS:The total number of nested windows in the group.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getNestedWindow(int) const
DESC:Returns the nested engine window by its index.
PARAMS:index:Index of the nested window.
RETURNS:Nested engine window.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getNestedWindowIndex(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
DESC:Returns the index of the specified nested engine window.
PARAMS:window:Nested engine window.
RETURNS:Index of the nested window.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.containsNestedWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow}) const
DESC:Returns the value indicating if the specified window is a direct child of the current group.
PARAMS:window:Window to be checked.
RETURNS:true if the specified window is a direct child of the current one, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.containsNestedWindowInHierarchy(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow}) const
DESC:Returns the value indicating if the specified window is a child of the current group or any of its children.
PARAMS:window:Window to be checked.
RETURNS:true if the specified window is a child of the current one, otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setTabTitle(int,char)
DESC:Adds the title to the specified tab and the window itself.
PARAMS:index:Index of the tab. | title:Title to be added.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setTabIcon(int,Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image})
DESC:Adds the image to the specified tab and the window itself.
PARAMS:index:Index of the tab. | image:Image to be added.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setCurrentTab
DESC:Sets the index of the currently active tab in a tab group.
RETURNS:The index of the tab to set as currently active.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getCurrentTab const
DESC:Returns the index of the currently active tab in a tab group.
RETURNS:The index of the currently active tab.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabWidth(int) const
DESC:Returns the width of the tab. Available for horizontal groups only.
PARAMS:index:The index of the tab.
RETURNS:The width of the the tab.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabHeight(int) const
DESC:Returns the height of the tab. Available for vertical groups only.
PARAMS:index:The index of the tab.
RETURNS:The height of the tab.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabBarWidth(int) const
DESC:Returns the width of the tab bar.
PARAMS:index:The index of the tab.
RETURNS:The width of the tab bar.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabBarHeight(int) const
DESC:Returns the height of the tab bar.
PARAMS:index:The index of the tab.
RETURNS:The height of the tab bar.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabLocalPosition(int) const
DESC:Returns the screen position of the tab relatively to the parent group (global window). The coordinates represent the displacement from the top left corner of the parent group (global window).
PARAMS:index:The index of the tab.
RETURNS:The screen position of the tab relatively to the parent group (global window).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getTabBarLocalPosition(int) const
DESC:Returns the screen position of the tab bar relatively to the parent group (global window). The coordinates represent the displacement from the top left corner of the parent group (global window).
PARAMS:index:The index of the tab.
RETURNS:The screen position of the tab bar relatively to the parent group (global window).
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setHorizontalTabWidth(int,int)
DESC:Sets the width of the tab in the group of tabs arranged horizontally. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to change its tab width immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
PARAMS:index:The index of the tab. | width:The width of the tab in the group of tabs arranged horizontally.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setVerticalTabHeight(int,int)
DESC:Sets the height of the tab in the group of tabs arranged vertically. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to change its tab height immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
PARAMS:index:The index of the tab. | height:The height of the tab in the group of tabs arranged vertically.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getSeparatorWidth const
DESC:Returns the width of the vertical line separating a tab group from the rest of the area. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to access its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
RETURNS:The width of the separation line, in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getSeparatorHeight const
DESC:Returns the height of the horizontal line separating a tab group from the rest of the area. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to access its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
RETURNS:The height of the separation line, in pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setSeparatorPosition(int,int)
DESC:Sets the position of the line separating a tab group from the rest of the area. The separator line can be horizontal or vertical depending on the group type. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to change its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
PARAMS:index:Index of the tab. | pos:Position of the separation line, in pixels, from the top-left corner of the window.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getSeparatorPosition(int) const
DESC:Returns the position of the line separating a tab group from the rest of the area. The separator line can be horizontal or vertical depending on the group type. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to access its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
PARAMS:index:Index of the tab.
RETURNS:Position of the separation line, in pixels, from the top-left corner of the window.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.setSeparatorValue(int,float)
DESC:Sets the relative position of the tab separator. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to change its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
PARAMS:index:Index of the tab. | value:Position of the tab separator, the value from 0 to 1 that is recalculated to pixels.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getSeparatorValue(int) const
DESC:Returns the relative position of the tab separator. You may need to call updateGuiHierarchy() first, if you have added a new window to the group and want to access its separator immediately. Otherwise, you may get incorrect results.
PARAMS:index:Index of the tab.
RETURNS:Position of the tab separator, the value from 0 to 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.swapTabs(int,int)
DESC:Swaps the specified tabs. If the group is fixed, tabs won't be swapped and the console will display a corresponding warning.
PARAMS:first:Index of the first tab. | second:Index of the second tab.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getIntersectionTabBar(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
DESC:Returns the value indicating if the mouse is hovering over the window tab bar.
PARAMS:global_mouse_pos:Global screen coordinates of the mouse relative to the main display.
RETURNS:1 if the mouse hovers over the window tab bar, otherwise 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getIntersectionTabBarArea(Unigine.Math.ivec2)
DESC:Returns the value indicating if the mouse is hovering over the window tab bar area.
PARAMS:global_mouse_pos:Global screen coordinates of the mouse relative to the main display.
RETURNS:1 if the mouse hovers over the window tab bar area, otherwise 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getIntersectedItemPosition const
DESC:Returns the position of the left top corner of the intersected group item in the screen coordinates. In case of several displays, the position is relative to the main display.
RETURNS:The screen position of the intersected item — coordinates of the left top corner.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.getIntersectedItemSize const
DESC:Returns the size of the intersected item.
RETURNS:The size of the intersected item, in pixels.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.EngineWindowGroup.GROUP_TYPE_NONE

ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.#ctor(Unigine.Math.ivec2,int)
DESC:Constructor. Creates the window viewport of the specified size with the specified flags.
PARAMS:size:Window size (width and height). | flags:Mask containing window flags.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.#ctor(int,int,int)
DESC:Constructor. Creates the window viewport of the specified size with the specified flags.
PARAMS:width:Window width. | height:Window height. | flags:Mask containing window flags.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.#ctor(char,int,int,int)
DESC:Constructor. Creates the window viewport of the specified size with the specified title and flags.
PARAMS:window_title:The title of the window, in UTF-8 encoding. | width:Window width. | height:Window height. | flags:Mask containing window flags.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.disableFullscreen
DESC:Disables the fullscreen mode for the window in the fullscreen mode and sets the focus to this window. States and positions of other windows are restored. This method can't be applied to nested windows.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.enableFullscreen(int,int)
DESC:Enables the specified fullscreen mode for the specified display. The states of other displayed windows are stored in order to restore their states and positions when the fullscreen mode is disabled. A nested window will be withdrawn from the group if set to fullscreen.
PARAMS:display:Display index. | mode:Index of the mode supported by the display.
RETURNS:true if the specified fullscreen mode has been enabled for the specified display; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.addChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget},int)
DESC:Adds the specified widget as a child to the client area of the engine window.
PARAMS:widget:Child widget to be added. | flags:Widget flags: one of the ALIGN_* pre-defined variables. This is an optional parameter.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.removeChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget})
DESC:Removes the specified widget from the engine window.
PARAMS:widget:Child widget to be removed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.getChild(int)
DESC:Returns the child widget by its index.
PARAMS:index:Widget index.
RETURNS:Child widget.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.EngineWindowViewport.isChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Widget})
DESC:Checks if the argument widget is the child of the current window viewport.
PARAMS:widget:Widget.
RETURNS:true if the widget is the child of the current window viewport; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WindowManager.getWindow(int)
DESC:Returns the window by its index.
PARAMS:index:Index of the window.
RETURNS:Engine window.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WindowManager.getWindowIndex(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow}) const
DESC:Returns the index of the specified window.
PARAMS:window:Engine window.
RETURNS:Index of the window.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WindowManager.stack(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,int,bool)
DESC:Stacks the window to the other window. If the first argument is the separate window, a new window group is returned. If the first argument is the nested window, the window is added to its group. group_1 will consist of 3 windows: window_1 and window_3 stacked vertically and window_2 stacked horizontally.
PARAMS:first_window:The parent window to which another window is stacked. | second_window:The window to be stacked. | group_type:Type of a group to be created. | decompose_second:Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge, if it is a group, and combine with the first group.
RETURNS:Group of stacked windows.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackToParentGroup(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},int,bool)
DESC:Stacks the second window to the parent window group of the first window. In the result, both windows passed as arguments will be on the same level in the group hierarchy. If the first window has no parent group, the function will return it as is.
PARAMS:window_in_group:The window into the parent group of which the other window is stacked. | window:The window to be stacked. | index:A place where a window or a group should be placed in a group. | decompose_second:Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge, if it is a group, and combine with the first window or a group.
RETURNS:Group of windows.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackWindows(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowViewport},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowViewport},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE)
DESC:Returns a newly created group of the separate and/or nested windows. You cannot stack the window group to the separate window, however, you can stack a window nested in the window group: in this case, the window will be unstacked from its parent group and added to the new one. The windows are stacked in the default order. For example: group_1 will be a vertical group of window_3 and window_1.
PARAMS:first_viewport:The window to be stacked. | second_viewport:The window to be stacked. | group_type:Type of a group to be created.
RETURNS:Group of windows.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackWithWindow(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowViewport},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE,bool)
DESC:Returns a newly created group of the engine window viewport and any other engine window — another viewport or a window group.
PARAMS:window_viewport:The window viewport to be stacked. | window:The window to be stacked. | group_type:Type of a window group to be created. | decompose_second:Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge, if it is a group, and combine with the first group.
RETURNS:Group of windows.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackGroups(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup},EngineWindowGroup::GROUP_TYPE)
DESC:Returns the group of window groups. The second group is added to the first group. To combine two windows or a group and a window, use the stack() method.
PARAMS:first_group:The first window group for merging. | second_group:The second window group for merging. | group_type:Type of a group to be created.
RETURNS:Group of windows.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WindowManager.stackToGroup(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindowGroup},Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow},int,bool)
DESC:Stacks the window or window group to another window group. The updated group of windows is returned.
PARAMS:destination_group:The parent group to which another group is stacked. | group:The window or window group to be stacked. | index:A place where a window or a group should be placed in a group. | decompose_second:Flag to decompose the second argument of the merge and combine with the first group.
RETURNS:Group of stacked windows.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WindowManager.unstack(Unigine.Ptr{EngineWindow})
DESC:Removes a window or a group from a parent group. If there is only one window left, the group is automatically deleted after removing the window from it.
PARAMS:unstacked:A window or a group to be removed from a parent group.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getCollision(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Object},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Searches for all collider objects within a given bounding box. As a new node becomes a part of the BSP tree only after the updateSpatial()method is called (the engine calls the method automatically each frame after the world script update()code is executed), all engine subsystems can process this node only in the next frame. If you need to get the node in the very first frame, call the updateSpatial()method manually. The engine will call this method automatically after the update() code is executed anyways.
PARAMS:bb:Bounding box. | objects:Array with collider objects' smart pointers.
RETURNS:true if collider objects are found; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getCollision(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundSphere,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Object},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Searches for all collider objects within a given bounding sphere. As a new node becomes a part of the BSP tree only after the updateSpatial()method is called (the engine calls the method automatically each frame after the world script update()code is executed), all engine subsystems can process this node only in the next frame. If you need to get the node in the very first frame, call the updateSpatial()method manually. The engine will call this method automatically after the update() code is executed anyways.
PARAMS:bs:Bounding sphere. | objects:Array with collider objects' smart pointers.
RETURNS:true if collider objects are found; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getCollision(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundFrustum,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Object},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Searches for all collider objects within a given bounding frustum. As a new node becomes a part of the BSP tree only after the updateSpatial()method is called (the engine calls the method automatically each frame after the world script update()code is executed), all engine subsystems can process this node only in the next frame. If you need to get the node in the very first frame, call the updateSpatial()method manually. The engine will call this method automatically after the update() code is executed anyways.
PARAMS:bf:Bounding frustum. | objects:Array with collider objects' smart pointers.
RETURNS:true if collider objects are found; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getCollision(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Object},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Performs tracing from the p0 point to the p1 point to find all collider objects intersected by the line. This function detects intersection with surfaces (polygons) of mesh and terrain objects. Collisions with the surface can be found only if the following conditions are fulfilled: The surface is enabled. Per-surface Collision flag is enabled. The surface has a material assigned. As a new node becomes a part of the BSP tree only after the updateSpatial()method is called (the engine calls the method automatically each frame after the world script update()code is executed), all engine subsystems can process this node only in the next frame. If you need to get the node in the very first frame, call the updateSpatial()method manually. The engine will call this method automatically after the update() code is executed anyways.
PARAMS:p0:The start point coordinates. | p1:The end point coordinates. | objects:Array with collider objects' smart pointers.
RETURNS:true if collider objects are found; otherwise, false.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.Vec3,int)
DESC:Performs tracing from the p0 point to the p1 point to find the first object intersected by the line. This function detects intersection with surfaces (polygons) of meshes. An intersection can be found only if an object has a matching intersection mask. Intersections with the surface can be found only if the following conditions are fulfilled: The surface is enabled. Per-surface Intersection flag is enabled. As a new node becomes a part of the BSP tree only after the updateSpatial()method is called (the engine calls the method automatically each frame after the world script update()code is executed), all engine subsystems can process this node only in the next frame. If you need to get the node in the very first frame, call the updateSpatial()method manually. The engine will call this method automatically after the update() code is executed anyways.
PARAMS:p0:Line start point coordinates. | p1:Line end point coordinates. | mask:Intersection mask. If 0 is passed, the function will return NULL.
RETURNS:Pointer to the first intersected object.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundFrustum,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Object},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Searches for intersections with Objects that are found in a given bounding frustum. This method catches all objects independent of their visibility (i.e., if an object is disabled, any of its LODs are disabled, or it is out of the visibility distance range, but is located within the bounding frustum, the intersection shall be detected). To check for intersections while taking into account the visibility aspect, use getVisibleIntersection(). Check the usage example applying this method. As a new node becomes a part of the BSP tree only after the updateSpatial()method is called (the engine calls the method automatically each frame after the world script update()code is executed), all engine subsystems can process this node only in the next frame. If you need to get the node in the very first frame, call the updateSpatial()method manually. The engine will call this method automatically after the update() code is executed anyways.
PARAMS:bf:Bounding frustum where intersection search will be performed. | objects:Array of intersected objects' smart pointers.
RETURNS:true if intersections are found; otherwise, false.
-

This method catches all nodes of the specified type independent of their visibility (i.e., if an object is disabled, any of its LODs are disabled, or it is out of the visibility distance range, but is located within the bounding frustum, the intersection shall be detected). To check for intersections while taking into account the visibility aspect, use getVisibleIntersection(). As a new node becomes a part of the BSP tree only after the updateSpatial()method is called (the engine calls the method automatically each frame after the world script update()code is executed), all engine subsystems can process this node only in the next frame. If you need to get the node in the very first frame, call the updateSpatial()method manually. The engine will call this method automatically after the update() code is executed anyways.
PARAMS:bf:Bounding frustum where intersection search will be performed. | type:Node type filter. Only the nodes of the specified type will be checked. | nodes:Array of intersected nodes' smart pointers.
RETURNS:true if intersections are found; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getIntersection(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundFrustum,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Searches for intersections with nodes of the specified type that are found in a given bounding frustum. This method catches all nodes independent of their visibility (i.e., if an object is disabled, any of its LODs are disabled, or it is out of the visibility distance range, but is located within the bounding frustum, the intersection shall be detected). To check for intersections while taking into account the visibility aspect, use getVisibleIntersection(). As a new node becomes a part of the BSP tree only after the updateSpatial()method is called (the engine calls the method automatically each frame after the world script update()code is executed), all engine subsystems can process this node only in the next frame. If you need to get the node in the very first frame, call the updateSpatial()method manually. The engine will call this method automatically after the update() code is executed anyways.
PARAMS:bf:Bounding frustum where intersection search will be performed. | nodes:Array of intersected nodes' smart pointers.

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getVisibleIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.WorldBoundFrustum,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Object},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},float)
DESC:Searches for intersections with objects inside a given bounding frustum that are visible to the specified camera position, i.e. either of its LODs is within the visibility distance distance. Unlike the getIntersection()method, this one takes the "visibility" concept into account (hidden objects or the ones that are too far away won't be found). Check this usage example for more details.
PARAMS:camera:Position of the camera from which the visibility distance to objects is checked. | bf:Bounding frustum inside which intersection search is performed. | objects:Array of intersected objects. | max_distance:Maximum visibility distance for objects, in units. If the distance from the specified camera position to an object exceeds this limit, the intersection is not registered even if the node is within the specified bounding frustum.
RETURNS:true if at least one intersection is found; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getVisibleIntersection(Unigine.Math.Vec3,Unigine.Math.WorldBoundFrustum,Node::TYPE,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator},float)
DESC:Searches for intersections with nodes inside a given bounding frustum that are visible to the specified camera position, i.e. either of its LODs is within the visibility distance distance. Unlike the getIntersection()method, this one takes the "visibility" concept into account (hidden nodes or the ones that are too far away won't be found). Check this usage example for more details. This method can be used only for nodes inherited from the Object class, i.e. they have sufraces that store LOD and visibility distance data.
PARAMS:camera:Position of the camera from which the visibility distance to nodes is checked. | bf:Bounding frustum inside which intersection search is performed. | type:Node type (one of the NODE_* variables); set it to -1 if you won't use this filter. | nodes:Array of intersected nodes. | max_distance:Maximum visibility distance for nodes, in units. If the distance from the specified camera position to a node exceeds this limit, the intersection is not registered even if the node is within the specified bounding frustum.
RETURNS:true if at least one intersection is found; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.loadWorld(char)
DESC:Loads a world from the specified file path and replaces the current world with it. The world is not loaded immediately — loading starts at the beginning of the next frame, while the current world is unloaded at the end of the current frame.
PARAMS:path:Path to the file describing the world.
RETURNS:true if the world is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.loadWorld(char,bool)
DESC:Loads a world from the specified file path and replaces the current world with it. The world is not loaded immediately — loading starts at the beginning of the next frame, while the current world is unloaded at the end of the current frame.
PARAMS:path:Path to the file describing the world. | partial_path:true if the path to the world file is partial; or false if it is a full path.
RETURNS:true if the world is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.loadWorldForce(char)
DESC:Loads a world from the specified file path and replaces the current world with it. The world is loaded immediately, breaking the Execution Sequence, therefore should be used either before Engine::update() or after Engine::swap(). If called in Engine::update(), the Execution Sequence will be as follows: update() before calling loadWorldForce(), loadWorldForce(), shutdown(), continuation of update() from the place of interruption, postUpdate(), swap(), init(), etc. This function is recommended for the Editor-related use.
PARAMS:path:Path to the file describing the world.
RETURNS:true if the world is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.loadWorldForce(char,bool)
DESC:Loads a world from the specified file path and replaces the current world with it. The world is loaded immediately, breaking the Execution Sequence, therefore should be used either before Engine::update() or after Engine::swap(). If called in Engine::update(), the Execution Sequence will be as follows: update() before calling loadWorldForce(), loadWorldForce(), shutdown(), continuation of update() from the place of interruption, postUpdate(), swap(), init(), etc. This function is recommended for the Editor-related use.
PARAMS:path:Path to the file describing the world. | partial_path:true if the path to the world file is partial; or false if it is a full path.
RETURNS:true if the world is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.loadNode(char,bool)

Cached nodes remain in the memory. PARAMS:file_path:Path to the *.node file to be loaded. | cache:true to use caching of nodes, false not to use.

PARAMS:file_guid:GUID of the *.node file to be loaded. | cache:true to use caching of nodes, false not to use.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.updateSpatial
DESC:Updates the node BSP (binary space partitioning) tree. The engine calls this method automatically each frame after the world script update() code is executed. As a new node becomes a part of the BSP tree only after this method is called, all engine subsystems (renderer, physics, sound, pathfinding, collisions, intersections, etc.) can process this node only in the next frame. If you need the subsystem to process the node in the very first frame, you can call the updateSpatial() method manually. The engine will call this method automatically after the update() code is executed anyways.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getNodeByName(char) const
DESC:Returns a node by its name if it exists. If the world contains multiple nodes having the same name, only the first one found shall be returned. To get all nodes having the same name, use the getNodesByName() method.method filters out isolated node hierarchies and cache nodes, so it does not return nodes having a possessor (NodeReference / Clutter / Cluster) among its predecessors or nodes from cache.
PARAMS:name:Node name.
RETURNS:Node, if it exists in the world; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getNodesByName(char,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Generates a list of nodes in the world with a given name and puts it to nodes.
PARAMS:name:Node name. | nodes:List of nodes with the given name (if any); otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getNodeByType(int) const
DESC:Returns the first node of the specified type in the World. Hidden and system nodes are ignored.
PARAMS:type:Node type identifier, one of the NODE_* values.
RETURNS:First node of the specified type, if it exists in the world; otherwise, nullptr.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.World.getNodesByType(int,Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Generates a list of nodes of the specified type in the world and puts it to nodes. Hidden and system nodes are ignored.
PARAMS:type:Node type identifier, one of the NODE_* values. | nodes:List of nodes of the given type (if any); otherwise, nullptr.
-

When trying to access cached nodes, keep in mind the following: if the node was loaded by the name — the node gets stored in the cache by its name; if the node was loaded from the parent Node Reference — the node is stored in the cache by its GUID. Here is an example on how to clear cached nodes and reload them in both cases:
PARAMS:file_path:Path to the *.node file.
RETURNS:true if nodes for the given *.node file were successfully removed from cache with related Node References removed from the scene; otherwise, false.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMaskImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},bool)
DESC:Sets an image (in R8 format) that defines the placement of meshes.
PARAMS:image:Pointer to the image. | invalidate:Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all world clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
RETURNS:1 if the mask image is successfully set; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaskImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}) const
DESC:Writes the image that is currently used as a mask for the placement of meshes into the given buffer.

RETURNS:1 if the mask image is successfully written into the buffer; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMaskImageName(char,bool)
DESC:Sets the name of a new mask image (in R8 format) that defines the placement of meshes.
PARAMS:image_name:Name (path) of the mask image. | invalidate:Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all world clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaskImageName const
DESC:Returns the name of a mask image (in R8 format) that defines the placement of reference nodes.
RETURNS:Name (path) of the mask image.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMaskMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},bool)
DESC:Sets a mesh to be used as a mask on-the-fly. Limitations: Before the method is called, another mesh must be set via setMaskMeshName() first. If the world is reloaded, the mesh set via setMaskMeshName() will be loaded. If the memory limit is exceeded, the new mesh might be replaced with the mesh set via setMaskMeshName().
PARAMS:mesh:Pointer to the mesh. | invalidate:Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all world clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
RETURNS:1 if the mesh is set successfully; otherwise - 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaskMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}) const
DESC:Copies the current mask mesh (if it exists) to the specified target mesh.
PARAMS:mesh:Pointer to the mesh to copy the current mask mesh to.
RETURNS:1 if mesh mask exists; otherwise - 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMaskMeshName(char,bool)
DESC:Sets a mesh to be used as a mask for the world clutter. This mesh should be plane.
PARAMS:mesh_name:Path to the *.mesh file. | invalidate:Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all world clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaskMeshName const
DESC:Returns the name (path) of the current mesh used as a mask for the world clutter. This mesh should be plane.
RETURNS:Path to the *.mesh file.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMaxScale(float,float)
DESC:Sets the scale for meshes in the areas with high density (according to the mask). With the minimum scale it is possible to automatically render, for example, big trees in the center of the forest. A spread value enables to control the range of scales relative to the mean value.
PARAMS:mean:Scale mean value. | spread:Maximum spread value to randomly upscale or downscale objects.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaxScaleMean const
DESC:Returns the scale mean value for meshes in the areas with high density (according to the mask).
RETURNS:Scale mean value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaxScaleSpread const
DESC:Returns the scale spread value that controls the range of mesh scales in the areas with high density (according to the mask).
RETURNS:Scale spread value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMinScale(float,float)
DESC:Sets the scale for meshes in the areas with low density (according to the mask). With the minimum scale it is possible to automatically render, for example, small trees at the forest border. A spread value allows to control the range of scales relative to the mean value.
PARAMS:mean:Scale mean value. | spread:Maximum spread value to randomly upscale or downscale objects.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMinScaleMean const
DESC:Returns the scale mean value for meshes in the areas with low density (according to the mask).
RETURNS:Scale mean value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMinScaleSpread const
DESC:Returns the scale spread value that controls the range of mesh scales in the areas with low density (according to the mask).
RETURNS:Scale spread value.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.getSegmentNodeMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},int,bool)
DESC:Gets a mesh used by a node with the specified index, placed along the specified spline segment, and puts it to the specified target Mesh instance.
PARAMS:mesh:Target mesh instance to which the obtained mesh is to be put. | segment:Spline segment for which the mesh is to be returned. | node_index:Number of the node instance placed along the spline segment. | bake_transform:true to use baked mesh transformation, false - to use default (the mesh will be placed at the origin). The default value is false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.getPointNodeMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},int,bool)
DESC:Exports a mesh with the specified index placed as the specified spline point to the specified target mesh. Due to the nature of the mesh, there will be visual artifacts connected with the float precision, in case an exported node is located very far from the origin (around 10,000 m and further). In this case we advise exporting it without baking transformation.
PARAMS:mesh:Target mesh to store the desired mesh placed at the specified spline point. | point:Spline point for which a mesh is to be retrieved. | node_index:Number of the desired node in a row of nodes placed at the specified point, in the range from 0 to the total number of nodes placed at the point.The node must be an ObjectMeshStatic or an ObjectMeshSkinned, otherwise an error occurs. | bake_transform:Bake Transform flag:true - to export the mesh preserving the current coordinates (can be useful when splitting largeWorldSplineGraph objects to keep relative positions of meshes); orfalse - to reset the position of the exported mesh to origin (0,0,0) with zero-rotation.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.createSplinePoint(Unigine.Math.Vec3)
DESC:Creates a new spline point with the specified parameters and attaches it to the world spline graph.
PARAMS:position:Position coordinates for the new splint point.
RETURNS:New spline point.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.removeSplinePoint(Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},bool)
DESC:Removes the specified spline point from the world spline graph. You can set the merge flag to merge spline segments sharing this point as their start and end points. Segment merging is available only when the point to be removed is shared by two segments, otherwise the merge flag is ignored and all segments sharing this point are also removed.
PARAMS:point:Spline point to be removed. | merge:true to merge spline segments sharing this point as their start and end points, false to remove all segments sharing this point. The default value is false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.getSplinePoints(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Returns the list of all points of the world spline graph and puts them to the specified vector of SplinePoint elements.
PARAMS:points:Vector to store the list of all points of the world spline graph.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.createSplineSegment(Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3)
DESC:Creates a new spline segment with the specified parameters and attaches it to the world spline graph.
PARAMS:start_point:Start point of the spline segment. | start_tangent:Tangent coordinates for the start point of the spline segment. | start_up:Coordinates of the "up" vector for the start point of the spline segment. | end_point:End point of the segment. | end_tangent:Tangent coordinates for the end point of the spline segment. | end_up:Coordinates of the "up" vector for the end point of the spline segment.
RETURNS:New spline segment connecting two specified points.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.removeSplineSegment(Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},bool)
DESC:Removes the specified spline segment from the world spline graph. You can set the with_points flag to remove the segment together with its start and end points.
PARAMS:segment:Spline segment to be removed. | with_points:true to remove the segment with its start and end points, false to keep points. The default value is false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.getSplineSegments(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
DESC:Returns the list of all segments of the world spline graph and puts them to the specified vector of SplineSegment elements.
PARAMS:segments:Vector to store the list of all segments of the world spline graph.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.rebuild(int)
DESC:Rebuilds the world spline graph. This method is to be called after making any changes to spline segments (mode, etc.), point positions, tangents, or "up" vectors, as well as after changing source node assignments and/or other parameters (UV tiling, gap, etc.)
PARAMS:try_force:Forced rebuild flag: set 1 to try and force rebuild the world spline graph.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.isRebuilding const

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.splitSplineSegment(Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},float)
DESC:Splits the specified spline segment into two parts by inserting a new point placed at the parametrically specified point on the T (times axis) in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range from the segment's start point.
PARAMS:segment:Spline segment to be split. | new_point_t:Coordinate of the splitting point of the segment along the horizontal T (times) axis in the range [0.0f, 1.0f].

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.breakSplinePoint(Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint})
DESC:Breaks the specified spline point shared by several spline segments into a set of separate ones, so that each of the segments gets its own point.
PARAMS:point:Spline point to be broken.The point must be shared by a least 2 segments.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.weldSplinePoints(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
DESC:Joins all spline points specified in the list into a single one, so that this point is shared by all spline segments having the specified points as starting or ending ones.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getSegmentMode(char) const
DESC:Returns the current segment mode for the source node with the given name.

PARAMS:name:Source node name. | enable_uv_tiling:1 to enable UV tiling for the material textures of the source node, 0 - to stretch textures. The default value is 0.

DESC:Returns a value indicating whether UV tiling for the material textures of the source node with the given name is enabled.
PARAMS:name:Source node name.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineSegment.setAdaptiveAngleThreshold(char,float)
DESC:Sets the angle threshold value for splitting source node with the given name. If an angle between the tangents for the two subsequent parts of the spline segment exceeds this value, the node will be split. This parameter is used only for the SEGMENT_ADAPTIVE mode.
PARAMS:name:Source node name. | adaptive_angle_threshold:Angle threshold value for the source node with the given name, in degrees. The default value is 1.0f.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getAdaptiveAngleThreshold(char) const
DESC:Returns the current angle threshold value for splitting source node with the given name. If an angle between the tangents for the two subsequent parts of the spline segment exceeds this value, the node will be split. This parameter is used only for the SEGMENT_ADAPTIVE mode.
PARAMS:name:Source node name.
RETURNS:Angle threshold value for the source node with the given name, in degrees. The default value is 1.0f.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineSegment.setGap(char,float)

PARAMS:name:Source node name. | gap:Gap size to be set, in units.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getGap(char) const
DESC:Returns the current size of the gap between the adjacent copies of the source node with the given name tiled along the spline segment. This parameter is used only for the SEGMENT_TILING mode.
PARAMS:name:Source node name.
RETURNS:Current gap size, in units.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getNode(int)
DESC:Returns a node assigned to the segment by its number.

-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SplineSegment.FORWARD_X
DESC:X is a forward axis for stretching.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SplineSegment.FORWARD_Y
DESC:Y is a forward axis for stretching.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SplineSegment.FORWARD_Z
DESC:Z is a forward axis for stretching.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SplineSegment.SEGMENT_STRETCH
DESC:The source node is stretched along the segment. This mode is the most performance-friendly, as only a single node is created for a segment. However, the stretched geometry will cut the curves of the spline to straight lines.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SplineSegment.SEGMENT_TILING
DESC:The source node is duplicated along the segment. Selecting this mode for a large spline graph may siginficantly reduce performance, due to a large number of tiled nodes.
-
ENTRY:F:Unigine.SplineSegment.SEGMENT_ADAPTIVE
DESC:This mode represents a combination of stretching and tiling to make the geometry placed along the spline graph look more plausible for a lower performance cost.

ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.#ctor(char,int)

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setLoop(int)
DESC:Sets a value indicating if the transformation defined by the path should be looped.
PARAMS:loop:1 to loop the transformation defined by the path; 0 to play it only once.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getLoop const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the transformation defined by the path is looped.
RETURNS:1 if the transformation is looped; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setOrientation(int)
DESC:Sets a value indicating if an object should be oriented along the path. When this option is enabled the complete transformation matrix (position, rotation, and scale) is taken into account when calculating intermediate transformation between the frames. When disabled - only the intermediate position between the frames is used, while keeping object's scale and rotation.
PARAMS:orientation:1 to orient an object along the path; 0 to keep the initial orientation of the object. The default value is 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getOrientation const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if an object is oriented along the path. When this option is enabled the complete transformation matrix (position, rotation, and scale) is taken into account when calculating intermediate transformation between the frames. When disabled - only the intermediate position between the frames is used, while keeping object's scale and rotation.
RETURNS:1 if an object is oriented along the path; 0 if the object initial orientation is kept. The default value is 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getPath const
DESC:Returns the path, by which the transformation is defined. By using this function, you can edit the current path or change velocity or transformation of the object moving along the path.
RETURNS:Instance of the Path class.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setPathName(char,int)
DESC:Reloads the internal path transformation.
PARAMS:name:The path name to be set. | unique:The dynamic flag:0 - If the reloaded path is changed, paths loaded from the same file will be also changed.1 - If the reloaded path is changed, paths loaded from the same file won't be changed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getPathName const

-

-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setSpeed(float)
DESC:Sets the speed of playback of the transformation defined by the path.
PARAMS:speed:Speed of the transformation playback. Negative value controls reverse playback.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getSpeed const
DESC:Returns the speed of playback of the transformation defined by the path.
RETURNS:The playback speed.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.isStopped const
DESC:Returns a value indicating if the transformation defined by the path is stopped.
RETURNS:true if the transformation is stopped; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setTime(float)
DESC:Sets the time, from which the playback of the transformation defined by the path starts. If the object is oriented along the path, its transformation will be correspond to the path transformation at the specified time. Otherwise, only position of the object will change.
PARAMS:time:The playback time to be set.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getTime const
DESC:Returns the time from which the playback of the transformation defined by the path starts.
RETURNS:The playback time.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.play
DESC:Continues playback of the transformation defined by the path, if it is paused, or starts playback if it is stopped.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.stop
DESC:Stops playback of the transformation defined by the path. This function saves the playback position so that playing of the transformation defined by the path can be resumed from the same point.

PARAMS:name:Name of an argument. | value:Value of an argument.
RETURNS:Always 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.getVec4Arg(char) const
DESC:Returns a value of a given vec4 argument. To check if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.
PARAMS:name:Name of a target argument.
RETURNS:Argument value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.setXmlData(char)
DESC:Sets an unquoted string to data stored in the node. This string can also contain XML sub-tree with rich text formatting.
PARAMS:data:Unquoted string to set.
RETURNS:true if the string is set successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.addChild(char,char) const
DESC:Appends a new XML node to the current XML node as a child.
PARAMS:name:Name of the XML node. | args:Arguments of the XML node. The default value is 0.This value should be passed if the first argument is a string
RETURNS:Created XML node.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.addChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml}) const
DESC:Appends a new XML node to the current XML node as a child.
PARAMS:xml:XML sub-tree smart pointer.
RETURNS:Created XML node.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.clear
DESC:Clears all data associated with the node.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.clearChildren
DESC:Clears all children of the current XML node.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.clearUnusedData
DESC:Clears the unused nodes and arguments.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.copy(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml})
DESC:Copies all data (name, arguments, data, flags and a child hierarchy) from the source XML node to the current one.
PARAMS:source:Source XML node.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.decode(char)
DESC:Decodes special XML characters (less-than, greater-than, ampersand, double-quote and apostrophe) and numeric character references.
PARAMS:arg1:Data to decode.
RETURNS:Decoded string.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.encode(char)
DESC:Encodes special XML characters (less-than, greater-than, ampersand, double-quote and apostrophe) to their character entity reference.
PARAMS:arg1:Data to encode.
RETURNS:Encoded string.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.find(char) const
DESC:Searches for an XML sub-tree.
PARAMS:path:Path to the XML sub-tree.
RETURNS:Pointer to the XML node.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.findArg(char) const
DESC:Searches for a XML argument by its name.
PARAMS:name:XML argument name.
RETURNS:XML argument number.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.findChild(char) const
DESC:Searches for the number of the XML node child by name.
PARAMS:name:Name of the XML node child.
RETURNS:The number of the XML node child if it is exists; otherwise, -1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.load(char,bool)
DESC:Loads an XML document and sets the current node to be the root of the parsed tree.
PARAMS:name:File name. | skip_errors:true to enable automatic skipping of errors (the file will be loaded in any case); false — to disable it (the file will not be loaded in case of any error).
RETURNS:true if the file is read and parsed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.load(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream},size_t,bool,bool)
DESC:Loads XML data from the specified stream and sets the current node to be the root of the parsed tree.
PARAMS:stream:Stream from which the data of the XML node is to be loaded. | read_size:Size of the data block to be read from the stream, in bytes. | binary:Binary format flag: use true to load data in binary format, or false - to load it in text format. | skip_errors:true to enable automatic skipping of errors (the data will be loaded in any case); false — to disable it (the data will not be loaded in case of any error).
RETURNS:true if the data is read and parsed successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.parse(char)
DESC:Parses a string with XML mark-up and sets the current node to be the root of the parsed tree.
PARAMS:src:String pointer.
RETURNS:true if a string is successfully parsed; otherwise false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.printUnusedData(char) const
DESC:Logs warnings of unused data for debugging.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.removeArg(char)
DESC:Removes the argument with the given name from the list of the current XML node arguments.
PARAMS:name:Name of the target argument.
RETURNS:1 if the argument is deleted successfully; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.removeChild(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Xml})
DESC:Removes a child node and its descendants from the current XML node.
PARAMS:xml:XML sub-tree smart pointer.
RETURNS:Removed child node and its descendants, if they are found; otherwise, 0.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.save(char,bool,char) const
DESC:Formats the tree of the current node and writes it to the specified file in the specified format. Creates the given file path if it doesn’t exist yet (including subdirectories).
PARAMS:name:Path to the file. | binary:Binary format flag: use true to save data to a binary file, or false - to save it to a text file. | indent:String to be used for indentation (e.g. "\t").
RETURNS:true if the file is written successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.save(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream},bool,char) const
DESC:Formats the tree of the current node and writes is to the specified stream in the specified format.
PARAMS:stream:Stream to which the data of the XML node is to be written. | binary:Binary format flag: use true to save data to a binary file, or false - to save it to a text file. | indent:String to be used for indentation (e.g. "\t").
RETURNS:true if the file is written successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.symbols(char)
DESC:Replaces ampersand characters with character entity references.
PARAMS:arg1:String to encode.
RETURNS:String which contains replaced ampersand characters with character entity references.
-

ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.setLongArg(char,longlong,int)
DESC:Sets a long value of a given argument.
PARAMS:name:The argument name. | value:The argument value. | radix:Radix (base) specifying the form of representation of the value, one of the following:2 - binary8 - octal10 - decimal (default)16 - hexadecimal
RETURNS:Always 1.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.getLongArg(char) const
DESC:Returns a value of a given long argument. To check if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.
PARAMS:name:The argument name.
RETURNS:The argument value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.getLongArg(char,longlong) const
DESC:Returns a value of a given long argument. To check if an argument exists, use the isArg() method.
PARAMS:name:The argument name. | value:Default value of the argument.
RETURNS:The argument value.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.setLongArrayArg(char,llong[],int)
DESC:Sets the specified array of long elements as a value of a given argument in a given number notation. By default, the decimal number notation is used.
PARAMS:name:The argument name. | src:An array of long values. | radix:Radix (base) specifying the form of representation of the value, one of the following:2 - binary8 - octal10 - decimal (default)16 - hexadecimal
RETURNS:true if the array is set successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.getLongArrayArg(char,llong,int) const
DESC:Retrieves a set of long values stored in an argument and puts them to the specified array.
PARAMS:name:Name of a target argument. | dest:Target array with llong elements. | dest_size:Array size.
RETURNS:true if dest contains anything; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.setIntArrayArg(char,int[],int)
DESC:Sets the specified array of int elements as a value of a given argument in a given number notation. By default, the decimal number notation is used.
PARAMS:name:Name of an argument. | src:An array of integers. | radix:Radix to use when setting a value.
RETURNS:true if the array is set successfully; otherwise, false.
-
ENTRY:M:Unigine.Xml.getIntArrayArg(char,int,int) const
DESC:Retrieves a set of int values stored in an argument and puts them to the specified array.
PARAMS:name:Name of a target argument. | dest:Target array with int elements. | dest_size:Array size.
RETURNS:true if dest contains anything; otherwise, false.
